text: full just outside off, and Rayudu suffles across to the off side before driving it to mid off
full on middle, but Watson makes some extra room and then drills it past the bowler. Kaul's lucky that he got out of the delivery's way. Smokes this to the long-off boundary
length ball outside off, and Rayudu punches it off the back foot to sweeper cover. Ten needed now
low full toss on middle, and Watson mistimes a bunt to long off
dropped just in front of Hooda at deep backward square! And then it bounces away to the boundary. A horror evening for Hooda. It was a full ball on middle that Watson had slog swept to the leg side
full on off, but Watson's picked the wrong'un. Goes down on one knee, and then ramps it past the keeper's left. He's doing this in style!

full outside off, and defended with soft hands to cover. They take the single and that's an IPL hundred for Watson The first IPL finals hundred while chasing, the second in all IPL finals. Take a bow, legend. Also his second of the season
full on off, but it's not spinning. Watson drives it past the non-striker to long on. Moves to 99
back of a length on off, and Watson fends it off the back foot. Comes off the bat's outside edge and runs down to third man
short ball, and it's the offcutter too, but Rayudu picks the length early. Comes dancing down the wicket and then slaps it inside out over long off. Ambati's done waiting
edged to first slip! But goes to the fielder on the bounce. Pitches outside off, and spins into Rayudu
yorker on leg stump, and going down the leg side. Watson does well to skip away from the ball's line
good length outside off, and Rayudu opens his bat's face to run this down to Bhuvi at third man

goes short! Brathwaite's appealing for the caught behind, and Williamson reviews. It was a quick delivery that rose onto Raina. Raina misses the pull, and the ball brushes his top glove. Raina's walking even before the third umpire gives his decision. Rayudu's already made his way out
length ball on middle, but Watson mistimes his pull. Played along the ground to sweeper on the leg side
back of a length on middle, and cramps Raina for space. But still he manages to clip it off his hips to deep backward square
hat-trick of sixes! Length ball outside off, and Watson opens his stance to go towards the leg side. Drags this from outside off and slaps it over long on once again
misses the yorker again, and Watson sends this over cow corner! Low full toss on middle, but Watson gets his front leg out of the way and deposits this into the stands. Delightful hitting

goes short outside off, and Watson simply checks his pull shot. Doesn't matter. It comes off the bat's bottom half, but the shot soars over long on! How powerful is this man. Replays show that the knuckle ball just didn't come off

low full toss outside off, and this time Watson drives it over extra cover. Off the bat's toe end, but still finds the gap past wide long off. Sharma misses the yorker-length, and is punished by Watto on this occasion
wide yorker outside off. Watson tries to steer it square, but can't get bat to ball. An excellent start for the bowling side
slower ball to end the over. It's wide outside off, so Watson is forced to reach at it. Flat-bats it past the bowler's left, and takes a single to keep the strike

slower ball on off, but it's always angling into Watson. He attempts to pull, and despite it not coming off the bat's middle, the shot has enough behind it for the ball to race away to the square-leg boundary
back of a length on middle, but angling into Raina. He backs away to make some room, but can only chop it down to short third man

attempts to cut it late, but he can only steer it to short third man. Watson's halfway down the wicket, so the fielder has a shy at the stumps. He misses, and now that allows CSK to take the run after all. Bhuvi the guilty man, and Brathwaite's not pleased one bit
back of a length on off stump, but he's taken the pace off the ball. Raina walks inside the line of the ball, and nudges it to the vacant area on the leg side
wide outside off, and allows Watson to free his arms. Slaps a cut to Rashid Khan at sweeper cover
length ball on off, and Raina has the luxury to go onto the back foot. Punched to mid on
flat outside leg stump, and Watson goes down on one knee and thumps it over deep backward square leg! What a classy way to get to your fifty. A freebie to start his spell
flat down leg, errant line. Just a bit of bat on Raina's sweep and the ball races away to the fine leg boundary.
knew that was his area. 115 kph, a knuckle ball outside off. Watson knows the fielder is up so just slaps the ball over the fielder. Lands just inside.
clears long-on. Another knuckle ball outside off, Watson looks to muscle that over midwicket but he can only splice it. Such is the power of Watson that it clears the fielder easily.
92 kph, the googly on middle and leg. Watson misses a flick, going down? A muted appeal is rejected.

lands safe! Full outside off, Watson wants to hit straight, his preferred hitting range against seam. But the ball skews over point. Rashid runs in from sweeper cover and can only collect on the bounce
it's Watson's bread and butter. On the pads and Kaul just nonchalantly flicks that over square leg. That's just a flick, people. Wow.

a slower ball down leg, Watson misses a slog. Raina steals a leg bye, but Sandeep kicks the ball onto the stumps. Raina's full-length dive saves him. That's the commitment you want to see in an IPL final
130 kph, too straight and Watson smashes it right back. Full and in the arc. Watson can't quite get underneath it but can get enough power. Thwack past mid-off
catch that Rashid, says Watson. Full and straight, it's like Watson was waiting for that. Not even that short but he heaves it away, T20 style over midwicket. Way into the stands.

picks that length, rocks back and pulls on the bounce to deep midwicket. Rashid "can do anything" Khan just plucks the ball with one hand. And says so what? Watson lets out an expletive. Can't quite say what was here.
131 kph, good length on off, blocked back. This has been special from  Bhuvneshwar. Interesting move from KW to keep him going too.
on a length outside off, 139 kph, inside-edged into the pad. Raina wants one. Watson says he can't make it.

beautiful bowling. Watson's pressure results in the wicket of du Plessis. He charges down, but it's the slower knuckle ball. Faf does not pick that. As a result, he goes through with the lofted drive and the ball goes straight up instead of far back. Sandeep says I got this to his team-mates. He's got it.
that's closer! But still sliding. A knuckle ball down leg, Watson looks to slog sweep but misses. Struck on the pad, but going down. 0 off 10
good length outside off, 140 kph. Another slapped punch to point. Watson is 0 off 9

breaks that streak! And it's five. Bhuvneshwar has the right to be seething. Good length outside off, dabbed to backward point for a run. Hooda runs in and throws unnecessarily at the batsman's end. No back-up. FIVE.
full and straight, 126 kph. Another push to mid-on. Watson is now 0 off 8
full and straight, 129 kph. Excellent delivery because it keeps the pressure on Watson. Defended
maiden to start! Second of the match! Another beauty, back of a length, pitches and deviates away to leave Watson hanging.
short and wide outside off, slashed away to backward point. Five dots. Pressure on Watson.

flat-batted over long on! He's not even hit it well, but Brathwaite's so powerful that the ball soars over Rayudu. It was short, and Brathwaite clearly hadn't timed it well, but hey, welcome to T20 cricket
slower ball on the fourth-stump line, and Brathwaite misses! Gold dust. Brathwaite swings blindly towards the leg side, but he's through with his shot way too early

finally connects, and that's a biggie! Loopy delivery wide outside off, and Brathwaite waits for this delivery. Gets his front leg out of the way, and then smashes it over Rayudu at long on. A good way for SRH to end the over
swing and a miss! It's the slower ball, but he drops the length short. Brathwaite attempts a leg-side slog, but he's through his shot way too early
tries to be cheeky, but that doesn't come off! Length ball on off, and Brathwaite walks inside the delivery's line to paddle it over short fine leg. Can't connect at all though
in the air for a long time once again, but lands safe! Full on middle stump, and Brathwaite's leg-side slog comes off the bat's toe end. It falls just in front of long on

first strike! Back of a length on middle, and angling into Ricky. He tries to drive it straight over Ngidi, but plays it down the wrong line. The ball goes over the top of leg stump and through to Dhoni

short on off, and Brathwaite mistimes his pull. It's in the air for ages, but the ball lands between deep midwicket and long on. Bravo's not happy. I think he had started celebrating as soon as the ball went in the air
deft, but well stopped by backward point. It was a yorker on off, and Brathwaite did well to steer it behind square. Good effort inside the circle
full outside off, and that's been walloped! In Brathwaite's arc, and he smashes it over Bravo's head
brilliant yorker on leg stump, but oh that's cruel! It goes down the leg side as Brathwaite skips his toes out of the way. Wide called by umpire Erasmus
slower ball, but going down the leg side. The batsman did move towards the off side, but Bravo was just a bit too wide

full toss outside off, and that's been struck straight to Raina at cover! Bravo's going to feel very lucky. Shakib did hit it well, but Raina's a beast in the field. Time out as Hooda makes his way out
lands on middle, and Shakib wants to send this to deep midwicket. Slogs hard at it, but mistimes it to the sweeper on the leg side

sliding defense from Shakib! Full on off, and he came down the ground to drive at it. Checks his shot at the last moment, but his feet go sliding. Looked rather uncomfortable. Hope he hasn't overstretched his hamstring
big heave, but Shakib misses it completely! Flighted outside leg, and it's the topspinner this time
slashed away to third man this time. Length ball on middle, and Shakib attempted that cut once again. Came off the bat's thick edge
back of a length on middle, and Shakib chops this cut to third man. It was too close to his body for that shot to be played perfectly
steered past first slip! Nice effort by Ngidi in the deep, but he just failed to parry it back. It was a length ball outside off, and Yusuf used Karn's pace to place it well
length ball outside off, and zipping straight through. Pathan rocks back, and cuts this from very close to his body

legspinner's dream ball! Sweeeet. Full, but wide outside off, and KW couldn't pick the line. He came shimmying down the wicket trying to play it big, but the ball drifts away from the batsman, lands near the tramlines, and then Dhoni does the rest. A rare pre-meditated shot attempted by Williamson
full outside off, and Williamson connects with the drive once again. But Faf's on the 30-yard circle, prepared for that very shot
full outside off again, and Shakib goes for the leg-side slog once again. Not timed as well, but still has behind this shot to send it to the wide long-on boundary. Seventeen off the over
massive! Is this Shakib's night? Tossed up outside off, and Shakib's quick to get down on one knee, and thumps it over cow corner. Uff
a short and wide delivery outside off, Williamson misses an attempted upper cut.
excellently played. Short and wide, spinning in. Shakib cuts towards short third man. Watson labours down, in slow motion, to his left. Allows the ball to go through

the wild slog and Jadeja strikes! Flat and straight, as anticipated, Dhawan looks to slog sweep that over midwicket but he doesn't make contact. The ball beats the slog, clips the thigh pad and then knocks into the stumps. That'll slow Sunrisers down. Again, the first over after a time-out.
some flight on middle, Williamson makes room and chips the ball to long-off for one
that's filth from Bravo. A slower ball down leg, a full toss as well. Williamson just swivels on a sweep and clears short fine leg. The catch is taken, but by a ballboy outside the boundary.
picks the slower ball outside off, full and wide. Williamson gets underneath the length and lofts the ball cleanly over cover for four.
132 kph, another good delivery. Using the bouncer well this time, short and down leg. Dhawan looks to pull,  but misses. Bravo and Dhoni appeal, Bravo more vociferously. No glove.
short and wide outside off, cut away to backward point for a run. A good start from Karn
smashed on the midriff! Back of a length on middle and leg, Williamson misses a pull, and winces almost as the ball makes contact with his body
thinks of carving the ball over the keeper, but withdraws from the shot late and wisely. A bouncer is way over the head of Williamson.
that's tripe. What was that? 114 kph, a slower ball, that's okay. But it's short too. Williamson waits and waits and pulls through square leg.
the top-edged pull waaaay over fine leg. Short on middle and leg, Williamson looks to pull, but gets a thick leading edge which flies over the fielder.
maiden over! In the fourth over! That's a very unusual result for Williamson and T20s, at this point of an innings. An overpitched delivery is caressed to cover for nothing.
142 kph. Now five dots! Back of a length and wider outside off, Williamson now goes cutting but misses. Pressure now on KW and Sunrisers.
full on off, Williamson has shuffled across so far, like he usually does in white-ball cricket. Pushed to mid-on
too short! Back of a length outside off, Williamson drags a pull to midwicket

that same line and length. And a terribly-judged second from Goswami! CSK's first wicket. Worked away towards backward square leg. Fine leg gets across quickly, he's holding the ball by the time Goswami turns around. Dhawan looks at his partner mid-way through and knows that's an iffy call, but trusts his partner. Maybe, he shouldn't have. Dhoni takes off the bails with Goswami well short.
some pace? 137 kph, back of a length down leg, hurries Goswami. A thick inside edge onto the thigh and then towards point.
good length outside off, 134 kph, carved to backward point. Decent comeback from Chahar.

he's picked out Rashid at deep midwicket! Oh, dear. Surely that's the end of KKR's hopes? This was hit well, but he got more elevation than distance. Swirling in the air, Rashid came in from the ropes and then took it well with his palms facing upwards. Brathwaite's decision of going around the stumps to cramp the batsmen for room has worked so far. Is that the final nail in KKR's coffin?

the off stump has been flattened! Chawla went to wallop this over long-off, swung through early, missed it and heard the death rattle. Cross-seam delivery this from Kaul, landed just a touch ahead of length. Chawla didn't get anywhere close to that. KKR right on the edge.
belted back, Bhuvi gets a hand, but it will be cruel to call that a chance!  Deflects this to the boundary. So hard was that hit by Gill. Much-needed for KKR.
angles this full delivery into the base of leg stump to cramp Gill, who works this to deep midwicket
third yorker in a row, Chawla toe-ends this back towards the bowler, Bhuvi can't stop it cleanly on his followthrough, parries this to mid-off
right into the blockhole, Chawla squeezes this towards backward point as they scamper a run
hit back past Kaul but there's no timing, they'll scamper a single

he's hit this into his hometown Moradabad! Remember the shot! Full and angling in full, Chawla had decided he'll heave this come hell or high water, got enough bat on it. Wild hit, way over deep midwicket.
slapped away to the cover boundary! Angles this in from around the stumps, Gill makes room and punches this past a diving Williamson
angles back in from wide of the crease to skid in and hit Chawla on the pads as he looks to work this to the leg side

did that take the edge? Yes! Russell played down the wrong line, the ball drifted in, he played outside the line. Lobbed off the pad as Saha fluffed it as he went for the catch.  Tough chance, big inside edge onto pad
cut away very nicely, into the gap between backward point and short third man. Couple for Gill
turns this indrifter into the leg side, Shakib runs across to stop that
deceived in flight,  just manages to chip this over Shakib.  That would've sent a few shivers down the KKR dugout
works this with the spin to deep midwicket. Picked the googly nicely there, did Gill

there's the key wicket  and he can't remain unbeaten tonight, though. This is superb from Shakib. Gets the ball to drift back in a long way from around the stumps, skid through to cramp Karthik for room as he shaped to cut. This didn't turn and took the underedge onto the stumps.
punched on the up past Shakib, to long-off
googly that spins back in sharply, Karthik gets a thick inside edge towards backward square. Don't think he picked it

Oh, Uthappa! What have you done? Why would you want to reverse sweep the opposition's best bowler who can turn it a mile? Played too early, the ball drifted into middle and leg and flattened the leg stump.
back of a length and outside off, slower ball, Lynn jabs at it early and sends a thick outside edge between backward point and short third man. If ever, you needed proof this game is KKR's
realising slip has been pulled out now, Uthappa opens the face and secures a single down to third man
on a length and wider outside off, Uthappa stabs at it but the outside edge does not carry to Dhawan at wide slip
on a length and outside off, Uthappa lets the ball slide off the face to point
just short of a good length and angling in from over the wicket, punched back to the right of Bhuvneshwar
tossed on off, Lynn gets forward and pushes to mid-off

worked off the pads through midwicket. Rashid runs in from the deep, gathers the ball cleanly, and throws it to keeper. Saha does the rest. Rana chances a second. He slips after completing the first, still goes for the second, dishes out a desperate dive, but is caught short. The second wasn't on after the tumble. Fine throw from Rashid
pushed through on middle, Rana rolls out the reverse-sweep and hits it between backward point and short third man for four
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, Lynn has a crack at it and scythes it for a one-bounce four to the cover boundary
slower ball wide outside off, away from the reach of Lynn, he swings and misses
short and wide, Lynn throws his bat at ball and carves it up and over short third man
quick fizzer from Rashid, he beats Rana for pace and hits the pad but this might have been heading down the leg side
googly, zips away outside off, keeps low and beats Rana
full on off, Lynn rolls out another sweep, this is hit along the ground to long leg

Rashid belts out an appeal for leg before. Umpire Nitin Menon calls it not out. Rashid chats with Saha and asks for a review. Pushed through on middle, skids off the pitch, and looks like Lynn has tickled the ball with the glove as he shapes to sweep. Ultra Edge detects a spike
just short of a good length on off, Lynn clears his front leg and swipes only as far as mid-on
length ball on off stump, 139ks, Lynn clears his front leg and plants Kaul into the stands beyond long-off. Powerful swing of the arms
bouncer outside off, Rana now ducks under this
Top-edged for a six over fine leg. 140.6ks, short ball, rushes Rana into a hook. He skies it over the fielder for another six
short and angling in at off, Rana hops and fends it off to cover
clears big Carlos at deep third man. Banged in short and outside off, Rana upper-cuts it and sends the ball beyond the boundary for six

Narine holes out to Brathwaite at mid-on. 113.4ks, slower knuckle ball on the leg stump, Narine attempts a loft but can only toe-end it in the air to Brathwaite inside the circle. Narine has done his job, though
dipping full-toss, swings away late, Narine toe-ends it in the air to the left of Shakib at cover
back of a length and attacking middle stump, Lynn quietly defends it back to the bowler
Make that four boundaries in a row. Knuckle ball, but the length is shortish. Narine reads the change-up. Clears his front leg and hoists it over the bowler's head
back of a length on the hips, 142.1ks, Narine clears his front leg again, this time he drags it away square of short fine leg for a hat-trick of boundaries
Bhuvneshwar errs too full and outside off, Narine gets under the length of this slower ball and carts it over mid-off inside the circle
full-toss angling away outside off, Narine now clears his front leg and crunches it to the left of covers for four
Smashed flat and hard for six. Length ball, angling away from Lynn, he backs away outside leg, fetches it from outside off and smears it over the covers
short at Narine's arm pit, 144.6ks, cramps the batsman for room, flapped away to square leg
lifter on middle, 144.3ks, Narine sways his upper body out of the way. That's the length to Narine, Khaleel
really full on off, 144.6ks, Lynn clears his front leg and hammers it wide of mid-off. Brathwaite throws himself to his left to stop the ball
slower one, 113.6ks, knuckle ball? Pitches outside leg and grazes the thigh pad of Narine and he sneaks in a leg bye
back of a length and more width outside off, Lynn throws his hands at the ball again and connects well this time. Scythed up and over point for four
back of a length and swings back in from outside off, Lynn throws his bat at ball and only collects fresh air

slower delivery, he fetches this from way outside off and muscles this over long-on. Is this a game-changing knock? Stunning hitting. Once again Prasidh lost his length, bowled too full. Rashid was expecting it as he waited, waited, waited and then clobbered it away.
full but far too wide outside off, pressure getting to Prasidh
the reverse sweep, but there's no timing because of the length. Straight to point. The bounced more than Hooda would've liked. First wicket for Narine on the night.

Backing up too far and Shakib's gone!  Full on middle, this has been drilled back straight. This flicks Kuldeep's fingers along the way and smashes into the stumps even as Shakib is nowhere near the crease at the non-striker's end. This is a big, big moment in the game.
floated outside off as Hooda advances, he reaches out and slices this over the infield, Uthappa was circling below the ball and allowed it to bounce before he took it at deep cover.
another googly, this time it drifts away, Hooda steps out and then offers his bat with the pad tucked behind.
steps out but Kuldeep lands this wrong'un at length and gets it to bounce, he lunges further and smothers that
turns this googly towards midwicket, Chawla runs quickly to his left to prevent a single
backs away and gets underneath the flight to drill this, beats wide long-off. Gave all his might. Just a little bit of width that time from Chawla, punished.
Once again looking to back away, only to see the bowler cleverly alter his line. Skids back in to hit him on the pad, but Shakib was miles outside leg.
lands this length ball outside off, Shakib makes room but is cramped so he bunts this towards midwicket

this is sensational from DK, not so much for the effort but for the alertness. This fizzing googly drifts in from length to hit Saha on the pad as he looks to defend, rolls to Karthik off the pad. By now, Saha is overbalanced and Karthik picks up the ball and breaks the bails even as Saha turns and looks to plonk the bat back in. The only reason why the third umpire was summoned perhaps was to check if the bails were broken by the gloves without the ball lodged in.
leading edge but safe, just eludes point. Shakib wanted to muscle this googly over deep midwicket
tossed up slower and higher outside off, Saha stretches out for a sweep and nails it to the left of deep square leg for four
Shakib steps out, looks like a googly, Shakib somehow keeps it out
floated up on middle, Saha stretches out and paddles it fine of Narine at short fine leg. Narine simply escorts it to the boundary
another big appeal for lbw. Did that pitch outside the line of leg stump? Umpire Nitin Menon shoots down the appeal. DK calls for a review. Saha aims a sweep and smothers it with the bat
short and skids back in to hit Shakib on the mid-riff. He sneaks in a leg bye and another off a ricochet
wide of the crease, short and slanting in towards the top of off, Saha hops and fends it towards point
overpitched and outside off, Saha leans into it and drives it crisply through the covers. Sweeper can't cut it off

Kuldeep has dismissed Dhawan and Williamson in the same over. He leaps for joy and celebrates. Williamson knows he has nicked off and walks off. Tossed up on off and breaks away outside off, Williamson does not read the googly, and tickles an edge behind to DK. Sharp catch from DK to his right
full and wide outside off, Williamson collapses his back knee and drives it through the covers
tossed on middle and turns away, googly? Saha now squirts a leading edge to point
lovely dip and turn for Kuldeep, Williamson does not meet the pitch and squirts a leading edge to the leg side

Kuldeep traps Dhawan lbw. He then collapses in his followthrough while appealing. Kuldeep loops it up on middle stump, straight ball, Dhawan misses it, looking to drag it away to the leg side with a sweep. He is pinned on the back thigh in line with middle. That's pretty adjacent and KKR find their first breakthrough
Chawla pushes this one wide of off, Dhawan drags a slog-sweep to deep midwicket
Chawla draws an appeal for leg before. Not given. Googly from Chawla, Saha attempts a sweep and ends up gloving it through backward square leg
similar ball, too full on off, Dhawan clears his front leg and muscles a drive between Chawla and Saha now. No stopping that
short on off stump, not much spin, Saha hangs back and forces a pull straight to deep midwicket. Should've smashed it to the fence

where did that come from, Saha? 145.5ks outside off, but it's on a length. Saha clears his front leg and hoicks it over midwicket. Not middled, but Saha won't mind it. His strike-rate nudges past 100 now
banged in short and outside off, 138.7ks, Saha drags a pull through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, 108.1ks slower ball, Saha plays early and squirts it through the covers
back of a length and outside off, Saha plays away from the body and slices it away fine of deep third man. Saha uses the pace of Mavi to his advantage
lifter on middle, 141.4ks, Saha ducks under it. Saha: 6 off 12 balls
back of a length on off stump, Saha brings his bat down in line in defence

DK calls for the skier but misjudges it and drops it. Mavi hits a hard length outside off, Saha pulls and sends a top-edge in the air. It soars to Mars. Then drops down. DK looks to settle under it and the ball swirls away from his reach. He can only finger-tip it away
good length, starts outside off, cuts back in, Saha has a big yahoo at it but only collects fresh air
Saha rides the bounce of this back of a length ball outside off, taps to Gill at backward point, and sets off for a risky single. Dhawan makes it in the end
slightly overpitched and outside off, Saha stretches out, gets close to the pitch and drives but Uthappa makes a tumbling save to his left at short extra cover
re-set the radar, Prasidh. Back of a length and slanted down the leg side, away from the reach of the batsman's flick
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, Saha is rooted to the crease as he drives and jams an inside edge past the leg stump
really full and outside off, Saha squeezes to short cover and threatens to run himself out but Dhawan sends him back. There simply wasn't a run there
back of a length, starts outside off, and nips away further. Saha simply watches it through to the keeper. Encouraging carry

yorker on leg stump, and Gowtham moved to the offside to try and paddle it fine. He misses, and the ball goes down the leg side. They want a wide, but not given. Probably because Gowtham moved around so much
full outside off, and Gowtham misses the big attempted slog! He expected the ball to angle in, but it held its line. KKR are through if Krishna can bowl five legal deliveries
short! And the umpire says 'dot ball!' Klaasen ain't happy, but the cal stands. He did try to pull, but was nowhere near the shot. Royals need 34 off the final over
full on middle and leg, and Klaasen goes for the big shot. Misses the slog, as the ball comes off the bat's inside half
swept to square leg! Just three off the over. It was a dipping slower ball on off, and Binny tried to sweep. Plays it eventually with one hand, and it's completely out of control. Sliced to Lynn
banged in short outside off, but he misses the pull! Two dots in a row. Binny was through his shot way too early
yorker, wide outside of. Binny tries to stick his bat out and glance it square, but he can't connect. Huuuuge roar at the Eden, says Varun!
starts off with the slower ball! Lands just inside the tram-lines and Klaasen can't connect with the attempted heave over cover. Ooo, close. Could've easily been called a wide

in the air! And "hear that roar", says Varun from the Eden Gardens! Searles holds on at long on and the crowd goes ballistic. It was full on off, and he went for the pull once again. This time he can only slice it, and that brings an end to Samson's innings
backs away, and  carves it over point. Chawla saw him move, and therefore followed him. Good cricket all around
flat on middle, but turning in further. Samson mistimes his whip to deep backward square. But gets to fifty
reverse sweep over short third man! It's the offspinner, and Klaasen got into position early for the shot
full on middle, and driven down the ground to long off. They walk across for the single, and what an excellent final over from Kuldeep! Is this the last of Kuldeep for IPL 2018, I wonder

caught and bowled, once again! Tossed up on leg stump, and it's the wrong'un. Rahane prepares to sweep, but he's played it way too early. Comes off the bat's toe end, and the leading edge is swallowed by the bowler
sent into the stands! Uses the depth of the crease to make use of Narine's length. Slightly short, and it's been pulled to cow corner
good length outside off, but turning away this time! Mistimes his back-foot punch to Narine
good length just outside off, but spinning into the batsman. Defended back to Narine
slower ball to end the over. It's the offcutter, and Rahane taps it down the ground to long on. Played gently enough for them to come back for the second
misses the pull completely! Back of a length just outside off, but the ball stays low. Rahane misses the shot
quicker ball! The extra bounce gets big on the batsman, but he still manages to fend it towards short cover. No one's there, so Samson rotates the strike as well
slower ball outside off, and Rahane punches it to the mid-on region off the front foot. Team hundred as well
flighted outside off, and the ball turns inwards! Too close to his body for the cut, so Samson mistimes to short third man. He'll keep strike
almost a yorker on middle stump, and Samson's straight drive takes an inside edge. The ball ricochets onto his toes
flatter ball, and it turns away from the batsman. Tries to punch it towards cover, but comes off the bat's inside edge. It trickles down to midwicket, and Samson returns for two
full on off, but Rahane takes a step forward and smothers it towards cow corner. Man there though
flighted outside off, but too wide. Allows Samson to free his arms, and driven to long off for a single
low full toss outside off, and Rahane drives through the line. It trickles away to cover
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he defends this back to Kuldeep
too short, and punished! Samson opens up the leg side and pulls this to the right of deep midwicket.
spins back in from off, Rahane makes room and punches this to sweeper cover
picks the googly, gets forward and jabs this to cover. Superb first over from Kuldeep
paddled nicely down towards fine leg. Kuldeep went flat, so he had pace to work with.
hit on the back leg, but this one's turning too much. Rahane didn't pick it at all as he tried to work this to the leg side.

He survived in the previous over but the lost review doesn't cost KKR. Tripathi chips this back and Chawla puts his right hand out on the followthrough to pluck that off running to the left. Tripathi jabbed at this googly, got it high on the bat and it lobbed. Eden roars
slower ball, but wide outside off. Tripathi waits for eternity trying to cut, but he misses. Wants the 'wide call' but the umpire isn't interested
too short, and Rahane won't let those go. Cuts it, and the ball flies over point once again. Could've gone for six, but lands just short of the boundary
angling into his pads once again, and Rahane turns it off his pads to the fielder in the deep on the leg side

given! But will Rahane review? Yes he does. It was a skidder, that hit Rahane really low. The googly again that forces the error from the batsman. Way too much spin on offer, so wonder if that would've gone down leg. Replay time. And it's missing the stumps! Rahane survives.
flatter ball, on leg stump. Tripathi nudges it towards the vacant square leg region, but they settle for only the single
beautiful! Tripathi's a different batsman when he opens. It was flighted just outside off, and he leans into an excellent drive. Sweetly timed
full outside off, and Rahane chooses to defend it towards cover point. Played with soft hands
full on off, and that's drifting into his pads. Rahane takes a step forward, gets inside the line of the ball, and then drives it past midwicket for a classy four
Tripathi backs away so Prasidh follows him. Full outside leg, and Tripathi can't drag it towards the leg side. Hits the handle of his bat, and the bat goes flying! They take the single though
goes short, and Tripathi rides the bounce. Fends it off the back foot and carefully sees the over out
on off stump, and Rahane taps it with soft hands towards wide mid on. Will get Tripathi on strike
carved over point! Uses the pace to cut it over the infield! Width offered outside off, and easily done by Ajinkya Rahane. Looks so good
length ball just outside off. Angling into Rahane, so he fends it off the back foot. Tapped towards Tripathi at the non-striker's
back of a length outside off, and he misses the cut. The ball takes the bottom edge and goes to DK. Russell falls over on his follow through, but looks okay
falls in no man's land! Leading edge, and the ball teasingly soars over cover's head. Full on leg, and Rahane tried to play it towards square leg. Lucky, lucky
yorker, squeezed to the off side as they scamper a single. Russell finishes on 49.

backs away and drills this fuller delivery to the extra cover boundary. Laughlin didn't miss his length by much, went for a yorker and got punished. Long-off was no more than three metres away from the ball, had no chance
too far wide outside off. Russell has the presence of mind, lets it go. He was initially backing away, so Laughlin went outside off. Just outside the wide line
veers in a yorker but just ends up slipping this down, Russell manages to get out of the way. Wide. Can't fault him for the effort

slower short of length ball that got stuck into the pitch, Russell backed away, held his shape very nicely and then flat-batted this over long-off. Deep into the stands. Lined himself up superbly. Forehand for six
backs away but he's denied the free swing because Laughlin angles into his body. No problem. He still swings through, gets a top-edge that flies over the fine leg boundary.
bounce and angled in from wide of the crease, Russell looks to pull, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to short fine leg

sitting up nicely for the pull, Russell has muscled this over deep midwicket. Too short, not the best delivery to bowl at this stage. Russell didn't get it anywhere near the middle but still managed to clear it
slower and fuller, lucky to get away with that. Russell mistimes this slog over cover to the fielder at the edge of the ring
Jaydev hasn't learnt. Keeps giving width and keeps getting whacked! Russell clears his front leg and slaps this to the extra cover boundary. Very poor

just over Samson's outstretched hands at wide long-on!  This is a slower length ball that spins away from outside off, Russell backs away and fetches this slap from outside off, ends up dragging it but still manages enough
square turn from length, stops on him as Russell goes back and across to defend
length ball on middle, and going down the leg side. But Russell manages to clip it off his pads to deep midwicket
maximum use of the free hit! Full on leg stump, and Russell gets his front leg out of the way before depositing it over the long-on boundary. Raw power
short on middle, and goes straight through to Klaasen again. Russell chooses not to play any shot, knowing that's too high. No ball for height. Free hit
short! Pitches on middle, and soars straight through to Klaasen. Russell had made some room to pull, perhaps, but played no shot
length ball outside off, but Russell was thinking of making room already. Eventually forced to reach at it, and punches it to cover

cramps him for space, and finds the edge! Back of a length on off and zipping straight through. Gill chose to cut, but it was close to his body. Finds the bat's top edge, and Klaasen makes no mistake. An exciting innings comes to an end
thumped! Through point this time! Loose ball first up. Wide outside off, and Gill sent this powerfully for four
there's the fifty partnership! Yuuuge over. Half-tracker outside off and Karthik rocks back to earn some extra time. Swivels, and then pulls it over cow corner. Expensive!
length ball on off, but spinning into Gill. Taps it off the back foot to point
going, going, gone! Teases Archer at long off, but goes just beyond him. Full on off, and Gill was quick to shimmy down the ground. Full swing of the bat thereafter

not afraid to flight the ball. Lands on middle, and entices the batsman to drive. Gill's through with his shot early, and it comes off his toe end. Still manages to find enough behind it, to take it to the fielder at long off
back of a length, on middle and leg. Gill goes onto the back foot and turns it off his pads to midwicket
flighted, and lands full on off. Karthik takes a big stride forward, gets to the pitch of the ball, and then drives through the delivery's line. Goes to long off
pitches on middle, and that's been flicked to square leg. The region's vacant so they take a quick single. Gill wants the second, but that's a resounding 'no' from DK
length ball, wide outside off. Which basically means it's a googly. Gill rocks back, and punches it straight. Gopal stops it on his follow through
back of a length on the fourth-stump line, and Gill punches it off the back foot. Plays it square to the cover point region on this occasion
goes back into the crease and defends back to Sodhi

punched straight back to Shreyas. Big wicket! Another googly that he lands on length outside off, this stopped on Lynn as he looked to punch, checked his stroke and Shreyas takes the simple offering on his followthrough. KKR in some trouble.

gets across the stumps to go over the leg side, changes his stroke and defends to the off side.  Confusion, confusion.  Lynn calls for the single, stops. DK is three-four steps forward and then turns back. All good in the end.
checks his shot, punched on the bounce to cover. Square turn for Sodhi, but a touch slow
slower length ball outside off, Lynn is down on one knee as he slaps this up and over cover. Disdainfully done
length ball just outside off, and defended back to Gowtham off the back foot. Keeping it tidy
almost a yorker on leg stump. Lynn carefully pushes it back towards the non-striker
disaster! Mistimed to midwicket. Full on off, and Rana looks for the release shot. Attempts to slog it over midwicket, but it's sliced. Easy as ABC for Unadkat
short! This time it's aimed on middle stump, and Rana backs away trying to cut it over slip. Pulls out of the shot eventually though
Back of a length, but outside off stump. Rana chooses to shoulder his arms, and the carry to the keeper is quite promising
wants a single, but sent back! Full just outside off, and carved off the front foot to cover point. Lynn's halfway down, but he's been asked to go back
just a bit more air offered, and Lynn smacks this through the cover region. Winds up early, waits for the ball to land, and then slaps it through the off side
length ball outside off, but spinning into Lynn. Stands tall and slaps it off the front foot. But straight to cover

leading edge, and caught by the bowler! Tossed it up, and Uthappa tried to work it towards the leg side. Through his shot too early, and the ball lobs straight back to KG. Big jump from the big man, and he manages to hold on to it. Two wickets in seven balls for Gowtham
quick single to end the over. Back of a length once more, but Uthappa gets inside the line of the ball and defends with soft hands. Cover's too far, so Uthappa can call for the run
back of a length on off, but Archer's really getting some pace. The ball gets some extra bounce, and hits his glove. Uthappa was merely trying to defend it off the front foot
length ball on off, and angling in once more. Uthappa adjusts on this occasion, and nudges it off his body towards the leg side. Doesn't look comfortable at all
mistimed this time. Archer pitched it on middle, but the ball jagged in sharply. Hits the shoulder of his bat, and goes towards square leg
quick! Full on middle, but going down the leg side. Lynn did go chasing after it, but couldn't manage to clip it off his hips
length ball just outside off, and angling in slightly. Uthappa drops his gloves and plays it towards the leg side off the back foot
drops just short of mid on! It was full on off, and Lynn goes for a slog towards the leg side. Comes off the bat's inside half and lobs in the air. Lands between midwicket and mid on
gone through everybody! Attempts the reverse sweep, but the ball spins sharply down the leg side. Won't be called a wide since Uthappa changed his stance, but Klaasen can't hold onto that either
full just outside off, and nicely driven straight down the ground. Gowtham gets his hands behind the ball, but it ricochets towards mid off. They jog across for one
full outside off, and spinning into Lynn. Tries to drive it towards midwicket, but it takes a leading edge! Falls in front of cover point
length ball on off, and spinning into Uthappa. Keeps his eyes on the ball and nudges it off his pads to the leg side

aaaand stumped! Narine came dancing down the wicket, but Gowtham dropped his length. Pitches it just outside off and the ball spins away from Narine. He misses, and Klaasen whips the bails off in no time. Big, big wicket!
slapped for four! Starts around the wicket, and pitches outside off. Narine backs away, makes some extra room, and crunches this past the diving cover fielder. Tripathi the man who couldn't stop it

Straight drive over the bowler's head, and Faf du Plessis has taken CSK into the IPL final! Seventh time in their history. The Wankhede's gone ballistic. It was full on off, and Faf went for the big one. Proper follow through of the bat and the ball lands just beyond the boundary line.
low full toss outside off, and he's edged it between the keeper and a fine short third man. It was a yorker just outside off, but Thakur manages to find some bat on it. He'll take it. CSK'll take it

full on off, and that's been creamed through the cover region. Looks like four, except Rashid's tumbling effort stops that at wide long off. Recovers quickly, and throws it in flat at the bowler's end. Brathwaite collects, and then brings the stumps down with his right hand. Harbhajan's nowhere near!
slower ball, but full outside off. Big wind up from Harbhajan, but he mistimes a leg-side slog. The ball goes past Faf to long on. Importantly, gets off strike.
back of a length outside off, and Harbhajan pulls it to the fielder at deep midwicket. Kaul's happy to concede a single off the final ball. That means Bhajji's back on strike
yorker, and just outside off. Harbhajan tries to open his bat's face, to run it down fine, but misses completely! That's zero off seven balls for Harbhajan
full on leg, and Harbhajan attempts to flick it towards the leg side. Hits his front leg, though, and that's enough for CSK to take a single
knuckle ball outside off, and Harbhajan can't even connect with the drive. The ball angled away slightly after pitching, and that, perhaps, put the batsman off. Through to Goswami

Is that a clean catch from Brathwaite? He does not claim the catch. The soft signal from umpire Erasmus is out. They go to the TV umpire now. He dives forward, Brathwaite stretches his hands out, and wraps his fingers around it. Or did that bounce into the turf and into the hands. The close-ups are quite blurry. No conclusive evidence. TV umpire Ravi does not have conclusive evidence to overturn the soft signal. Chahar has to go. This was full and outside off, dragged off the bottom of the bat to long-on. Excellent effort from that man Carlos Brathwaite
slower short ball, sits up outside off, Chahar reads the change-up. Delays his big shot and slugs it over midwicket for a flat six
full on off, but turning away from the right hander. Knocks it past the non-striker to the vacant mid-on region. Shakib goes running behind it
good length, just outside off, and he pushes at it with soft hands. Played in the gap in front of cover, and Chahar gets off the mark

another caught and bowled! The slower ball does it again. Back of a length on middle, but he's through his front-foot defense too early. Tries to check his straight drive, but still can't do enough. Hits the top half of the bat and lobs straight into Sandeep's hands. Replays suggest that was the knuckleball
accurate! Pitches on off, and keeps it tight. Too close to Jadeja's body to play it anyway. Chooses to fend it off the back foot
appeal for lbw, but turned down! Inside edge, I think. Length ball on middle, and turning into Jadeja. Hits his front leg, and impact's in front of leg stump, but the edge saves him
full on off, but spinning away from Jadeja this time. Pushed off the front foot to the cove region. Plays it rather safely

straight to first slip! Half tracker on off, really, but Bravo goes chasing after it. Tries to cut, but it's the legbreak from Rashid this time. Turned a lot, and took some extra bounce too, and Bravo has edged it to Gabbar
full on off, and pushed past the non-striker to the mid-on region. No one's there, so Shakib goes chasing behind it

tries to play inside out over cover, but takes the bat's inside edge. These batsmen are having a rough time facing Rashid. It landed wide outside off, and enticed Bravo to drive. Comes in, and finds the bat's inside edge
wide of the crease, back of a length and slanting in, impact in line but Bravo may have managed an inside edge
another wrong'un, Bravo does not read it either, plays around his front pad. Impact may have been outside off with Bravo shuffling across

Rashid bursts through the gate of Dhoni. Tom Moody in the dug out has a big smile and high-fives Hales. Another googly, good length, breaks back in from outside off, Dhoni does not read the variation either, reaches out for a drive and misses. Rashid hits middle stump. Dhoni goes and with it CSK's hopes?
wide of the crease again, short and springs off the surface outside off, Dhoni reaches out and carves to point
Dhoni forays down the track, shorter and attacks the body, hooked straight to long leg
chest-high short ball on middle, 131ks, Dhoni rocks back and hooks it away to the left of long leg for four
full and outside off, Dhoni presses out and inside-edges it past leg stump to get off the mark after nine balls
Dhoni 0 off 8 balls now. Tuk tuk Dhoni. Full and outside off, no shot again from Dhoni
full and slanting in from outside off, does not threaten off, Dhoni jumps across off and leaves
short and skids back in, Dhoni shuffles forward and across as he wears it on the thigh

Cracking delivery from Kaul.. My ball of the tournament. This was the big dipper from Kaul, a la Malinga, swings away so very late. Opens up Rayudu, beats him on the outside edge, and hits off and middle. He sends Rayudu back for a first-ball duck and pumps his fist animatedly. Look at Williamson, he's pumped too. This defence is on

Kaul floors Raina's leg stump. Raina jumps across off, exposes his leg and middle stumps, and can't meet with a flick. Perhaps, he was expecting the short ball, especially with leg-gully in place. This was full, however, and Raina gave Kaul a free path to access it
full-toss outside off, Raina eases in to it and drives to the right of Pandey for four
Raina backs away to this off-stump yorker and carves it to the right of backward point. Excellent diving save from Sunrisers' gun fielder Pandey
short on off, Raina hops and taps to mid-on for one
full and angled down leg, Raina misses a flick, leg-side wide
Bhuvneshwar hits a hard length - neither driveable nor pullable - fended of
Raina jumps across off, gets inside the line of this short ball and flicks to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Raina rides the bounce and shovels it away to the left of deep square
sliding into the pads, Raina checks his flick and chips it in front of midwicket
full awayswinger, much better from Sandeep, left alone in the channel
make that a hat-trick of boundaries, and this is the best of the lot though this was overpitched and outside off. Raina presses forward and eases a drive straight of mid-off
full and wide outside off, Raina reaches out for the ball again. This time he scoops a drive in the air to the left of Williamson at short cover
short and wide outside off, Raina loves width, he reaches out for the ball and carves it away through the gap at point
another gem of a ball from Bhuvneshwar. This finds the outside edge of Watson. Good length, angling in towards off stump, and swings away sharply, the opener hangs his bat out and nicks off
dug in shorter on off, jabbed back to Bhuvneshwar
Bhuvneshwar drags his length back on off, Watson stands tall and punchily plays it back to the bowler
big inswinger from Bhuvneshwar, full again, zips back in, Watson is rooted to the crease as he is pinned on the back pad. Replays suggest an inside edge. Height also a factor
gem of a ball from Bhuvneshwar first up. Full, angling in, then swings away outside off. Watson plays inside the line and is beaten

Dhoni finally hits the stumps! Off the innings' final ball, heh. Shardul goes short on middle, and Brathwaite misses the pull. They're off for a bye, but Dhoni finally finds his aim. Sunrisers end on 139 for 7

straight into the sightscreen! Brathwaite thinks the inning's over, and walking back into the pavillion, but he's asked to wait! One ball to go. It was a length ball, and wide outside off. Allows Brathwaite to open his chest and flat-bat it over the bowler's head
length ball on leg stump, and that's a wild, wild one! Brathwaite tries to pull it fine over short fine leg, but misses
full, but wide outside off. This time Brathwaite expected the line, and carves it over cover! Properly muscled over cover
yorker wide outside off.  Brathwaite slogs, but the shot comes off his toe end. Mid off intercepts

full, but outside off again. Tries for the big shot, and slices it over the infield. Bhajji cleans up at sweeper cover, but his throw is flat. Chance of a run out? Nope. Dhoni misses his flick, but Brathwaite's big strides would've saved him anyway
yorker, but way too wide outside off. No movement from Brathwaite, and umpire Erasmus calls it how it is
second yorker in a row, and this time the off-stump line forces Brathwaite to stop skipping around. Mistimes his drive to cover
too cheeky, and Shardul gets away with a wide. It was full, but wide outside off, and Brathwaite tried to paddle it. Misses, but the umpire chooses to give the bowler the benefit of the doubt
and that's two in two. Can Brathwaite repeat his Kolkata performance? Length ball on off, and comfortable for the big man. Winds up, and then smashes this pull over wide long on.
slow offcutter outside off, and jagging inwards. Big swing of the bat from Bhuvi, but he can't connect at all. Great disguise from Bravo
down the leg side again! Bravo appeals for the caught-behind, but the umpire's not interested. Calls it a wide again.
he didn't have a clue! Proper pace. Good length just outside off and zipping straight through to Dhoni. Brathwaite did try to glance it fine, but his bat was nowhere near the ball

what a catch! Tumbling forward while completing it! The stadium is on fayahhh! It was full outside off, and Yusuf's drive comes off the bat's bottom half. Low catch on offer from Bravo, and he dives forward on his follow through, holds on to the catch, and then spectacularly does a somersault to regain control. My oh my!
slower ball, and full on off. Brathwaite spots it, and waits for eternity, before whipping it to deep backward square
full on leg, and he misses the flick down the leg side. Hits the outside of his pad, and oes to short fine leg. Brathwaite wants the run, but Yusuf sends him back
full on middle and leg, and Pathan can't get bat to ball. Hits his pad as he attempts a leg-side flick
back of a length on off, and Brathwaite walks inside the line of the delivery and flicks it to the square-leg fielder
length ball just outside off. Angling into Brathwaite, and blocked off the back foot. Played to cover point
pacey! Drills this straight on middle stump, and Brathwaite defends it back to the bowler

leading edge back to Jadeja! Good length on middle, and looking to work it towards midwicket. He's through his shot too early, and the leading edge comes towards Yusuf, the non striker. But Jadeja scoots behind Yusuf and holds on to the offering. That's No. 5!
almost a perfect yorker on off stump. Yusuf jams it off the front foot, and sends it back to Chahar
good length on off, and this time Pandey punches it off his back foot. Goes past the non-striker, and to the man at long on
low full toss on middle, and Pandey hits this straight to the only infielder on the leg side. Watson there, and he has a shy at the non-striker's stumps. Misses!
length ball on middle, and angling into Yusuf's body. Flicked off his hips to the vacant midwicket region. Forces Jadeja to go racing behind it
Pathan gets on top of a short ball outside off and forces it away to the right of sweeper cover
Bravo hits the deck. New role for him? Short on off, spliced away to the right of the bowler
dug in short and outside off, no off-pace balls from Bravo today, Pathan evades it again
back of a length and floated down leg, leg slip still around, Pathan can't tickle it away. Leg-side wide
lifter on middle, keeps leg slip interested does Bravo, Pathan, however, ducks under this

This is the left-hander's version of Williamson's dismissal. Another batsman has been strangled down the leg side. Dhoni dives to his right (yes, he dives) snaps it up. Back of a length and slanted down the leg side, Shakib now tickles it behind. Bravo brings out his RunDWorld Jig and celebrates
slower short ball on off, Shakib delays his pull and hits it to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Shakib charges out and drills it so straight, it it hits the stumps at the other end. No deflection from Chahar
hip-high short ball on middle, Shakib rolls his wrists and pulls it away behind square, placed to the right of fine leg
Shakib leans back to this short ball outside off and chops it to point
back of a length, on top of off, CSK's quicks keep hitting that hard length, jabbed back to Thakur
back of a length and angling away outside off, Shakib throws his hands at the width, and cuts it fiercely between cover-point and backward point

Williamson has been strangled down the leg side. He throws his head back in despair. Thakur sets off on a celebratory sprint. Thakur now hits a back of a length and angles it down the leg side.Williamson looks to pull but can only tickle it behind for a straightforward catch. Gloved to Dhoni. What an unfortunate way to go. Big scalp for CSK
back of a length and zips away in the corridor, Pandey hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge by this near 140kph dart

Pace on the ball now. Ngidi dives forward, pockets a  low return catch, and lets out a big roar. Goswami continues to back away outside leg, Ngidi follows him and hits a hard length. Goswami is cramped and pulls weakly. He ends up flapping a low catch to Ngidi
another slower ball outside off, 116.7ks, Williamson spots the change-up and runs it down to third man
Goswami flits around the crease, Ngidi bowls a slower cutter on leg stump, dabbed to the leg side
Goswami skips away outside leg, gets the full length he was looking for. He manufactures width and belts it away to the cover boundary
back of a length and climbs over middle stump. Goswami backs away outside leg, has a mighty whoosh, and collects fresh air
slower ball outside off, 118.9ks, not sure if that was a knuckle ball. Williamson delays his push to cover
Goswami helps one to third man and gets off strike
this is regal from Kane Williamson. Just short of a good length and outside off, he leans back and cuts it away between square point and backward point
similar length and outside off, Goswami stays leg-side of the ball and jabs with an open face to deep third man
back of a length and shaping away outside off, Williamson allows the ball to come on and then rides it out to deep third man for one more
edged and flies away past the left of a diving Watson at first slip. Full and angling away outside off, Goswami flashes an outside edge and gets a fortunate four
Gowswami ventures outside leg, Ngidi hits a hard length and cramps him for room. Stabbed hastily into the off side
pitched up and outside off, 142ks, Williamson presses forward and scoops a drive to mid-on
nip-backer from Ngidi, back of a length, starts outside off and nearly chops Williamson into half. Beats the inside edge and runs away to Dhoni
inswinger from Chahar, too full and finishes on the pads of Williamson. This leg-stump half-volley is delightfully flicked away behind square

Chahar goes wide of the crease, but this full ball holds its line outside off, Williamson leans into it and caresses a cover drive. There were four in the ring on the off side but Williamson still found the gap. That's how good he is
pitched up and swinging away outside off, Williamson presses forward and taps it quietly to cover
nice and full, angling in at off, then swinging away slightly, Williamson covers up in defence

Perfect start for CSK and Chahar! Back of a length and angling away outside off from over the stumps, Dhawan chases  it with a cut but is rooted to the crease as he throws his hands at the ball. He only ends up dragging it back onto the stumps via a thick inside edge. Chahar pumps his fist and celebrates. Dhawan bags a first-ball duck

a blockbuster finish! Mohit Sharma looks to double-bluff Dhoni, the man who mentored him through his early phases in this tournament. He bounces him. Dhoni knows it's coming. He's sitting on the back foot. He's ready - he sends the hook sailing over long leg
off the middle! It has happened. Raina gets behind a bouncer and expertly taps the hook past short fine leg
another one lands short but this time it'll go through the fielder as well. Raina is mastering these toe-end strokes. Length ball wide outside off and he throws his hands at it. Sweeper done for
just clears long-on this time! That's fifty. A slog right off the toe-end. Dropped short from Tye again, full swing from Raina again. Poor connection again

just clears deep midwicket. A new trend in the IPL, to keep your leg side boundary riders in a few yards. Raina picks the slower ball that's dug in short and drags it over that man who has to pedal backwards
yes he is! And he gets it too. Mohit bowls a length ball on middle stump, Dhoni swivels and swings this between deep square and deep midwicket

falls short of deep midwicket now. Raina has hit two boundaries in a peculiar innings. Can't middle them yet. Ends up slicing another attempted slog and it lobs before plonking in front of the fielder running in

end of Chahar's adventure. And what a good one it's been for him. Showed two gears and the team will be very happy with him. It's a carrom ball floating away from him outside off. He slogs and gets it high in the off side. Easy catch in the infield
clears the straight boundary! Chahar is doing this too easily now! Backs away, exposes the stump and swings from under this length ball skidding into him. It's flat and clears the fence
short and wide and he chops it over cover! Kings XI need to get six wickets and concede nothing to qualify. Chahar does it with simplicity
well done Mohit. Sprints to his left at deep mdiwicket and stops it on the bounce to his left going for the catch. A slog sweep from Chahar, picked up from outside off stump

gets down for another big slog. Not full enough and raps the pad of Harbhajan. He's hanging around contemplating a review but ends up walking away. Comes on straight from a length and pins him in front of middle and leg
short of a length, angled across a set of stumps outside off, Raina shuffles across and flicks it into the on side
short of good length, Raina shuffles across and whips it to deep midwicket
short, angled across too much as it drifts out of Raina's reach
full toss that drifts down the leg side, Harbhajan swings and makes no contact
short of a length, Raina shuffles across and tucks to square leg

short ball, swings for a pull and misses as the ball gets over the bat. Harbhajan asks if it isn't the second bouncer and then the umpire calls it a no-ball. He had walked down the ground too. Rajpoot can't be any less amused
short ball, too much pace and bounce outside off, Harbhajan tries to ramp it over but can't get on top of it
almost strangled down the leg side. Harbhajan moves across and tries a flick and the ball goes over leg stump. Barely! Geez, what's happening here!

he's early run out! Why is Harbhajan out there?! Calls for a run he can't make and is not even stretching to make the striker's end. Raina anxiously dabs another length ball to square leg and the fielder can't hit the stumps
length ball in the corridor, Raina nervously defends off the inside edge

dropped! Finch has dived in front of Gayle from second slip and put one down! Rahul chucks the ball away in frustration. CSK were this close to being in a disastrous position. Rajpoot, back of a length outside off. Harbhajan jabs at it with feet rooted to the crease. That was going straight to Gayle.

got him! Ankit Rajpoot does not like simple endings! He's keeping Kings XI alive. A length ball that nips away marginally to beat a very nervous-looking forward defence from Billings - he's inside the line. The top of off stump is tonked and suddenly CSK will feel the nerves!
well done Tiwary. Leaps to his right and saves four. Raina leans in nicely for this cover drive on the up but can't get it past him
short ball down leg side. Raina leaping to get out of the way and stabbing at it. Beaten
slapped away. Too short from Tye. Sits up outside off stump and it's an easy put away. Aerial, over point
big inswinger onto the pads. Raina falls over into the off side and glances uppishly towards fine leg
got him! The new ball is talking, the new ball as got CSK's best batsman of the season! Mohit hits a length just outside off, Rayudu jabs at it and gets an edge through to Rahul
close. Rayudu allows this to come very close to him, with no forward press. It's a length ball and he gets it onto pad off the inside edge

and then he msicues one to find mid-off. Nair is livid with himself. Seems to have been in the right place once again. A yorker and he's leg-side of it, trying to go inside-out between extra cover and mid-off. Gets it right off the toe to that fielder and whacks the ground with his bat

he's in full control. Once again, puts the pressure with one six and makes the bowler bowl exactly what he wants the next ball. Bravo's slower ball is anticipated - he's going down on his knee very early outside off. When it arrives, he scoops him over fine leg
hello! Karun Nair with an outrageous reverse pick-up from outside leg stump. Full and fired down leg side. He skips quickly into stance and taps this over backward point

chips the next one straight to mid-off. Ngidi with the Heavy BallTM  in the corridor again. Tye looking to jab at it well in front of the body, can only chip it harmlessly over the bowler. 4 for 8 for Ngidi. Kings XI's season closing rapidly

a review this time. Ngidi must have charming eyes. Dhoni says he heard nothing but takes the review anyway. But Ngidi is right! Ashwin is looking to chop this length ball down to third man and he's got a very very thin edge on this! Ashwin is gone! What a review. Some climb in in the corridor from a length, very fast, and just enough for Ashwin
short ball down leg side. He looks to tickle it fine. Ngidi appeals. Umpire says wide. No review.

lazy attempt from Dhoni and that's a missed chance. Nair backs away too much and is lunging to try and play a square drive. Gets a thick edge that flies to Dhoni's right and he only gets an obligatory right hand out at this, feet barely moving
goes over extra cover. New favourite shot for Nair. Exposes the stumps and gets an overpitched ball again that he can open the face against as he goes aerially. Beats BIllings to his right
oh well played. Jadeja is firing it in to make sure they don't get a swing on the front foot. So he goes on the back foot and uses that pace to slap it wide of long-off. Stunning hit
short of a length and in at leg stump. Backs away and slices to sweeper cover. Jadeja pushing em in fast
glorious shot. Exposes the stumps and lofts it wide of long-off with a clean, straight bat. It's overpitched on off stump and just what Nair needs to get this off the middle
his go-to shot clears Ngidi at deep backward square. Nair likes to sweep. Jadeja has ample pace for that and despite getting too far under this and getting it off the toe-end, he clears the man
beaten on the inside edge. Plays down the wrong line at this. It's in the corridor and he's poking well wide from that. Bravo thinks there's an edge but Dhoni's in no mood

bowled him! Beauty from Bravo. The perfect yorker. Miller shuffles and comes back in line but it's all too much because he won't be able to keep this yorker from hitting off. Right on the crease and crash. Two set batsmen gone in six balls.

length ball on leg stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot and then calls for a suicidal second run. Karun rightly sends him back and he has to dive in the end. Jadeja misses the stumps after collecting the throw. Might have just made it

there's a sound as Dhoni takes this. Yeah he's out. No one appeals. But Tiwary and Dhoni both no he's got an edge on this attempted slog sweep. Once again, before the review can be taken, a batsman walks off. Routine length ball outside off and a very tame, sober sequence of play breaks the partnership. Good innings from Tiwary
something in the pitch today if you dig it short. Another top edge as Miller is late on the pull. Lands well in front of fine leg
top edge as he looks to hook. Flies over Dhoni. Sharp short one from Bravo just outside off and he's too late on the shot
just over a leaping Jadeja at long-on. Tiwary comes down the track and hoicks this one after getting right to the pitch
good length and straighter, Tiwary bunts it back
short and wide, Tiwary rocks back and cuts very late to knock it through backward point
another bouncer, Miller walks across and bends, and as its the second bouncer of the over, it's a no-ball
bouncer that goes well over Miller who doesn't even duck
good length, late away movement, opens up Tiwary who does well to defend it really late

old wounds opened up for Rahul. Remember the Tests in Sri Lanka when he lost his stumps shouldering arms? It's happened again. A length ball that nips in sharply from outside off. Error in judgement costs Rahul

good length ball that nips in, comes forward and blocks and the ball goes off the inside of the at to mid-on. Tiwary is halfway down eager to get off the mark but is sent back. The throw misses the stumps and three fielders fall over it and they end up getting it anyway. Comedy of errors

what a delivery! A brute from Chahar. Shortish, pushes him right back and then gets it to rip away off the deck to square up Finch who gets an outside edge to Suresh Raina who snaffles a sharp catch at first slip with the ball rushing onto him
length ball with a bit of nip away, Finch punches off the backfoot between cover and point diving to his right
short of a length ball banged into the corridor, climbing into Finch's body as he looks to defend on the back foot. Gets it off the inside edge into the leg side

big appeal turned down, but Gayle walks off! Short ball on the hips. A tentative nudge from Gayle, trying to tickle it fine. He gets a glove on it and Dhoni takes it down leg side. Walks off before Dhoni - who looked very convinced - can think of a review
beaten. Ngidi gets some sharp climb across the corridor as Gayle gets stuck in the crease, fishing away from the body
here we go! KL Rahul celebrates immeidately. Full outswinger outside off and he gets close to it, head above the ball, to squeeze this through cover

it's all over! Mumbai are eliminated from IPL 2018. A slower ball outside off from Harshal and Bumrah just chips a catch to long-on. Boult takes the catch. Glum, glum faces in the Mumbai dugout as their campaign ends in the final hurdle before the playoffs.

and taken! That was a very brave delivery from Harshal and he gets away with it. A short and slow wide delivery outside off. Cutting had walked across, looking to drag the swat over midwicket but because he has to reach out for it so much, he's not in control of the stroke. He picks out deep midwicket. No relay catch this time. A terrific cameo from Cutting though.

a short delivery down leg and Cutting smashes that for SIX. That's the worst ball you can bowl. Short and slow down leg and Cutting just helps it along over short fine leg for six. WOW. Mumbai still in this.
he misses a full toss. A full toss on off that is very quick, Markande misses it and the ball knocks off stump
a full toss outside off is badly hit to deep cover for a couple. Cutting wanted to hit that over long-off but the ball skewed away.

Shaw misses the stumps at the batsman's end, with Cutting not even in the picture. A full delivery is driven to short cover. Shaw takes aim and throws the ball wide. Boult cannot believe it. Cutting back on strike. Pant made the attempt to come front and gather, but fell over while collecting. He needs some time to gather himself.
not easy for a No. 9. A good length delivery on middle, goes over the stump after Markande misses a dab.
the change in length works. A short offcutter outside off, beats Cutting's pull.

that's maaaaaassive! Wheeee. Big hit from Cutting. Now there is time to take it easy too. Full and straight, right in the slot for Cutting, who stays upright and then lofts the ball over long-on. Lovely hit
picks that and launched over long-on. A slower ball outside off, Cutting waits and waits before heaving that over midwicket
a slower ball outside off, a big swing and miss from Cutting.
googly down leg, worked to deep midwicket for a couple. 3 for 36 for Lamichhane
the googly on leg, 88 kph. Markande doesn't read that and pats the ball back to the bowler

is that Mumbai done? Mishra and Iyer embrace! Lovely bowling from Mishra, tossed that up well outside off. Hardik Pandya looks to go for the big slog down the ground but it was wider outside off so he isn't quite in control of that. The ball takes the leading edge and lobs to backward point. Mumbai on the brink of elimination.
looking for the fine paddle sweep, was very slow from Mishra, the ball climbs past the paddle sweep
a short delivery on leg, Pandya walks across and looks to flick the ball fine, but fails to make contact. Over leg stump that was.
chipped to cover! And Mumbai are collapsing, like RCB yesterday. A googly again outside off, Krunal just drives loosely and finds short cover. Very loose hands, just throwing his hands at the ball.
a googly down leg, Krunal sweeps that very fine for four. The fielder runs around and misfields. Surprise, surprise. This time the fielder is Harshal

sensational stuff from Maxwell and Boult! Boult has taken tougher ones than this, but this was Maxwell's catch. A legbreak around middle and leg, the ball was exceptionally full so Pollard went straight, full face and flat. Maxwell runs around to his left and takes a reverse-cupped catch, but he's falling over so he just throws the ball to Boult nonchalantly, running in from long-off. The best thing about that catch was that Boult ran towards Maxwell when the ball was in the air, realised very early what was at stake.

Mishra strikes again! Follows that up with a terrific googly, but it's wider outside off. Lewis doesn't read the variation, he just runs down and slogs across the line. Mishra's wiles ensure the ball is short enough to allow room for turn and bounce to beat the slog. Pant does the rest.
not the best line. It's another googly but well down leg, Lewis top-edges this slog sweep and gets it behind square. Enough timing and power for six, lands on the boundary cushion.
the big slog sweep, goes past Lewis. Lots of flight on that googly and Lewis can't make contact

hit on the side of the helmet! A short slower ball around off and Lewis is through his shot too early. Because he's early through it, the side of the helmet meets the ball, and the ear! Needs some treatment, maybe a new helmet too.

Prithvi Shaw having a shocker! An eaaaaasssy catch dropped. A flighted legbreak outside off, Mishra has done Pollard in all ends up. So he goes after a slog sweep, gets a thick outside edge at head height to slip. The ball just goes through his fingers, and then he looks at the ball, doesn't even go after it. Very sloppy work.
goes right through! The googly outside off, Pollard gets forward and prods but the ball finds a massive gap between bat and pad. Does not hit the stumps
starts with a googly, down leg. Pollard misses a flick. Struck on the pad.
six to finish the over! Lots of flight on off, Lewis comes down and hits it straight again. Full face, loads of power over long-off
six more! Lewis on fire. Flat outside off, Lewis steps out and nails a lofted drive right back. Over the bowler's head
and smashed over midwicket! 128 kph, a short delivery outside off, sits up for Lewis at that pace and walloped with the cross bat.
flat and straight, Lewis skews a lofted drive away towards midwicket via the inside half.
terrific over from Boult, short outside off. Kishan tries to lace a cut through backward point but makes no contact

12 runs and a wicket in the opening over so far! Lamichhane strikes, a googly down leg, Suryakumar looks to work the ball through midwicket but a leading edge carries all the way to Shankar at long-on. He ran in quite a bit and took a good catch.

launched straight back over, this smashes into the sightscreen. Massive strike, right in his hitting arc. Shankar got the timing right this time. Can't bowl length. Held his shape superbly, held pose for the cameras later.
full and angling wide, Shankar looks to reach out and slice this over but misses.
sliced over, just eludes Rohit, who runs to his right from short third man.  Goes down as a dropped chance nevertheless . Slower and fuller from Bumrah, Shankar had to reach out to play this one
punches this straight to extra cover, big mix up with the running. Shankar was a long way down when he was sent back, a direct hit at the striker's end by Hardik and he would've been gone.
sees him winding up and fires this full and wide, Pant reaches out for a wallop, loses his shape, balance but somehow manages to skews it into the gap at sweeper cover.
fires one into the blockhole, Pant somehow manages to jam his bat down to keep it out.
slips a length ball down leg, Pant helps this along to beat short fine leg. Off the thigh pad, missed the bat. Races away.

now he shows he can reverse pull as well! This one sails over third man. Helped of course by the length, too short. Pant had enough time to change his blade, half-stance and of course help that over. Raises the half-century stand
belted back down the ground, Fizz can't stop this on his followthrough, deflects it to long-on.  Pant's fifth 50 plus score in seven innings.  This one off 34 balls
driven firmly to mid-off. Bowled this full and slanted this across to Pant
that's a one-handed wallop , dragged it from outside off to a slower ball, but it just sailed over wide long-on. Massive from Pant.
slower length ball on middle and leg, Pant wrists this to deep midwicket
uses the pace and then times this to perfection. Short third man had no chance. Short, hint of width and Shankar just laced it away.

oh, dear. He's hit this straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Too short, he picked the correct ball to pull, a googly, pulled but didn't connect as well as he would've liked. Krunal was mindful of the ropes behind him. He was no more than an inch or two in front of the ropes. After a promising start, Iyer has ended the season with a string of ordinary performances.
slides one away, Pant looks at Dharmasena in anticipation of a wide, but not given and rightly so.
back of length angling away, Pant stands tall and punches this to cover.

delightful wrist work. There's point, short third man. It's short, so Pant adjusts slightly to pick the gap between the two. Superbly done. Cut away in style, didn't bother keeping this down because he knew he was hitting this in the gap
too short and sliding down, Pant pulls this with the spin to beat deep backward square. Valiant effort from Ewin Lewis. Poor from Markande
beaten! Another cutter, a typical Mustafizur special. Iyer poked at it with an angled bat.

delightful from Pant. Picks the length, stands tall and punches this between cover and point. What timing, special stroke. Who said his game's just about biffing the ball? Held the pose for the cameras too!

right through, 144kph.  Maxwell's forgettable IPL is over. Bumrah gives him the silent treatment. Maxwell went for a glory hit, trying to belt this up and over his head. But the ball angled back in to sneak in off a big inside edge and flatten leg stump. This is the fourth time Bumrah has dismissed Maxwell.
bit of an inside edge onto the pad as he looked to hoick this over midwicket. Stifled appeal from Bumrah
grips the surface, bounces extra. Maxwell slices this punch on the bounce to backward point.

what laziness, Shaw was taking a Sunday stroll and has to walk back. Defended to point by Maxwell, he called no and turned back immediately. Shaw was no more than four or five yards outside the crease even as Pandya threw the ball direct at the bowler's end. This is very poor, lack of game awareness. He didn't even make an attempt to get back in. Completely taken aback by Hardik Pandya's throw. Virender Sehwag like.
pulled behind square. Nice timing, once he beat short fine, he was always assured of a boundary. Too short, Shaw fetched it from outside off.
