slower and fuller outside off, Maxwell takes a step across as he looks to whack this over cover, played too late. On the bounce to Ishan Kishan.
wallops this short ball up and over the ring, but there's long-on specifically for that kind of stroke from Shaw
back of length on off, Shaw gets on top of the bounce and defends back.
too short and drifting into middle and leg, Maxwell waits and then tickles this fine off his hip to beat short fine leg.
drifts in, rolls off the thigh pad to short fine as Maxwell attempts a tickle. Oh, dear. Overthrow from Bumrah at the bowler's end, they get an extra run
good length on off, and Rana succumbs! Tries to play the pull, but he's mistimed it to fine leg. Bhuvneshwar the man there. Drama?
full and wide outside off, but Rana manages to find the boundary! Reaches at it, but manages to drill this cut past point. Deep point's dive is futile. Scores are tied
full on of, and Rana backs away to make some extra room. Drives through the cover region. Man in the deep though
full just outside off, and Russell winds up for a big slog. Tries to send it over long off, but toe ends it this time. In the air for ages, and mid off settles under it

back of a length on middle, and Russell ain't done trying to pull.Connects this time, and top edges it to fine leg. Good effort by Sandeep at fine leg, but the scoreboard won't show that. Diving effort, but dropped
short on middle, and Russell makes room to pull it away. Misses again!
back of a length on off, and Russell goes for a wild swing of the bat. Misses completely
full outside leg, but goes down as a wide. Karthik did try to flick it fine, but can't get bat to ball

falls to the pull once again! Wide outside off, but short. And that sends Uthappa chasing after it. Top-edges it, and Goswami runs towards square-leg to complete the catch. Brathwaite does the 'Run D World' dance
full just outside off, and this time Uthappa manages to read the turn. Picks the legbreak, and then smashes it over Rashid's head
length ball on middle, but angling down the leg side. Karthik swivels, and then drags it over the fine-leg boundary. Seventy-seven metres!

full on off, and in his arc! Lynn swings through, and hits it flat to wide long-on, but Pandey's in the deep! Takes the catch, but lobs it up as he's going over the line, then comes back, and finally completes the catch. Classic T20 catch
the reverse sweep doesn't come off. Full outside off, and Uthappa goes unconventional
deft! Best of both words from Uthappa. It was full outside off, but Uthappa uses the depth of the crease to bring out the late cut. Goes between point and short third man
full on off, and in Uthappa's arc. Big stride forward, and struck over the man at long on. Classic Robin!
full on middle, but straightens after pitching. Lynn thumps it straight, between the umpire and the non-striker, to long on
length ball on off stump, and Uthappa makes some room. Attempts to lift it over cover, but slices this over the infield instead
slower ball outside off, but Lynn's been waiting for that length ball. Lines it up, gets his front leg away, and then slogs it over the long-on boundary. Fifty! Ninety-six metres
full just outside off, and Uthappa check drives over Lynn's head. A chip actually, which saves him. Lands just short of long on
good length on off, and Uthappa shuffles across to the off side. Works it behind square this time, and calls early for the second run
back of a length outside off, but the ball stays low! Uthappa considered pulling that square, but checks his shot at the end. Lets it go to Goswami on the bounce
flat outside off, and angling into Lynn again. He backs away and cuts it between point and cover
full on off and drifting into Lynn's pads. Fended off the front foot
length ball on off, and he backs away to carve it to sweeper cover. Uthappa wants the second, but Lynn does well to end him back. Would've been harakiri
overpitched just outside off, and that's been muscled down the ground past Shakib's left. Long off's there though
flatter, and full outside off. Pushed off the front foot to cover point by Uthappa
length ball outside off, and allows Lynn to free his arms. Cuts it to point, and the fielder can't hold on to it. Allows them to complete the run

dropped off his own bowling. Uthappa goes with the slog sweep and gets it off the toe-end. It hangs high in the mid-on area. He's running backwards and looks to be in a bad position as it comes down. Swerves away from him as he follows it and bounces back off the turf to hit him in the face. Not an easy chance, that one
cramped and a big appeal.  Not out - on lbw and caught. Googly ripped in at Uthappa who was set up for a back foot punch. It's off his thigh to first slip
graceful. Uthappa springs up quickly after his forward press and lifts this pull shot neatly over midwicket. Full control.
misses the length this time and is punished. With some force. Overpitched this time on off stump and Lynn drills this between bowler and mid-off
yorker. Perfect. Lynn can't do more than get his front toe out of the way and dig this out

gets him this time. Slightly shorter and a similar slow pace from Shakib. Narine beaten in flight again and this time it's off the inside half of the bat as he looks to slog. Pandey runs in and completes the catch easily
poor ball. Dragged very short and Narine waits for it to come on before spanking it to the square leg boundary
tossed up full outside off. Lynn through the cover drive early, gets an inside edge that tickles through square leg
thumped over mid-off. The line and length is predictable - short of a length and in at the body. Lynn backs away in anticipation. Gets a knuckle ball that sits up nicely
swatted away! Not connected too well, but this is Lynn, and this is the norm. Clears the ropes easily. Short ball into the body and he gets the slog out quickly
kncukle ball that floats away at an off stump line. Lynn solidly behind the line to defend off the back foot

clears the long-on boundary! Sandeep has gone for 20 in his first over. A slower ball. Narine looks like he knows it's coming. Steps out and meets it at the pitch in front of middle stump before launching it flat to long-on's right
clears point with a mistimed slice. Narine wants to thump this over over but it's a slower ball drifting away from him and it takes the thick outside edge
wide bouncer first up. Narine goes after it but is too slow to get bat on it
how did you do that Narine? Ridiculous stuff! An inswinging yorker coming in at middle stump. He opens his stance, and digs it out to third man from less than a yard in front of the stumps
chopped away easily. Short of a length and some width outside off. Lynn stays shuffles back a little and bisects cover and point
big inswinger to start. But it's a tad short of good length. Lynn keeps it out, taps it back to the bowler
creamed! Full outside off, and allows Shakib to free his arms. Drills this drive to the extra-cover boundary. Oof, what sound off the bat

full toss outside off, and that's been slogged towards the leg side. It's a flat shot, but Rinku Singh, the substitute, displays some excellent athleticism in the deep. Slides and takes a diving catch running forward. Prasidh applauds!
full and wide outside off. But a well-aimed yorker. Shakib tries to ramp it past short third man, but misses. DK collects and that's well done by Russell
good comeback! Short on off, and going over Shakib's shoulders. He tried to ramp it over DK, but can't get bat to ball
slower ball, but a length ball. Shakib settles deep into his crease, and pulls it over the square-leg umpire!
full on leg stump, and that's the short arm jab from Shakib. Excellent timing off the bat, but the fielder in the deep puts in the hard yards
back of a length on off, and that's way too quick for Carlos. Tried to pull, finds the top edge. DK races forward and completes a comfortable catch. Russell wins the battle of the West Indians
a yorker on leg stump, and Brathwaite manages to get enough behind that to play it down the ground. Long off cleans up
good length outside off, but angling into Pandey. He checks his punch, and glances it towards backward point on this occasion

almost a yorker on middle, that he tries to play the straight drive to. The shot ricochets onto his boot and then goes to the bowler's hands. Prasidh's asking for the catch! They're going upstairs, but the ball actually hit the ground before hitting Pandey's boots. False alarm
good length on off, and offspin from Narine. Whipped towards midwicket off the back foot
full on off, and in Pathan's slot. Goes for a big one, but toe-ends it unfortunately. Mid on, Uthappa, settles under it, and holds on to this catch. Narine strikes!
length ball on middle, but angling down the leg side. Pandey flicks, and helps it on its way to fine leg
back of a length, slower ball. Pandey tries to cut it over point, but he's completely deceived! Goes through to DK
short on middle, and that's fiery! Pandey hops across to the leg side in a bid to get away from the ball's line
good length on off, and Pandey opens his bat's face, but finds the man at point once again
short and wide outside off. Starts off with the offcutter, and Pandey mistimes a cut to point
full outside off, and wide enough for Pandey to free his arms. Drills this drive to sweeper cover
length ball on off, and Williamson shuffles across to the off side and nudges it to the square-leg region. Played with gentle hands, and that actually allows them to take the second
on middle, and angling into his pads. Williamson pushes it off his pads to the vacant square-leg region, and there's enough time to come back for the second
good length on middle, and it's the wrong'un this time. But Williamson drags it off the backfoot to deep midwicket with ease

over wide long on! Flighted on middle and leg, but Williamson comfortably gets his front leg out of the way and then thumps it towards the leg side. Too slow from Kuldeep, which gives the batsman that extra second
nice, juicy full toss outside off, but Williamson can't put it away. Miscues a drive to mid off
length ball on middle, and Williamson bends his knees and then pulls this along the ground to the square boundary. Perfectly placed
flighted on middle and off, and Goswami attempts the late cut. Mistimed to short third man this time
flat on off, and turning away from the batsman. Flat-batted back to Kuldeep off the back foot
so simple. Gets to the pitch and calmly lofts this over long-on with a clean swing. Narine doesn't get grip or turn outside off because of that big stride
guides it past short third man. Chawla made to pay for his leg stump line. It's full, it's fast enough - Dhawan shovels it past the fielder
loopy length ball outside off. Goswami reaches out for the aerial drive over off side but doesn't get to the pitch. Just manages to clear cover with the chip
through Uthappa! He's expecting this slice from Goswami to turn to his right at extra cover, but it goes straight after pitching a couple of yards in front
smart. Very smart batting from Goswami. He's dismantled Russell. Leaps to cover the bounce of another short one in the corridor and caresses it between point and backward point
opens up the off side again! Superb stuff from Goswami. This one is overpitched on off stump and he uses the room to slice it through cover point
good bouncer but it's the second one! Free-hit coming up. Russell wins the battle, following Goswami down leg side with this bouncer, but it's come at a cost
superb yorker angled in towards the base of leg stump, Chahal somehow manages to keep that out
hit back hard but Archer stops it with his boot, they'll scamper a run nonetheless

full ball that tails in to beat his defence, there's an appeal for lbw. In the meanwhile, the non-striker hares across to force Chahal into the bye. Klaasen fires a throw at the bowler's end, a direct hit and Chahal would've been gone.
slower length ball outside off, deviates away. Southee heaves but can't connect.
slower length ball but way outside off, Siraj looked to upper cut but let it go. Two bounces to the keeper.
he's walloped this pull to deep square. Too short, Siraj had decided he'll pull no matter what. Hit it cleanly too.
slower one, dipped on Siraj as he lunges forward and blocks
googly that he lands outside off, Southee lunges forward and blocks
beaten on the drive, sharp turn again from Sodhi.

misreads the googly, gone. That could be the final nail in RCB's coffin this season? Class from Shreyas Gopal! Lands this outside off, AB is sucked into the drive, but is done in by the length as well as the ball rips back in to beat the inside edge. Klaasen is alert as he pulls off another superb stumping.

shapes to drive, doesn't get to the pitch, is beaten for turn, and gets a thick edge that has been taken beautifully by Rahane at slip. Excellent captaincy to have himself stationed there. Superb from Sodhi. Dragged him forward into the drive, deceived him in flight and thank you very much. RCB slide further.

too short and he gets punished! So the single has now resulted in a boundary that brings up AB's sixth half-century this season. Too short, he stays his ground and flat-bats this into the gap at deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, AB drives to a misfielding Samson at sweeper cover, ran in too quickly and couldn't bend down properly. Gives away an extra single

there's the big wicket. Mandeep runs down under pressure to go over the top, beaten by sharp turn and Klaasen executes a straightforward stumping. Superb bowling, nicely tossed up him and deceived him in flight.  Big moment in the match.
leading edge as this rolls to short third man. Mandeep was squared up, looked to work this to midwicket. Sharp turn for Sodhi
welcomes him with a reverse sweep past short third man. Flatter one that spins away from outside off, so AB was hitting it with the spin. Easy, he just helped it along.
sees AB back away and drops it at a back of a length on the leg-stump line, and AB pulls it away to square leg
short of a length, this is a cutter, and AB make sure to give himself enough room, before punching it crisply with loads of timing through extra cover
short and angled into him, can't be bowling there to AB, who pulls it away to deep backward square leg

gone, Kohli's gone! This is a huge wicket for Royals. You got the feeling Kohli was playing for the 15.5 over requirement. Charges down the ground to force the pace, not quite full enough and he swipes only for the ball to spin in from a length and flatten the stumps
and again. Archer drops it short to Parthiv who leans back and helps it over the keeper. This time the timing's so good that it carries all the way
flat back of a length ball outside off, Kohli fends and gets an inside edge, lucky to not chop on
length outside off that stays low, Kohli shuffles and the ball sneaks from beneath

walks across, so Southee fires this full and wide, he can't carve it so decides to scoot a bye. Parthiv flicks the underarm throw to Southee, who breaks the bails at the bowler's end with Gowtham not even in sight.
bowls this full and wide, inside the wide line though as Gowtham leaves.
squeezes this full delivery to short third man, a direct hit at the bowler's end from short third man and Gowtham would've been gone.  As it turns out, they sneak in an overthrow
pulled magnificently. What were you doing inside the dressing room for so long, KG? Goes short and wide, Gowtham is across in a jiffy as he nails this pull in front of square to perfection.

looks to clear long off, but no timing and Moeen takes a simple catch at the ropes. Klassen backed away, Siraj bowled it full and wide. Slowed the pace down as well, so he couldn't get any timing on that as well despite having a good reach. Useful knock nonetheless.
sees him backing away and bowls a slower one outside off, Klaasen can't reach this. Nice awareness from Siraj
full toss, he walks across and then scoops this deep into the stands at fine leg. Siraj looked for a yorker, missed his length completely.
right into the blockhole, Tripathi backs away and squeezes this to cover
slower and fuller outside off, Tripathi looked to biff this over midwicket but swung through early and missed.
backs away to to over the off side, Southee sees this and lands the slower ball wide but gets this outside the wide line. Rolls to Parthiv
flatter and fuller on off, Klaasen gets a thick inside edge on the drive past midwicket
skiddy length ball back in from wide of the crease, Klaasen hops back and defends
slips back in to beat the underedge as Klaasen looks to punch on the up.

make that three in one over! Umesh is producing another sharp burst of bowling. And this is a stunning delivery. An extremely full ball, curving into him at pace and dipping to hit the pad. Klaasen reviews and could the angle save him here? No, it's actually an inside edge. Clear deflection onto the pad. Top delivery nonetheless

straight to short midwicket. Umesh again provides RCB with crucial strikes. Royals cannot afford to slow down anymore, and Samson has paid the price for checking his stroke here. Closes the face from outside off to a length ball and the follow-through isn't great as he's caught in two minds. Chips it straight to Moeen Ali

swings across the line to heave it over the leg side and gets hit on the pad. Umesh turns around and appeals and the umpire takes a long time to give it. Rahane asks for the review. A little too full for him to attempt that heave with a half-angled bat as the ball sneaks from underneath after keeping a little low. Seems to be be hitting the stumps, but he did take a big stride across which is what could save him. Nah, actually, it's umpire's call on impact
takes it away from him and spins away, and that's got to be a wide. Tripathi was expecting the call, which is why he let it go. But not called by the umpire

comes down the track and heaves blindly without getting behind the line, gets a thick outside edge that runs away to third man. Nicely done by Chahal to flight it up and draw the batsman forward but taking it away from him
skews this short one off the top portion of the bat to deep midwicket. No pace again at 111.7kmph. Fifty for Tripathi
too much bounce, catches him off guard and raps him on the pad as he misses the flick. Southee belts out an appeal, but then again, bounced too much
shortens his length, Tripathi quickly transfers his weight back and slaps this through midwicket
whipped superbly. Beats deep square leg. Lovely wrist work. Just a touch short from Southee, Rahane used the depth of the crease superbly to put that away.

he's gloved this down leg, so the move hasn't worked. Archer swivels back to pull but is cramped for room as the ball angles back in, faint little edge through to Parthiv. Fourth duck of the season for Jofra.
skiddy bouncer, Archer is late on the pull, toe-ends it to midwicket
length ball on middle, Archer works this to midwicket
drifts back in from wide of the crease, lands on length and spins back in. Tripathi defends. Excellent first over
slows it down nicely, tossed up on middle, Tripathi lunges forward and blocks
flatter and fuller outside off, Tripathi prods outside to get a thick inside edge. Excellent bowling
full down leg, Chahar walks right across and misses a swing. Good non-call, not a wide.
a full delivery outside off, Bravo backs away and chips a lofted drive towards cover. Shankar backtracks and takes it comfortably.
length on middle and leg, 134 kph, off the pad to third man. Sensational night for Harshal Patel: 4-0-23-1 and a terrific cameo.
a shortish and wide delivery outside off. And again, Jadeja plays over the line, another dot.
just clears the boundary. Full on middle and off, Jadeja lofts the ball elegantly. Very high but just enough and clears the straight boundary.

that's the game! A stunning over this from Boult. Not just because he has conceded just five and taken out MS Dhoni, but his execution has been awesome. A low full toss from Boult, on middle and off. Dhoni broings out his bottom hand and whips the ball flat. But not enough distance. Iyer runs in and takes a good catch.

and now the short ball, around middle and leg. Pulled away to midwicket. Boult goes for the catch but falls over. Long-on throws wildly to the keeper and somehow Mishra gets around to his left to prevent four overthrows. CSK get three
awesome bowling. He has a clear plan (the easy part) and then he executes to Dhoni with deadly accuracy (soooo hard).
it's wide, but on a length. Dhoni's eyes light up and he swings, but toe-ends it back to the keeper. DOT.

Avesh does not go for the catch. The bowler says go for it. Full and wide outside off, Jadeja looks to go over cover but the ball skews off the outside half, to the sweeper cover fielder. On the bounce!
another dot! A short slower ball outside off, Dhoni misses an attempted dab to third man.
well bowled, the right length. Quick outside off, not full, not short. Jadeja misses a cut.
flat on off, worked to long-on. Dhoni knows what he's doing. Letting Jadeja take the risks now, he'll stay there till over No. 20 and take full responsibility then
gets to the pitch and Jadeja goes boom! A googly outside off, Jadeja runs down, gets there and launches a massive six over the bowler's head. 89 metres back.
another dart, quick down leg. Dhoni misses a sweep. Struck on the pad.

top-edged sweep, down to short fine leg. It's always risky sweeping a wristspinner for this very reason. The googly ALWAYS produces extra bounce because there are more revolutions on the ball. So you'd rather go from bottom to top while sweeping. But Billings tries to keep this down, takes a thick leading edge straight to the fielder. Also, he had to drag the shot from well outside off.
just misses leg stump! The googly down leg, Billings looks for the reverse-swat (he plays that as well very well). But bottom-edged and just misses leg stump

he's picked out deep midwicket. And Lamichhane is pumped! That was a googly that Raina picked as soon as it was released because of the line - it was down leg. So Raina cleared his front leg and looked to smash that over midwicket, but he did not get underneath it well enough. All he did was pick out the fielder.
a very full delivery and Dhoni just pushes it back.
the googly outside off, Raina closes the bat face and gets a leading edge towards extra cover for a run
a legbreak outside off, tapped to point for a run. And Dhoni has 6000 T20 runs
short and wide from Maxwell, and even though the ball is turning back in, Dhoni creates room by generating some power through the line of the ball and scything the ball through backward point.

that's the Raina trademark. A flat delivery outside off from Maxwell, Raina lofts the ball over cover so easily. I remember him playing a similar shot in the second IPL, with Matthew Hayden at the non-striker's end. Now, Hayden on air says "there is no better player of that shot"
comes down and chips the ball towards long-on, in typical Dhoni fashion

good catch by Maxwell! He's hit that well, but he's met the ball too early. Rayudu came charging at the bowler but it was an offcutter. So Rayudu was through the shot a fraction of a second earlier than he would have liked. Therefore, the ball met the bat with its bat face already pointing up. That means the ball will always go higher up than further back. Hangs in the air for a long time. Maxwell takes a good reverse-cupped catch.
full and straight, pushed to long-on. Another fifty for Rayudu, off 28 balls. Sparkling form.
an excellent yorker but the line is errant. It's slightly leg side-ish and Rayudu flicks the ball easily through backward square leg for four. Just had to place the ball there.
full on off, and it's flatter this time. Driven to mid off, and they're taking the quick run. Rayudu would've been gone, except the fielder can't get the direct hit.
flighted on middle, but Rayudu comes down the wicket, converts it into a full toss, and then thumps it over Mishra's head. Oh, delighful.
full just outside off, and it's the one that's spinning away. Rayudu's quick to pick that, and drives it beautifully after getting to the pitch of the ball. Long off can't cut it off either
full on leg, and Rayudu comes dancing down the wicket. Misses the drive, and it hits his front leg. Impact outside leg
bowls the cross seamer, almost like a pacer! Full on middle, and Raina pushes it towards midwicket and gets off strike
full on off, and Raina takes a big stride forward to drive to wide long on. He'll keep strike
fended by Raina on this occasion
full on off stump, from around the wicket. Defended off the front foot by Raina.
dropped first ball! Pant the guilty man. Good length outside off, and sliding further away from Raina. He tried to poke at it, but the ball found the outside edge. Oh dear
flighted on off, and turning away from Watson. He tries to lift it over Mishra, and this time it doesn't have the power to go over long off. Straight down Boult's throat in the deep
flighted on middle, and Rayudu drives it straight back to Mishra. Meets the ball before it could even turn
full on middle, and Watson drives it to the cover region

Twenty-two runs off the over! What a way to end the Powerplay. Length ball on off, and Rayudu backs away to power it over wide long on this time. Swings away, and connects with it well enough for it to soar over the boundary rope. Big, big over. End of the Powerplay too, and they've taken the time-out as well

good length on middle, but Rayudu comes shimmying down the wicket. Swings his bat towards the leg side, and manages to get some connection behind it. Mistimed, but enough power for it to over the midwicket boundary
good length on off, and Rayudu backs away before driving it through the cover region. A packed field inside the circle though
four or six is the question! Drops just short of the boundary. Length ball on off and Rayudu swivels to slog it over the cow-corner region once again. Ten off three
quick! Rayudu's too slow to play the pull. Short on off and angling into Rayudu. He tried to repeat that shot, but it's come off the bat's top half and over the bowler's head
full on off, and that's been thumped over cow corner! Once again Rayudu goes well to deep inside the crease, gets his front leg out of the way, and then powers it into the midwicket boundary

full on middle but angling into his pads. Watson misses the shot towards midwicket, and it raps him on his pads. Appeal for lbw turned down. Good decision, the bowler's natural angle would've taken it down the leg side
short on off, and Rayudu pirouettes on his toes to pull it to deep backward square
short outside off, and that's a wild shot from Rayudu. Tries to slap it over point, but absolutely no timing behind that. Through his shot way too early
slower ball, outside off, and Watson checks his slog. Muscles it over midwicket, and the ball falls in no man's land
good length on off, and Watson rocks back to fend it off the back foot
back of a length, but very wide outside off. Rayudu did shuffle across to the off side, but failed to connect with the cut. Through to Pant
crunched through cover! Full, but just a bit too much outside the off side. Rayudu goes deep into his crease, and smashes it over extra cover. Great shot

length ball on off, and angling into Watson. He drops his hands, and defends it towards the leg side. Rayudu wants the quick single, and he manages to complete it easily. Watson looked kinda surprised by the pace!
overpitched outside off, and Rayudu mistimes the straight drive. Plays it back to the bowler on this occasion
back of a length on leg stump, and Rayudu walks across to the off side. Whips it off his pads to square leg
yorker on leg! Great comeback ball, but Watson manages to dig it away towards the leg side
good length on off, and gets big on Rayudu. He glances it down to third man to get off the mark
good length on off, and angling away from the batsman. Rayudu, playing his first ball, tries to defend towards cover, but the ball goes past his outside edge. Nice carry to Pant
full outside off, and it's the legspinner. But Watson played for the googly, and the drive takes a leading edge. Goes to mid off
flighted outside off, and it's the wrong'un this time! Turns sharply into Watson, who backs away and cuts to point
full on off, and going straight into Watson's pads. Defended back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length on middle, and get big on Watson. He tried to defend off the back foot, comes off the bat's shoulder. Goes to third man
short on middle, and Watson manages to swivel and pull. Mistimes the shot to deep midwicket, and CSK are off the mark
late inswing! But well defended by Watson. Full on middle, and angling back into his pads
Bravo concedes 52 off four overs! That was the worst last over from Bravo I've seen ever. Ends with a full toss on off and Harshal smashes the ball straight back for six. Hits the sightscreen.
six more. A nice symmetry to this over: 6, 1, 6, 1, 6. In the slot again and Harshal drills a lofted drive over Bravo's head. Big hit again.
another poor delivery. A length slower ball on middle and off, Shankar swats the delivery over midwicket. Picked the variation. Might want to change his line.
just clears mid-off. A good length delivery outside off, Shankar chips a flat-batted swat over mid-off for a couple.
full outside off, blocked to mid-off for a run. Nicely bowled from Bravo.
that's a good slower ball, it deceived Harshal Patel. But he got there early and still flicked the ball over square leg for six. Enough power
digs it in, Shankar reads the length early, stays back and pulls over deep midwicket for a big six. Far too easy once he picked the length.
a back of a length delivery outside off, Shankar mis-times a pull to long-on for one
a short delivery outside off, the slower bouncer. Goes past Shankar's pull
yorker, outside off. And Patel squeezes it away towards point. Off the bat's toe end
lovely! Short on middle, and Shankar adjusts towards the off side, and flicks it fine past MSD's left. Collects four to end the over

short on middle, and that's been top edged! Bhajji makes no mistake at mid on. Quicker ball, and his inexperience to the pace shows. Not as good a performance as last time for Abhishek. The ball got big on him, and eventually cramped him for space. Looks like it's the time-out as well
flat on middle again, and Shankar goes onto the back foot. Fended towards short cover
low full toss, and Shankar plays this towards wide long on. It was an attempted slower ball
full just outside off, and that's been drilled! Straight past Bravo, and even beats the man at long off! Bravo did well to get his feet out of the way
slower ball, and Maxwell mistimes to long on. It was full and wide outside off, and his attempted punch comes off the bat's inside half
short on off, and he tries to hook it over square leg. Misses, and the ball goes through to MSD. Shankar looks at the umpire for a wide, but nope.
back of a length on off, and spinning away from Shankar. Tries to defend, but the ball sneaks just past his outside edge
full outside off, and Pant tries the big heave towards midwicket. Slices it though, and that's gone straight down third man's throat. Lungi gets Pant
slower ball, and a length delivery on leg stump. Pant shuffles across to the off side, and nudges it off his hips to deep midwicket
full on off, and Maxwell flicks it away to wide long on to get off the mark
cleaned him up! Iyer tries to make room and cut, but Ngidi bowls straight on off stump. Iyer misses, Ngidi hits. Crashes into the top of off stump
too close to his body for the cut! On the corridor of uncertainty, but Iyer attempted the square cut anyway. Through to Dhoni
flighted outside off, and Pant takes the bait! Slices it over Bhajji's head, and long off's getting under. Nope! Sails just over Bravo
grip and spin! On off, but turning away from Pant. Defended with soft hands
good length outside off, and cut away past point! Men there inside the circle, but Pant manages to thread the gap with perfection
tries the reverse, but can't connect! It was full outside off, but Pant expected it to be closer to him. Stopped by MSD
on his toes, and slogged over cow corner! Full on off, and muscled by Pant towards the leg side. The ball straightened after pitching, but Pant's just too good
a slower ball down leg, Pant misses a flick. Off the pad to square leg.
a length delivery down leg, Pant swings across the line, off the thigh pad down to fine leg.
just over cover. Full outside off, chipped over cover for two. A sloppy effort from Thakur and Pant gets two
full outside off, Pant looks to drive but the ball goes past the outside edge, Just missed a straight ball.
nicely bowled. Sees Iyer coming so he fires it wider. Defended to cover.
quick down leg, the pace beats Iyer's flick. Struck on the pad.
on the pads from Jadeja, 96 kph, worked to midwicket for one.
130 kph, another bouncer on off. Pant gets over the bounce and pulls, but finds midwicket.
122 kph, a short delivery, aimed at the helmet. Pant watches this nicely, gets on top of the bounce and pulls through square leg for four. Nice.
full and wide outside off, another swing and miss from Pant.
full and straight, some swing. Pant works the ball through backward square leg for a couple. He had to get bat on it because it swung back in.
awful bowling. Tripe. He digs a slower bouncer outside off with third man up? Iyer has four free runs if he makes contact: he does with an upper cut over Dhoni.
a slower ball down leg, Iyer stands his ground and slogs across the line. Misses. Struck on the pad, but going down leg.

out with a direct hit! Good from Pant to trust his partner. But maybe he shouldn't have. A good length delivery down leg, Iyer pushes to mid-on, calls for one, realises his weight is on the back foot so he says no very late. But Pant is already down, he turns back and dives back. But the throw from the fielder is not accurate so he's fine. His wrist is not though. Some damage to his hand.

and it gets worse. What kind of a shot is that? It's a good length delivery on off, Shaw stands in his crease and looks to hoick the ball over midwicket. No feet movement, no regard for the fielder at long-on. Exuberance, I suppose. But all he can do is splice the ball to long-on. That was not a very pleasing innings.
flat and wide, Iyer tries an open-faced dab but misses.
good work. Flat and straight, Shaw slog-sweeps again over midwicket. Just clears the fielder. Thakur goes back and pulls the ball back in.
just over midwicket for a couple. Flat and straight, Shaw stays low and slogs a sweep over midwicket. He's looking quite bad with those strokes
full on off, quick. Iyer comes down and pushes away to long-off. More of a leading edge
back of a length outside off, Iyer makes room and slices a cut to backward point. Picks out the fielder very well. But a fumble allows one.
he's picked the length of that. A slower delivery on middle and leg, Shaw reads the length and swats over midwicket with so much ease. A poor delivery.
full delivery outside off, a massive swing and miss from Shaw.
a good change in length but too short. Dug in around middle, Shaw ducks. Too high.
swung away. Looking to go through the line. Full and wide outside off, Shaw throws his hands at the ball, mis-hit to mid-off
good length around off, Iyer defends towards point solidly
wow, Shaw struggling against swing! Full this time outside off, Shaw drives and is beaten comfortably. Very loose indeed
was there glove on that? Sloppy glovework from Dhoni. Back of a length down leg, off the pad as Iyer misses a flick. Dhoni dives to his left, but the ball pops out for some leg byes.
beaten again! Good length delivery outside off, Shaw's feet are rooted in the crease as he drives. The ball beats the bat
hoicked away over square leg. Chahar tries the other one this time, the inswinger. Back of a length down leg, Shaw picks the length early and pulls easily over square leg
beaten on swing again! That's another beautiful delivery, back of a length outside off. Shaw looks to punch the ball through cover, but the ball swings and moves away late
back of a length outside off, Shaw stands tall and punches to cover from the back foot

swings this full toss towards wide long-on, single is all Pandey will get.  Firecrackers go off in Bengaluru as RCB stay alive!  Sunrisers have been pipped at the post despite some shoddy bowling from Royal Challengers.
Kohli fluffs a simple chance at long-off  but Chinnaswamy applauds because they know barring a brain freeze, they can't lose this. Hooda looked to clear the ropes, toe-ended it
full toss angling down, swings and misses. Ball deflects off the pad towards short fine. A leg bye is all they'll get.  Siraj escapes with a juicy full toss
in the blockhole, just inside the wide line. Pandey let it go, errs in judgment. Hits the turf in anger.
walks across to scoop, Southee bowls this full and wide, deflected gently to short third man, misfield from substitute Pawan Negi, but there's no damage done
into the blockhole perfectly, squeezed on the bounce over Southee's head, Kohli comes hustling in from long-off to keep it to a single

gets underneath the length and belts this over, de Grandhomme comes in from long-on, and slides to stop but in doing so, ends up kicking this over the ropes. Oh, oh. Half-century for Pandey. CDG was late in getting down
sees Pandey move around in the crease and spears this full and wide, but bowls this well outside the wide line outside off.
gets into position to scoop again, Siraj bowls length outside off, so Pandey gets down on one knee and ramps him cleverly over short third man. Stunning!

walks across the stumps and scoops this full delivery over short fine leg. All three stumps exposed. Siraj missed his yorker and watched him lap sweep. Pandey power. Finds an admirer in VVS from the dugout
walks across and squeezes this wide yorker to Umesh again, at mid-off. Followed Williamson's movements there.
slower and fuller outside off, Pandey looks to go over Southee's head but mistimes it straight back to him. Dot ball
yorker-length outside off, Williamson walks across and squeezes this to third man
short and fired down leg, wide called. Rightly so. Frustration for Chahal and RCB

turns this against the turn to deep square leg, the throw from de Grandhomme is on the bounce but a touch wide, Pandey hares back and is safe. Only just. Saved by a couple of centimetres. Great work by Parthiv as he gathered the throw and came up with an underarm flick onto the stumps
short and sliding in, Pandey swivels back and helps this to the deep square leg boundary. Poor ball from Chahal
clean strike to clear long-on. Big, big strike. Pandey is finding his hitting range, finally. Length ball from De Grandhomme, punished.
full and straight on middle, quite loopy, Pandey mistimes this attempted lofted hit to long-on
slower length ball outside off, Williamson unfurls his wrists nicely. Opened it up nicely to slice this over point. Magnificent
pulled over deep midwicket! Flat hit. Too short, sitting up nicely, Williamson picked the length early
goes over cover, down to Umesh at sweeper cover, for a moment it looked like a risky second but Williamson completes it easily
fizz, turn and bounce. Williamson pokes and misses as this whizzes past the outside edge from middle and off

today is a day of catches, physics-defying from AB!  It's that superman AB de Villiers. The catch is so good that Kohli and his mates do a 100 metre dash to run towards their mate. Magnificent, incredible. Hales steps out and muscles this length ball over deep midwicket, he thinks he's cleared it but doesn't know what's to come. AB leaps high, but realises the ball was swirling away. Instinctively puts his right hand out and pulls off a one-handed stunner even as it continued to curl away. Mind you. he was airborne when the ball lodged in his hand, so there was still a simple matter of having to land, keep control and be mindful of the ropes. All items checked. Wow
skiddy length ball, Williamson is cramped for room as he hops back and defends back past Umesh for a single
slashed away to point where Mandeep moves quickly to his right to stop that. Williamson has missed out
beats the diving mid-on fielder. Too much drift in from wide of the crease, Williamson meets this on the half-volley as he flicks imperiously
through with the pull early, hit on the body. Siraj changed the pace, rolled his fingers across the seam to bowl a slower bouncer
walloped in style! Dhawan gets into position quickly and belts this pull over deep midwicket. Welcome, Siraj
driven back to Chahal, good stop off his own bowling.
the helicopter has taken off. The wristy whip from outside off to the deep midwicket boundary. Sensational from Hales. Not much wrong with the delivery, Umesh has an exasperated look.
same line and length, but Mandeep plays a different shot, a flick into the gap at midwicket for two.
flat and quick outside off, pushed to cover for one. Good single, good awareness from Mandeep

for all the pyrotechnics of RCB batting, that is spectacular from Dhawan! Stalls this innings, quietens the crowd with a typical T20 play. Events such as this change games. And all it needs to be is a catch. A flat delivery on middle and leg, AB stays low and sweeps towards deep square leg It seems like it's lobbing over Dhawan, but he stays calm, takes the catch and ensures his balance doesn't take him over by keeping a strong centre of gravity. Awesome catch. Not as good as Boult's, but very close.
a very similar delivery, a slow wide delivery outside off. AB goes from bottom to top and carves the ball over backward point.
that's what he does, forces you to bowl wides. Just outside the tramline and wide. But that's a good option from Sandeep

it's the shot he plays when he feels at the top of his game. Remember him sweeping Steyn or Rabada or Holder? He tries it again, it's a slow delivery, he waits and pull-sweeps over short fine leg. AB at his best
Moeen on faaaya! A short delivery on off and middle, Ali pulls fiercely and beautifully over square leg for six. A front-foot pull, that's how much T20 batting has changed.
another fifty for AB. And what an innings too. Just a tad short on middle, he stays back and pulls through midwicket for four. So easy
another googly down leg, he misses a swat. AB asks why is that not a wide with his expressions at the umpire.
AB misses a sweep, gets right outside the line for just this. The googly hits the pad, but outside the line

a great catch from Dhawan at long-on, but he backtracks into the boundary cushion. Slapped with fierce power from Ali, flat and hard. Dhawan takes an overhead catch but goes back into the boundary for six. This is a lovely cameo
a slower ball outside off, Ali's wild heave is missed.
flat and straight again, punched to cover. Excellent over from Shakib.
signs of a slow surface, but it's very slow from Shakib too, on middle and leg, wants to hit to cover, hits to the bowler
flat and straight, de Villiers drives back to Shakib. Well bowled again
very wide outside off, forcing Ali to drag a sweep, to deep midwicket
slow on middle, AB backs away and pushes to cover.
flight outside off, Ali flat-bats a slog to long-on. This is new-age T20 cricket, going after pretty much everything early in the over
on the bounce! A slower delivery on leg, 98 kph, may have been too slow for AB. Pulled to deep square leg
smashed for six! That's good, clear, proactive batting from Ali. Doesn't want to leave all the scoring to AB, so when he gets a full delivery outside off, he lofts a lofted drive over mid-off.
the googly outside off, goes past Ali's cut.
a tad short. That's the AB 1-2. Forcing a short delivery after a good shot of the full one, pulled to square leg.
a googly on off, tapped to cover for one. He read that well did Mo Ali.
excellently bowled, a yorker on middle, jammed out to mid-off. Very good over from Kaul.

AB's picking them before the bowler knows what he wants to bowl. As soon as he sees it's full and straight, he knows where he's going - over mid-on because the field is in. And even though it's not AB's best timing, it's good enough because his decision-making is so quick. Awesome. Just lands inside? This is taking an age from the third umpire. The 147th replay goes on screen. Woooohooo, a decision at last: it's four.

cleaned 'im up. You can't really say that often but that was poor game awareness from Kohli. He just got four against the opposition's best bowler, and went for six this time. It's a tossed up googly outside off, Kohli backs away and slogs across the line. He misses, the ball doesn't, hits off and middle stump. Maybe it was instinct or his determination to attack the best, but that wasn't the best decision he's made.
races away. Rashid drops short, Kohli goes back and pulls over midwicket for four. Just read the length quickly.
Williamson saves four. Flat and wide outside off, Kohli flat-bats that towards KW at mid-off. He races away and dives to his right
the googly on middle, worked to midwicket. Kohli comes down, AB says get back. And Virat does. Good early communication because it was the wrong call from Kohli
too much flight there, overpitched and Kohli chooses the safer option to drive with the spin to deep cover.
flat and straight, some more spin but Kohli is an exceptional player of spin. Goes back and works to wide mid-on, against the spin
nicely bowled actually. Very slow outside off, bowling to his field. AB drives to deep cover and gets off strike.
nailed! 18 off 7 now is AB. This one is full outside off, he clears his front leg and nails a lofted drive over cover. This is glorious, free stroke-making

still shortish, can go a tad fuller and try to get AB out playing a lofted drive on this surface. The short length allows AB to go back and cut towards cover for one. Excellent over from Shakib, but well played too.
lots of spin actually already. Flat and wide, it takes plenty of spin and Kohli cuts away into the off side
excellent bowling. Slows the pace up outside off, AB checks his shot. Takes a thick leading edge towards point, does not carry. Lovely flight
that's a fantastic start for AB. He loves it when he starts with four. A short flat delivery outside off, AB hurries back and nails a cut through point.
good single now. Back of a length outside off, tapped down towards point and Kohli calls his partner through.
yummy! A full delivery outside off, Kohli walks down to negate the swing. It's full enough and he nails a delectable off drive. Past the bowler, past mid-off. Lovely shot.
on the pads from Sandeep, a hint of away shape. Worked away to midwicket
at last! A poor ball that's been punished! Axar Patel lines up this full toss with a lot of width outside off and slaps it over long-on.

holes out to sweeper cover! It's the third length ball in a row from Mitch, and this time he even gets rewarded for it. Yuvraj uses the angle and tries to go off side - ends up slicing it straight to deep extra cover
oh he's missed a juicy length ball outside off. That was there for the six. Yuvraj swings and can't get bat on it
inside edge onto body. A short ball and a nervous poke from Yuvraj. Single pitch side on the leg side

he's got him! There is one hero in the Mumbai Indians team too! 2 for 12 in his fourth over before this ball. Jasprit Bumrah's slower ball has deceived Rahul again. It's in the slot - overpitched outside off - and Rahul is looking to deposit this over long-off. It's off the toe-end and is taken well inside the boundary. It's a sensational, if not legendary innings, from this man. But he's fallen with 10 balls to go.
slower ball. Pitches and cuts away from the wide marker. Rahul leaves
genius. KL Rahul knows exactly what's coming. He's made it so - he's making the bowler do it. Another slower ball dropped short, another reverse-swipe to third man
shot! Rahul with the reminder he's still around. Slower ball dropped short outside off. He swivels and reverse-swats this over short third man!
bye-bye! Don't. Bowl. Short. It's climbing up at Rahul's shoulder but he has swiveled much before it can get close and swatted to this to the long leg boundary

appeal immediately, given immediately! Bumrah has turned it on! Stoinis has no answer to this mean bouncer headed for his face. Not even close to playing a hook. It's flicked the glove before half his swing is in. He's out before he can put in a semblance of a follow through. What. An. Over.
length ball, driven firmly back down the pitch. Deflects into the midwicket region off Bumrah's leg

good catch from Hardik Pandya. This ball has gone at least five stories up from what I can see. He has to run in from deep midwicket with half an eye on Evin Lewis who is coming in from deep square. For most of his journey, that ball is possibly just a dot in the sky. For some of it, it's swerving. And by the end, it's coming down hard. He is fully composed through it all and completes it. Good job. Finch was looking to bludgeon this length ball over deep square leg

what pressure?, Rahul asks as he jumps down once more and sends this flying into the second tier over long-on! What a player this guy is. He hasn't got to the pitch of this after stepping out but he goes through and launches it long
you gorgeous man! Rahul jumps down confidently to meet this length ball at leg stump and holds his shape - perfect shape - to cream this over  the straight boundary

lifts it over short third but hasn't hit it too well. Krunal pedals backwards and flicks it back for point who has given him an option. Rahul lifted this with a reverse-scoop, it was full on off stump
top edge! Lands to short third man's left. He's teasing Finch here. Loopy length ball spinning away from off. He's backing into the leg side and swinging for midwicket

loopy, tossed up ball on leg stump. Finch swings hard. Gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket's right comes back very casually and just makes his ground as Kishan deflects the throw onto the stumps
nice. Very nice. Steep bouncer is too much for Finch as he looks to hook. Carries nicely to Kishan
gets it right. Well bowled. Rahul looks to clobber this length ball over midwicket from outside off. It's an offcutter that sits in the pitch and climbs past the outside edge

bludgeoned. Krunal Pandya, what are you doing sticking your hand out at that?! A full ball floated up at middle stump and the shot would have taken the bowler with it if he had miraculously reacted quick enough to get a hand on it
short of a length ball at off. An ugly hoick from Finch. Off the inside half of the bat and running away from Cutting at deep midwicket. He sprints and lunges to his right to stop this

just clears mid-off and Cutting's slide is not enough for him to pull this back. Short ball outside off, Finch backs away and picks the right direction to go with the drive on the up - but it's off the toe-end

there it is. Rahul's newfound superpower to find boundaries behind the wicket. Short ball angled into him and he caresses it with the pace past short fine leg. Not the smartest length from the bowler with fine leg in
sixth fifty in seven chasing innings. Sixth in the tournament as well. Gets calmly behind this length ball and nudges to long-on. KL Rahul, once again, has got into the zone.
lots of power, but straight to long-off. Finch pummels this full ball outside off, along the floor
oh no. Poor bowling. Rahul's been putting these away since he was 10. Short and wide. Decent pace on it too - perfect for a square cut that is executed perfectly
nice. Waits and waits. It's a slow turner from Markande, but it's very short. He hangs deep and bisects backward point and short third man

dropped! An extremely difficult chance for Cutting at cover point. Rahul backs away and stabs aimlessly as this spins away from off stump. It floats high for Cutting who leaps to his right with his left-hand going at the ball and tips it over the bar

oh yeah! Is that Finch getting back into form? Two controlled chops and now an old-fashioned swing across the line to send this slower ball wayyyyyy over deep midwicket. A length ball on off and he's got such a sweet connection on this

got him! The bouncer and the catch in the deep on the leg side - just like in the last game. Rohit points his finger and sprints at Ben Cutting, the fielder who went to his right at deep square to take this miscued hook. Mitch Mac is known for this specific wicket-taking ball. It's climbing, Gayle is swatting. Gayle is gone. Wankhede has burst into celebration
out of the way quickly. A bouncer slanted in at his throat and Gayle is hopping to get out of the way. A customary air-ramp to make it look more convincing. He misses
drilled. Mitch has changed ends and changed length. It's full and in at middle stump - perfect for Gayle to have a swing at it. And he does, four on the bounce at long-on

shot!/ Glorious flowing drive to beat extra cover to his left. An overpitched ball from Hardik, who has managed to be all over the place in a span of six balls. Nice transfer of weight through the forearms from Rahul as he extends them and keeps them along the floor
boom. Pandya messes up his slower ball. It's dug very short and it's sitting up at leg stump. Gayle stands tall and slaughters it, over deep square
nervous feet from Gayle and a slight loss of shape as he fends this away. A short of a length ball in the corridor
beaten. Length ball pushed across the corridor. A lazy jab at it from Rahul and it skids past his outside edge
a superb landing 50 metres behind the keeper. Rahul didn't want it to go there. Trying to tickle a short ball from his hips only to get a top edge
walks across and sweeps this high full toss straight to short fine leg. McClenaghan was on one knee as he looked to play the stroke but this was clearly over his waist.  Freehit coming up
the knuckleball on length, Pandya looks to cut but can only get a thick outside edge that lobs straight to Ashwin at short third man.
into his swinging arc as the ball drifts in from around the stumps, Mitch McClenaghan is down on one knee as he slogs this over cow corner! The carromball gone wrong this time
dags the slog sweep from outside off, picks out Axar at deep midwicket. As easy as they come. Cutting was hitting this against the turn as well.
driven back, excellent stop by Tye off his own bowling
dug in short but way over Cutting's head as he ducks

backs away and clobbers this straight to long-off. Ashwin bowled this just slightly wide outside off as he saw Pollard backing away, he went through with the stroke but didn't hit this off the middle and Finch takes an excellent catch moving to his left at long-off.
bowls this carrom ball wide, Pandya mistimes this slap to cover

thumped over long-off, what a way to get to a half-century. This is some way to announce your return in style. Pollard is pumped, fist-pumps towards the dressing room  Clearly being left out hurt him. What a way to channel that hurt. He's delivered when his team needed him to.
slower ball, the result is the same. Yuvraj can't stop it at third man despite the effort to run around and get there. Pollard saw this full, went for the big hit and sliced it over.
too short, sticking into the surface because this is an offcutter, Krunal into the pull early and he toe-ends this straight to short fine leg.
muscled over long-on. This is brute Pollard power to the fore. Fetched it from outside off but he knew what he was doing
backs away, Axar drifts this into his swinging arc and Pollard muscles this over deep midwicket. Onto the top tier
in the slot, Pollard drags this lofted hit down to long-on
slower and fuller outside off and he's drilled this to beat long-off. Stoinis under pressure, crunching stroke that
short and sliding down leg, Pollard misses a nudge, well taken by Rahul
full and swings back in late, Pollard flicks to deep square off a thick inside edge

knuckleball, knuckleball and them seam-up. is there some bat on it? Yes! Two in two and Tye is on fire. Surya his hustled for pace as this skids on, he looks to play the short-arm jab to square leg but ends up getting a thick bottom edge edge that lobs off the thigh pad and is taken by the keeper.
cross-batted heave but he can only hit it as far as mid-on. No timing, no power, dragged it from outside off. Clever from Tye, it's that knuckleball again.
right through Lewis! The purplecap holder strikes gold! This is a knuckleball that comes back in to beat the inside edge and flatten off stump.
low full toss, which Russell swings away to long-on

that's ridiculously good! Unadkat is bowling around the wicket, often taking all the pace off it. This one comes down at top pace, Karthik spots it and gently deflects it away to the third man boundary. Imagine your friend putting an arm around you, only to slap a sign that says "kick me!"
defends a good length ball on middle. That's Stokes' spell - and his season - done.
full on middle, Russell knocks it away to deep midwicket

taken at deep point! It's short. It's wide. It needs to be whacked, which Lynn tries to do. But the connection is weak. It comes off the outside half of the bottom of the bat and goes only as far as Anureet.
tosses it up on middle, Karthik blocks into the covers and sprints through

top edge flies away past Buttler on the right. Lynn sees another short ball that he likes, this time he goes for a pull, and still gets the runs he wants. Perhaps more considering that part of the ground is well protected
takes the pace off, but Lynn picks it and pulls to long-on

carves it to the point boundary! A little room to work with. A lot more pace to take advantage of. And the old Chris Lynn. The man nearly everyone comes to watch at the Gabba in the BBL pops out to prove it really is him
full, wide, smash and the ball disappears to the cover boundary. Karthik's skills in finishing a chase are fairly incredible
bounces short of long-on, where K Gowtham races in seeing Lynn loft a short and wide ball in his direction.
shifts over to off stump to deal with Sodhi's big-turning legbreaks and whips this through midwicket
offcutter again, which Lynn glides to the sweeper cover
slower bouncer, moving across the right-hander, Lynn ignores it
back of a length on leg stump, Karthik deflects it to fine leg
lovely drift into the right-hander, but Karthik stretches forward to cover it and blocks with soft hands

huge appeal for lbw. Umpire Dharmasena says no but Royals want a second look. Regardless of what happens, this is a lovely delivery. Sodhi slows it up, and as a result, gets it to drift away. That drift has Rana nervous. He has no stride, he is playing outside the line as if he thinks this is a googly, but the ball turns sharply to pin him on the front pad and HawkEye shows it is hitting leg stump. Decision overturned. Royals rising.
fires it in from around the wicket, Rana reads the trick early and chops it behind point
the googly around off, 82 kph. Rana looks for the big slog sweep but all he can do is chop it back into his body
shortish delivery outside off, short enough for Lynn to go back and read the ball off the pitch. Worked to wide long-on
80.5 kph. Very hard hands from Lynn, which is why that ball almost popped back. A legbreak on middle, Lynn blocks and almost carries back to Ish.
the googly, read by Rana. He goes back and carves a cut to point
back of a length around off, 135 kph, defended into the off side. Rana happy to play this out.
a good slower ball, 109 kph, some loop and dip on that. Ends up floating like a butterfly, and jamming down on Lynn as he blocks.
149.6 kph. Back of a length on middle, Rana backs away, clears his front leg and carves a cut wide of backward point, to his left. That's his strength and he played to that.
the beautiful Test 1-2! A nice full delivery that pitches and moves away. Rana's feet are rooted and his drive is beaten
Rana too has struggled against the bouncer already this IPL. A bouncer outside off, Rana avoids that watchfully.
too full and Lynn says why bother bowling there? An overpitched, hit-me, half-volley outside off. Lynn gently drills the drive through cover for four.

taken at deep square leg! 144 kph, it's another short delivery. Another well-directed bouncer. Uthappa struggles to time the ball or keep it down. He does neither and picks out the fielder. Stokes is using that length exceptionally well. Harried for pace.
keeps low? Back of a length down leg, Lynn looks to pull, but the ball keeps a tad low. He is hit on the thigh or midriff

147 kph. "That's not the plan with third man up," says Warne with the host broadcaster. That indeed is a terrible plan. A short delivery outside off, Lynn just stays underneath the length and lofts the ball over short third man. Lands just inside

the look-away pull six from Lynn. Archer attacks the badge, it's a very good bouncer. But that's the risk on grounds like these. Lynn is hurried, he takes his eyes off the ball and then top-edges the pull over backward square leg.
just short of Buttler! Back of a length outside off, Uthappa looks to guide this down to third man, an under edge is collected on the bounce.
a slower ball down leg, nudged down to short fine leg. 0 off 5. Wicket maiden from Stokes.

Gowtham takes the catch and sends Narine off. 21 off 7, that's three runs a ball. Job done from Narine. But that's the length to bowl to Narine. Another short delivery outside off, Narine backs away and mis-times a pull. He was clearly rushed for pace there, and all he could do was splice the pull to cover.
that's how Narine plays the short deliveries. Gets outside the line and tries to hit short deliveries over point. Misses.
flat and quick outside off, Lynn blocks.
too close to that! BOOO! Full and straight, Narine comes down and hits to long-on. All along the ground.
flat on middle and leg, Narine backs away and slaps the ball over cover. Flat-batted glory for Narine. Bludgeoning both lengths.
toe-ended away over long-on. Narine is looking at the bottom of the bat. He runs down, gets close enough to the pitch and lofted pretty cleanly over long-on for six! Job done? 16 off 3.
first ball six! Block the first ball? Watch the spin? Play with a straight bat? No, says Narine. It's full, straight and T20d away over midwicket for six. Too full and heaved away
that's it. A slower ball crashes into middle stump as Unadkat looks for a slog sweep. Misses it completely, but the umps are going to check on the no-ball. He's fine. Innings over.
full toss on off stump, Unadkat whacks it to long-on
slower ball off the back of the hand, dipping on the right-hander. Anureet defends in front of middle and gets a single
full toss on middle, Anureet slices it to sweeper cover

dropped by Krishna running in from cover. This is the quicker ball, and it that should have got a wicket. Unadkat is beaten for pace. He's swinging hard because it's short and outside off. But it goes straight up. There's an age for Krishna to get under it, but it pops out
legcutter, which Archer picks, but the lack of room means he can only find cover

appeal for the weirdest caught behind ever with KKR thinking the ball has come off the bottom edge, onto boot and then to the keeper. Soft signal is not out. The fun starts with a yorker, that Sodhi inside edges onto his back boot, bounces off his back pad and settles in DK's hands. Third umpire rules it out, rightly. Boy, if ever there was a sign that this game is KKR's
over the fielder at point! Unadkat is 22 from 12! And he's played some sparkling shots. Like rasping cut to a short and wide delivery.
width on offer and Unadkat lashes it to the point boundary. Lovely placement, picks the gap to the right of the man inside the circle and to the left of the sweeper
slower ball on off stump, Unadkat picks it and blocks down the pitch
full on middle and off stump, Unadkat smokes it to cover
spears it through the covers, Unadkat showing how its done. Stands still on leg stump, opens the face to place it to the right of the fielder
tosses it up on off stump, Sodhi comes forward to block. That's the end of a supremely good spell of spin bowling.

pops it back to the bowler! Fourth wicket for Kuldeep! This angle from around the wicket to Stokes has really been messing with him. The left-hander keeps playing the original line, with each ball pitching on leg stump, but since he isn't reading the ball out the hand, and with his team in tatters, he cannot attack. He can only nudge. Goes for a little flick, but there is just enough gap between the ball and bat for it to turn, claim a bit of the leading edge and return to where it came from.
loops it up on leg stump, from around the wicket, Stokes makes room and drives to long-on

bounces him out! Hostile stuff! Gowtham has shown he is outrageously good at dispatching anything in his half out of the park. So makes perfect sense to test him with the short ball. And Mavi's really quick too. Gets it to come up towards his throat. Gowtham shuffles inside the line and tries to fend it away to fine leg. Only gloves it through to the keeper
short on middle, Stokes dabs it through point
strays on the pads and Stokes whips it away to deep square leg
slower ball, and Stokes, who is stuck in the crease, mistimes it to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, Stokes chops it to point
another googly! Gowtham presses forward to defend, thinking it will spin into him, but the ball darts past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves
looks to nudge it through wide mid-on as Kuldeep goes around the wicket. Gets a leading edge down to long-off

sensational googly! Binny does not pick it. He's lunging out of his crease, searching for ball so he could flick it through midwicket. But it just does not behaves the way he thinks it would. Drifts past the edge. Pitches and spins further. DK is ready and waiting behind the stumps and well
lunges forward to block a tossed up offbreak and is surprised by the dip on it. Binny thinks he can get to the pitch, but suddenly has to use his wrists to keep the ball down
good length and outside off, Binny lets it go

appeal for lbw as Samson sets up a pull shot. He is hitting with the turn, but the ball skids through and strikes him on the pads. DK wants to review. The impact is on the back leg, which is right in line with off stump, and HawkEye says it's hitting the stumps as well. Umpire Anil Chaudhary will have to change his on-field not-out decision
length ball on leg stump, Stokes flicks it away to deep midwicket
on the pads, spinning away from the left-hander. Stokes works it through midwicket
full and on and around off stump, Stokes hits to long-on
full toss outside off which Samson slaps down to long-off
nice and full to the new batsman and Stokes jams it down the ground
nice drift away from the right-hander and that is what makes Buttler a tad bit tentative. Reaches out to it and blocks as carefully as he could
back of a length outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides that down to third man for a run
on leg stump, worked to deep midwicket. Buttler may just look to bat for a bit now.
the conventional paddle sweep, Sanju tries first up. It's the googly, hits Samson on the body

80 kph, that's a weird shot. Is that a shot he plays well? I don't think so, which makes that reverse sweep a weird attempt. Looks to reverse sweep that ball - a lofted googly - through point. It's on leg stump too, indicating that was a premeditated shot. He misses, but the ball hits leg and middle stump. Kuldeep has confidence now, that's dangerous.
doesn't bother with the straight bat. A stock delivery on off, Rahane stays low and sweeps to deep square leg for a couple.
back of a length on off, nudged away towards midwicket, Rahane calls for two and makes it. Well placed, well run
breaks that pressure with a neat flick through backward square leg. Was an exceptional over till that point, but the line was errant and Rahane's off
looks to slog sweep, but makes no contact. Slow and wide outside off, the ball turns back in. Rahane misses, so does Karthik
slow around off, worked to midwicket. Two dots for Rahane.
back of a length outside off. Russell sticking with that length. Guides to gully, on the bounce.

gloved and gone! Eden Gardens goes wild. A short delivery down leg, Russell was quick and hustling. Tripathi is hurried on the pull and eventually, he can only get a glove on his pull, through to DK. That's a massive wicket, primarily because it's some relief.
a low full toss, down the leg side. Tripathi misses a flick somehow, off the pad to third man
slingy action. Full and wide outside off, Tripathi wants to play then bails out.

too full this time outside off. Buttler stays low and bottom-hands that drive away through wide mid-off. How he gets so much power on that is down to that bottom hand. In the slog overs, he would just loft that shot for six. He doesn't need to against Narine.
11 in 12! A full delivery outside off, an offbreak. Tripathi stays low and swats the delivery over midwicket for four. Almost went for six.

10 boundaries in 10 balls! Wow, what a start for Royals. Probably his best delivery, close to a wide yorker but why would you want to bowl that with third man up? Buttler sees the ball early and scythes the ball through backward point.
nine in nine! 45 runs in 2.5 overs. Buttler backs away, then shuffles right back in line and scoops a straight delivery over fine leg for six. Too easy for Jos.
a poor ball. Royals are flying. Short and wide outside off, Buttler slices an upper cut over point. Bad bowling.
short and wide, 139 kph. Buttler backed away too far and so had to stretch out too far to get bat on it. He gets that: a top edge and it flies over short third man.
that's splendid. Full and straight again, don't think that's the length you want to bowl here. Tripathi says thanks with a delightful, delectable on-drive through mid-on.
how has that gone for four? 143 kph, full on off, a bit of seam too. Tripathi now wants to work that ball through midwicket, but that away movement takes the outside edge and flies through gully!

that's what T20s are all about. Anticipation. The first ball of the over was tidy and straight. So Tripathi backs away and hopes it's there again. It is. He slices a carve off a full, straight delivery over point. Fantastic batting

back of a length, the ball pitches and seams back in after pitching. Tripathi wants to play the ball into the off side but didn't account for that movement. The ball snakes in to hit Tripathi on the body, near the neck.
hitting the hard length. Back of a length down leg, hustles Tripathi for pace. Hits him on the body as he misses a flick.
good single. Back of a length around off, the ball seams back in. An inside edge into the pad, trickles back towards the keeper. Tripathi calls Buttler through.
back of a length outside off, Buttler stays back and carves the ball to point. No feet movement, not much at least.
a full, wide delivery outside off, Buttler looks to drive through the line but jabs it back

dropped but it's also a no-ball. Kohli doesn't run. It's high and outside off, he lifts a simple catch for long-off who comes in, makes the ground, gets to the ball and then fails to hold on. Would have been game over if he had run there
beaten. Another slower ball dying on the batsman from back of a length. Patel swings and it skids through from under his bat
a short ball just outside off. Kohli onto the front foot to pummel this to deep midwicket's left with a flat bat

ohhhhh yesssss! Last ball of the Powerplay crunched over the long-off boundary. Kohli backs away to get full swinging room at this overpitched ball on off. Brings out the full swing too to lift this, flat
lovely bouncer has Kohli falling away into the leg side to get his head out of the way as he leaves. Of course, then he appears incensed that isn't a wide

oh this looks plumb. It's not given and Ashwin reviews straight away. If there's no bat on this, I reckon Kohli will be in some trouble. Misses a length ball headed for leg stump as he plants the front foot across oh it's going down! That looked closer in real time. Turns out it's a very good decision. Among other things, Kings XI have lost their review now as well
bouncer climbs over his right shoulder. Nice height on that. Too steep for Kohli to try and hook
beaten in pace as he steps out. It's a knuckle ball from Tye that stops on him and he's forced to fend into the covers off the outside half

dropped. Finch lunges to his right at mid-off but can't hold onto this miscued shot. Kohli steps out again and turns this into a full toss. But his attempted shot is right off the toe-end and he ends up chipping it
slices over the off-side infield. Rajpoot getting special treatment. Length ball on off stump and Kohli is jumping down the pitch before if lands. Makes room and carves it over point

boom! Kohli was setting up for that shot with Rajpoot still two metres away from delivering. Length ball on middle stump, he has taken a tiny step into the leg side and whipped this well over the midwicket boundary

close call! Length ball at middle stump, flicked straight to mid-on. It's timed well and Kohli has misjudged this one. Ashwin is onto it quickly to his right and fires a throw at the non-striker's end. Kohli would have been short
leading edge. Kohli walks down the track to try and flick a length ball that's swinging away in the corridor

has he nicked off here? Yes, sounded like a feather. Tye tries to pull this shortish one that gets a little too big on him outside off and gets a mild top-edge that goes through to the keeper. Seems like he wanted to review that. At least that was the signal to the umpire but he ends up walking right past him

has Ashwin run himself out here? He's put in a dive that may have just saved him, No, in fact, it hasn't. That's pretty incredible. A wide, bad throw but Ashwin is nowhere in the frame as Parthiv breaks the stumps. The Kings XI captain dropped this length ball into the covers and just set off for the single but was sent back by an uninterested Axar. Kings XI in quite the mess here

and he's picked out deep midwicket. Kings XI falling apart here. Finch picks up this length ball from middle and off and fails to get hold of this slog, skews it straight into the hands of Kohli in the deep
slides on outside off, Finch backs away and chops it to the right of cover
backs away and Moeen follows him with a shortish delivery. The angle only helps Finch as he swivels and mows a pull over deep midwicket

oh what a shot! Finch has generated an unbelievable amount of power for a straight-batted shot to clear the extra cover boundary. Very full and just outside off and this is so smooth - a clean lift to clear the ground

bowled him! Good old spinner's wicket - keep the single option open to a nervous batsman and bowl at his stumps. Stoinis looks like he wants to push it through covers but has pushed his front foot too far forward in anticipation. Yorks himself and loses his off stump
two-handed forehand wide of mid-off. That is creamed. Short of a length and the first semblance of room Umesh has offered. Gayle backs away and slaps away
see ya! Umesh tries to become the wristspinning Yadav and fails woefully. A half-tacker, sits up nicely at off stump Rahul slogs it over midwicket
deft from Rahul. Length ball at middle stump, gets right on top of the bounce and tickles it through the open square leg region
full toss this time and Punjab have a sensational over. Gayle has his front foot out of the way as he's backing into the off side. Gets behind the line, chips it over mid-off
too short. Southee can't get that to climb at Gayle's chest and that means plenty of room for the batsman to swivel and swat this on the bounce to the midwicket boundary
hammered. Poor ball. Short, very wide. Gayle pummels it well in front of cover

falls short of AB at mid-off. Rahul backs away to open up the off side. They haven't given him any room today. He's off balance as he tries to punch on the up while moving down leg side. Chips it and AB puts in a full length dive to his right and forward. Won't get there

shot! Cannot bowl short to Rahul this season! His game behind the wicket has improved dramatically. It's at his head, but slightly down leg side. He has no issues getting slightly inside the line and hooking over fine leg
guides the yorker down to third man. Almost expects this ball from fast bowlers, Gayle. Stands tall in the crease and digs it out
struck on the thigh and looking for a quick single! Yadav has Gayle rattled. Short of a length and into his body. He's very very late on the attempted pull and there's no run at short leg
beats the outside edge as Gayle is stranded. No feet as he hangs the bat out in the corridor. It fizzes past him

swiped away. Southee goes marginally short and with his stump-to-stump line, Rahul has the freedom to go behind square. He's got the ability to get on the back foot quickly too. Sends it over square leg
Rahul walks into the leg side to expose the stumps. Southee follows him with a length ball and forces him to defend
ouch. Gayle doesn't know about this one either. A bouncer slanted across his stumps that he's expecting to nip away. Expect it thuds him under the left shoulder

dropped! Parthiv Patel can't hold on with a one-handed dive to his left. Gayle and he are both expecting this to swing in. It does through the air before straightening. Gayle defends inside the line to get the edge, Parthiv takes a step to his right before leaping one-handed. Can't take it
late swing again. Length ball hooping away and Rahul stabs at it away from the body to run is uppishly towards third man
swing. Late away swing in the corridor. Rahul on the front foot and jabbing at this with soft hands. Gets it into his body off the inside edge
Samson has no interest in landmarks, he just wants a quick finish! Powered over cow corner, and this one is utterly cooked!
slower ball, too short, and Samson responds with arguably the most massive spank of the night! High and mighty into the floodlights and 20 rows back!
slower ball, aiming for the tramlines, and that's worked out in the end. Buttler left it alone, but was adjudged to have shuffled close enough to have a swing
too short for a man seeing it this well. Buttler stands firm, such a solid base, and baseball swings over the leg side
slower-ball bouncer, Buttler has the big wind-up but he can't make any contact. There've been some moments in this innings where Buttler's been out-smarted, but he finds a way to hit back every time
no contact this time, as this one zips through Buttler's swing and into his thigh-pad
here we go! Tossed up, right into Buttler's slot, and he slots it with glee, high over the leg side!
stunning ball! Tossed up, dips late, spins and bounces, and whistles through his pushed drive and over the top of middle! Takes a good ball to get past Buttler at the moment
attempted back-cut, can't get it off the square but they scamper the single, Krunal has been effective tonight
on the pads, no room to free the arms, and Rahane settles for a measured nudge to square leg
that's a good response from Pandya, shorter and sharper, tempting Buttler into the ramp shot, but the ball is through him too quickly. Cat-and-mouse stuff in that over
Buttler inverts his stance for his trademark scoop shot, the length was safe enough, but no contact as the ball hops over his stumps
makes room early, Krunal follows him, Buttler retreats some more, lofts inside out over cover, and away for four! Skill and power
