attempted ramp from Rahane, but he wears it on the glove. Leaning back, attempting to pinch a four through third man, but the slower ball did for him
swept hard to square leg and has that carried to Markande? No it hasn't   a flurry of excitement, but Buttler was unbothered. Good connection, if a touch early. Nope, just short
on the back foot, left-arm over the wicket, Buttler slides back to meet the ball under his nose, deep in his crease
edged and gone! And that had been coming all over! A bit of swing, Bumrah gets his line right, Short's feet going nowhere, and the keeper snaffles a comfortable nick!
Short is creasebound, and pokes awkwardly as the ball zips through from back of a length
Zoinks, that is a staggeringly good first ball, a massive booming inswinger, Short jabs down late and somehow digs it out through fine leg for four!
slower short ball outside off, Cutting can't manufacture his own pace. Dragged away to wide long-on. Cutting hares back for the second
Cutting tees off in the final over. Slower ball, 100ks, but too full on middle, Cutting clears his front leg and smites it over the long-on fence. Muscled away. Royals continue to err in lengths

Archer now drops an absolute sitter. Look at Warne in the dugout: he has his hands on his mouth. Slower offcutter outside off, Cutting is way too early into his slog-sweep and toe-ends it into the sky. It drops down and Archer drops it at backward point

seam-up, the yorker isn't coming out right for Unadkat. Low full-toss outside off, Hardik rocks forward, lets his hands flow through the line. Smeared up and over extra cover for another six. Last four balls 17 runs
the pressure gets to Unadkat. Full and spared wide outside off, past the marker
Unadkat goes for the wide yorker, it comes out as a low full-toss outside off, not quite the MS Dhoni slice over backward point, but still effective. Back-to-back boundaries for Hardik
147ks - pace like fire - bouncer, aimed at the head, rocks his head out of the way. What a way to finish your spell. Well done, Archer
Hardik shuffles across off and throws Archer off his line. Sprayed down leg, leg-side wide

Gowtham nearly drops it. He hangs onto the catch on the rebound. After playing out two dots, Krunal goes for an almighty leg-side swing. He doesn't have the pace to work with. This is the offcutter from Unadkat, bounces from a length outside off, Krunal wants to drag it from there. But he can only skew a catch to long-on, where Gowtham nearly made a mess of it
another short ball, wide outside off, away from the reach of Krunal's hook. Beaten in the end
big lifter on off from over the stumps, Unadkat forces Krunal to duck under it
Unadkat goes short and wide outside off, seam-up, as Hardik ventures down the track and cracks the ball away to Samson at sweeper cover
length ball on middle, Krunal jumps away outside leg and smears it straight to Stokes at mid-off
Krunal rides the bounce of this 137.6ks short ball outside off and glides it down to third man
good length, a bit of width, Lewis opens up and slaps but slices it in the air and Sanju Samson moves to his right and snaffles it at deep point
Kulkarni slows it up, but Lewis moves across off and mows this length ball towards the sightscreen
short outside off, Lewis punches to mid-off off the bottom of the bat. He's struggling through these middle overs here. Need to find some fluency
back of a length, complete lack of pace messes up Lewis' timing as he feels for it and misses
shortish and some width, goes on with the arm and Lewis slaps it through the covers
legside fuller ball, Lewis gets down for a sweep and he's timed it alright, but it's ridiculous how that's carried over the backward square leg fence. A flat six
walks down the ground and Unadkat pulls his length back, Lewis steers to third man with an open face
ruins a good over with a useless full toss. Seems like that slipped out of the hand and Lewis shovels it over the in-field on the off side
starts off with a short delivery with loads of width and Lewis throws his hands at it and gets an outside edge through third man
angles it into the batsman, Yadav goes too hard at a flick and gets hit on the pad
shin-high full toss around middle and off, Lewis goes too hard at a punch and ends up mistiming it to mid-on
extremely full outside off, Lewis squeezes it out to point
angled too sharply down the leg side and Yadav can't put it away with the glance

in the air, stays there for like forever, and Binny can't get his hands to it at mid-on. He got in position nicely, mind you, but that took so long to come down Binny might as well have taken a power nap.  Goes reverse-cupped and the ball just about grazes the fingers before landing on the ground. Lewis gets lots of elevation but hardly much distance on this loft down the ground
in the air again and once more falling short. Not as close as the previous one though. The bat turns in Lewis' hands as he tries to drill this fuller one away
in the air and short of mid-on. Kulkarni bowls this full and Yadav flicked early to slice it in the air. Mid-on dives forward but it just drops short

walks across the stumps and works this length ball to square leg.  That's Rayudu's century, what a knock!  Points to someone in the coaching staff, does a circle around his head and then walks up to Dhoni to give him a hug. Lovely knock. I haven't seen Rayudu smile like this ever before. I've only seen him angry
lands short of third man! Rayudu went over mid-off, ended up slicing it towards third man.
banged in short, Rayudu leaves. Umpire signals one bouncer for the over. He shaped to pull but decided to let go late
Sid Kaul keeps bowling full tosses, keeps getting whacked! Hasn't learnt, bowls a full toss on middle, Dhoni sends this deep into the deep square leg boundary. That was the  fourth full toss in a row
waist-high full toss, punched through to long off. Rayudu asked for the no-ball, Erasmus went 'no, mate. All good there.'
can't get this past cover, Dhoni squeezed out the yorker length ball
bang! Advances and picks the length to flat-bat this one bounce into the ropes. Rayudu inches closer to a century.
friendly full toss, Rayudu gleefully accepts as he steps out and swings this straight back over Shakib's head. This shot is as easy as stepping out in Hyderabad and finding a biryani store
charges down, Shakib cleverly fires this full and wide, Rayudu reaches out to squeeze this away to cover

Pandey, one of the best fielders in the IPL, has dropped an absolute sitter at long-on!  Dhoni stepped out to launch this over the ropes, but didn't get the elevation as this lobbed off a thick inside edge. Oh, dear.
too short, way over Dhoni's head. Easy call for wide
poor shot in desperation results in Raina's fall. Was looking to muscle this over midwicket but got it high on the bat and Williamson took a tumbling catch at mid-off.
Goswami gathers the throw from Kane Williamson and catches Watson short. Rayudu pushes it to cover, and they chance a quick single. But Watson isn't quick enough. Some respite for Sunrisers
Rayudu uses his feet, speared wide, swished to extra cover
looped up on leg stump, Rayudu dashes down the track and launches it into the wind. Into the midwicket boundary
just short of a good length and outside off, Watson drags a pull between long leg and deep midwicket
here comes Rayudu, charges down the track. Bhuvneshwar shortens his length on middle. Clubbed over the wide long-on fence for six
back of a length, skids in, hits Rayudu on the mid-riff as he is rushed into a pull
back of a length and angling in on off, Rayudu has an almighty leg-side swipe, and skews it to the right of Rashid at deep midwicket
Rayudu slices a loft and clears Hales at long-off. Tossed outside off, breaks away, drops to one knee and lifts it over for six
overpitched on middle now, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball and crunches a drive to the left of long-off. Skips away to the boundary
middle-stump yorker, good comeback ball, jammed back to Kaul
Rayudu brings up a fifty of his own and the side's 100 with a six over midwicket. Banged in outside off, Rayudu, having shuffled across, smokes it over midwicket. Bam!
Kaul bangs another one into the pitch, attacks the body, Watson top-edges a hook to deep square
chest-hunting short ball on middle stump, Rayudu takes it on with a pull and splices it between deep square and deep midwicket
slower again, short, Watson waits for the ball to arrive and scythes a square cut. He raises a 31-ball fifty and is embraced by Rayudu
gee, how did that miss off stump. Knuckle ball, bounces  over off. Watson swipes early and misses
low full-toss outside off, Watson stretches out and creams it to the right of sweeper cover. Excellent sliding save in the deep from Rashid
hip-high short ball on middle, slower one, Watson picks it up and pulls to deep midwicket
wide of the crease. Pretty full and just outside off, Watson hoists it over extra cover. Hales skips to his left and cuts it down at long-off
googly spins from outside off, Watson does not read it, slog-sweeps and does not make contact
back of a length and breaks away outside off, Rayudu flashes and sends an outside edge to short third man
Rayudu ventures down the track and hits a shorter one down to long-off
hip-high short ball outside off, right in Watson's swinging arc. Rocks back and muscles a pull against the intended break to the wide long-on fence
Shakib hits a hard length on middle, slides in, messes with Watson's sweep and hits the pad
short and angled in on middle, Rayudu flat-bats it down the ground to long-on
lifter wide outside off, Rayudu lets it fizz through to Goswami
overpitched and outside off, Rayudu, having camped back all this while, presses forward and drills it straight of mid-off
wide of the crease, chest-high short ball, slanting in, Rayudu stays back and fends it off
short and outside off, Rayudu clears his front leg and skies a pull. Hales moves in as opposed to hanging at the edge of the boundary. Rayudu clears Hales and lifts the ball into Sunrisers' dug out
back of a length on off, cramps Rayudu for room. He dares to pull and ends up splicing it over midwicket for four
flat dart on middle stump, here comes Rayudu. Down the track and clipped down the ground for one
CSK pass fifty in the last over of the Powerplay. Tossed on middle, Rayudu forays down the track, gets close enough to the pitch, and hoists it over the bowler's head
Watson makes room outside leg, Shakib follows him with an arm-ball, jabbed to the covers
tripe from Shakib. Full and sliding down leg with fine leg inside the circle, nudged away fine of the diving fielder. Easy pickings
speared outside off, Watson presses forward and secures a single down to long-off
another wrong'un, back of a length and skids in, cramps Rayudu for room, worked to leg
full on off stump, wrong'un?  Rayudu stretches out, rolls out a sweep and hits it to the right of a sliding Hooda at deep midwicket
slid through on off, hint of turn, Rayudu camps back and runs it to short third man
quick fizzer outside off, no turn, Rayudu punches off the back foot to backward point
goes inside-out and this sails over deep cover. Full and moving away, Rayudu just cleared his front leg and biffed that away
short, and this is even bigger. Muscled over deep midwicket! This is Watson unleashed. Sandeep can't afford to bowl that length, he needs to be much, much fuller.
poor. Slower ball gone wrong, slides this down leg, Watson nonchalantly gets down on one knee and sweeps him over the fine leg boundary
pulled in front of square, sails over deep midwicket. Not all that bad a delivery, length and Watson got into position quickly
back of length on off stump, Watson gets on top of the bounce and defends
beats point, races to the point boundary. Once again there's width from Sandeep, Watson used the pace to steer this wide
floats this full on off, Watson punches this into the cover region to get off the mark with a couple
and now the one outside off. Slower ball, offcutter, beats Shakib's attempt to cut it

yorker, under his bat, hits his pad. Might just have pitched outside leg. This is a bluff because he has three fielders in the circle behind square on the off side. Shakib is expecting something outside off but gets a straight yorker
not great bowling. On a length, on the pads, with square leg and fine leg inside the circle. Shakib plays the pick-up over square leg
down the wicket, expecting the slower one. Bravo slips in the quicker one, and follows him too. A cramped-up Hooda gets just the single to long-on
full, just outside off, Shakib drives it to long-off to hand it over to Hooda
on a length, gets away with just a single as Shakib manages to hit this only as far as point
Hooda moves across again, Thakur bowls length, and he turns this to leg for a single
Hooda moves across to another full and wide ball, and strikes it clean over long-off. This one is not executed well either. The two previous ones were too wide, this one too close to Hooda
bouncer, seems like the off-pace bouncer, Pandey through it before it arrives. A rare dot ball
slower offcutter, Hooda pushes it to long-on, turns for the second but slips. Everybody safe

shuffles too far across, Bravo pings him right in front with a full ball. He has kept CSK into the game with two wickets and a catch now. Oh hang on. This is interesting. Seemed like a review in hope than in conviction but the ball is shown to be missing the leg stump by the ball projection. This ball didn't have much to travel but the tech ology shows Hooda is not out
wide down the leg side, Bravo trying to go behind him but going too far with the angle
mid-off is up, Hooda picks his spot, and manages to mis-hit this length ball over that man. The timing is not perfect but Hooda's idea is good: go over the man inside the circle

sensational catch from Bravo. He has removed two set batsmen in two balls. Full and wide from Thakur, Williamson drives with an open face, over short third man, but from deep point Bravo runs to his left, goes about 20 metres, and takes this low to his left with both hands

oh, dear. He's scooped this straight to short fine. Dhawan tries to be too cute, gives away his intentions much before Bravo delivered, so he bowls a cutter at length on middle. No pace to work with and he hits it straight to Harbhajan even as thick rain clouds gather over the MCA Stadium  from the east. They look ominous too.
belts this full toss to long-off, another half-century for Williamson. His 10th overall in the IPL
makes room and forces this length ball past extra cover, don't think Williamson realised how well he hit it till it raced away. Deep cover stood no chance
goes short, this time Williamson goes back and helps it over point, good work by Jadeja
clobbered deep over deep midwicket! Stands his ground and simply swings through. Harbhajan dragged it down and got punished
steps out and belts this over the bowler's head. Harbhajan beat him in flight as he stepped out, but he reached out and swing this over. Delightful
goes for a slog, has to fetch it from way outside off, gets a thick inside edge wide of Jadeja as they scamper a single
full toss, above the waist? Not quite, punched straight to point.  Harsh call, Watson gets away with one. Above the waist
oh, wallop! Right in his hitting zone. Round-arm from Jadeja but right down Dhawan's alley as he gets underneath the flight and belts this back over the sightscreen
short and angling down leg, Williamson helps this on its way to the fine leg fence. Too easy
steps out and blasts this past Watson's outstretched left hand on the followthrough, long-on was pretty straight
beaten by a lovely awayswinger. Shapes to drive, minimal feet movement as Williamson looked to lace that through extra cover
lovely shape away, Williamson laces this to Willey at sweeper cover
delightful shape away! Williamson is tempted to commit himself to defend but lets it go
pulled! And he's literally walloped this to the square leg boundary. Banged in short, Williamson picked the length early, swivelled back and executed the stroke superbly
shapes back in from outside off, Williamson plays down the wrong line. Bends back in to smack the pad. Angle would've taken it down leg

he's hit this straight to backward point, good catch because the ball was travelling. This was bowled full, it swung away late from the fourth stump and Hales only managed to slice this. Got this off the bottom, the bat face turned in his hands. Got the impression he was looking to hit it too hard. Chahar's impressive run in the IPL continues. Back from injury and among the wickets immediately.
swings back in late, yorker length. Somehow manages to keep that out. Superb start from Chahar
cuts back in from length on off, Hales is on the backfoot, hurried for pace, as he defends back
full outside off, and another yorker that ABD can't put away. Driven to the man at deep extra cover
full and wide outside off, and AB squeezes it away to deep backward point. Sarfraz gets back on strike
crashes into middle stump! Twist in the tale? Straight on middle stump. Mandeep misses the pull, and the ball goes through the gates
full outside off, but he connects with the sweep. Not timed well, and that actually allows Mandeep to come back for the second. Team 150
low full toss on middle, and AB drills it down the ground to long on. They walk across for the single
full outside off, and once again forcing Mandeep to reach at it. Mistimes it to mid on
full outside off, and Mandeep's forced to reach at it. Slaps it towards point, but takes a thick outside edge to the man at third man
good length on middle, but angling down the leg side. Mandeep, however, swivels and pulls this over deep backward square. Great rotation off his toes
wrong'un to start off. Full on middle, but turning into his pads. Mandeep can't flick it away

feathers one to Pant! Done by the turn. Mishra's delighted, Kohli's frustrated. It was full outside off, and turning away from Kohli. He tried to play the inside out drive, but the ball takes some extra bounce and finds the outside of his bat. Credit to Pant for holding on though
slower ball, but wide outside off. AB thumps it in front of cover, but the man in the deep does well to clean up
slapped past point! Outside off, and AB cuts it furiously to the boundary. Reach in no time. AB's follow through reminded me of Dhoni's helicopter. That swirl
almost chopped on! Good length outside off, and AB tries to cut it away. Bottom-edges it, and the ball just about misses the top of off stump

short-arm jab! And no better way to get to a hundred-run partnership. Good length on middle, and Kohli takes a few steps down the ground, then lifts his back leg, and completes the shot by whipping it over deep midwicket. Classic
full on leg stump, and turning into AB's pads. Blocks it off the front foot. End of Lamichhane's debut with the ball
flighted on off, but AB nonchalantly walks across to the off side before lifting it over deep backward square. The fielder in the deep was getting under it, but just clears the man there!
good length on leg, but it's the wrong'un this time! Creeps onto Kohli's body, and he whips it off his hips to deep square leg
full outside off, and AB goes down on one knee to sweep it from outside off stump. Not timed well though
short on middle, and turning away from AB. He goes onto the back foot and drags this towards the midwicket boundary
makes it look soo easy! Full on off, and AB shuffles across to the off side, gets down on one knee, and ramps it over the keeper's left! Mr. 360!

Harshal hits Kohli this time! No malice though. A soft shot towards cover had the batsmen running for a single, but Harshal ran there to try and break the stumps at the non-striker's, but the throw finds Kohli instead
Is Harshal okay? Looks alright. Full outside off and Kohli came dancing down the ground before driving it towards the bowler. Hits his palm on the full!
good length on off, but angling into Kohli. Tries to punch towards cover, but comes off the bat's inside half. Goes towards midwicket
flighted outside off, but too wide. AB takes a big stride towards the pitch of the ball, and lifts it over the extra-cover boundary. The margin of error that the bowler can afford is minimal
full just outside off, and defended back to Mishra
flat on middle, and sliding through to Kohli. Punched off the back foot to the long-on boundary
wild spin, and well stopped by Pant! Full outside off, and legspin that goes further away from Kohli. Forced Pant to dive to his right
almost a yorker on middle stump, and AB bunts it away towards the vacant midwicket region. Forces the bowler to go chasing after it
back of a length outside off, and this time there's some extra bounce. Kohli works it towards square leg, and that's the time out
slower ball, but full toss on middle stump. Flicked off his pads to deep midwicket, but he calls nice and early for two. Dala took a tumble on his bowling followthrough
full on off, and Kohli chops it onto his toes! Ouch. It was almost a yorker, and Kohli inside-edges his cover drive
pitched up and spinning away a tad outside off, and AB carves it over long-off
too full outside off, another languid drive from Kohli. Smooth swing and tremendous follow-through as he crunches through extra cover
short, angled across, AB now latches onto a pull that beats deep square leg diving to his left
he's batting like a dream. Kohli's determined to see RCB home tonight, and he backs away to this fuller one and chips it over mid-off with the full face of the bat
now he goes full and angles it in, and Kohli backs away and carves a drive through the covers. This is splendid batting
pins AB on the pad firs ball but the impact is outside off. Long stride across - that's the only thing that saved him there

that's plumb. First wicket for young Lamichhane. And it's a beautiful wicket. Nicely pitched up around middle, not giving him an inch to free his arms. Parthiv gets down to sweep and the ball spins in subtly to pin him in front of middle
shuffles across early and this one nips away off a back of a length and finds the outside edge of Kohli as it runs away to third man

gets down for a sweep but the ball escapes from underneath the bat as it's too full and he fails to get underneath it. Runs past the keeper as well. Harshal Patel chases it down and slides in front of the boundary but he has made contact with the ropes
full on off, and that's been driven over Siraj's head! It's a great shot, but long off manages to cut it off. Only a single, and Daredevils finish on 181 for 4!
full on middle and leg, and this time it's been drilled straight back past the bowler. Siraj does well to get away, so does the umpire, and the ball beats both men in the deep! Moves on to 45
yorker on middle, that all Shankar can do is work it towards cow corner. Gets Sharma on strike
takes the pace completely off this, only 97.5kph. Shankar tries to slog it over cover, but inside-edges it towards square leg
slower ball, but wide outside off. Shankar waits for it this time, before driving it square. Negi at deep cover though

it's the slower ball, and pushed full and wide outside off. Shankar is forced to check his big wind-up, and muscles this down the ground to long on. Free hit because there weren't enough people inside the circle
full outside off, and drilled straight down the ground past Siraj's left. Long off's there though
check drives over Southee's head! Hold that pose, son! It's the cutter on leg stump, and he simply lifts it into the stands. Oof

back of a length on middle, and he tries to muscle it straight down the ground. Slaps it over Southee, but off the bat's top half. The poor timing actually allows the batsman to come back for the second run
good length on off, and that's been fended away from his body. But takes the bat's toe end, and comes to Siraj's left. He tries to take a diving catch, but the ball was just too low!
good length on middle stump, and tapped back to Siraj off the back foot. Sharma wants the single, but Siraj is quick to recover

full on off, and angling into his pads. Iyer lifts it off his toes towards long on, but Kohli's manning the cow-corner boundary. Holds on to it despite being some ten feet inside the boundary line. Iyer's sluggish innings ends. Time out as well
back of a length on middle, and Shankar opens the leg side and pulls it fine past short fine leg! Uses his wrists to play it well
good length on middle, and Iyer walks across to the off side to tap it towards midwicket
full just outside off, and Shankar drills this drive to cover
back of a length on off, but Iyer stays on his crease. Punches it to long on this time
almost a yorker on off stump. But Shankar manages to drive it to deep extra cover and gets off the mark
drifts and lands on off stump. Shankar takes a big stride forward, and defends
flat on middle, and going straight through. Shankar goes onto his back foot, and taps it towards mid on

excellent sliding catch at long on! AB the man. It was full outside off, and Pant is forced to reach at it. Manages to lift it towards the long-on boundary, but de Villiers races across to his left to complete a difficult catch
angles into Iyer's pads, and he smothers it with the turn to the man at deep midwicket. Another walking single for Daredevils
good length on middle, and Pant comes skipping down the ground. Taps it towards the vacant area near midwicket to collect another run
grip off the surface! Takes the outside edge of Pant's bat as he looks to defend. The ball flies away towards point
back of a length outside off, and Iyer rocks back to punch it straight past Pant. Goes to the man at long on
good length on middle, but a lot of turn across Iyer's body. Goes down the leg side
misfield from Sarfraz! Full outside leg, and swept to short fine leg. The ball slides under Sarfraz at short fine leg, which eventually allows them to take the second. Chahal's not happy at all
drift in the air, and the ball lands full outside off. It's turning further away from Pant, so he's forced to reach at it. Misses completely
full on leg stump, and would've gone down for a wide. But Iyer chases it, and flicks it to deep square leg
good length on leg, and too easy for Pant. Goes deep into his crease, and pulls it over the square-leg umpire! His fifth fifty-plus score this season.
over long on! Tossed it up outside off, but Pant leans into this shot. Full power, as he slaps it over Chahal
full on middle, and straightens after pitching. Pant pushes it towards the on side, and shall keep the strike as well
full on off, and turning into Iyer's pads again. Whipped off his legs to deep backward square
back of a length on off, but spinning across the batsman's body. Iyer walks to the off side, but can't play it fine enough. Straight to short fine leg
good length on middle, and Pant shuffles across to the offside and flick it to deep midwicket
quicker ball, but the appeal is turned down. Full on middle, and hits Pant's in front of leg stump. Reckon that would've gone down leg
in his arc, and muscled! Full outside off, and turning into Pant this time. Goes down on one knee, and sent into the cow-corner boundary
deft touch! Full outside off, but Iyer loves that region. Decides to cut it late, and opens the bat's face slightly past the keeper's right, and the quick outfield does the rest

AB and Kohli mess up a catch! Never thought I'd ever type this sentence. It was full on off, and Iyer slices his drive. It's in the air for ages, and AB tries to get under it from cover. Kohli's coming from long off, and the ball lands between both of them! AB went for the final attempt though
wild! Short, and outside off, but Pant flat-bats it straight back to CDG. The bowler stuck his right hand out, but the ball doesn't stick
starts off with a boundary! Pitches outside off, and Iyer pokes at it. Opens his bat's face while trying to carve it towards the off side. Played fine
short on off, and Iyer shuffles across to the off side. The ball's going down the leg side, but he helps it to short fine leg for a single
good length outside off, but turning away from Pant. He drags this pull towards deep midwicket for a walking single
slog swept! But lands short of deep midwicket. The delivery was full on off, and Iyer took a big stride towards the off side
pitches on off, and turns sharply into his body. Iyer misses the leg-side whip, and it hits his pad. Appeal for lbw, but would've been too high
good length outside off, and Pant rocks back to flay this cut to the man in the deep
short of a length, angled across and giving him a world of room, Pant stays back and shovels it straight over long-off
that's too short. RCB keep dropping it short to Pant and he keeps walloping them. A 142.4-kmph short ball, pulled off the front foot over deep midwicket

short of a length around middle and leg, Pant moves across and whips it to square leg, where Mandeep Singh runs across, leaps to his left with one hand outstretched and flicks the ball back into the field. Top effort
and gets hit on the pad for the third time. Length again, but no room as Pant swipes and there's a bit of an inward movement as well
slower length ball, 111.6ks, Pant tries to flick but is hit on the pad. Pitching outside leg
pins the pad with a length ball. Pant simply swipes across the line and makes no contact
short again, similar line as well, Pant pulls it out but Umesh sprints from deep midwicket and slides to make a stop
short around middle, that's easy for someone in the kind of form that Pant is, swivels and pulls through midwicket

floats up a googly around off and draws him right forward. Roy falls for the flight comes forward. And he doesn't pick the variation, which means the gap is enough for the ball to sneak through and flatten the stumps. Beautifully done
straight through! It's the slider once more. Pitches on middle, and zips straight through. Shaw tries to work it towards the leg side, but he's played down the wrong line. Crashes into leg stump!
full just outside off, but it's the wrong'un this time. Driven to long off again, and Roy's off as well
full outside off, and driven away down the ground. Shaw gets off the mark

skiddy full ball, slanting in from over the wicket, 144ks, Ashwin looks to slog over midwicket. He misses it and is hit on the unprotected knee. Trapped in front. The umpire takes his own sweet time before raising his finger
DK throws himself to his right to complete an excellent catch. Banged in short at the body, Tye shuffles across and gloves an attempted pull. DK does the rest behind the stumps
back of a length on middle, Ashwin clears his front leg again and launches it over the wide long-on boundary. Kings XI pass 200

fuller than a good length and skids in to cramp the batsman for room and ping the pad. Ashwin strays out for a single but Tye sends him back. There's a horrible mix-up, they then go for the single. Russell swoops down on the ball, turns, and aims to effect a direct hit at the non-striker's end. He, however, loses his balance and collapses. Has he hurt his hamstring again? Given as one leg bye
good length on middle, Ashwin clears his front leg and skies a loft over Russell. Six
Tye goes very deep in the crease and hoicks a length ball from outside off to the midwicket boundary. Right out of the middle of the bat
flat dart outside off, Ashwin uses the pace of Narine, opens the face at the last moment and steers it fine of short third man
The ball drops between long-off and long-on again. Tossed outside off, Tye skies it in the air and gets away
Ashwin steps out and slices it over cover
shortish and outside off, Ashwin delays his cut and finds the gap between backward point and short third man for four

Finch skies it in the air, Searles (long-on) and Russell (long-off) look at each other and watch the ball drop in between them. Back of a length on middle, Finch aims for a loft and miscues it. He gets away in the end
slider on off, Ashwin camps back and defends it back to Kuldeep
Finch muscles another six, clears Searles at long-on. Googly, leaves Finch, he drags it from outside off and slog-sweeps it away. Hit against the spin this time
dropped short on off stump, Finch picks the length up so quickly. He rocks back and muscles a pull over midwicket. Hit with the spin
shorter and just a shade outside off, Finch manufactures additional room and chops it away to sweeper cover
clipped with the angle to deep midwicket as Ashwin gets off the mark

Narine comes from around the wicket and has Rahul chopping a sweep back onto the stumps. Rahul's wicket exposes Kings XI's lengthy lower order. Full and slid through on middle, Rahul stretches across for a sweep, the ball sneaks through the legs. Oh wait, the replays suggest the ball brushes the thigh and disturbs the stumps. Kings XI lose Rahul and with it the game? Narine says enough of the deadpan and celebrates the big wicket
Finch goes low, and deflects a sweep to short fine leg
short and sliding away outside off, would have been an off-side wide had Rahul left it. Instead, he chops to cover
dragged down outside leg, follows Rahul, who was backing away. Rahul smacks a pull over the midwicket boundary. Bam! Into the second tier
Narine loops it up on off stump, Rahul charges down the track, meets it on a half-volley and muscles it over the long-on boundary. That's outta here

pulled straight down the throat of deep square. This is a fiery bouncer, Agarwal had decided yesterday that he'll pull this, got big on him but he went through with the stroke but showed signs of pulling out very late. But by then, the deed was done. Sensational from DreRuss. I have no reason why the onfield umpire even went upstairs to check for the no-ball. Agarwal didn't control the pull because he wasn't even looking at the delivery. His poor IPL season after a magnificent breakout domestic season continues.
the bouncer has done the trick! Pacy bouncer, Gayle is late on the pull and in doing so, feathers one to a leaping Karthik. Fist pumps. One Jamaican gets the other
clobbered over deep midwicket! Russell pays the price for bowling too short, Gayle didn't have room to swing his arms but went through and boy
Has Gayle nicked this down leg? There was a noise, given wide and Karthik has reviewed There's some pad on the way. So it shouldn't be a wide for starters. Gayle survives.
pulls and misses. Angled in to cramp Rahul, didn't allow him the free swing. Excellent. In the 140s again
right into the blockhole, Gayle was making room to carve that over the off side, ended up having to jam his bat down to keep that out

oh, no. Dinesh Karthik has dropped that!  Tough chance, did most things right, except hold on. Gayle gets a leading edge as he looks to whip this to the leg side, DK leapt high like a goalkeeper but just couldn't take it cleanly.
nearly took Russell's head with that blow! Floats this full on middle and Gayle's ready with this ammunition. Absolutely belts this flat and straight, Russell just about managed to get out of the way
hustles Gayle for pace, also targets the ribcage, turned towards fine leg.
thick outside edge past slip, races past slip to the third man boundary. Rahul didn't have the kind of width he would've liked, slashed it away
spins back in sharply, off a thick inside edge towards square leg, Rahul was looking to whip this through midwicket
drifts one in full, Rahul steps out and works this to long on to get off the mark immediately
steps out and punches this to cover, Gill cramped for room as this angled back in
to the moon and back, Miller settles underneath to take a tumbling catch. Rana looks to hoick this short of length knuckleball from across the line, didn't get the power he would've liked.
full and wide outside off from around the stumps, Rana swings and misses
too full, Russell backs away and squeezes this over short third man. Just opened the bat face late to hit it up and over
down on one knee as he sweeps this short ball over deep square leg. Mujeeb has lost his lengths, not sure how much of that is because of his bowling hand
ah, too short and walloped. Karthik stays his ground and pulls in front of square to clear deep midwicket
slogged, that's out of here. Onto the roof. New balls, please! The cow corner region targeted again! Length, drifting in and right into Russell's swinging arc
pushed through outside off, Karthik opens the face and guides it to the right of Gayle at short third man

Mohit pulls off a smart catch to his right. He gets into a side-on position and snags the ball. Slower one outside off, possibly a knuckle ball, Uthappa is early into his shot and ends up carving it in the air. So, Tye gets both set batsmen in the same over
Tye bangs it short and has Narine nicking behind. Banged in short and slanting away outside off from over the wicket, Narine can't get on top of it. He pulls weakly and edges it behind to Rahul
115ks, slower ball outside off, Narine gets under this full ball and lifts it over extra cover. Sliced away
Narine forays down the track, Sran finally gets the yorker right, darted wide outside off, away from the reach of the rampaging Narine
Pulled flat and hard for six. Hip-high short ball outside off, Narine sizes it up, clears his front leg, and bashes it over midwicket
slower short ball on the hips, Narine is early into a hook and lucky that the ball did not roll back onto the stumps

96.8ks slower full ball on middle and leg, Narine spots the change-up. He picks this back-of-the-hand variation off the pads and toe-ends it over square leg. Mis-hit for six. That's how small the boundaries are in Indore
Mohit falls on his back at short third man after missing a run-out chance. Back of a length and angling across off, Uthappa leans back, and dabs to short third man. He sets off and Narine gets a life
Ashwin lobs a full-toss outside off, Narine rocks forward and drives to the right of long-off and left of sweeper
pushed through full and on middle, Uthappa slog-sweeps with the intended turn over deep midwicket for a clean six
Gayle at short fine leg jogs and escorts the ball to the boundary. Full offbreak, Uthappa drops down to one knee and rolls out a sweep to the left of Gayle
hip-high short ball on leg stump, 99ks, Narine uses the pace and swats it away to the long on fence
tucked off the pads to wide long-on. Narine raises his bat. That's a 26-ball fifty
tossed full on off stump, Uthappa collapses his back knee and hoists it to the left of the bowler
non-turner on off, front-foot defence from Uthappa
looped up on middle, sticks in the surface, Uthappa plays early and nearly spoons a leading edge back to the bowler
biting offbreak, full and breaks back in to catch the pad as Uthappa plays all around it, but this may have been heading past leg stump
back of a length on middle, Narine inches forward and clubs it away to the right of mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
tossed up outside off, Narine dances down the track, does not meet the pitch, but manages to carve it in the air to the left of cover
on a length on off, Narine gets forward and bunts a single to long-off
Narine has thrown Axar off his line and length. Short and slid past the tramline, off-side wide
104.3ks dart outside off, but this is just too full, Narine gets under the length and carts it up and over Axar's head for a straight six
dragged shorter and sliding away outside off, Narine inside-edges a pull past leg stump
arm ball from around the stumps to Uthappa too. He hangs back and secures a single through midwicket
length ball on off, looks like the knuckle ball, Narine clears his front leg. He has a big hoick and inside-edges to wide long-on
back of a length on the hips, Narine is airborne as he picks it up and flicks it square of short fine leg

Tye drags his length back, cramps the batsman for room, and bowls him. Short and angling into the body from over the wicket, Lynn swivels into a pull. The ball hits the thigh, then his arm, the ball swivels, and bounces up to trim the bails. Lucky break for Kings XI
Lynn welcomes AJ Tye, the purple cap holder, with a straight six. Pitched up on middle, right in his swinging arc, lifted over the bowler's head

Narine clears his front leg and clears mid-on. Much fuller, another slower ball on middle, Narine is set to tee off. He does not have enough pace to work with. Instead, he holds his shape, manufactures his own pace, and swings it over mid-on for four
Narine backs away outside leg, Sran chases him with a short ball and beats his attempt to ramp it away
149.3ks, is Sran that quick? He runs in from over the wicket and digs a chest-high short ball on off, rushes Narine into a hook. Top edge sails over short third man
slower bouncer, climbs over middle as Narine ducks under it
short and plenty of width for Lynn to flash a cut to Karun at sweeper cover
That's outta here! #Lynnsanity. Offcutter on a length on middle, Lynn spots it. He clears his front leg and disdainfully smites it over the wide long-on boundary. Bang!
dangled up outside off, driven through the line to mid-off. Lynn chances a single, AJ Tye nails the stumps, but the batsman has slid his bat in
much fuller on off, Narine clears his front leg and hacks a single to long-off
pushed through on a length on off, Narine presses forward and swats it over mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
back of a length and slides in on off from round the stumps, arm-ball Narine takes this thigh-high ball and pumps it over long-on

Belted back to Mujeeb, but the ball bursts out. He drops a difficult return catch. Narine runs down the track, meets a half-volley on off, and slams it back, the bowler attempts the catch and in the process hurts his bowling hand. He needs some attention from the physio. Such chances stick or they don't.  Adding injury to insult: Mujeeb has gone off the field
banged in short and angling in on off from around the wicket, Narine shuffles across and hauls a pull to the left of mid-on
Mohit keeps it short from round the stumps and attacks the body of Narine, he flaps a pull to mid-on
short and angling in on off from round the wicket, change-up as well, Narine arches his back, waits for the ball, then dabs to short third man
105ks back-of-the-hand slower ball from Mohit, foxes Lynn, as he swishes early and misses
pushed through outside off, the new ball doesn't turn, Narine stays leg-side of the ball and scythes it over cover-point. Karn Nair chases the ball hard, slides, and hauls it into play
tossed outside off, Narine presses forward and drives to the right of extra cover
on a length and fizzes through outside off, Narine plays for turn and is beaten on outside edge
back of a length and width outside off, Lynn punches it through the line but can't piece the packed off-side infoeld
much fuller and outside off, Lynn does not meet the pitch, and lets the hands do all the work. Flayed to cover
back of a length and climbs on off, Lynn ventures deep in the crease and fends it off
Who hit the repeat button? Shorter and much closer to off, Lynn nearly chops it back onto the stumps. The result is a fortunate inside-edged four to fine leg
Mohit goes shorter and outside off, the ball does not come onto the bat, Lynn slashes hard and inside-edges it past the leg stump and left of Rahul for four
back of a length, angling in towards off, then nibbles away in the channel, Lynn watches it through to Rahul

Buttler has done it for Royals! He is mobbed by his team-mates. He is now embraced by his England team-mate Ben Stokes. Slower and fuller outside off, Buttler slices it to Watson at cover. Watson has a shy at the non-striker's end despite Buttler making his crease. He concedes an overthrow. Game, set, and match for Royals. Dhoni shakes his head. Sums up the night for CSK
length ball outside off, another slower ball, Buttler waits for it and slugs it over midwicket for six. Buttler manufactures his own pace. Gowtham lets out a cathartic roar in the dug out
slower ball outside off, Buttler goes deep in the crease and skies it to short midwicket. Bravo collapses in his followthrough and does not go for the catch. Dhoni isn't pleased
slower one dips outside off, 116ks, Buttler slogs early to the leg side and only collects fresh air
Willey hits a hard length outside off. Gowtham throws his bat at the ball and edges it behind. Dhoni snags the catch. Gowtham walks back for 13 off 4. He has set it up for Buttler and Archer
Gowtham clears long-off. Pitched up and just a shade outside off, he gets under it and launches it straight over for six
good length and sliding into the legs, right in his swinging arc, but Buttler loses his shape and drags an inside edge onto the pad. Slower one it was
Gowtham tees off with a first-ball six. Mid-off was just brought up and third man slid back. Length ball outside off, right in the slot, clears his front leg and smears it over for a six

Has Dhoni dropped this? Buttler shuffled across off even before the bowler delivered. He does not get enough bat on the scoop to fine leg. He tickles it away. Dhoni dives to his left and goes for the ball with one hand but it pops out. Replays suggest it carried to him. That's dropped

DJ has Binny holing out off a knee-high full-toss. Drop, six, out. That's T20 cricket for you. Binny eyes up the leg side, instead he leading-edges it in the air. Watson settles under this skier at cover
length ball outside off, seam-up, Bravo errs in length, Binny clears his front leg and smites a six over long-on. Such a clean strike from Binny
slower, short ball outside off, 102.7ks outside off, Buttler waits and flat-bats it in the air. Bravo leaps but can only finger-tip it away
Buttler shimmies out and makes room. Bravo chases him with a short dart and pings the back thigh
good length ball on middle, Buttler shuffles across off and flips it over to fine leg
Buttler shimmies out, Willey chases him with a short ball and cramps him for room. Played back to the bowler
Buttler ventures outside leg and carves it up to Raina at backward point. Buttler strays out of the crease, undoes his steps, as Raina misses a direct hit
Buttler moves outside leg and slaps a slower ball to the right of deep point. Shortish and outside off, flayed away
back of a length and outside off, Binny steps away and flat-bats it to the right of sweeper cover

Buttler reverse-sweeps a four like a boss. Watson does a double tea pot. Very full on middle, most other batsman would have driven this through the covers. Buttler reverses it away through backward point

Watson drops a tough return catch. Bursts through the hands of the bowler. Back of a length and just outside off, another slower one, drilled back to the bowler, he puts his hands above his head but it does not stick
back of a length and attacking the stumps, Binny presses forward and clips to deep midwicket
whack! Binny finds the point boundary. Thakur with a short and very wide ball and he climbs into this, on the front foot and full control
appeal for caught-behind and stumping both turned down. A regulation spinner from Jadeja, pushed through flat outside off. Binny looks to poke through the covers and can't get bat on it

chipped straight to midwicket. Fast hands too fast from Chopra. This is on the leg stump as well, but shorted than the last one. He's closed the face too early on this and it's off the inside half, straight to the fielder
shot! Superb! Wide length ball outside off and Chopra, a specialist opener, has carved this old ball past backward point to find the boundary

Samson run out ball watching! Plays a glorious late cut to find backward point. Looks at his partner then at the fielder. Is caught looking at the fielder when his partner responds and comes through for the run. They're both at the same end, nearly. Buttler falls to his knees - he knows what's coming. A throw on the bounce to Bravo as Samson makes a desperate attempt to run back. Bravo receives, turns and flicks it onto the stumps with an underarm throw. Raina was the man at backward point
ping-pong. Bravo fields to his left as Samson punches firmly on the up, and then attempts to chuck it back at the stumps. He's off-balance though and the throw is wayward
rolls his fingers over this short ball wide outside off. Samson through the cut too early and is beaten
googly, knocked back to Karn from off stump
looped up and spins away outside off, Buttler flays at it and sends a thick outside edge fine of short third man

full and straight, Samson sweeps it flat and hard to the right of deep midwicket. Billings tears to his right, slides, knocks the ball away. The ball still rolls away towards the boundary. Billings then brings out another slide and swats the ball into play. Great commitment from Billings. Yes, a CSK fielder slides not once but twice
Buttler stretches out for a sweep, this ball from Karn drifts in and narrowly misses leg stump. Dhoni is beaten as well. Given as a bye
non-turner on middle, paddled to fine leg. Buttler brings up his fourth successive IPL fifty. Only Sehwag has more fifties in a row in the IPL
back of a length and angling into middle, Samson stands tall and punches to deep midwicket
99ks dart on middle stump, and Buttler rolls out a reverse-sweep. He drops to one knee and drills it through point.
short and outside off, punched away, but Samson can't beat the packed off-side ring
Samson presses forward to meet this length ball and drives it down to mid-off
Buttler moves away outside leg, Thakur follows him with a yorker, jabbed away to the right of the bowler
Buttler stays leg-side of this full ball on off and drives to long-off

Jadeja draws an outside edge, Raina snaffles it at slip. Drifts in from around the wicket, turns and bounces. Rahane simply wafts and edges it, the ball bounces out of Dhoni's gloves but into the hands of Raina. CSK's spinners hit back with two wickets in two overs
four, six, and out! Stokes screams in agony. He runs down the track, Harbhajan bowls a slider, angling in from around the stumps, Stokes does not meet the pitch, the spinner hits the middle stump
Stokes tees off. He nails it into the stands beyond midwicket. Floated up on middle stump, Stokes stretches out and slog-sweeps fiercely
pushed through outside off, Stokes slashes an inside edge past leg stump, fine of short fine leg
on a length on off, Buttler clears his front leg and whips it away to the midwicket boundary. Top timing from Buttler
pushed though outside off, Buttler ventures outside leg and opens up the off side. He drives it inside-out over extra cover. Excellent execution
arm ball, Buttler stays leg-side of the ball and drills to cover
Stokes now attempts a reverse-sweep and gloves it to short third man
leg-side dart from Jadeja, Dhoni collects it and breaks the bails in a flash. Appeal for stumping, shot down. Not called a leg-side wide either. Might have clipped the pad

picked off the pads to square leg. There's a mix-up between the wickets. Stokes is nearly halfway down the pitch, but Buttler sends him back. The throw is to Harbhajan, and he does not gather it cleanly. Stokes dives makes it in the end. Run-out chance missed
pretty full on off or just a shade outside off, Buttler gets under it and launches it over his England team-mate Billings at long-on
Such fast hands from Buttler. Tossed outside off, Buttler stretches out and reverse-sweeps it through point. He made it look as easy as eating a sandwich
sliding into the pads, Buttler deftly paddles it away fine of short fine leg for four
back of a length and skids into the thigh, beats the inside edge, and bounces to hit Buttler
Dhoni has his hands on his mouth. Back of a length and width outside off, Buttler brings his fast hands into play and smears it past Raina at backward point
similar line and length outside off, Buttler manipulates the gap between covers and mid-off now. Lovely back-foot punch again
back of a length and slanting away outside off, no swing, the new ball comes on. Buttler leans back and punches it crisply through the covers. Yes, he will go hard at the new ball
drags it to short fine. A slower ball, short of a length. Bravo halfway through a pull before this ball lands

direct hit from Buttler. Dhoni forgets to cross over. A stunning yorker from Stokes outside off and Billings can't get bat on it. Runs down the pitch, looks back, finds the stumps being tonked. Well outside the crease
drilled over mid-off! Stokes making life easy for Billings today it seems. Length ball on off stump, backs away and slams this flat
inside edge zips past short fine. A full, straight ball and Dhoni has his front leg out of the way to get a short-arm helicopter in. Finds the boundary

run-out appeal at the non-striker's end. Dhoni has taken the stumps down at the other end but the bowler hasn't got a hand on it. Billings it looking for a run though as the ball deflects towards the bowler who now has to run back at the stumps and uproot them with ball in hand. Manages it but Billings' dive saves him
boom. Everyone knows what the next ball is going to be. An offcutter outside off. Dhoni stays back in the crease and swipes from under it to clear midwicket
slower ball dug in too short according to the umpire. Dhoni lets this float in the corridor. Didn't look so high to me but I was wrong. That was way over the head
slower ball, skids away rapidly off the pitch as Billings it rooted to the crease chasing this with his hands. Doesn't get close to connection
lovely bowling. Keeps putting it up there slowly. Keeps them on the back foot. Even Dhoni can only tuck it into the square leg region. What an over
Billings tied. Another floated length ball and he's caught deep in the crease trying to flick against the turn. It runs back down the pitch
sweeeeet. Billings meets the offcutter at the pitch outside off and laughs at his mate as he bludgeons this drive wide of mid-off

taken at short fine. Binny pedals backwards and falls awkwardly on his back, but he's held on with the reverse cup. Another ungainly hoick by Raina against a googly he hasn't picked. More a sweep, in fact. Regulation top-edge taken at 45
leading edge as Raina steps out against a googly and has no idea. Nowhere near the pitch of this leg side delivery turning away from him. It lands short of short third man
short ball, jumps awkwardly, shovels it into the leg side with a half-pull. Another Raina pull, another Raina fifty
another one. Same pattern - full and down leg. Raina falling over into the off side trying to flick but that's fizzing past
goes around the wicket and fires one straight down leg side. Archer hasn't found any rhythm against Raina. Switch to over the wicket maybe?
clears the keeper with a top edge. Same ball that got Rayudu to chop on. Except Watson looks for the pull to this quick short ball outside off

nicely done. Raina has almost become a specialist at this one-legged, no-balance shot to fine leg. This time it's off the spinner of course. Length ball fired down leg and he swivels to tap it on its head
another off-side wide from Unadkat
Unadkat goes wide of the crease and darts a full ball past the tramline. Off-side wide
hip-high short ball outside off, slower ball, Watson waits for the ball to arrive. Then lines it up and smokes it over midwicket
Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat takes pace off the ball, chopped to cover. Raina collides with umpire Erasmus. Ouch! Rahane, meanwhile, misses a direct hit and hands Raina a life
Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat follows him with a seam-up ball and tucks him up for room. Fended off
back of a length and outside off, forced to the leg side past the left of Sodhi
tossed up outside off, not sure if that was a googly, Raina stretches out and slugs a sweep over midwicket

tossed outside off, Watson ventures down the track, gets close to the pitch, and belts it past the left hand of Sodhi. Relays suggest Sodhi just finger-tipped it away. Only a harsh man will call it a drop. Sodhi, in fact, saved three for his side
half-tracker on middle, right in Watson's swinging arc, he sits deep in the crease and launches a pull over midwicket. First boundary for CSK after 21 balls. Watson finally connects with one
Raina shuffles outside leg and hacks a single to deep square leg
full-toss outside off, Watson presses forward and slices to sweeper cover
Raina rides the bounce of this short offering outside off and glides it to deep third man
back of a length on off, 140.7ks, Watson miscues another pull to midwicket
shorter wrong'un, spins outside off, Raina reaches out and chops to cover
straight ball on middle, Raina stretches out and plays it right back to Sodhi
back of a length, starts on off and breaks away, Watson leans back and steers with the spin to sweeper cover
dragged down on off, Watson can't put this away either. Hauls a pull to deep square leg
short and just a shade outside off, turns in slightly, Raina punches a single down to long-on
just short of a good length and outside off, Watson is early into a cut, loses his shape, and chops the ball only as far as cover
slower ball, floated on middle, Watson stays leg-side of the ball and flays to mid-off
short on middle, the ball does not come on, Watson struggling for timing. Drags a pull to short fine leg off the inside half

Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat targets his head with a lifter, Raina splices it over mid-on. Stokes tears back from mid-on, gets into a side-on position, slides to his left, and hauls the ball back into play. Great work from Stokes
full and sliding down the leg side, Raina falls over the flick, leg-side wide
Stokes spears it full and wide outside off, drags Watson forward. He drives and watches the ball run away past the outside edge
back of a length and homing in on off, Raina clips it away to the leg side for one more
hip-high short ball outside off, slower one, Raina picks it up and swats it over midwicket for his fifth boundary. Raina setting the pace for CSK
slower ball, 117ks, drifting into the pads, Watson helps it away wide of short fine leg
shorter and shoved down leg, Raina shuffles across and does not connect with a pull
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Raina thrashes the ball straight to backward point
back of a length and sliding in on middle, hangs back and nurdles it to the left of Gowtham
overpitched and outside off, Watson drags it across the line to long-on
back of a length on the hips, Raina stands tall and forces it down to long-on
shorter and outside off, 100.7ks, Raina leans back and punches it sweetly. Finds the gap between backward point and cover
short and slanting in at top of off, 148.2ks, pace like fire, Watson answers with an ice-cool back-foot defence
back of a length and slanting in at off, 146.6ks, Raina hops and secures a single to the leg side
short and angling into the body, 147ks, Archer has Raina hopping, skipping, and fending to leg
Raina jumps a long way outside leg, Archer spears it outside off, away from the reach of Raina. Inside the tramline. Poor, poor call from umpire Barde
back of a length and slanted down leg from around the wicket, leg-side wide. And the umpire spots Archer overstepping
147.3ks, leg-stump half-volley, not the short one, Raina stylishly picks it off the pads and finds the square leg fence

Archer has Rayudu chopping his first ball onto the stumps. Back of a length and outside off, 142.3ks, Rayudu throws his bat at the ball and aims to chop it away through point. Instead, the ball does not come on, takes the inside edge, and leaves Rayudu's stumps in a mess
slower through the air on off stump, Rayudu waits for the ball to come on, then shovels it with the bottom hand to wide long-on for one more
straight ball on middle, Watson forces it down to long-on
half-tracker sliding into leg stump from round the stumps, Watson sizes it up and sweeps it away past short fine leg. Easy peasy
back of a length on middle, Rayudu ventures down the track and belts it past the bowler. Gowtham slides to his left from long-on but can't haul the ball in
Rayudu steps out again, but is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. He still goes through with the loft and winds up slicing it over mid-off running back
wide of the crease, holds its line outside off, extra cover is up in the circle. Rayudu dashes out of the blocks and hoists it over the infield
tossed up slower and outside off, non-turner, Rayudu stretches out, meets the pitch and drags a sweep past the right of a diving Unadkat at square leg
full toss, that delivery sums up Delhi's bowling show today because Williamson steers it behind square and Sunrisers make it to the playoffs, Delhi are knocked out
too full, driven through the covers yet again from Williamson and that's gone past a diving mid off for four. Williamson showing his authority

full toss above waist height and he pulls it for a single. Not given a no ball! Williamson looks at the umpire and can't believe it. That was certainly above his waist at the point of contact and he was on his toes too
much fuller but still outside off and Williamson uses his wrists to flick it to leg
slow at 118kmh, short outside off and Williamson gets a bottom edge this time on the off side
into the pads from around the wicket and Williamson works it to long leg easily

almost run out! He tapped the ball to point and hesitated for a fraction of a second before responding for the single. Iyer went for a direct hit from point but missed it, Williamson had given up on the attempt to make it
that angle is not working either! Too full outside off, Williamson shows his class by driving that nice and square for four more. Spectacular batting
angled in and Williamson helps it with the wrists off his hips to the long leg boundary and that's his fifty
slow and really slow outside off, Williamson sees it go outside the wide line but it's not given

fullish on the pads and Dhawan lofts it straight down the ground. This is not great bowling and Dhawan has struck the sight screen here, looking in good touch after a while. Oh, replays show that was a wristy legbreak from Nadeem
a slow bouncer gets some bounce and Williamson lets it go

clever bowling and adjustment, the result is four! Dhawan charges down and Mishra responds by darting it down leg, it's flat and quick, and Dhawan manages to get enough bat to send it away fine for four
into the crowd! Too full from Mishra, the batsman goes down on a knee and slog-sweeps it away from the meat of the bat
reaches deep midwicket after a bounce. It kept low but Williamson managed to pull it away nicely
slow again and angling in, Williamson waits and chips it in the air with a whip for one in the vacant area
and again! Slow, full and wide again, Williamson drives uppishly this time, almost chipping it in the air, and it's gone to the same place for four more
really slow and really full, mid off in the circle and Williamson drives that to perfection by piercing the gap between cover and mid off
he charges down to take it on the full and drills it back along the ground, absolutely straight and gets four. That makes it eight from the over, Mishra won't be happy
similar to the first delivery, with flight and turn outside off. Williamson connects the drive this time and gets one to long off
on the stumps this time and Williamson kind of slog-sweeps it to leg
charges down and bunts it back to the bowler, Mishra scares KW by almost throwing it to non-striker's end
loud appeal from Mishra as Williamson misses the sweep but it was going down leg
back of length outside off, Williamson runs it to third man again

all the way into the crowd this time over long on! Slow offcutter from Boult, well outside off and it gave Dhawan the chance to swing his arms even more for a straighter hit down the ground. Good spot of the variation
143.6kmh, another late dab from Williamson and this time he sends it much finer to easily beat the third man for a four
gives him the charge, Harshal sends it slower around 128kmh, Williamson slogs for a thick egde to deep midwicket
full on the pads, Williamson drives it nicely with the wrists but straight to short midwicket
slower on the stumps at 120kmh, Williamson waits and helps it to leg for one
targets the stumps, Williamson goes back to defend dangerously and brings his bat down just in time

in the block hole, that's plumb! What a reply from Harshal. Hales went back and across early to cover the stumps and steer it to the leg side, and Harshal sends down a slow offcutter with some revs, Hales misjudges the pace completely and is trapped right in front
cuts in the air, it lands short and wide of a diving backward point and runs away for four. Too short, not the kind of length you can ball to Hales. Or anyone
too short and pulled away! That length gave Hales ample time to stay back and hammer it wide of mid-on to the wide long on boundary
brings the length shorter and swings it into Hales's body this time, cramped up for room and he takes it near the abdomen
bit of inswing from well outside off, Hales drives it away to extra cover

full toss, waist-high on middle, Pant swings this cleanly to clobber this over deep midwicket. All of them in orange come up to shake hands. Stand up and applaud, this has been a majestic innings.  138 runs off the last 10 overs
one-handed six over long-on. He can walk on water tonight? Bhuvi shortens his length, Pant holds his shape and then wallops this
pulled into the fine leg boundary. Bhuvi does short, this didn't have much pace so Pant picked the length early and helped it along
slices this slog to long off. Hales makes no mistake. Wonder if this was a little too ambitious from Maxwell? Was he better off giving strike to Pant? Looked to go straight but got no timing.
time for Maxwell to join the show. Waist-high full toss, and he flat-bats this straight over the bowler's head. No chance for long on and long off.
shaped to paddle this fine but Kaul went full and wide, Pant looked to angle it past short third man but couldn't get any bat
full, wide and just inside the wide line this time. Pant reaches out to beat point but can't lay bat to it
goes over cover, belts. Beats long-off. Once again looks to outfox him by bowling this wide and out of Pant's reach, this time he was ready for it.
angles it full and wide, Pant can't reach out. Wide called, however. Bhuvi is frustrated at that call, asks the umpire furiously why he called it a wide. Correct call, I have to say

tournament's best bowler: take that. Pant has walloped this length ball into the change rooms at deep midwicket. Clean, clean strike. Superb picking of length, hit the middle of the bat. Sailed away. Wow
leading edge to backward point, loud call of noooooooooo from Maxwell
high and super handsome. Rashid goes full and Pant was waiting for it, muscled over the bowler's head, deep into the long-off boundary. This is some hitting.
another excellent yorker-length ball angling away, Pant can't get any bat as he looks to carve this behind square
slips in a yorker-length delivery across Pant, who can't reach out to squeeze this awa
width and Pant tees off like a golfer. Swung away wide of long-on. Another meaty blow.
appeal for lbw as Pant misses a heave, this was sliding down leg.
in his hitting arc, Pant shimmies down the pitch and belts this to the long-on boundary. Flat hit, angry stroke. He's taking out all the anger on the ball now.

comedy of errors.  Another mix-up with Rishabh Pant. Harshal Patel is three quarters of the way down the pitch for the second, but the throw from deep midwicket is fumbled by Shreevats, but he recovers quickly to get to the ball and then comes up with an underarm flick to beat Harshal's dive. Surely someone's got to have a word with Pant about his running, very very poor.  Fourth time now that Pant is involved in a run out this season. He's run his partner out on three of those occasions
too much leg side, so Pant tickles this past short fine. Easy pickings. Today, he hasn't been about the muscle or the big hits, there's been a lot of calculative strokes.
too short and down leg, Pant picks the length, rocks back and helps it along the way to the deep fine leg boundary.
this time he paddles it past short fine leg. Went across a long way, looked to hit it to square leg but got an inside edge. Result doesn't matter. Pant's back hand came off the grip as well.
brings out the reverse paddle, beats short third man. Nicely executed. Rashid pushed this through so there was pace on it, Pant got on top of it nicely and used the pace.
short and sliding in, Pant swivels back and wallops this pull to the fine leg boundary
slower and fuller delivery that angles in, Pant dabs this into the off side for a quick single

another ball, another inside edge  and Pant is involved in a run out again. This rolled just wide of the keeper, Iyer was more than halfway down the pitch when he had to turn back. By that time, Goswami had lobbed the ball to Sandeep, who broke the bails at the bowler's end.
knuckleball that cuts back in to take the inside edge onto the pad as Pant looks to go off side. There's plenty of grip on this surface for the slower ones
drifts in to take the inside edge as Iyer looks to defend to the off side, they squeeze in a single
toe-ends a lofted it but this just eludes the two fielders running backwards from cover and mid-off. Slower delivery but Pant had to reach out to this delivery.
much fuller this time, Pant gets a good stride in and defends to cover
this time he pierces the gap between cover point and point. Once again length angling away, Pant uses the hint of width and then uses his wrists to pick the gap. Lovely.
back of length on off stump, Iyer shows the full face as he defends back

stunning ball, super grab. Dream ball for any left-arm spinner. Drifted in, drew the batsman forward but spun away sharply from off stump to take the nick through to the keeper. Roy didn't even wait for the umpire's decision.
steps out, doesn't get to the pitch but goes through and manages to absolutely blast this wide of Shakib. Mid-on had no chance
another legcutter, angled into middle and leg, Roy looks to whip but gets some thigh pad on this
lofted over the bowler's head, couple of bounces into the ropes. Not much wrong with the delivery - length - and Roy was happy to hit through the line. Brave
slower and fuller on middle, Roy times this down the ground, long-off cuts it off.
shortens his length this time, Roy stands tall and punches to point
floats it full outside off, Shaw mistimes an off drive to long on. Thick inside edge on that
inswinger from Bhuvneshwar, on a good length, Roy flicks and falls over. He wears it on the pad but this is heading down the leg side. Sharp first over from Bhuvneshwar
back of a length and nips back in on off, the ball does not come onto the bat and messes with Shaw's back-foot punch. The result is an inside edge to cover
short, swings away wide outside off, Shaw stays leg-side of the ball. Throws his bat at it with his back leg a fair way outside leg. Beaten emphatically
back of a length and angling in at middle stump, no swing, Shaw sits back and punches between midwicket and mid-on
fuller than a good length and swings back in sharply from over the wicket, Shaw is tucked up for room and an inside edge saves him

and Krunal seals it, but Kuldeep reviews it. A reverse sweep from Kuldeep for the ball pitching on middle and leg stump and it's going pretty straight from around the wicket, goes under the bat, hits him in front of the stumps and it's all over
outside edge goes off Kishan's gloves! The wrong'un again and Kuldeep went forward to defend but the turn took an edge and deflected off the keeper's gloves on the off side
132kmh, pitches it short again and Kuldeep makes room to steer it to off but misses yet again
angles it in from back of length, Kuldeep defends it back

slogs it straight to SKY (Suryakumar Yadav) at wide long on, his second catch to add to Lynn's run out. Looked like a slower ball again, it was fullish on leg, and Chawla slogged it high on the leg side, easy catch in the deep
short and on the leg side, Chawla tickles that absolutely fine on the leg side, past a diving Ishan Kishan for four
a short ball on the off side, it's a cutter (from Cutting) and Chawla chops it into the off side
moves a bit too much to off to make room, Bumrah replies with a full delivery outside off and Curran swings and misses
142.8kmh and down the leg side, Chawla also backs up and then tucks it to long leg
another short ball, Chawla ramps it late on the off side and Bumrah runs to his right from third man to get to it after a bounce
much shorter this time and nipping in a bit, Chawla defends it back after it rises
around the off stump and Chawla pushes it into the covers
right on the off stump, Chawla blocks it back

edged to the keeper, KKR collapsing on their home ground against seam bowling. Bumrah leaps in celebration and why shouldn't he. That one pitched around the leg stump and Bumrah angled it nicely to absolutely stifle the batsman with the line and he only tickled it to the keeper
short ball angled across and Rinku Singh waits for it to rise and then ramps it over the slip fielder for a well-placed four

holes out to deep midwicket, Cutting takes a superb catch running to his right. What's happening here! A short ball from Hardik, Rana pulled and that hardly went any distance beyond the 30-yard circle, Cutting wasn't at the boundary but well inside and he did well to run a few yards to his right and slide to catch that

another run-out chance, Hardik may not have collected the ball here! Rana steered the ball to point and DK wanted the single, he hared out and turned back too. Oh hello, that's so so close. Hardik's right hand is in front of the stumps as the throw comes in and looks like the hand has broken the stumps as it comes back to collect the ball. But the ball is just touching the hand as the zing bails light up. Umpire Dharamsena gives it out!
well over midwicket on this big ground! Another short ball to Rana, like the first one, and Rana went down on his knee quickly to pull that over the fielder's head in the deep

straight to cover! A slower one outside off, Russell wants to pounce on it and makes room to slap it on the off side. He does that but hands it straight to Markande who grabs it with both hands over his head
135.9kmh, ducks for the short ball and takes it on the shoulder. Hardik banged it in short and maybe Russell picked the length a bit late and ducked late and took his eyes off the ball while ducking
another offcutter and Russell pulls but connects well enough only for one
back of length offcutter and Rana scythes it to deep point where Lewis does well to keep it to one
fullish on the off stump and Rana drives it down to mid off
wrong'un to end the over, but it was short enough to be spotted by Rana and he pulled it to deep midwicket
straight to deep midwicket! Suryakumar had to move only an inch to his right because Uthappa made some room, Markande pitched it on the leg stump and Uthappa slog-swept it straight to the fielder
on the leg side and Rana helps it away easily to deep square leg
this one comes in with the arm and Uthappa helps it to leg off the back foot
a slow offcutter at 115kmh on the stumps to end the over, Rana makes room but gets a thick edge to cover point after attempting to slice it

how delicate was that and so well placed. A short offcutter from Hardik, Rana spots it and lets it come to him to tap it late with short hands and places it between the keeper and the fine gully fielder
around the off stump off back of length, Rana defends it late and behind square on off
starts on the pads, Rana is strong on that side and he clips it away nicely to roll it along the ground past short fine leg
nearly plays on! Strong finish from Bumrah to end the over with one that angles in, Uthappa gets an inside edge that nearly gets the off stump
beats the outside edge! Length delivery outside off that just about holds its line after coming in with the angle, Uthappa pokes and misses
bangs it in short and Uthappa pulls that away stylishly for six! Watched the ball land well outside off, turned on the back foot and swivelled nicely to pull it square
length delivery on the off stump this time, Rana blocks it back
swings it across Rana on the off side who drives and misses

oh, mix up and Lynn is nowhere close! Uthappa sliced the ball to cover point and took a step or two out of the crease but Lynn reacted late and suddenly ran down the pitch but it was too late. Suryakumar swooped in and sent it a flat throw to Krunal well before Lynn could reach the crease
comes down the track this time and Krunal pulls the length back a bit, a single towards cover
slightly slower than average again, on the stumps this time. No room at all so Lynn makes some and chops it with hard hands to deep point
fine leg is in, a short ball again and this time Lynn uses placement instead of power to pull it wide and square of short fine leg
that goes a bit high and behind the stumps, Kishan runs forward and dives desperately but it falls well short of him. Took a bit of glove when Lynn tried to pull the short ball
short ball, it's a slower one and Lynn waits after that high back lift, and then pulls it late for it to go fine on the leg side this time, four more
he angles it across from length and Lynn reaches out for it to drive but gets an inside edge to the leg side
short ball follows and mid-on takes it easily! Right on the money, Mitch! Bangs it in short, Narine opens up a bit and pulls for a top-edge that goes high and Krunal comes under it comfortably
over mid-off first ball for four! Not sure why that happened but Mitch bowled it straight and full on the off stump for Narine to loft that over a leaping mid-off for four

pulled, and pulled very very well. What a flourish, what a finish. Sitting up nicely as Krunal muscled this over deep midwicket.  KKR will have to bat out of their skins to get this.  22 off the last over, not the finish they wanted.
in his hitting arc and this has vanished over wide long-on. Drifted in from wide of the crease, Cutting was waiting for it as he teed off like a golfer in style
Swing and a miss. Little more effort into the delivery, bounce as well. Cutting once again looked to pull from outside off
slips this short and outside the wide line, Cutting leaves.
too much power, too much muscle. Slower length ball way outside off, Cutting picked it early, walked across, held his shape and belted this over wide long-on
toe-ends a lofted hit straight to mid-off.  First IPL wicket for Prasidh  and a slower delivery has earned him one. His one-time Karnataka team-mate takes the catch.
swing and a miss. Narine carefully drifted this across. Kishan heaved wildly
squeezes this yorker-length ball back, Russell can't stop it cleanly

just over Kuldeep's outstretched hands! Drifted into middle stump, and Rohit drives too early. The ball holds off the pitch, and Rohit pushes it straight back. In the air, but just over the bowler's left hand. Close!
defends back. Narine took the pace off, spun back in from length as Surya played that

what a strange way to go.  This was a loose delivery, a half-tracker on middle and leg, the ball took ages to get to Lewis, who was already through with the pull. The ball looped off the back of the bat after it hit the thigh and then to short third man. The missed opportunity doesn't cost KKR much.

dropped by Kuldeep running back from square leg!  Prasidh beat Lewis for pace, took him on with the pull and got it high on the bat. Lucky to get away. Lewis was hustled and in no position to play that in front of square. Prasidh's first IPL wicket will have to wait
