sees this in his half and belts this over cover. Almost as if Lewis had decided he'd just look to blast this. Not quite to the pitch but he swung this through nicely.
once again, good bounce off the deck. Gets bounce as Surya is hit high on the bat as he defends. Lovely from Prasidh

Rahul ends on 95! An unbeaten, but valiant knock. It was short on off, and Rahul once again reverse paddles this over short third man. Ends the game with a 16-run over, but it was all too late. Rajasthan Royals win by 15 runs!

dropped by Unadkat! That's hurt his arm. It was the slower ball, on a good length, that he tried to muscle towards leg side. Took the toe end of the bat and came to Unadkat rather slowly, but he was expecting it to come quicker. Hits his wrist
full outside off, and Rahul backs away before thumping it over deep extra cover! His highest score in the IPL!
waist-high full toss way outside off, and the ball hits Rahul's shoulder. Tried to paddle it over his shoulder once again, but this time it didn't come off the bat. Ouch. Free hit as well

deja vu! It's outside off, and Rahul once again shuffles towards that side before paddling it over short fine leg again. Does well to get his head out of the ball's way before playing it over his left shoulder. Kings XI need 32 off the final over
smart! Planned for the yorker this time, and moved to the off side even Archer bowled. It was a yorker, of course, and Rahul does a Marillier over short fine leg!
another yorker on leg stump, of course. Dug away towards midwicket, and no one's there in the deep. Archer has to go racing behind it, and does well to keep it down to only two
change up, and short on off stump. Stoinis backs away to make some room, and bunts it over Unadkat's head. Some work for long off, but he does well to keep it down to two
wide outside off, and even a full toss. But Rahul misses out. His slap towards point comes off the bat's toe end. Lucky Unadkat
back of a length, but wide outside off. Rahul can't wait no more as he walks down the ground and meets this cutter from near his chest. Pulled into the gap between wide long on and deep midwicket
ends with another yorker. Straight at middle stump, and Stoinis does well to get bat to ball. Mistimed to backward point
too slow! And short as well! Stoinis has no clue when the ball would get to him. Completed deceived as he tries to swipe at it. Just 95kph
full outside leg stump once again. Successfully pre-empts Stoinis' movement to the leg side. Can only squeeze the yorker away to mid on
slower ball, but outside off stump. Big wind up from Stoinis, but he's through his cut shot too early. Mistimed to cover point. Stoinis is disappointed to have missed out
toe-ends it! Full on off, and Stoinis comes charging down the ground. Tries to drive towards cover, but takes the edge to short third man
Stoinis shapes for the sweep, Sodhi drags this legbreak shorter and outside off, swatted away to square leg
113.4ks short ball outside off, Rahul picks the change-up and hauls a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Rahul brings up his fourth fifty of the season
back of a length on top of off, punched back to Anureet
sharp offbreak, starts outside off and rips back in, storms through Rahul's gate but beats the off stump as well as the keeper. It raises a puff of dust from the surface

Rahane dives forward to snag the catch and send Tiwary back. 143kph, good length on off and but the ball sticks in the surface. Tiwary closes the face early and lobs a catch to cover off a leading edge
Rahul gets on top of this short ball outside off and cuts to sweeper
Rahul presses forward to this full legbreak and eases it to sweeper cover
slider, Rahul falls over the flick and wears it on the pad
quicker and flatter on off, Rahul ventures a reverse-sweep and deflects it over Rahane at slip off the forearm
loopier legbreak outside off, Tiwary collapses his back leg and drives inside-out to wide long-off
nice and full outside off, Tiwary stretches out, meets the pitch, and rolls out a sweep between deep midwicket and deep square leg
long-hop outside off, Rahul jumps onto the back foot and nails a pull between deep midwicket and long-on. Duly put away

Sodhi has Shane Warne applauding from the Royals dug out. Tossed up and breaks away outside off, Nath clears his front leg and looks to mow it over midwicket against the turn. He can only send a leading edge to long-off. The asking rate has shot to 10.36
dropped short and outside off, Rahul leans back and cracks it away to sweeper cover
back of a length and turns away, Rahul punches off the back foot and finds backward point
loopier, full on off, spins away, Rahul gets forward and smothers this legbreak
full on off, and Nath takes a big stride forward to defend. Firmly played
back of a length on off, but angling into his body. Worked off his pads to wide long on, and enough time for Nath to come for the second run

bat-pad, or pad-bat?! Full on off, and zipping straight through. The batsman tries to defend, and hits his pad first, perhaps. Sodhi wants to review. Interesting. It's definitely pad first, but is it turning away too much? Yes, just too much. Missing off stump by a whisker!

low full toss outside off, mistimed to cover, and Rahul's halfway down the wicket. The fielder picks up and has a shy at the striker's end, but misses completely. Direct hit and the batsman would've been gone! Rahul choosing to live dangerously
crunched through cover! Full outside off, and what a delightful shot from KL Rahul. Shuffles onto the front foot, and simply drives through the ball;s line. Perfect placement.
full on middle and leg, and Rahul tries to drive towards mid on. Takes the leading edge towards mid off instead
full, and on off stump this time. Perfectly timed straight drive from Rahul, but Stokes gets his left hand to it. Parries it towards mid off
full and wide outside off,  and Rahul reaches at it to slap it over point. The ball was past the tramlines anyway, so he had to stretch slightly more
back of a length on off, and angling across his body. Fended away from his body off the back foot towards cover. Good end to the over from Unadkat
back of a length on off, and Nair tries to work it towards the leg side. Mistimes it, and the ball ricochets onto his own pads
back of a length outside off, and Nair whips it towards midwicket off the back foot

two-ball duck! Perfect offspin from Gowtham, and that crashes into leg stump. It was outside off, but wild turn into the batsman. Tries a big heave towards the leg side, but the ball sneaks through the big gap between bat and body

stumped! Down the leg side. It was full on leg stump, and Gayle came charging down the wicket. The ball angles down leg, and Buttler's excellent behind the stumps. Quick to remove the bails, CHG has to go!
slapped over point! Short outside off, and Rahul slashes this hard and away from his body. Top edged, but still goes to the point boundary. Archer's pace hurts his own bowling
full on off, and Rahul makes some room this time. Lifts it over the infield, and although the bat turned in his hand, the shot had enough power to clear the infield. Binny goes chasing after it
back of a length, and outside off again. Too close to Rahul for any off-side shot. Taps it towards cover point with the bat's open face
back of a length just outside off again. Rahul shuffles onto the back foot and opens his bat's face. Played to backward point
back of a length just outside off, and Rahul rides the bounce to defend it with soft hands
good length outside off, and Rahul tries to be cheeky. Backs away and attempts a late cut, but can't beat short third man
full on off again, and Rahul comfortably drives off the front foot. Stopped by cover once again
big appeal! But turned down. Keeper says impact's outside off, so they choose not to review. It was full outside off, and Rahul tried to sweep it square. Hit his front leg
Holes out to Karun Nair at long-on. Very full on off, another knuckle ball, Unadkat ends up skewing it to Nair at long-on. Tye is now the top wicket-taker in IPL 2018 with 16 wickets
Lomror jumps across off, meets a middle-stump full-toss and scoops it right over the head of short fine leg
First-ball duck for Archer. 114.3ks slower full ball on off, Archer ventures down the track and slices this knuckle ball to Tiwary at long-off

loopy full-toss slanting away outside off, knuckle ball, Stokes is forced to reach out for the ball. He loses his shape and ends up toe-ending a catch to Ashwin at extra cover. Tye kisses the black band on the side of his jersey
rounds out the over with another slower one, 116.4ks outside off, Lomror swings early and misses

slogged from outside off to deep square leg. Lomror chances a second. Rahul takes it on the half-volley and whips the bails off. Lomror dishes out a full-length dive and makes his ground. The desperate dive saves him
Stokes steps out, Mohit spears a high full-toss above the waist, spliced down to long-off. Tight call, considering Stokes was down the track
slower bouncer, Lomror is early into a pull and only collects fresh air

overpitched and outside off, Stokes stays beside the line and drills it down to long-off. Stokes wants two, the throw is to Tye, who gathers it and takes the bails off. Binny stretches, but is caught short by an accurate throw from his Karnataka team-mate
Binny steps out, change-up, short and outside off, the batsman leaps and chops through covers
pitched up on off, right in the slot for Binny. He gets underneath the length and hoists it over long-on for six
short and angling across off, Stokes throws his bat at the ball and scythes it over backward point

very full and darted in from wide of the crease, Stokes hangs back to this full offering and plays around his front pad. Umpire Erasmus shoots down the lbw appeal. This seemed to be heading down leg. Ashwin decides against a review

Buttler ventures down the track, but misses hie leg-side swipe. After seeing Buttler use his feet, Mujeeb drags his length back and gets it to slid down leg. It beats Buttler, keeps low, and Rahul takes the bails off. Buttler falls for a career-best 82. Two wickets in two overs for Mujeeb

Nath runs in from long-off, dives forward, and shells it. Carrom ball, on middle, swerves away, Buttler goes for a loft, slices it and gets away. Tiwary was running back from short extra cover and perhaps thew Nath off
Stokes welcomes Ashwin with a muscular hit. Fullish and outside off, he jumps outside leg, and flat-bats it past the right of Ashwin. Bam!
dragged down outside off, Stokes rocks back and hauls a pull to wide long-on
Mujeeb puts Samson out of his misery. Pushed through flatter on off, Samson aims to slog it over midwicket. Instead, he drags it much straighter to long-on for 22 off 18 balls
full on middle, but legbreak again to end the over. Played with soft hands towards cover, and Samson takes off for the single. Time out as well
more air this time, but too wide. It pitches outside off, and spins further away, which Samson has no problem in putting away. Cut past the infield! Fifty partnership as well
good length on middle and leg, but spinning across Buttler. Pushed off the back foot to the mid-wicket region
good comeback! Flight and drift outside off, and as Samson tries to defend, the ball turns away from his bat
flat-batted over Ashwin! Short on off, and Samson goes deep into the crease. Opens his stance, takes his front leg out of theway, and sends it into the long-on boundary
wild swing! But misses Samson. Misses KL too. It was full outside off, and he tries to slog it over Mujeeb. Samson looked for the release shot, but played it down the wrong line
full on off, but Buttler shuffles across to the off side and smothers it to midwicket. Wants the second run, but can't
overpitched on off, and tapped to the midwicket region off the front foot. Guides it into the gap, which allows Buttler to get back on strike
fuller outside off, and Samson displays little footwork. Simply opens the bat's face and glances it to backward point
good length on middle, and angling into his pads. Buttler goes deep inside the crease and punches it to long on
tossed up, but very wide outside off. Forces Buttler to reach at it, and all he can do is carve it to the man at point
tries something new, but doesn't come off! It was fuller outside off, and Samson shuffled across to the off side to paddle it fine down the leg side. Doesn't come off
good length outside off again, and spinning away from Buttler once more. Opens his bat's face and plays it towards cover point. Gap there to exploit
good length outside off again, and spinning away from Samson. He stays on the back foot, and whips it off his pads to the midwicket region
another misfield! Add another free run to Royals' total. It was just outside off, and Samson played a delicate late cut to short third man. Mujeeb the guilty man
short on middle, and going down the leg side. Buttler whips it off his pads to deep midwicket. Played gently enough, and that allows him to take the second run
outside off again, and angling into Buttler. Punched to cover once again
good length on off, and gripping & turning away from Buttler. Stays on the back foot and pushed to cover
loose! And punished. Good length, but outside leg stump. Buttler mistimes this fine down the leg side, while trying to drag it towards the leg side. Beats short fine leg!
back of a length outside off, and easily thumped down the ground to long off for a walking single. You'd think Buttler would be happy to get off strike
good length on off, and the ball comes into Buttler's body. Smacked down the ground to long off for one, and that's a very tidy over from Axar.
full on off, and Buttler attempts the reverse sweep. Mistimed to point. Excellent start to the second over from Axar
gripping! Tossed up outside off, and turning away from Buttler's bat as he tries to work it towards cover
straightens after pitching! Beautiful. Full on off, and Buttler tried to defend it straight. Played down the wrong line as the ball turns across his bat. Sharply collected by KL
it's the legbreak! Good length outside off, but turning away from Samson. He tried to defend it towards cover, but completely misread the turn. Well taken by the keeper
fuller on leg stump, and Buttler gets his toes out of the way before driving to the man at long on. Moves on to 48
full on middle, and Samson easily whips it off his toes to deep backward square. Wastes no time in getting off the mark

muscled to long on! The experiment fails. Full outside off, and he tries to send it into orbit. Got his front leg out of the way to connect with it, but the lack of pace does Gowtham in. Played too early, and easy for Tiwary in the deep
back of a length outside off, and he tries to cut it late! Almost chops it onto his stumps, clearly deceived by the change up from Stoinis. Was too close to his body for that shot anyway
another slower ball, but Tye overpitches it outside off again, Buttler stands still and hoists it over extra cover for a one-bounce four
very full and sliding into the pads, Buttler takes this overpitched ball and shovels it with the bottom hand between midwicket and mid-on
pitched up and outside off - right in Gowtham's swinging arc - he launches it right over the bowler's head. Dismissive. The ball lands in Royal's dug out. And he holds his pose like a boss
hurled short and outside off, Buttler jumps off the ground and hauls a pull to deep midwicket
banged in short and outside off, Gowtham uppercuts it down to deep third man
Buttler feigns to back away outside leg, Mohit isn't perturbed, nails an off-stump yorker, squeezed past him
back of a length and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out, opens the face and glides it away in the gap at point. Finesse from Buttler
Buttler jumps down the track and throws Mohit off his line and length. Short and sprayed wide of off, off-side wide
just short of a good length and outside off, Buttler leans back and flat-bats it away but straight to cover

Tye hoodwinks Rahane with the change-up! Knuckle ball, short and sticks in the pitch, Rahane does not pick the variation. He forays down the track and looks to ping it over the leg side. Instead, he skies a leading edge to extra cover
seam-up, nice and full on off, Rahane stretches out and defends it back to Tye
follows it with a full ball on the pads, Rahane happily tucks it away to deep square leg
shortish and just a shade outside off, Rahane angles his bat and chops it away fine of third man for his first boundary
Rahane ventures down the track, meets a short one outside off, rides it out to point
starts off with a back-of-a-length delivery outside off, sits up to be hit. Buttler obliges, swats it off the hips over midwicket
good length on off, and angling into Buttler. He punches it to Tye at long off. Will keep strike
width offered again, and allows Buttler to free his arms even more. Pure timing as he thumps it over extra cover on this occasion. Goes all the way!
flighted outside off, and Buttler gives it the thrashing it deserves. Big stride forward, and driven inside out over cover
full just outside off, and all Buttler can do is push it down the ground to long off
full outside off, and Rahane smothers it off the front foot towards midwicket for a single
Buttler shimmies down the track, Stoinis drags his length back on off, Buttler carries through with his shot. Punched it right past the bowler for back-to-back fours
angling into the pads, too full, Buttler twirls his wrists and simply picks it off behind square for four
full and moves away outside off, Buttler does not middle a drive, slices it away to the right of deep third man
floated very full and outside off, hint of outswing, Rahane reaches out for the ball with his hands and toe-ends the ball down to deep third man

and their season goes out the window. RCB all but out of the tournament. De Grandhomme walks across a long way and tries to whip it but the yorkers  angles into him and sneaks from underneath the bat to smash the stumps
yorker, angled into his leg-stump, and all de Grandhomme can do is squeeze it out to long-on. They can't even attempt the second. Top work all around
slower length ball outside off, Mandeep walks across and paddles but straight to short fine leg. Just a single
shot and wide outside off, Mandeep slaps this to sweeper cover. Rashid almost over-ran the ball there, but somehow manged to recover and fire the throw
almighty heave, gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket. Sid Kaul got that to reverse back in
leading edge but lands short of Sandeep. He looked to work this to the leg side, closed the bat face early.
drifting in, this goes through, punched back. Half-stop from Shakib but they can't sneak in a run
whips this uppishly towards square leg, Dhawan grabs this on the bounce. De Grandhomme would've been anxious
shapes to pull, misses. Wasn't far from his gloves. Skiddy bouncer from Kaul
fizzing legbreak that beats Mandeep's tentative forward push. It's all happening in Uppal!
back-to-back wrong'uns  and AB's gone. Picks the googly, but too close for the cut. This keeps a touch low as AB chops on! RCB in real trouble
cuts back in sharply, AB played for the legbreak. Somehow managed to get some bat

leading edge and the catch has been taken by Yusuf at short third man. He's taken it one-handed! For a while it looked like Yusuf lost it completely, thinks its going over, eventually sticks his right hand out to pluck that. Kohli shaped to pull but was cramped for room and the ball looped up. Big strike, the match is alive!

there's absolutely no spike on it, but Saha's brilliance down leg has made this look ridiculously easy. AB walks across to pull this short ball sliding in, and in doing so, missed the pull. Wide called.  Not out stays that way . SRH lose a review
dropped at slip!  Is that the game? Williamson lets this go through his hands. This was a thick outside edge as Kohli jabbed at this. What's worse? It races away to the third man boundary

has that been dropped? Might have dropped just in front. Seems like this one just stuck into the pitch. De Villiers chips this length ball straight back, and Sandeep dives forward but there's no catch taken

oh, he's chopped it on. So the drop doesn't prove as costly. A legsidish slower ball, 113ks, just back of a length. Vohra doesn't pick the drop in pace and tries to whip forcefully. Swings early and gets an inside edge to the thigh pad, before the ball clips the glove as he completes the swing and then takes the bails out
a bit of spin away from him, Kohli moves across and blocks
slides it into middle and leg, and Kohli whips it away through midwicket for a brace
dropped. Rashid dropped this short and it sat up for Vohra who didn't entirely get hold of his pull. Kaul at deep midwicket goes at it reverse-cupped after getting around it but lets it pop out
down the track, right to the pitch, and smoked over long-on. Overcompensation from Shakib as he flights it up too much
short of a length, Kohli stays back and just jab it through deep midwicket with a full-blooded pull
short of good length outside off, Kohli walks across and drills towards mid-on off the inside part of the bat
trying to be too ambitious! This is a 146kph delivery that has cleaned up Saha's stumps. Full and angling in, he tries to ramp, misses and the off and middle stump take a knock.
even finer! Goes with the pull, gets a top-edge over the keeper's head. Poor from Southee. Too short again

slower length ball, Shakib gets across and sweeps this straight to Umesh at backward square leg. Big wicket under the circumstances. Made him fetch this, because he changed the pace, this bounced that much more to hit the top part of the bat to deny him the power to clear the infield.
slower ball, Shakib steps out and slaps this to long off
this was so, so close to the base middle. Shakib exposed all three stumps as he went across and paddled it wide of short fine leg. Brave
too close to cut as Shakib misses and the ball goes over the outside edge
back of a length, slides across with the angle, Shakib stays back and whips it to wide long-on
pushes this fuller one out to sweeper cover. And that's a fifth half-century for Williamson this IPL
fullish length around middle and off, punches to the left of the bowler who fumbles as he tries to stop. Shakib wants a single but is sent back
too short and too wide, luckily for him, Shakib finds deep point with his cut
walks across and pummels this short of a length delivery straight back at Chahal, who gets a hand and half-stops it. Recovers and gets to the ball quickly to make sure it's a dot

that's much better. That's beautifully done, in fact. Draws him right forward by floating it up but makes sure to take it away from his off-stump, causing him to stretch forward and lose balance. Parthiv takes the bails off. Has Williamson slid the foot back in? Yes, he has
too short again, Chahal isn't finding the right lengths tonight, Williamson swivels and rolls his wrists over a pull through midwicket

ah, that's tame. Chips a length ball straight into the hands of short cover. They go upstairs to check the front foot, and he seems to have done alright there. Chahal gave it just about enough loop and landed it around middle, Pandey cleared the front leg and simply gave Kohli some catching practice
punched back, Chahal misfields to concede a single
well bowled!  steps out but Chahal cleverly shortens his length, defended back

pulled straight to Southee at fine leg!  This was an effort ball from Siraj, Dhawan picked the length early and swivelled to pull, but he was looking to clear the long boundary, didn't get it off the middle. The local boy has given RCB a reason to cheer
whips this length ball from outside off to square leg. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end from Umesh but Williamson is in
gift of a delivery first up. Too full, drifting into the pads. Was he searching for late swing? There was none here and Williamson tickled it to the fine leg fence to get off the mark

Cleaned up,  the middle stump has been flattened! This is a top, top delivery. Angles in a cross-seam delivery length from wide of the crease, this may have nipped away ever-so-slightly as Hales looked to play across the line. Missed it to see the stumps pegged back.
the extra ball, a cruel one too, has been lofted through the line over mid off. Length on off, Hales went through to clear the infield
another two! Rahul expects the slower ball, he holds his shape, nudges it to the left of deep square leg and catches the fielder dozing
targets the blockhole again, but Rahul clears his front leg and smears it to long-off. The crowd is going bonkers. They scream "Ra-hul! Ra-hul! Ra-hul!
slower ball on middle, Stoinis blocks
back of a length on off stump, Rahul comes out of his crease to try and nudge it through midwicket but ends up getting a leading edge through cover. Highest IPL score for Rahul

around the wicket and it doesn't work! It just doesn't work! Rahul is batting on another level. He sees the length earlier than he should. He can only see the gaps. And so his backing away and cutting the ball between point and short third man is academic really

shifts over the wicket and is sent over the fence at long leg! Rahul has been starving himself of runs just so that he can feast in the death! All through the middle overs he's been dabbing the ball for singles and twos. And now, at the pointy end, he's swivelling on the back foot and pulling short balls to oblivion

full and outside off, Rahul slams it to deep cover and they pinch a couple again. This is super work from Kings XI, assuming Stoinis has stretched far enough to make his ground at the non-strikers. And he has. This is a small ground, people, and these guys are absolutely stealing doubles.
yorker again, at 146 kph, Rahul digs it out to cover and wants a new bat. Some serious heat on these deliveries
nails the yorker this time at 145 kph, Stoinis jams a straight bat down to find a single at long-off
another slower ball, looping up and dipping in towards the base of off stump. Stoinis winds up but gets another inside edge to short fine leg
looks for the blockhole at 140 kph, Stoinis clears his front leg and inside edges his slog to square leg
short ball at 114 kph, Rahul pulls it to deep square leg
full and outside off, Rahul drives to deep cover

insists he has taken the catch and Samson might just have turned the game with a one-handed stunner! The on-field officials take it to the third umpire, but the soft signal is not out. First replays indicate the ball might just have touched the turf before Samson scoops it up. So Rahul can heave a sigh of relief and think about improving on that cut shot. He did make room to try and get the gap to the left of point. And almost managed it too.
direct hit would have had Stoinis! Rahane at extra cover has one stump to aim at. And only misses it by a clump of whiskers! Another slower ball from Unadkat throws up great action
goes around the wicket for a pitched-up offcutter which Stoinis defends, careful not to be sucked into playing the angle and popping a leading edge

flies past the keeper! These offcutters are getting some purchase tonight, enough to have Stoinis playing a loose shot, the bat reaching in front of his body, the feet going nowhere. A thick edge results, Buttler dives full-length to his right, but he has no chance
back of a length on off stump, Stoinis blocks with an open face
he wants to keep from giving Stoinis room, but in that effort, he bowls short and down leg and is wided
short of a length, straightening from middle, Stoinis whips it to mid-on
that's easy. Flights up a length ball with ample room. Stoinis has his nose under it as he pummels it straight over
Stoinis sees the shorter length and tries to cut but with no room available, gets beaten
floated up and turning away slightly outside off, Stoinis shuffles and keeps the bat inside the line
takes it away from his off-stump, and Rahul reaches out to drill it towards point
pitches it up outside his off-stump, Rahul reaches out for a drive to extra cover
drifts down the leg side, and Rahul clips it off the pads to deep fine leg
length ball, beautifully done. Draws him forward and gets it to leave him off the deck very late as Rahul walks into the shot and gets beaten
short of a length, comes on with the arm around off, Rahul backs away and cuts through cover
that's some pristine placement. Short of a length outside off, Rahul waits and punches really late with an open bat face to beat backward point diving to his left

slower ball, short of a length, Rahul crunches a pull to deep backward square leg where Tripathi dives and nearly fumbles to push it away towards the boundary but recovers and does well to get a hand and pull it back
short of good length on a fourth-stump channel, Rahul punches and finds cover
keeps going short - perhaps he's worried Rahul too would stride down the pitch - but the batsman is happily slinking back to pull to the square leg boundary

leading edge but it finds its way through to long-off. Karun tries to come down the track, Gopal pulls his length back, the batsman plays against the turn, and what little comes off the pitch, produces a mis-hit
full and outside off, Rahul slices it to deep third man
shortish and outside off, Nair chops it down to third man
nails the half-volley down the ground! In the slot on middle stump and Nair keeps the front leg away and presents the full face
holds in the pitch does this 139 kph delivery and Rahul has to keep his shape a second longer so that he can crack the ball through to the sweeper cover
fullish and slow and outside off. Nair hits it to cover
slower ball, on and around off stump, Nair picks it up rather late, tries to punch it down the ground. Makes no contact as the ball flicks the top flap of the pad and goes through to the keeper

fumble by Gopal at third man, and so another beautiful delivery, pitched up, outside off yields a result the Royals don't like. Nair throws his hands at this too, gets a thick edge, and Gopal, running around on the edge of the boundary makes a mess

falls short of Rahane at second slip! Lovely delivery to the new batsman, hitting a good length, probing in the off-stump corridor. Nair pokes at it, gets an outside edge, but he's played with hands just about soft enough

straight to long leg! And it's a rip-roaring shot too! Agarwal picks the short ball early, gets inside the line and tears the leather off it with a pull shot. But he forgets all about placement, which is just fine for Stokes, Tripathi and the Royals
taps it behind square leg and pinches a couple as well. Good work from Rahul. Plays with soft hands and had a partner who was willing to put in a little extra effort. Karnataka boys going well.
goes for the short one, but it goes way over Rahul's head, and down leg too.

aaarrrgghh, screams Gayle as he absolutely wallops a short and wide delivery straight to point! Kings XI have ridden on the openers' performance in this IPL. And this early wicket is going to test their middle order. Lucky breakthrough because this looked like it would have made a hole through the boundary boards and gone off to Mumbai
149 kph! And it's thrashed through extra cover! Archer slots it in the hitting arc for the big man, who clears his front leg and creams it through the gap
tosses it up wide outside off and Rahul drives to cover

reverse sweep, and it's done effortlessly. He knows Gowtham wil lbowl on leg stump. And that gives him a leg up. He knows a general area of where the ball will be, he knows third man is up, and he takes advantage
attempts the sweep with Gowtham firing it down leg. Doesn't connect
bounces over the stumps! Rahul tries to cut a ball that's way too full and gets a bottom edge. Buttler is in agony as he watches the ball bounce over leg stump
he is ever so good! Even with the offspinner wants to cramp him for room, Rahul backs away and cuts a ball on leg stump to the point boundary

oooh, this is a battle! Archer's angle from around the wicket, and his line of attack, going short and at the body, is not fun for Gayle. He backs away and blocks this with his bottom hand flying off his bat
147.8 kph, short, a little wide, and it bounces over Gayle's cut shot. The big man is coming off second best
beats him with a peach! At 147 kph, this good length ball holds its line from around the wicket and try as Gayle might to block it, he simply cannot touch this
another very good short ball, angling into the body and always rising up on the batsman. Rahul is in discomfort as he fends it away towards square leg.
forces Rahul back with a shortish delivery on off stump. The batsman blocks it into the off side
full on middle and leg, Gayle nudges it to a short leg that Royals have put in place. Rahane knows he needs wickets.
fires it through on middle and leg and strikes Gayle on the pads. Big shout for lbw but it would have gone down leg
cramps him with a full delivery on middle, from around the wicket, Gayle blocks it

and a wicket seals what has been a top effort from Kings XI on the field. A slower ball again, and Unadkat holds no shape as he tries to pull. They try to steal a bye but a direct hit from Rahul catches Shreyas short of his ground
slower full ball at 116.1ks outside off, not picked by Tripathi who presents the full face and just chips it in the air to offer an easy catch to mid-off
short and wide, that's too much room, and Tripathi carves it away through the vacant third man region

ah, bad misfield at third man boundary from young Mujeeb. Gowtham slashed at the sight of a hint of width. Still not enough and he gets an edge that eventually gets to the boundary as Mujeeb over-runs to his right

oh, beauty! What a delivery from Mujeeb. Top stuff from the legspinner. A googly that lands right on a length and draws him forward. Archer is unsuspecting and the ball spins right past his inside edge and clatters into the stumps

after a hundred swings and misses, finally an outside edge has been found. A carrom ball from Mujeeb, Buttler shapes to slap it away but ends up getting severely tucked up due to the lack of room and produces an edge
short and wide and Buttler wallops it to the point boundary to bring up back to back fifties

the relay catch! Mayank grabs it at long-off, but he's overbalancing, he knows he will go over the boundary, so he lobs the ball over to Tiwary at long-on and it is seamless. It is poetry. It is very very good. And so Stokes has to go, after smacking a loopy old delivery on leg stump straight down the ground. The percentages were right. But Kings XI outdid him on two counts: Mujeeb followed his moving away to leg stump. And then Mayank stayed supremely calm on the boundary, leapt up to take the catch over his head, and then relayed the ball through at the perfect height to his mate Tiwary
draws him forward on off stump and Stokes flicks to short midwicket
on the pads and it doesn't spin as Ashwin wants it to. So Buttler can clip the carrom ball out to deep square leg
offbreak, on a good length on off stump, Stokes works it through midwicket
carrom ball first up to the left-hander. It dips even as Stokes stretches forward to reach it. Misses the flick and hits the pad.

bounced out! And so simply done too! Digs it in short. Gets it to rise up towards the batsman's shoulder. Doesn't give him too much room to swing the arms, but Samson chooses to anyway. And sends the ball right down deep square leg's throat

another dipping delivery - this time at top pace - and it messes with Buttler's timing. He has his front leg cleared away. Tye does well to change his line and keep it wide of off stump. As a result, the batsman has to reach out, and ends up mistiming a bunt to long-on
draws him outside off with a good length ball and Samson, lunging in search of the ball, is beaten. Knuckle ball, gets a little extra kick
lovely slower ball, mostly because it dips on the batsman, and Buttler is unable to cope with the sudden change in direction. Tries to flick, but it goes off the pad and barely leaves the square
shortish and outside off, Buttler wants a single behind point, opens the face looking for the gap, but can't find it

misfield from Ashwin at cover, which means a run-out opportunity goes a-begging! He rushes in, alert to the chance of a wicket, but it spins past his right and Samson, who was ball-watching, while his partner Buttler had raced off the blocks, finally ends up able to complete the run and get an extra
that's at top pace, at 132 kph, and it's dug into the middle of the pitch. Buttler thinks about flat-batting it, but it gains too much height. Zips past his nose
they are setting up for the slower balls. Samson waits in his power position, feet apart, bat high over his head, and then pulls the slower short ball to long-on

gets down for a reverse sweep and misses to get hit on the pad. Given out almost instantly but Buttler reviews. The impact could have been outside off. Spins in a little but this could just be umpire's call on impact. Nope, it's just outside, so overturned
takes it away from him this time, and Samson swings and misses

has that been taken? Yes, Chris Gayle with a forward-diving catch. That's as rare a sight you'd see but it's true. Superb take as well. Rahane backed away and was looking to force a cut, but the back of room meant a thick outside edge, which is met by Gayle getting down and stooping low with both hands. They're going upstairs to check but he seems to have done alright. Yup, fingers underneath it. That should be out
switches over to a good length outside off, Buttler plays a late cut to backward point and they immediately take off for the single. Rahul takes the bails off, but a dive has saved Rahane
takes out the width but offers up the same length, and angles it into him as well, which allows Buttler to simply rock back and pull through midwicket. A horrific over from Rajpoot
that's awful bowling. Short and wide, and at Rajpoot's pace, it's a gift for Buttler as he opens up for a late slap through backward point
short of good length, cuts into his middle stump, Buttler backs away and haphazardly drops it into the pitch
short outside off, sits up nicely for Buttler who smokes a pull through the vacant midwicket region

Short has holed out third ball. That's a poor shot from the batsman. Takes no time to suss out the offspinner and simply swipes. Ashwin flattens his trajectory and slides this into middle and leg. Short expects it to come on with the arm but the ball straightens and as a result finds the outside of the bat as he looks to slog and lobs to midwicket
starts off with a fullish one that curves into his pads, and Buttler tucks it away through square leg
good length on leg stump, and DK tries to pull it. Tries to play it on one knee, but can't connect. Krunal appeals for lbw, and then asks for a review. Nah, it's going down leg
full outside off, and angling away from Narine. Tries to lift it over cover, but slices it to the man on the circle. DK has crossed to the other side though!
full toss outside off, and that's in Narine's arc! Thumped past the non-striker to the straight boundary. Long-on just a spectator
low full toss on leg stump, but Karthik can't put it away. Tried to slog it towards the leg side, but the ball hits his front leg
full on off, and Narine backs away to muscle it towards deep midwicket. Gets off the mark
slower ball full outside off, and Narine's big wind up doesn't connect. Inside edges it to the keeper

back of a length on middle, but Russell makes a lot of room on the leg side. Pulls it towards the leg side, but Krunal takes a screamer! He's at short fine leg, but needs to race towards the square-leg boundary. Dives forward, and takes an excellent catch!
cramps Russell! Aimed at leg stump, and with the batsman backing away, it's a perfect delivery. Russell tried to pull, but in trying to protect himself, he plays it back to Bumrah
full on middle, and no spin this time. Russell takes a big stride forward and defends it back to young Markande. Time out
too wide outside off, and then spinning sharply inwards. Russell goes deep into his crease and thumps a flat-batted shot to the wide long-on boundary
good length on off stump, and Karthik makes some room to free his arms. Cut off the backfoot to the man in the deep
backs away before the ball was bowled, and Markande goes short on middle. Turns sharply into DK's body, and forces the error from the batsman. Hits his pads
good length on leg, and Russell clips it off his toes to square leg
full on leg stump, and straightens after pitching. Russell misses the leg-side tap, and it comes off his pads
back of a length on middle, and Russell flays a cut towards backward point. All he can earn is a single
offcutter that Russell can't pitch. It was short on off, and he had walked across to the off side. Hits his body, but rather gently, as he misses the leg-side whip
goes short outside leg, and DK wants to pull. He can't connect, and goes through to Kishan. What's surprising is the umpire doesn't call it a wide. Karthik is bemused

back of a length on middle, and Rana goes for a pull. It's been sliced though, and Bumrah gets under it at deep square leg! The ball was swirling in the air, so extra marks for that effort. KKR losing wickets in a clump once again

conventional legbreak, and that earns him the wicket! Straight to long off. Full outside off, and Uthappa plays it straight down the ground. The ball spun away slightly, and induced the shot from the bat's toe end. Markande makes amends after all!
full on middle, and turning away from Rana. Sticks his bat out and taps it to point
fuller, on off and that's been driven to cover. A dot to start and a dot to end for Cutting. But four boundaries in the middle. Great over for the visitors
fourth boundary in a row! Short on off, but Cutting doesn't have the pace to trouble Uthappa. Takes his backfoot deep, and swivels a pull over short fine leg

crunched over midwicket! Good length on off, but Uthappa walks across to the off side and checks a pull shot over the infield. Placed to perfection, and what a way to get to your first IPL 2018 fifty!
full on off, and Uthappa was ready for the slower ball. He walked across to the off side, and paddles this behind square. Beats the man at square leg, and the sweeper fielder can't cut it off either
on a good length, and pitching on middle stump, Uthappa backs away to cut it square, but can only find the man at cover point

full and wide outside off, but takes the pace off (123.8kph). Uthappa wants to drive it towards cover, but he's played it too early. Hits the bat's toe end, and goes over the umpire's head. Lands in no man's land
slower ball, full on middle but angling across Rana. He tried to run it down fine, but the ball sneaks past his outside edge. Taken by Kishan on the bounce
back of a length outside off, and Uthappa can't resist to pull. Mistimed over the non-striker's head to long on
full outside off, and punched to McClenaghan at sweeper cover. A wild throw that hits Rana's bat but Lewis does well to back up

appeal for caught behind! But not given. Came off something, but not the bat. Good length outside leg, but goes over the top of leg stump as Rana misses the clip off his pads. Replays show it flicked his trouser
offcutter outside off, and he opens the bat's face to run it down to third man. Uthappa wants the run, but there's none on offer
slower ball yorker, but outside leg stump. Uthappa checks his shot, and eventualy whips it off his toes. Played over square leg, and no one's there in the deep.
sticks with the slower ball. On a good length and angling away from Rana. Mistimes the cut, but finds the gap on this occasion. Deep point cleans up
short on off, and angling away from Rana. Tries to cut it square, but off the bat's toe end. Trickles away to cover point
offcutter on off stump, and Uthappa comes inside the line of the ball to clip it off his hips. Played to deep backward square
freebie! Full toss on off, and Uthappa backs away to thump it over cover! Wide long off does not bother moving an inch
good length on middle and leg, and Uthappa makes further room on the leg side to punch it straight down the ground. Krunal gets his body behind it, and saves the single
yes, no, yes, no! Uthappa's safe though! Tapped towards point, and Uthappa wants the run. Rana says no, and he's forced to turn back. Does well to slide in before Kishan can dislodge the bails
wide outside off, and Uthappa makes room to cut. But can't find the gap as point pounces onto it in a flash
almost a yorker on off, and Rana digs it away towards midwicket for a walking single
way too wide outside off, and Uthappa leans into this one. Swats it over Markande's head, and the ball lands on the sightscreen!
good length outside off, and Uthappa chooses to play this fine. Cut straight to short third man though
dropped short and sliding away outside off, that's ripe for the cut. Rana goes on the back foot and cracks it away to the left of backward point
skids on just a shade outside off, Uthappa camps back and punches a single down to long-on
tossed liberally on middle, full, Uthappa clears his front leg and launches it over Pandya's head and the sightscreen. Terrific timing although it was in his swinging arc
wide of the crease, bouncer on middle, fizzes past the helmet as Uthappa is late onto a hook

Markande backpedals and drops a sitter! Pandya is shocked. Back of a length, slower ball outside off, this is more a short-arm flap as opposed to a short-arm pull. He drags it in the air, Markande does not have a stable base, and the ball pops out
short from wide of the crease, Uthappa's weight is on the front foot, the ball gets big on him, gloves it in the air but wide of the stumps
short and outside off, Rana is airborne as he scythes an uppercut up and over third man. Sails over the deep fielder for six
lifter outside off, Rana aims cut it away but is beaten by extra bounce
back of a length and angling away outside off, Uthappa uses the angle and angles it down to third man
overpitched and outside off, Uthappa stretches out and drives sweetly straight of mid-off. Hardik throws himself to his right, half-stops the ball
just short of a good length and outside off, Rana frees his arms and chops it hard to the ground, beats point to his right

Gill caught Pandya bowled Pandya. Hardik floats a slower offcutter outside off first up. Gill does not spot it. He is early into a drive and gets more height as opposed to distance. Krunal snuffles the catch at mid-off, has his hands aloft and roars Wakanda forever. Two wickets in three balls for Mumbai
McClenaghan hits a hard length on middle and leg - neither driveable nor pullable - punched back to the bowler off the back foot
The short ball finally works for McClenaghan and Mumbai. Chest-high ball on middle, tucks Lynn up for room. He still goes for the pull, hits it well, but picks out Bumrah at short fine leg
keeps it short, angling away outside off, just over the hips. Lynn waits for this length on the back-foot and swats it away to the midwicket fence
Make that 16 runs off the last four balls. Floated full and wide outside off, Gill is early into a drive but flat-bats it past the left of the bowler

Bumrah nearly chops Lynn into half! 142ks, back of a length and zips back in from wide of the crease. There's that sharp angle from Bumrah. Beats the inside edge, beats off stump, and beats a diving Kishan. Two fours followed by four byes. KKR won't complain
115ks slower, back-of-a-length ball outside off, Lynn delays his punch and hits it past the left of mid-off and short cover for back-to-back fours
back of a length and outside off, Lynn flashes at it and sends a thick outside edge between wide slip and regular short third man for four
wide of the crease, 136.4ks, bouncer aimed at Lynn's head, he ducks under it and lets it sail through to Kishan behind the stumps
142.5ks back-of-a-length ball, straightening away outside off, Lynn throws his hands at the ball but only collects fresh air. Encouraging carry to Kishan
Bumrah ventures wide of the crease, but this shortish ball holds its line outside off, Gill rides it down to deep third man for one
back of a length and wide outside off, in Lynn's swinging arc, slapped away fiercely but straight to point who has moved back in from the deep
McClenaghan brings out his hit-the-deck bustle. Banged in short on middle, Lynn arches his back and lets it fly through to Kishan
much fuller and on middle stump, Lynn, however, hangs back and taps it back to the left of the bowler
beats the outside edge, and the off stump! Back of a length, skipping away with the angle from over the wicket, Lynn hangs back, has a lousy waft, and misses
back of a length and into the hips of Gill, punched past the right of mid-on for one
slower ball, and angling across Duminy. With all his might, the batsman tries to slog, but can only find the man at long on
Short, and Duminy can't pull it away! Duminy wants it to be a wide, but the ball went over leg stump. Excellent!
good length outside off, and Duminy shuffles across to that side to pull again. Not well connected this time
good length outside off, but Duminy walks across to the off side to meet it. Swings towards the leg side, and manages to get enough behind it to clear cow corner
full outside off, and driven straight past Johnson's right. Man at long on cleans up
slower ball to end the over. Cutter on leg stump and further angling into Duminy. Tried to slog it towards the leg side but deceived completely
short and wide outside off, but way too wide on this occasion. Duminy tried his best, however, to slap it over the infield
short! Duminy sways to get under the line of the ball. A well-directed bouncer from Johnson
sees the batsman charging down, and Johnson goes short and wide. Forces Duminy to reach at it, and he can't get bat to ball!
full on middle and leg, and Duminy clips it off his toes to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
good length outside off, and lifted over Johnson's head. Tried to swing through that arc, but comes off the bat's toe end
cutter outside off, but the umpire thinks it's too wide. Hardik had let it go anyway. Johnson's not pleased with the umpire's call. Looked like it was just inside the tramlines though!
finds Gill at long on! Tries the same shot, but Narine went shorter. The leg-side heave comes off the bat's toe end, and Krunal fails to find the distance on this occasion. He's disappointed!
good length on middle, and Krunal's big back lift comes to the party. Hits through the ball's line, and sent over the long on boundary
good length on middle, and Krunal flat-bats it over the non-striker. Man at long off, but it lands just in front of him
good length on leg stump, and Krunal can't paddle it away. Hits his front leg, but the appeal is turned down. Bounced just outside leg
well deceived! Slow and full outside off, and Krunal's through his slog way too early. Goes past his bat's edge, and through to DK on the bounce
back of a length on leg stump, and Krunal punches it towards midwicket. He'll keep strike

short again! And the keeper appeals for caught behind. Russell isn't convinced though. It was on leg stump, and Krunal was cramped to play that pull. Goes over his gloves. The appeal, however, may have saved KKR from getting that wide
short outside off, and Krunal goes chasing after it. Tried to slap it over third man, but can't get bat to ball

One-handed six from Pandya! Tossed up and spins away, finishes on off, Pandya stretches out, yanks his bottom hand off the bat, still finds enough power and elevation to lift it over the wide long-off boundary
Chawla lobs up a legbreak outside off, Suryakumar ventures outside leg and drives it inside-out. Lifted up and over short extra cover

Rohit slog-sweeps with the break but picks out Rinku, the sub fielder, at deep midwicket. Tossed up and spins in on middle, Rohit drops down on one knee but skews it off the bottom of the bat to the man in the deep. Only the second wicket away from home for Narine in IPL 2018
Chawla slips in a googly, turns in just a touch, Rohit smothers it with a forward defence back to the bowler
overpitched and outside off, another poor ball from Chawla, Rohit simply leans into it, collapses his back leg, and drives it through the covers, beats sweeper cover to his right
slower ball, and that does the trick! Full on off, and Lewis is tempted to go for the biggie. Tries to drive over cover, but slices it down short third man's throat. Comfortably for Lynn
dropped short and sliding away outside off, Suryakumar uses the depth of the crease, use of pace and angle of Kuldeep, and chops it away past short third man for another four
Kuldeep hangs it up in the air, dips, and breaks away outside off. Lewis can't connect with the sweep
Lewis stays leg-side of the ball and drives to wide long-off

100.8ks dart on middle stump, Lewis races down the track, converts it into a full-toss, and belts it back to the left of Rana. He stretches his hands to his left but the force of the shot ensures the ball bursts out. Dropped, but that was a very difficult chance. Such ones stick or they just don't. The umpire was in the firing line too

speared very full just a shade outside off, Lewis jumps outside leg and looks to cart it through the covers. Instead, he toe-ends it away to the left of DK behind the stumps and right of short third man. Fortunate four
flighted on middle stump, but Lewis gets inside the line of the ball. Flicks it to square leg
full on leg, and Lewis' leg-side push takes the leading edge towards cover. Time out
almost a yorker on middle stump, and Lewis does well to squeeze it back to Chawla
yorker on off! Good comeback, but well played by Lewis. Dug away towards cover for a quick run
back of a length, and in Lewis' slot! Goes onto the back foot, and pulls it over deep midwicket. Off the bat's sweet spot
good length on leg stump, and Lewis swivels to pull. Off the bat's inside half, and only to the man at short fine leg. Enough time to steal the single
shorter outside off, and this time Lewis is quick to spot the length. Goes deep, and brings out the punch past extra cover
full just outside off, and Lewis shuffles forward to tap it towards the off side
good length on middle, and Lewis tucks it towards fine leg for a comfortable double. Whipped off his hips
good length outside off, and the batsman goes onto the back foot to punch towards cover. No nerves for Prasidh
ends the over with a full delivery. Straight on middle and leg, and Lewis shuffles behind to tap it back to the bowler. Tidy start for KKR
zips through! Good length on off and skids into Lewis' pads. Impact outside leg though
gives it some more air this time. Full just outside off, and Lewis fends it back to Rana
good length outside off, and Lewis punches this off the back foot towards cover. That area's packed with men in purple though
good length outside off, but angling into Lewis. Drills it straight back to Rana, who does well to get his body behind it

short and wide outside off, and that's been flat-batted towards the bowler. Christian drops the catch, but manages to go towards mid on to collect the ball. Then has a shy at the stumps, and hey, it's a direct hit! Williamson's just in. So that's two to the total.
low full toss on middle stump, and Williamson taps it towards cow corner
good length on off, and angling into Pathan. Slogs it towards the leg side, but men there in the deep
yorker on leg stump, as Williamson comes down the wicket. Cramped for space, and all he can do is squeeze it towards the leg side
good length on off, and Williamson has all the time to choose his spot. But all he can do is pull it to deep backward square
low full toss outside off, and KW had shuffled across to the off side to try and ramp it over fine leg. But all he can do is toe end it back to Boult
full toss on off stump, and Pandey gets his front foot out of the way to mistime it towards cow corner. Only a single this time
low full toss outside off, and Pandey mistimes it off his toe end towards wide long on. Hit so poorly, that it actually helps him take the second run
full on middle stump, and it's been driven inside out to long off. Boult took the pace off the delivery this time
too short outside off, and Williamson shuffles across to the off side to meet it on the up. Ramps it over backward point, and hey, it's gone all the way!
waist-high full toss on middle stump. Pandey uncomfortably whips it off his hips behind square. Looked like it was going for four, but backward square does well to keep it down to one
width offered, and slapped past point! Just that extra pace from Christian, and Pandey makes full use. Cuts it square to the end over in a strong manner

Long off asks long on to field it, and long on asks long off to collect! It was a low full toss on middle stump, that Pandey hit over the bowler's head. Both pull out off the dive and they can't believe it's gone for four. Boult and Roy the guilty men
good length on middle, but he's done well to take the pace off. Williamson attempts a leg-side drag, but the ball hits his helmet and goes to square leg
good length on off, and Pandey comes shimmying down the wicket. Muscles this pull, but it only goes to the man at long on
slower ball yorker on leg stump. Williamson backed away towards the leg side, and eventually manages to squeeze it towards square leg. An excellent delivery
offcutter, full outside off. Forces Pandey to get onto the front foot, but all he can do is defend it back to Plunkett
good length on middle stump, and Williamson comes down the wicket to tap it towards cover point (Boult). The throw from there is awry at the non-striker's, and that allows SRH to steal another run.
good length on middle, and straightens after pitching. Slight adjustment from Pandey, as he gets inside the line of the ball, and then simply nudges it towards square leg
full on middle, and the straight drive almost goes into Mishra's hands. Hit very straight and the bowler did well to get his body behind the ball's line
good length on leg stump, and Williamson smothers this off the back foot. Played to square leg
good length on off stump, and Pandey taps it to the area near mid on. No one there, so that's a comfortable double

in the air, but just short of the bower! Back of a length outside off, and it hurries onto the batsman. Tries to defend, but comes off the bat's top half. Pandey stays alive because he played at it with soft hands
short on off, and sends Pandey ducking for cover. Does well to get away from the ball's line, but it's way too high
good length but wide outside off. Williamson's gonna be disappointed not to put it away. Cut straight to point
flighted full outside off. Slight legspin, and Williamson defends towards cover
good length outside off, and zips straight through. Forces KW to get onto the back foot, and tap it back to Mishra

a beauty! Ball of the tournament. Good length on leg stump, and spins across Hales' body as he tries to defend. He's on the back foot, and the ball whooshes past his outside edge, and crashes into off stump. A legspinner's dream ball. Time out
full just outside off, and that's been smashed past Mishra's left. Long off patrolling the boundary
chops this attempted cut into the off side, Christian hares across to stop that
slows it down nicely, Hales lunges forward and blocks
gets some bounce from length on middle, Hales on top of the bounce as he works this past midwicket
backs away and upper cuts this to clear square third man. Fourth six off the over, Hales on beast mode

this is terrific! Inside-out over long off. Not too full but he lofted it through the line. Sunrisers raise the half-century stand. Super expensive over and we still have two deliveries. This is Hales unleashed

very poor from Plunkett. Too short and angling down, Dhawan helps this down past short fine leg. He'll put those away in his sleep. Not the kind of ball you want to be bowling to someone who has a highest of 11 in his last five innings!
backs away but Plunkett follows him by bowling one fuller, worked to midwicket
helped over short fine leg. Too short and angling in, Hales walked across and picked his spot. Too easy
lucky to get away with that! Too short and outside off, Hales thumps this straight to point
short and wide outside off, Hales slaps this straight to cover point
flies down leg, Pant fumbles and they'll get an extra run apart from the wide. Wrong line from Boult

Oh, dear. Maxwell! What have you done?  Will that prove to be the difference? Straight in, straight out at deep square leg. Avesh hits the deck hard again with this short ball, rushed onto Hales as he pulled from outside off, got more elevation than distance. Maxwell came running in, trembled and never looked like taking it as it descended. Gosh!
clever, very clever. Made room to slap this over point but Avesh cramped him for room. Hales now changes his stroke and uses the pace to help this wide of short third man.
driven on the up to mid off, Hales is off the mark
bends back in from length on middle, Hales plays outside the line to get a thick inside edge onto the boot
sliddy length ball that curves back in slightly, Hales is besides the line as he defends
short outside off, and Bhuvi's also taken the pace off this. Christian flat-bats it over Shankar, but lands well short of long on
follows that up with a yorker! Right on off stump, and all Shankar can do is dig it away towards point
down on one knee, and over long on! Overpitched outside off, and Shankar shanks it into the stands. Perfect spot for him to free his arms
back of a length outside off, and that's been worked off his hips to Dhawan at deep midwicket. Gently played by Shankar, which allows them to return for the second
full and wide outside off, but Shankar gets his bat to ball and taps this towards point. Would've gone for four if it wasn't for Sandeep's diving effort near the 15-year circle
muscled to long off! But men patrolling the deep. Full outside off,and that was mistimed over Kaul's head

full just outside off, and that's been driven to Williamson at cover. The non-striker is stranded midway, and KW aims at the stumps. He misses the wicket, and Kaul - in front of the stumps - can't grab it either
full just outside off, and Shankar's drive takes a thick edge. Chipped over Shakib to long off

fair play! Full on off, and that was drilled straight into the non-striker's stumps. The umpire wants a replay in case the non-striker is run out, but Shakib says he hasn't touched the ball. Good to see
overpitched on leg stump, and Christian pushes it into the gap in front of midwicket. He'll keep strike

big appeal! And that's the slow finger of death. He's reviewing, but looks half-hearted. Was short on middle, and Pant just couldn't connect with the pull. The ball snuck under his bat, and hit his back leg. Looks kinda high though. Could miss the stumps, but alas! Would've clipped top of middle stump.
good length, just outside off. Spinning away from Shankar, and he fends it away towards point

yes, no, yes, no, out! Full just on off, and he pushes the wrong'un towards the non-striker. Ojha wants to get off strike, but Pant chooses not to carry on after starting off. Ojha's stranded, and Rashid collects and throws at the batsman's end. Saha does the rest
knuckle ball just outside off, and not too wide this time. Pant manageds to reach at it, and bunts it over Kaul's head. Not him well enough, but still sent the umpire scampering for cover
back of a length on off, and Pant winds up to flat-bat it down the ground. Mistimes it to long off though
back of a length outside off, and forces Pant to reach at it. It's been a strategy against Pant, but this is too wide
short on middle, but Ojha backs away to make that extra room. Sticks his bat out and runs it down to third man
full on the pads and he's flicked this straight to Dhawan at deep midwicket. Out comes the Kabaddi thump. Oh, dear. Iyer has thrown it away.

Dhawan has made a right royal mess at long off.  The harbour bridge as they'd call it in Australia. Iyer belted this full toss down to long off, Dhawan failed to bend down properly. What should've been a single is now four.
punches this length ball on the up to long off. Iyer wanted the second, Pant didn't. Cry of anguish from the skipper. Remember the run out from the other night?
chops this into the square third man region. Iyer backed away to slap this through point
has he gloved this? Big appeal but the umpire is unmoved. Iyer looks to hop across and whip this but misses. The ball may have brushed his thigh pad on the way
uppish but safe! This stopped on Pant as he looked to punch towards midwicket
spins away to roll to point off a leading edge. Iyer was looking to work this to the leg side
sweeps and misses. This was pushed through quicker, drifted away as well. Pant was too early into the stroke.
delightful skip down the pitch to get under the flight as he hammers this over long on. Iyer is in total control
this one drifts in, keeps a touch low as well. Shaw punches this to deep midwicket to bring up his second half-century
quicker, on middle stump. It's angling down the leg side however, and all Shaw has to do is drag it fine. Flicked very fine, and between the keeper and short third man. Hat-trick of boundaries
good length on middle stump, and this time Shaw pulls it over midwicket! Swivels well, and then his bat speed does the rest. Picking the length early
knuckle ball outside off, but easily picked by Shaw. Takes a big stride forward and muscles it beyond the long-off boundary
knuckle ball on off, and Iyer's through his straight drive way too early. Mistimes it between Bhuvi and the non-striker, but reaches the long-on boundary
on middle stump, and Iyer uses the angle to nudge it towards square leg
good length on off, and Iyer glances it towards point. He's halfway down the wicket but Shaw isn't interested in the run. Point collects and throws but Iyer managed to get back in time
good length just outside off, but Iyer opens his bat's face to run it down to third man
good length just outside off, and Iyer chooses to fend it away. Tiptoes and pushes it towards cover
full on middle, but Shaw backs away to the leg side to make some room. Carves it away, but only to point
full just outside off, and Shreyas gets off the mark straight away. Driven past Shakib's left to long off
good length outside off and Shaw tries to drive, but chooses to defend
tossed up first, and that's been lifted inside out! Pitches outside off, and Shaw makes full use of the first loose ball. Enough time to wind up, and then his bat speed does the rest
back of a length on middle, and once again taking the pace off. Shaw flicks it off the backfoot towards square leg for a single
slapped square! Outside off, and Shaw rides the bounce to cut it off the back foot. Between backward point and point

Is Maxwell out? Yes!  How unlucky would he have to be? It was full on middle stump, and Shaw drove it straight to Sandeep. The bowler managed to get fingertips to it, and it ricocheted onto his boots and then onto the stumps. Maxwell's too slow to react, and he's inches short of the ground.
over long on! What a talent. Good length outside off, and in Shaw's arc to smack this straight. Hits it through the ball's line, and thumps it over the bowler's head
good length outside off but angling further away. Maxwell slashes it square, but takes the top edge. Straight to third man
good length outside off, and takes the extra bounce! Maxwell's a tall man, though, so he comfortably fends it away with soft hands
knuckle ball, but short on of stump. Shaw stays on the back foot and blocks it back to Bhuvi

back of a length on off. Seams slightly away from Maxwell, so he pushes it off the back foot to mid off. Calls early for the single, and they've scampered across easily. But Maxwell tripped while completing the run. He looks slightly hurt
full on off, and swinging into Shaw. Mistimes an on drive to the midwicket region. They're off the mark
full and wide outside off. He wants Shaw to reach at it, but the batsman pulls out of the shot midway. Lets it go through to the keeper
good length outside off, but nice swing into Shaw. Defends it off the front foot to cover
Chahal tosses a legbreak outside off, Bravo reaches out and drives it to sweeper cover for a single. Bravo punches his fist, Dhoni keeps a poker face as usual. CSK go top
floated up on off, Thala Dhoni stretches out and smokes another slog-sweep over the midwicket boundary. Three sixes in four balls.
Dhoni clears long-off. Free-hit ball: back of a length legbreak outside off. Dhoni stretches out and launches it for another six
100.9ks dart, fizzes off the pitch, beats the inside edge and hits the back pad. Might have headed past leg stump. Front-foot no-ball from Chahal. He's feeling the pressure
tossed up wide outside off, Dhoni reaches out, and slog-sweeps it against the break over the midwicket fence. Clobbered into the stands
back of a length and skids in on middle, cramps Dhoni for room. Inside-edged to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, Bravo presses forward and drives with the wrists to wide long-on
tossed up and spins away outside off, Dhoni reaches out for a drive, Parthiv takes the bails off, but Dhoni's back leg went nowhere
back of a length and spins away outside off, Dhoni delays his punch and finds the gap to the right of sweeper cover
dragged down outside off, Bravo ventures deep in the crease and clubs a pull over the midwicket boundary. Pinged off the middle of the bat
full and slides on off stump, no turn, Bravo hangs back and pokes the ball to point
much fuller but similar line, Dhoni presses forward and drives down to long-off

Chahal drops a regulation catch at the sweeper cover boundary. Tossed up and spins away outside off, Bravo drives it inside-out. Hoisted in the air with a high elbow, Chahal makes a royal mess of it and gives Bravo another life
Bravo reads this googly off the pitch and plays it to the leg side

really full and wide outside off, Bravo has a crack at it, not sure if the batsman had edged it. Parthiv can't close his gloves around the ball. Ultra Edge detects a spike, and that will go down as a dropped chance. Very difficult one, though
short, wide, slapped into the lap of backward point. Shorey cuts it in the air and hands Mandeep a simple catch. RCB were 80 for 4 at a similar stage of their innings
First-ball wicket for M Ashwin. Short legbreak, spins away outside off, Rayudu throws his bat at the ball and loses his shape. Slices it off the outside half to short third man
back of a length and outside off, Shorey reaches out for the ball and edges it onto the ground. The ball hits Parthiv's foot
dug in short and outside off, Shorey shuffles across off, and unleashes a pull. Sails over the fine leg fielder

Southee pulls off an incredible hokey-pokey catch at the edge of the long-on boundary. He leaps back, catches the ball, goes past the boundary. But then drops the ball into play before going beyond the fence. Then comes back and pouches it with both hands. Raina hangs at the edge of the straight boundary, but he has to go. The TV umpire confirms that's a clean catch. Well done, Southee. Umesh banged it short and outside off, Raina, having backed away outside leg, attempts a pull and ends up dragging a catch. That it was a catch was down to Southee's brilliance. What a play
short, wide, 141.3ks again, Raina reaches out and punches to point with an open face
shorter on leg, 141.5ks, Raina shuffles across off, misses, and watches the ball bounce over leg stump
back of a length on middle, Raina ventures across off, gets inside the line, and helps it away fine on the leg side for four
slow turn for Chahal, as he tosses it outside off, Rayudu opens the face and guides this legbreak to short third man
flat, quick on middle, pushed past the left of Chahal
half-tracker on the leg stump, Raina lines it up and pulls it away to the square leg boundary, to the left of deep midwicket

Raina uses his feet, meets a full-toss, slices it down to deep third man. Raina hurtles back for the second, Parthiv takes the bails off without gathering Ashwin's throw from the deep. Raina dives and makes it
hip-high short ball outside off, you've got to get it up higher. After playing three dots, Raina jumps outside leg and hacks it over the long-on fielder for six
Raina shuffles outside leg, reaches out for this short ball outside off, and ends up missing it wildly
full and angling across off, Raina pokes it back to the bowler
overpitched and outside off, Rayudu hangs back but lets his hands flow through the line. Crunched away wide of mid-off. 16 off the over
yet another slower ball, Rayudu picks the offcutter, jumps across off and bludgeons it over midwicket. Muscled away. Raina manufactures his own pace again
114.7ks slower ball on of, Rayudu forces the pace. He bends his back knee and swats it across to the midwicket fence
Raina jumps outside leg, slower cutter, toe-ended to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to wide mid-off, where Siraj lets it burst through his hands. Rayudu stepped out and swatted it away
very full on off, Raina hangs back again, played back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, Raina rides the bounce and simply helps it away between deep square leg and deep midwicket. Baz chases hard, slides and parries the ball to Siraj
there comes the sucker ball - full and wide outside off - Raina hangs back, waiting for the bouncer. He jabs to cover
chest-high ball on middle, tucks up Raina for room, he wears it on the body
rides the bounce of this back-of-a-length ball and steers a single to third man. 400 runs this season for Rayudu
full and outside off, skips away in the channel, 143.6ks, Rayudu is late onto a drive and is beaten for pace and late swing
Rayudu comes down the pitch but has to adjust to this short ball outside off. He delays his shot and swats it with a flat bat to wide mid-off
short on off, Raina hops and shovels a pull to fine leg
Rayudu steps out even before Southee delivers. The bowler spots the movement, drags his length back and shifts his line wider of off. Left alone in the end

Umesh floors the off stump with a 141.1kph rocket. Follows the short ball with a full one. Watson hangs back, then ventures outside the leg stump and searches for a drive. Umesh goes very full - not quite a yorker - Watson reaches out for the ball but is beaten by late outswing. Cracking first over from Umesh. He thrives bowling in the Powerplay
short, Umesh hits the middle of the pitch, Watson is now beaten for pace and bounce. Top-edges a hook into the breeze to the left of deep square leg
Umesh beats Rayudu for pace, again. Back of a length and skids back in, cramps the batsman for room, deflected to the leg side
short on middle, Rayudu is a bit late onto the hook. He top-edges it into the CSK dugout beyond the fine leg boundary
back of a length and angling in on off, Rayudu opens the face and dabs to point
back of a length and fizzes in at off, Watson jumps back and punches straight to cover. Chahal rounds out a maiden
Chahal throws himself to his left to stop this front-foot drive from Watson
tossed on off, no turn again, Watson stretches out and drives it back
back of a length and skids in on off, Watson moves back and punches it to Chahal
short of a length, comes on with the arm around leg stump, and Watson stands tall and tucks into the leg side
short of a length, shapes away a tad, and Watson blocks from the crease
a tad fuller  from Southee this time, and Watson carefully defends to backward point off the front foot
short, wide and cuts away from the deck. To sum it up in one word, that was tripe. Watson slaps it out to sweeper cover

Siraj run out off the last ball? Indeed. Such fast hands from Dhoni, again. Full-toss on off, Siraj loses his shape and splices it down to long-on. It's the last ball, and he has to come back for the second. He finishes second to Dhoni in that race
Southee runs down the track for a leg-side yahoo, instead he inside-edges to short fine leg. Siraj drags himself for a single
length ball on middle and leg, whipped away through square leg. Southee hurtles back for the second. Dhoni fumbles the take

Chaos in Pune. Siraj is in pain. Man down. This was an accurate yorker on middle from DJ, Southee jabs his bat down hurriedly and inside-edges it behind to Ngidi at short fine leg. Siraj hares across for a single, Southee sends him back as he wants to keep strike. Siraj turns and that's when he collapses. The throw from Ngidi is awry again. Soars over Bravo, and Siraj comes across to the non-striker's end
Southee backs away outside leg and does not make contact with a slower ball
Thakur nails a wide yorker outside off, beats Southee

Southee jumps across off, meets a low full-toss, and looks to scoop it away over fine leg. Instead, he leading-edges it to the left of deep third man. Ngidi dives to his left but the ball pops out and sneaks away to the boundary
back of a length on the hips, Southee picks it up and launches it over the square leg fence. Such a clean strike from Sixer Southee
full-toss outside off, Southee, having shuffled across, swats it away to long-on and refuses the single
full and sliding in on middle, Southee plays around his front pad and deflects it to short fine leg, where Ngidi picks up the ball and fires a wide throw, the ball runs away to the boundary
and Southee welcomes him with four. Overpitched and outside off, clears his front leg and thrashes it through the covers
Southee becomes the second RCB batsman - after Parthiv - to move into double figures. He shuffles across off, meets a full-toss, and inside-edges it between his legs to the fine leg boundary
slower offcutter outside off, Siraj hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge yet again

Willey throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end. The TV umpire has been called in, and Umesh is caught well short. Ngidi ventures wide of the crease, back of a length and angling in, pushed towards mid-off. Umesh sets off, as does Willey. The fielder swoops down on the ball, has three stumps to aim, and goes bang

plays for non-existing turn and the ball shoots past the outside edge. But, hang on, has there been a stumping? Dhoni whipped the bails off, sure, and the backfoot has slid out. Ashwin tries planting the foot down, but only lands it on the line. Done in by pace, no turn and lack of bounce
curves in a back of a length delivery from wide of the crease, and Ashwin backs away and punches through the covers
oh, dear! That's been chipped straight back. Jadeja rushes him with a quick fuller one and Parthiv's bat turns towards the outside in his hands as he knocks it straight into the hands of the bowler
picks out deep backward square leg. Fullish but not quite full enough, Mandeep Singh gets down to sweep and crunches it off the middle but straight into the hands of the fielder
Mandeep hangs back and works with the spin to midwicket
arm ball, fizzes in, 102ks, Mandeep nearly drags it back onto the stumps. The ball sneaks away past leg stump

Is Parthiv run out? Tossed up on middle, Mandeep camps back and plays it back to the bowler. Harbhajan collects the ball cleanly, sees Parthiv straying out of the crease and taps it back onto the stumps. Parthiv, however, has enough time to slide his bat in
