shot! Lynn with the quality! Predicts the line and length again, has his front leg out of the way, a strong base as he waits like a boxer. Umesh delivers, full at off stump, and he bludgeons this straight and flats
looks to go straight, looks to go full. Lynn knows and is backing away. Makes room and clubs it wide of mid-off after taking it on the full

dropped! Kohli has his face covered at slip as M Ashwin puts down a sitter at extra cover. Chahal has done superbly to induce a leading edge from Lynn -  a dipping legbreak at off stump that he looks to lift over midwicket. There was no pressure on Ashwin, apart from anything he put on himself. He got under it, couldn't complete it
nicely placed. Length ball outside off. A legbreak. Not too full. And there's bounce on it. But Lynn shuffles and sweeps from under it to get four at long leg

lifts it just over the infield on the off side. No, we have not switched to permanent bold tags to start commentary lines. Narine living on the edge but doing a great job. Couldn't quite get under this overpitched bal and got it over cover off the toe-end

slices it but no one to take it as it lands near short midwicket! Narine can't get the hook away against a quick bouncer. It looks like Umesh has pulled something in his leg, because this wasn't too far from him for the catch. He couldn't get anywhere near it
changes it up. Low full toss outside off and Narine looks to run it past point with an open face. It lands in front of him on the bounce
shot! What a shot! Umesh offers a length ball in the corridor, with all his pace. Narine is grateful for it on this slow pitch. Stands tall, merely taps from under this and sends it over long-off
skies a slower ball but it clears mid-on and lands wide of long-off. Another offuctter but this one is back of a length. Narine wants to swat over midwicket but this goes away from him
another bouncer. Giving nothing to Narine today. He's hurried as he backs away to try and pull. Beaten but that's given wide on height
falls short of Kohli who runs to his left and in front after Narine awkwardly fends this short ball uppishly. Another slower short ball. Kohli runs from slip but this sneaks through from under
full and straight. Lynn gets his legs out of the way and jams it to mid-on. Siraj fires a low-arm throw and the ball rolls through to the keeper who is backing up
full ball at middle stump. Looking for the shape away from there, but there's none on that first ball. Lynn taps it back to the bowler

anticipates the slower ball going across him and shuffles right into the off side. Mitch drops this cutter shorter than the others. This means Kohli's momentum moving backwards can be used to spring at the ball as it climbs up at his hips. He duly lofts it over deep backward square
beaten again with the offcutter. Hits back of a length, finds grip and climb as Kohli brings out a square drive on the up

yes. Yes, yes, yes. That bottom-handed whip again. Wide of long-on. Russell misses his length yet again and despite this being a slower ball, he is punished. Kohli barely moves his feet to get this right off the middle
Kohli shuffles because there's a chance behind square on the leg side. But this yorker is perfectly done. Gets him at off stump. He jams it wide of long-on to come back for the second
Mavi keeps his cool at deep midwicket, and takes this with a reverse cup right at the edge. Mandeep hits the pull nicely, to be fair. But the elevation is missing and it's a smart catch

lovely! Mandeep hasn't had too much of the strike but he's been very productive with it in this over. Skidder at a length outside off, with some swing in. Stays deep in the crease and gets his bottom hand under this to whip it over long-on
swatted over deep midwicket. Mandeep has nailed this slog sweep against the offbreak. Good stride, clean hit. That's the fifty partnership

sensational fielding by Russell at long-on to stop a typical Kohli whip down the ground. He sprints to his left, rotates anticlockwise and stops this ball behind him, one yard in front of the boundary

sliced over extra cover. Not timed well at all from Kohli. It's a length ball going away off the pitch. He wants to go in that direction, but the poor connection means it's one bounce and into the boundary
beaten. Unplayable right now. Googly goes high enough in the air before landing that Mandeep expects it to bounce as it goes past him. Brings out the late cut but is well beaten
slugs it off the inside half of the bat. Kuldeep has Kohli in some bother tonight. Another loopy one has Kohli excited, but the slog sweep is not timed well at all. Trickles out to deep midwicket
beaten by big turn again. A googly, pitched short and outside off. Turns even further away as Mandeep shapes to pull
big turn into the pads. Kohli can't get bat as he looks to flick off the back foot
glorious from Kohli. Leans into this full ball outside off, makes use of the allowance - mid-off is in - and makes him fetch it. Hobbles immediately after. Looks like an ankle thing.

dropped! Mandeep's attempted ramp is poorly timed. It looks like Russell's getting bouncers to stick in the pitch. It's a lob that goes behind Rana who is at fly slip and he can't hold on after pedalling backwards and tumbling
swing in at off stump from back of a length. Mandeep looks to steer it to third man but can't get it past the keeper
full and very wide outside off. Russell got some swing on that one too
leading edge. This is why Kohli is tentative against Kuldeep. Hasn't picked this googly as he looks to flick through midwicket
full on middle stump, and yet another watchful drive from Kohli. This one to long-on

gone! A full toss! Vohra skips down the pitch and gets a shin height full toss tailing in at him that is ripe for a drilling through midwicket. It's what he was looking to do as well. Except, there's a gap between bat and pad and the inside edge sneaks through to smash the stumps oh it takes his back boot on the way too

got him! Through the hook shot too early, is McCullum, and he ends up getting a feather off the toe of the bat which carries comfortably to the keeper. A short ball and he made plenty of room for the swing, but the timing is just off
loses control against this loopy ball from Kuldeep. Looks like a googly. Kohli has to wait a long time after shaping to flick and ends up chipping to long-off

aesthetically beauty is where de Kock's inside-out loft over extra cover stops. He's not fully to the pitch and as a result, he's ended up slicing a very good looking shot to sweeper's left. The fielder runs a few yards to his left and watches carefully before completing the catch
short again, not sure what Chawla is trying here! Forget the off side, McCullum rocks back this time and pulls it high and wide over long-on
shorter and quicker, and it's short enough to give McCullum the time to go back and chop it between point and short third man
beaten but he gets four! Flatter one on the middle stump and it turned just enough to deceive McCullum, but he made a late adjustment and got it fine on the off side
hardly turns around the leg stump, de Kock tries the reverse sweep but doesn't connect at all
spoils the over for Kuldeep! It was pitched up a bit and McCullum slog-swept that one with the turn over the fielder at deep midwicket!
Kuldeep bowls this one much slower as de Kock comes down, he waits and cuts yet again
a fumble at deep midwicket, KKR's fielding still a beat wobbly. McCullum had swept this one with the turn to the leg side
slow and on length outside off, de Kock waits for it to turn and then cuts it past point for one
pitches the first one short and McCullum pulls it to deep midwicket
tries the same delivery but it's a low full toss this time and de Kock slices it to deep point
145kmh, a wide yorker outside off, de Kock stretches out and only gets a bottom edge
flat bats the short ball back to Narine
much slower than what McCullum expected, he's through with this sweep when the ball reaches him and takes it on the pad outside off
darts in one at 122.4kmh according to the TV, it was on off stump and McCullum did well to get his bat down in time
nobody on the leg side in the deep and McCullum reaches out from outside off to sweep the googly to deep midwicket for a one-bounce four
pretty full on the off stump, de Kock closes the face of the bat to drive it straght to mid on
length delivery on the stumps, McCullum makes some room and pushes into the covers
dances down the tack, Mitch bangs it in short and McCullum smacks it with a full swing on the off side for a cracking four
innocuous looking ball on the pads, McCullum tucks it carefully to leg for one
length delivery towards the off side, de Kock defends it carefully off the back foot
presses forward and blocks the length delivery into the covers. What a start from Chawla
tossed up on the leg stump, de Kock drives it down to mid off
bit more flight and bit fuller, de Kock tucks it to leg
all over. A fuller one that curves in and Archer whips it away off the pads to deep midwicket

gone. Gowtham has picked out long-off and that's the game. Fails to get hold of this fullish ball. Doesn't help that it's curving into him and he doesn't get the room he's looking for as a result. Chips it straight into the hands of long-off
low dipping full toss on middle, Gowtham shovels it straight back and long-on ad long-off converge. The latter slides across and stretches full tilt to pull it back
low full toss outside off, Rahane mistimes his punch straight back at the bowler who gets a hand to it
extremely full outside off again, and Gowtham can only squeeze it out to extra cover. They take the single

good delivery but an equally good shot from Gowtham. A full one, tailing in late into Gowtham. Nearly a yorker but not quite. Gowtham manages to get underneath it and whips it off the toes through square leg
slower length ball, keeps a little low outside off and Rahane pulls and the ball sneaks from underneath the bat
just back of a length, Gowtham walks across and whips it through backward square leg

brilliant catch by Saha! Another wide fuller one, slanted a long way across the left-hander Lomror and he throws his hands at it without moving his feet. Gets a thick outside edge and Saha flings himself to his left to take a superb, leaping catch

Manish Pandey with a brilliant effort to save a six. A wide fuller one that Lomror lofts over the in-field. Pandey at long-off snaffles it reverse-cupped, leans back as he does so, and is right in front of the boundary. He's falling over with the momentum and releases the ball as he's falling away. Top effort. Just about lets the ball go as he falls over the boundary line
Rahane finally with the big hit. Whew! That was a long time coming. Rashid nicely floats this up outside Rahane's off-stump and he gets down on a knee to slog it over square leg for a massive six
full outside off, flicks it from there to wide long-on where Pandey fumbles and allows Rahane to get back on strike
very wristy from Rahane, whips a length ball from way outside off through the gap at midwicket
slower length ball, a legcutter, picked early by Rahane who times a flick and places it wide of the deep midwicket fielder

is that a run out chance? Nah, the dive has saved him there. Lomror advances down the ground to a shortish delivery and slashes it away to sweeper cover. They take on the fielder for a second and the dive ended up being timely

off the outside part of the bat. A legbreak that turns minimally and Buttler slices it in the air as he fails to get entirely underneath the stroke. Simple catch for Dhawan at long-off. Sunrisers right back into this
tossed up, drifts in and turns away, Buttler jumps down the pitch and is beaten in flight, taps it to extra cover

and Sunrisers' sixth bowler knocks out Stokes' leg stump. Flat dart, fizzes in from around the wicket, not as short as Stokes anticipated. He swings his hands at a pull and only collects fresh air. Yusuf roars. No Nabi? no problem. It wasn't a great ball but Yusuf will take this wicket
short, climbs onto him outside his off-stump, and Rahane rolls his wrists over a pull to midwicket
cuts in from a shortish length, Rahane gets Rahane on the hip as he tries to work it away with a cross-batted whip
full and sliding into middle and leg, Rahane gets down and sweeps through midwicket
that's some pretty amazing work again through the leg side. Shortish from the bowler and there's not much pace. Samson gets in position and rocks a pull through midwicket. Great timing
there's a deep midwicket but no way he was going to get there in time. Another short delivery, and a powerful pull from Samson through square leg
slower ball, that's just 94.7ks, and Samson has to reach out as it nips away off the seam, skews it off the inside of the bat down the pitch
short and angled into him at pace. What more does a batsman need? Samson swivels and flays a pull over deep midwicket
back of a length on off, cuts away slightly and finds the outside part of Samson's bat as he blocks

pre-meditated from Tripathi, and he pays the price. Doesn't make an effort to suss out the length and just charges down the track. It's a little too shortish for his comfort and skids on at pace along a leg-sidish line before clattering into the stumps
length ball around off, good tight lines, Rahane drops it into cover. Good over apart from the boundary
inswinging fuller one again, Rahane watchfully blocks off the front foot

another painstaking Pandey innings comes to an end. Was in no control of this lofted hit. Sliced this slower delivery to point, where Rahane moved a couple of steps back to complete the catch. Royals continue to surge.
looks to scoop but Unadkat bowls this full and wide outside off, squeezed wide of point
slashes this straight down the throat of third man. Yusuf looked to upper cut, this one didn't bounce as much as he would've liked. Easy catch, Archer continues to impress with every outing.
short on middle, pulled all along the ground to deep midwicket where two fielders converge. Pandey wanted the second, Yusuf wasn't ken

the inswinging yorker has done the trick. Gets this to bend back in a long way from outside off from around the stumps, Shakib jams his bat down late as the ball bounces into the stumps. 'Should I, should I not?' the ball thought to itself before disturbing the bails
steps out and drives firmly, Gowtham half-stops so can't prevent the single
uses the pace to paddle this to the fine leg boundary. Nicely done by Shakib.

shapes to cut but this one spins back in the other way, keeps low and kisses the inside half of the bat as Buttler pouches a superb catch.  Staying low was the key. Williamson asked if this was an appeal for lbw or caught behind. Umpire Nanda Kishore signalled that it was for caught behind and he's made the right decision.  Sodhi gets his New Zealand captain. . First wicket in the IPL for him.
half-tracker down leg, saved by Unadkat's fielding effort at deep square. Williamson cleared his front leg and absolutely walloped this pull. Should've been four, it's one instead.

slices this to point. Gowtham has beaten him in flight. Hales backed away to go inside-out but Gowtham slowed this down nicely to have him reach out, Hales didn't get much bat on it. Easily taken by Samson at point.
backs away to go over cover, but is made to reach out for this as Gowtham fires this wide, hit down to long off
pacy bouncer on middle, Williamson ducks under it
yorker length outside off, Williamson beaten for pace as he looks to squeeze this behind square
he's in complete control. Touch full, Williamson swings through the line to clear long off with ease. Not by any means a half-volley, but the balance and poise all in sync as he put that away
pulled, on the bounce to deep midwicket. Too short, asking to be hit and Hales did the rest.

just short of Archer at long on.  Mishit again as Hales looks to step out and hit against the turn over long on. Didn't get to the pitch but went through. Archer made the mistake of running around initially when he could've come in straightaway

outstanding effort by Stokes to run in from deep midwicket, but takes this on the half-volley. The crowd went up to applaud, but Stokes immediately said no. The ball bobbled out as soon as his elbows hit the ground. This was full and flat on middle, Hales at the risk of being lbw hit that flat and hard. Full marks for the effort
rocks back and pulls. This was begging to be hit and Williamson said 'no fret, mate. I'll put that where it should be put.' No one at deep midwicket to protect that

Tripathi drops a straightforward offering at slip!  He squared him up with a length ball that climbed on him, nipped away a touch to take the edge as well, Tripathi juggled on the second attempt and muffed it in the end. Oh, dear. How costly will that be? Archer is annoyed.
hurries Hales for pace as he gets a thick inside edge on the drive to mid on, quick single scampered
too much width, Williamson stands still and slaps this through point when it finally arrives.
pulled handsomely in front of square, into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Too short from Kulkarni, can't bowl there at 125kph. Hales picked the length very early.
width and Hales has flayed that behind point. Cracking stroke! Opened his wrists up nicely to pick the gap.
holds his shape, swings through the line and clears long on effortlessly. Beautiful swing of the bat, poor from Watson. Can't bowl length.
looks to turn this slower delivery to long on but this one gripped the surface and bounced more to hit the top part of the bat. Defended back. Top over from Bravo

is that an opening? Surely has to be. The first ball after the break has fetched a wicket. Slower length ball angling away, Lewis slogs across the line, only to slice this to Shardul, who judges this to perfection at long off.
thick inside edge, the ball deflects to point. Bravo angles one in from wide of the crease, Rohit looked to whip this over midwicket
defended back but Bravo moves quickly to his left and fires the throw back at the striker's end. Rohit reacted quickly to get back
slider that drifts back in to keep a touch low, Lewis eases this down to deep point
juicy full toss and Lewis belts this back over Tahir's head. A good over has just been spoilt by that hit-me delivery. They'll take the time-out as well with that.
punched off the backfoot back to the bowler. Top over from Harbhajan; just two off it
and again. Fuller this time, and Lewis drives but Raina tumbles to his left again to stop it
brilliant stop by Raina at mid-off as Lewis slaps this off the backfoot and Raina dives to his left to intercept it
shortish around off, minimal turn, Yadav stands tall and carves out a punch through the gap between cover and point
shortish, Lewis swivels and pulls it away through square leg. Rayudu sprints to his left from deep midwicket and sticks the left hand out to make a one-handed stop in front of the boundary
not much room to work with there but Yadav makes up for it by shifting back and subtly opening the face of his bat to knock it through backward of point
this is not the ideal length to be bowling at all. Too short, and so much width on offer. Yadav waits and then jumps before slashing a late uppercut through third man
short ball, Yadav mistimes his pull and swings early to get hit around the rib cage area on his right side
ah, throws water on a good, tight over with this legside back of a length delivery that Lewis swivels and helps along to the fine leg boundary
short of good length, angled across around the fifth-stump line, Lewis stands tall and punches to point who moves to his right and stops it
short of a length, down the leg side as it gets past Lewis' attempted flick. CSK can't afford loose deliveries like this
right into Raina's swinging arc and he's walloped this over deep midwicket. Saw Raina backing away, and tried to cramp him but ended up straying on the pads. Raina didn't miss out.
backs away, so Hardik goes full and wide, Billings toe-ends this swing across the line to long on

wallops this length ball to clear deep midwicket.  Bumrah shortened his length so Raina didn't get underneath it, but didn't matter. Not much of a backswing but he still managed to generate enough power to clear the ropes.
not on control of this lofted hit down to long-off but he'll hare back for the second. Slower delivery from Bumrah, Raina looked to thump down the ground but didn't have the pace he would've liked.
backs away to go over the off side, McClenaghan angles it in to cramp him. Raina goes through and just manages to hit it past cover point

no room to swing, so he ends up slicing this pull to Markande at point. This is very good from McClenaghan, hit the deck hard to extract bounce. The effort ball has done the trick. Well held by the 20-year old. Mumbai are roaring back at the death.

full toss outside off, Dhoni reaches out to hit this well but picks out deep cover where Evin Lewis takes a dolly. Was McClenaghan looking to bowl a wide yorker? Doesn't matter, he's got the wicket somehow.
flicks this full toss, fine leg need not bother getting around because he'll never get there.  Half-century for Raina
too short, Raina gets across and pulls to clear short fine leg. Poor from Bumrah, his death bowling this IPL has been far from ideal.
full toss angling down, Dhoni swings and misses. His protege Kishan does well to dive to his left and stop.

the bottom-handed drill is sent soaring into the stands at long-on. Too full from Markande, just a little skip down the pitch from Dhoni as he tees off in style. So close he got to the pitch that he negated the turn superbly.
beaten by the googly, but is safe!  Steps out to swing, misses but has the presence of mind to quickly plonk his bat back in.  Only Dhoni could've stumped Dhoni there
sees Dhoni stepping out and fires this wide. No problem, Dhoni does well to reach out and then slam this inside-out over cover. Foxed him but he still had enough to use his reach to pick this.
slapped to point, where there's a misfield by Suryakumar. Dhoni pinches a single to keep strike
pulled! Almost like he knew what was coming. Hardik drops short, Dhoni stands his ground and pulls handsomely in front of square, one bounce into the ropes.
drills this, one bounce to long-off. Saw this in his swinging arc, brought out his powerful bottom-handed whip to belt this. Typical Dhoni shot
was looking to heave but Krunal drifted this in short on middle and leg, turned behind square
thumps the full toss back to Krunal
short of a length on off, Dhoni again shifts back and punches to extra cover
too full outside off, Dhoni carves it away to deep point
fullish length, curves in towards off, Dhoni pushes it out off the front foot

has he picked the fielder there? Yes, he has. Comes slightly forward and then slogs this Pandya delivery but it sails right into the waiting hands of deep midwicket as he doesn't find the power he's looking for. Cutting didn't have to move an inch. Surely, that counts as a failure for Rayudu going by his ridiculous form this season?
too full and a bit of width as he floats it up outside off, Rayudu jams the bat down and hits the turf
short of a length, angled into the leg side, and Raina tucks off the pads past Ishan Kishan diving to his right
that's even better. Steps down the track and mows this over long-on. A typical Raina strike, just giving the impression that it may not be clean, and then sailing well over
flat and powerful. Pitched right up to Raina with the gift of room, and he shovels it straight over the bowler's head after freeing his arms
back of a length, slower again, 106.6ks this time, and Rayudu flicks it between midwicket and mid-on
full on middle, slower ball at 114.4 ks, but Rayudu picks it and holds his shape as he carts it over long-on. This man is in some form
similar length and trajectory, Rayudu defends back from the crease
drifts away again, Raina is beaten on the dab
drifts away a short delivery, Raina stays inside the crease, reaches out and thumps this to the point boundary
makes room, steps out and swings through to hit this length ball over long off. He's in some nick is this Rayudu.

thick outside edge and just outside the reach of Ishan Kishan. Short third man was a mere spectator. This knuckleball bounced much more than Rayudu anticipated as he shaped to cut, the end result: streaky four
nearly a return catch, and nearly a run-out at the bowler's end too  Rayudu toe-ends a low full toss as he shapes to drive back
attacks his ribcage with a short of length ball, Raina hops across to work this to the leg side, gets some thigh pad on the way to short fine
the good old Raina mow, and he's cleared deep midwicket effortlessly. Just a touch full and in his swinging arc. Easy for Raina
skids through from length on leg stump, Raina hit on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square
just over gully!  Hint of width, Rayudu slashes over the fielder to beat third man
hint of width as it angles away, Watson leans forward and drills this drive past the diving Rohit at mid-off.
leading edge, but just short!  This bounced much more as Rayudu was looking to nudge this to the leg side. Was in the air for a while, Bumrah didn't dive though as he tried to catch that.
hustles him for pace with a short of length ball on the stumps, Rayudu is on the move as he defends back with soft hands
excellent short of length ball that zips through from outside off, Rayudu plays inside the line and lets this go

steps out and flat-bats this into the sightscreen. What confidence, there's something about Rayudu's batting that has become eye-catching this season. Terrific followthrough as he hit this straight back over.
full and wide delivery angling away, Watson slashes this down to square third man
full on off stump, and the ball's in Johnson's slot. Slogs towards the leg side, and thumps it into the cow-corner boundary. Delhi Daredevils win by 55 runs!
yorker on leg stump, and Boult can't believe it's not hit leg stump. Kuldeep backed away towards the leg side and the ball went between him and the stumps
full on off stump, and the sweep takes a top edge. Falls in front of Kuldeep even before Pant could think about taking the catch
swept, but straight to Munro in the deep! Full on off, and Chawla doesn't have the power to take it for six. Munro does well to gauge the height, stick his hand out, and then complete the catch
low full toss on middle stump, but Johnson backed away a lot. Slaps it past Pant's left to third man

yorked! Full and straight, and hey, Avesh has some words for Russell after getting him out. Dre Russ couldn't care less. Turns around and walks back like the cool guy he is. Excellent death-bowling from Avesh. Earns him a big scalp
excellent delivery! Short on leg stump, and going away from Russell. The angle's difficult for Russell, and he misses the pull again
good length on leg, and Russell's pull doesn't connect. The bat turned in his hand, and it comes off the edge. Lands just short of Avesh
waist-high full toss on leg stump, and Russell uses the all the power he has to bunt it towards cow corner. Protection there though
back of a length on middle stump, and Russell tries to slog it towards the leg side, but can't connect. Deceived by the slower ball
short on middle, and angling down the leg side. Russell pulls his buttocks in so that he can collect the wide, but my oh my, the umpire says nothing. Russell's jaw is on the floor
excellent ball on leg stump that cramps Russell. All he can do is hit it straight down the ground to long off
short on off and goes with the slower ball to Chawla. He's in two minds, and eventually wants to ramp it past the keeper, but misses completely
knee-high full toss on middle stump. Russell clips it off his pads to the man in the deep on the leg side
the googly does him! Good length on off and simply coming into Mavi's body. He tries to cut thinking it'll spin away from him, but Amit Mishra's a wily ol' fox. Wicket maiden

quicker ball! Full just outside off, but zips straight through. Defended down the wrong line, and lucky that doesn't find the outside edge. Pant removes the bails and the umpire wants to go to the TV umpire. Nope, Russell's safe. His back foot came down in time
good length outside off, and spinning away from Russell. Tries to slog-sweep but can't connect. The umpire doesn't think it's a wide either
full on off stump, and this time Russell drills this straight. Big backlift, and thumped over Tewatia's head
good length on off. It's the googly that angles into Gill's body. Does well to punch it down the ground to long off
full on off, and too close for the cut, but Gill goes through with the shot anyway. Hit hard to point, but they take the fielder's arm on
deft! Short on off, and Russell tiptoes before guiding it over point's head. Sticks his bat out and Boult's pace does the rest
in Russell's arc! Full on middle stump, and gets his front foot out of the way before muscling this over Boult. Lands over the sightscreen. Just misses the press box
the extra ball goes for half-a-dozen! Short on leg stump, but Russell was prepared for that. Backs away to the leg side, and powers this over cow corner
losing his line here, Avesh. Good length on leg stump, and going down. Russell's happy to collect the extra run for his team
back of a length on middle and following Russell. He does well to get under the ball and duck out of its way
back of a length on off stump, and Russell makes room before thumping this down the ground. Long on does well to slide across the ground and intercept
short on off, and Russell's wild leg-side slog doesn't come off. The pull is played through early and the ball sneaks under his bat
full and slanting in towards off stump, Gill eyes up the leg side. Instead, he squirts a leading edge to the left of the bowler
another slower short ball outside off, Russell does not spot the change-up and misses again
hip-high short ball outside off, back-of-the-hand slower ball, Russell waits for it to arrive and swats it away to the wide long-on boundary. Fetch that
Russell backs away outside leg, swings hard and is beaten by a slower ball from Plunkett

short, flat, quick, but does not bounce as much as the batsman expected it to. Gill shapes for the pull but adjusts superbly to the lack of bounce. He shovels it with the bottom hand and summons enough power. What was more remarkable was that he found the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on

Mishra lobs it up outside off and gets it to break away further. He forces Karthik to reach out for the ball. Karthik tries to do so but loses his shape. He aims to go over the covers, but instead carves it squarer to Boult at backward point. Over to you, Russell
short, ducks in at off, cramps Gill for room, chopped away to backward point
shot, Shubman! This was pitched up and outside off, right in his arc, Gill collapses his back leg and drives it up and over extra cover. Goes all the way for six
really full on middle, 139.7ks, Karthik ventures down the track and drills a single down to long-on
drifted into middle stump, and Gill punches it down the ground off the front foot
full on off stump. Very accurate, and Gill gives the delivery the respect it deserves. Defended off the front foot
fuller on off stump, and Karthik turns it off his pads to the leg side. Hit well, but man at deep midwicket for this shot
good length outside off, but angling into Gill. He tiptoes and glances it towards point. Nice, early call for the single
full just outside off, and that's a controlled drive past Plunkett's left. The Powerplay's over so there are men in the deep now
good length outside off, and this time Gill waits for the slower ball. Sticks his bat out and pokes it down to third man
short outside off, and Gill goes chasing after it. Tries to slash a cut over slip, but misses
back of a lent outside off, and Gill tries to flat-bat it down the ground. Hit straight to mid off

the short ball does the trick again! Almost 142kph this time, and Rana took his eyes off while trying to pull. Mistimes the shot, and it's the easiest of catches for Avesh. Cups his hands and collects his wicket
offcutter on leg stump, and the ball spins into Rana. Tries to work it towards the leg side, but takes a leading edge towards cover
slower ball, full on leg stump. But Rana keeps his eyes on the ball and smothers it with soft hands towards square leg
full outside off, and Karthik's more than happy to drive it uppishly. Hit well, but falls just short of point
good length on off but it's angling across Rana, and gives him that extra width to free his arms. Brings out the square drive, and times it to perfection. Races across the outfield
back of a length outside off. Angling into Karthik, and he pushes it off the back foot to cover. They jog across for a run
good length on middle. Angling across Rana as he sticks his bat. Outside edge takes it past the slip cordon and to the man at third man
full on middle and leg, Rana shuffles onto the back foot, and taps it back to the bowler

extra bounce does the trick! Short on off, and Narine backed away again to flat-bat it over point. Comes off the bat's top half, and Iyer - at cover - calls early for the catch. Slides across the surface to complete it
good length outside off, but extra bounce on this occasion. Narine backed away towards the leg side too much, and can't ramp it over the keeper
full on leg stump, but Narine drills this over the non-striker! Straight as an arrow. Too full, in fact, and Narine simple bunts this straight
over long off! Thumps this over Boult's head. Good length outside off, makes some extra room, and then sends this over the boundary
back of a length outside off, and Rana waits for this to come at him. Opens his bat's face and taps it to point
mistimes his pull! Straight to midwicket. Short on leg stump, and Uthappa was cramped for space. Tried to go through the shot nonetheless, but comes off the bat's top half

Bowled'em. First ball to Lynn, Maxwell has him chopping on. Narine is strong v spin, but Lynn isn't as strong. This was a low-arm slider from Maxwell, wide of the crease, slides in at off, cramps the batsman for room. He hastily jabs his bat down and drags an inside edge back onto the stumps
back of a length on middle stump, no turn, slides on, Narine backs away outside leg and crunches it over the covers again
tossed outside off, full, Narine stays still, gets under it and clouts it over the long-off boundary
back of a length and outside off, Narine steps away outside leg and flat-bats the ball to the right of mid-off
Boult responds with an inswinging yorker that finishes outside off, inside-edged onto the pad
short and angling away outside off, Lynn leans back and punches it crisply into the covers
Fittingly, Iyer finishes the innings with a six. Banged in short and outside off, Iyer holds a stable base and muscles it to the right of long-off again
pitched up and angling across off, Iyer anticipates it. He jumps across off and swats it away to the right of long-off with the bottom hand
Mavi has lost his head and line. Iyer jumps across off, Mavi sprays it past the marker. Off-side wide
banged in short and outside off, Iyer hangs deep in the crease and pulls it flat and hard over midwicket for yet another six

101ks slower ball, dips outside off, Iyer does not pick the change-up. He swishes so hard that he loses his shape and under-edges it back to DK behind the stumps. They search for a single but Maxwell is sent back. The keeper passes the ball to Mavi, who clips the top of the bails with an over-arm throw

Change of angle? It does not matter. Full and angling away outside off. Iyer anticipates it. Shuffles across off, like Dhoni did the other night in Bengaluru, and smokes it over the wide long-on boundary
Mavi ventures wide of the crease, bowls a full one outside off, Iyer backs away outside leg. He manufactures more swinging room and lifts it inside-out over extra cover for another six
pitched up and outside off, Maxwell stays still, gets underneath the length and golf-swings it over the bowler's head. Delhi surge to 190. 47 runs off the last three overs
slower ball, dips just a shade outside off, offcutter it is, Maxwell is way too early into his leg-side slog and only collects fresh air
full and wide outside off, past Maxwell's swinging arc, he reaches out, loses his shape, swings and misses
full and slower outside off, Maxwell aims for a reverse sweep but is beaten
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, Maxwell does not have room to free his arms but still manages to pull it flat and hard over long leg
fuller than a good length on off, Iyer picks it up and whips it over square leg
Maxwell finally middles one and launches it over the boundary. Tossed up outside off, he golf-swings it across the line and puts the ball over wide long-on. 36 off the last two overs
there comes the big reverse-swat from Maxwell, but he finds cover point
full-toss outside off, Maxwell stays deep in the crease and swats it down to long-on. He lost his shape and miscued it down the ground
Iyer now goes over wide long-off for a six. Back of a length on the stumps, he backs away, manufactures swinging room and lifts it over the boundary

Uthappa drops the catch, parries it over the boundary, and costs KKR six runs. Back of a length and outside off, Iyer flat-bats it to the right of long-on. Uthappa moves swiftly to his right but lets the ball burst through his hands. Brings up a fine fifty
slower, short ball outside off, Maxwell waits for this 112.5ks and swats it across the line to deep midwicket
off-stump yorker, 143ks, Iyer jabs his bat down and secures a single to short third man
short and outside off, slower ball, Maxwell delays his cut and sends the ball to sweeper cover
Maxwell ventures outside leg, Chawla fires it at 103ks outside off, flat-batted to long-off
dug in short and outside off, Iyer gives himself some room and merrily frees his arms. Fiercely flat-batted away over long-off. Bam
bouncer on middle, 138ks, Iyer shapes for the ramp but pulls out at the last moment
back of a length and outside off, Iyer leans back, lets the ball come onto the bat, opens the face and punches it to the right of backward point

Banged in short at off stump, Pant drops his gloves, expecting the ball to climb further. Instead the ball flies off the glove to Karthik behind the stumps. Just a waist-high ball. Inconsistent bounce has brought KKR two wickets in two overs

flat, quick, sneaks under the bat and hits the middle stump. This does not bounce at all. End of a sparkling fifty from Shaw. Another slider from Chawla, skids low, Shaw swings across the line and watches the ball shoot under his bat and rattle the stumps
Shaw uses his feet, Chawla goes short and cramps him for room. Played back to the bowler in the end
another slider from Chawla, he's firing 'em in, whipped with the angle through midwicket
Chawla loops it up on off, too full, Iyer stretches out, meets the pitch and launches it right over the bowler's head. Hoisted into the top tier
short and veering into the hips, you've got to got it up higher, Johnson. Shaw sizes it up and short-arms it away over square leg. Sweet swing of the bat
Iyer now succeeds in ramping it away fine of deep third man. Banged in short just a shade outside off, Iyer arches his back and finds the boundary
more bounce for Johnson. Dug in outside off and angling away, Iyer arches his back but can't connect with the ramp to third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, Iyer seeks to run it down to third man. No dice. Beaten
short on off, Shaw stands up tall and punches it past the bowler
dragged down on off stump, Iyer rocks back but loses his shape. He winds up dragging a pull between wide long-on and deep midwicket
Iyer uses his feet, the bowler pulls his length back on middle, dragged away to long-on
floated up outside off, Iyer drops down to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep over midwicket
142.3ks swinging full-toss on off stump, Russell searches for the yorker but overpitches it. Shaw stays still and belts it past the left of the bowler and right of mid-off. So easy on the eye
Shaw brings up a 38-ball fifty! His captain embraces him. Rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and secures a single to third man
dug in short on off, Shaw takes it on with a pull and flat-bats it up and over midwicket to skip away to 49
142.7ks wide yorker outside off, Shaw shows his ace early and backs away. Dre Russ spears it past the reach of the batsman
dropped short and wide outside off, Shaw makes additional room by backing away. Slapped away to the off-side sweeper
Shaw steps down the track, does not allow the ball to turn, he meets it on the half-volley and shovels with the bottom hand to wide long-on
Iyer rides the bounce of this back of a length ball outside off and steers to short third man
on a length and swerves away outside off as opposed to turning in, Shaw reaches out for the ball with his hands and carves a single to deep point
short on leg stump, and Shaw's cramped for space. Somehow manages to play it towards the leg side
oh, ho, ho, delightful! Full on middle stump, and that's been whipped over deep midwicket. Excellent pick-up from Shaw, and sent into the stands
good length on off stump, but angling into Shaw's body. Shuffles across to the off side, and flicks it off his pads behind square. Great timing, and the shot beats the man in the deep to the boundary
good length on middle and leg, that's too close to Iyer's body for a square cut. Chooses to open the face of the bat and glance it to point
full and just outside off. Enough width for Shaw to free his arms, and that's been driven to long off
short to end the over! On middle stump, and Iyer's happy to duck under this. Collected by DK from near his face
back of a length on the fourth-stump line. Forces Iyer to tiptoe, and defended off the back foot
good length on off, and Shaw mistimes a punch to long on. Gets his captain on strike

yorked! 143 kph. Full and straight, and Munro's been done in by the pace. Tried to drive, but too close to his body, and that's been inside-edged onto his middle stump. Mavi not afraid to give Munro a send-off
good length on off, and Shaw's in no shape to slog it towards the leg side. A wild shot, really, and it's been mistimed into his left leg. Shaw's hobbling.
rolls his fingers over this one. Back of a length, and very wide outside off. But Shaw's deceived by the pace, and all he can do is mistime a flat-batted shot to mid off
full on off stump, and Shaw shaped up well to drive this past cover. Can't find the gap, however
short! Good length on middle, and Munro's too slow to pull. Hits his bat's edge, and then ricochets onto his knee. That must've stung
good length on off and enough space for Munro to cut it square. But misses it completely, and the ball goes through to DK
What a take! Short on middle, and Shaw's in to position to deal with this. Flies off the surface and Shaw misses the pull. DK, however, displays some great hang time
leading edge! But just short of cover. Good length on middle stump, and Shaw's through with his leg-side flick too early. Almost carried to cover though
overpitched on off stump, and Munro's leg-side slog doesn't connect. Inside-edge takes it to mid on instead
good length on off, and spinning away from Munro. Tries to cut but the ball zips under his bat
Biggie! Good length on middle, and Munro goes down on one knee, and swats this away over deep midwicket! Hit so well that it lands 10 rows back
full on middle, and Munro allows the body to go away from him. Mistimes his drive towards the off-side, but manages to find the gap between cover and cover point
good length outside leg, and spinning across Munro's body. Worked off the back foot to midwicket
good length on middle, and Munro's trapped in his crease. Does well to defend it off the back foot
back of a length on middle, and Munro comes dancing down the wicket!  Mistimes his flat-batted shot over Mavi, but enough muscle behind it to clear mid on. Daredevils race away to forty
good length outside off, and Shaw's in position early to cut. Slaps it well, but excellent stop from Rana at point
good length outside off, and Shaw rides the bounce to punch this past point. Kept his bat's face open, and lets the pace of Mavi do the rest
back of a length outside off, and Shaw misses the ramp. Tried to glance it over short third man, but just timed his shot too late
good length outside off, and sharp spin into Shaw's body. Too close to his body for the cut, and that's been bottom edged
short on middle, and angling into Shaw's body. He allows it to come to his body, and then muscles a pull square to the leg side. Deep midwicket can't cut it off
full outside off, and Shaw tries to play inside out over cover. Lifts it easily over cover, and there's nobody in the deep either. Expensive second over from Chawla so far
good length on middle, and zipping straight through. Quicker one this time, and Munro can only tap it down the ground to mid on
oh he's feeling it! Full outside off, and forces Munro to reach at it. But he still manages to carve it over point, and once that crosses the infield, there's no stopping that
good length on middle, and it's the wrong'un to end the over. Angling into Munro, who is forced to go towards the leg side, and punches to cover
short outside off, and that was aching to be punished. Munro goes deep into his crease and flat-bats it over Kuldeep's head! That sounded sweet
tossed up on off, and that's been swept well! Drilled straight to the man at deep backward square. Shaw was quick to gauge the length there
good length on middle and angling away from Shaw. Goes onto the back foot, and whips this down the ground to long on. Gets Munro on strike for the first time
full outside off, and the wrong'un is picked up early by Shaw. Goes down on one knee, and slogs this towards deep midwicket. Man there though
good length outside off, but slightly low this time. Shaw tries to cut, but mistimed to point
full on middle and leg, and going down the leg side. Shaw tries to work it towards square leg, but misses. Appeal for lbw but the umpire isn't interested
good length outside off, and legspin this time. Shaw walks to the pitch of the ball and smothers it towards midwicket. Calls early for the second run
full outside off, and zipping into Shaw's body once again. Tries an expansive drive but checks his shot at the last moment. Tapped towards cover
full outside off, and that's sliding into Shaw. He does well to defend the first ball back to Chawla off the front foot

Base of middle Thampi seals the game! The simplest way to knock over the tailender. Go full, go straight, watch him flop around like mad and knock the stumps over. Rajpoot goes for the scoop, so he probably expected the fuller ball, just couldn't come out the right side of the gamble
goes for the inswinging yorker at 141 kph, Mujeeb clears the front leg to heave it through midwicket. Gets struck on the back pad and pinches a run to point
knuckle ball misses off stump by a whisker! Rajpoot goes for the six over long-on and for all the good it does, he may as well been a card board cut out of himself
slower ball, hiding it outside off, and Rajpoot only just catches up with it as he slashes it to long-off
he walks right across his stumps to heave the full delivery from the wide line out to deep midwicket. These nine runs, by the way, are Mujeeb's first in all T20 cricket

another reverse sweep, another boundary, this time over short fine leg! This game's alive and kicking again. Rashid tries to keep it away from the batsman's hitting arc, bowling wide outside off. But Mujeeb's the wunderkind. So obviously he pulls off this outrageous shot
almost finishes it as a quick leg break beats Rajpoot's swing and somehow takes pity on off stump. Allows it to stay standing

traps him in front, but Tye has reviewed! It's the knuckle ball - now that's a story to tell, Tye's a legend with that variation but he doesn't pick it. Swings all across the line, feet planted in the crease. Replays says there is no bat, HawkEye says it is clipping just enough of leg stump to make it umpire's call.

slower ball, it loops off the bat and settles in the SRH captain's hands at short midwicket. Sunrisers are breaking out of jail again. Should Bhuvneshwar Kumar worry about his place in the XI now? They're making mincemeat of a top batting line-up without him. Case in point, this special little variation, having Tiwary reach in front of him for a flick shot and making the ball kick up off the pitch to ping off the high part of the bat and into safe hands
slower ball - the legcutter. Tiwary slices it to point and looks for a quick single. Ashwin says no
full and outside off, Tiwary drives to long-off

taken at long-on, right on the edge of the boundary, with less than an inch leg! Pandey, you legend! Hyderabad is awake. The Kings XI are slowly falling asleep at the wheel. Finch wants another six to his name, wants to finish this off quickly, but that is a long straight boundary and even with perfect connection in the last ball, he only just cleared it

huge appeal, Rashid wants the review, Saha says high and there's a mini conference, in the end there is no review. What a beauty though. He angles the leg break into the right-hander, but doesn't let him reach the pitch. Tiwary is lunging forward, he's off balance, he's closing the bat face and is beaten on the inside edge. The ball strikes his back thigh, in line with off stump. But is it high?

doesn't read the googly! Ignorance is clearly not bliss, at least if you're Karun Nair and Kings XI. The poor guy gets forward to block what he thinks is a leg break and is comfortably beaten on the inside edge. Great control of length from Rashid, suddenly pushing this one fuller, and slowing the pace too.
a touch shorter than he likes to be and that allows Nair to tap it down to long-on
full on middle, Finch knocks it down to long-on

long straight boundaries here, and Agarwal chooses to take them on despite not being to the pitch of this Shakib special. There's enough flight to draw the batsman forward, even out of his crease, and yet he still can't get near the ball. That little distance he has to reach forward to make contact ruins his timing. Fiftieth IPL wicket for Shakib
pitches it up and gets it to skid into the right-hander as Agarwal plays a leg glance to short fine leg
loops it up, and keeps it outside off. Agarwal looks for the slap through cover and is beaten

top-edges the pull but he manages to evade the bowler's reach and the ball plops somewhere in front of the imaginary mid-on. Another good short ball from Kaul, rising up to the chest and giving no room to swing
full toss wide outside off and Nair laces it through the covers

can you hear the noise?! The screams of the Sunrisers. The absolute joy in the crowd. Basil Thampi is responsible for all of it. Started the season on the bench. But here he is, taking out the Bradman of T20 cricket, with an honest to goodness super dooper bouncer. It's quick. Its from around the wicket. It comes at his chest. The pull shot malfunctions. Top edge straight up and Thampi takes the catch himself somewhere around short leg

how  what . just  why. That just should not happen! Rahul covers the stumps. He gets a good stride forward. He looks all set to defend this good-length legbreak on off stump. Except, it finds a way past the outside edge and then clatter into sticks like it was always destined to. Plays for the googly. Done in by the legbreak. Unreal bowling from the best in the business
all of Hyderabad roars for an lbw appeal. But this good length ball, skidding through to beat Gayle's flick originally pitched outside leg
full on leg stump, Gayle taps it to midwicket
bisects the fielders with a mis-hit! Luck be with Gayle-y to-niiiiight. Also, that slice off the outside edge, landing between point and deep third man brings up the fifty partnership as well.
there it goes! High into the night sky. Up into the second tier above long-on. And all Gayle does is clear the front leg and give it the full swing. Jeez, how much power does he have?
squares him up - if only a tiny bit - with a shortish delivery on off stump from around the wicket. Gayle blocks to point
full on off stump, Gayle looks to go big down the ground - that's more like it - but he gets an inside edge to short fine leg

spears it between short third man and point. These are not shots normally associated with Gayle. Just like he was never meant to get a century with a quick single. So you can understand Kaul going wide yorker. And then going wide-eyed

falls short of short third man as Rahul attempts another unreal shot - the late cut to a short ball angled into him. And on this occasion, even the batsman mistiming a shot doesn't help Sunrisers as Sandeep dives forward but can't get there

outrageous! He walks down the pitch, the bowler tops him by shortening his length, but Rahul says I'm good enough to still hit down the ground. Stands up taller, that bottom hand grips the bat tighter and he somehow gets on top of the bounce to clear mid-on
shortish on and around middle, Rahul knocks it down to midwicket
knuckle ball? In any case, it deviates away from the right-hander, and rather late too. Rahul is playing in front of his body, with a closed bat face, and gets a leading edge
full on middle stump. Rahul goes back and pushes it to mid on. Enough time to take another single
full on off, but Rahul walks across to the off side and sweeps this over short fine leg! Some form he's in. Got inside the line of the ball and punished it once again
good length outside off, and enough width for Rahul to cut it square. Takes a step towards the leg side to make extra room, and crunches this past point thereafter
short on off stump, and Rahul's waiting to pounce on that length. Rocks back onto the back foot and pulls over deep midwicket!
good length outside off, and the bounce gets big on Gayle. Still manages to turn it towards mid on for a quick run
back of a length on off and cramping Gayle for room. Defended to mid on
full on middle stump, and Gayle check-drives to mid on. He wants the single though, and sprints across to the non-striker's end. Williamson's throw can't get the direct hit
slower ball, full on middle and leg. Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and judges the pace early. Whips it towards deep midwicket with the use of his wrists thereafter
full on leg stump, and easy clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Gayle is more than happy to walk across to the other end for a single
good length on the fourth-stump line, and Rahul taps it down the ground to mid off. Forced to call for the quick single, and they eventually scamper through comfortably
good length on off stump, and slightly shaping into Rahul's body. Fended off the back foot with soft hands

appeal for stumped! It was wide outside off, and Gayle lets it go thinking it'll go for a wide but knows fully well where his popping crease is. Slides his back leg inside the line before Saha whips the bails off
good length on off and Rahul goes onto the back foot. Punches it straight, and off the bat's top half. Falls just in front of Nabi and then sneaks under his body to long on
falls just short of long off! Fast and flat outside off, and Gayle crunches it down the ground. Was in the air for a bit. Pandey the man there
full on middle stump, but going down the leg side. Gayle tries to whip it behind square but it hits his pads
over long off Full on off, and Gayle comes shimmying down the ground before lifting it over Nabi. Checks his shot, but still enough to clear the boundary
good length on leg stump, but Gayle waits for the ball to go across his body. Opens his bat's face and glanced it towards point
full on middle stump but tailing across Gayle's body again. Takes a big stride forward and taps it towards cover
full on middle and swinging across Gayle's bat. He tried to defend off the front foot after covering his off stump. Through to Saha
good length outside off, but tailing into Rahul's pads again. Flicked off his pads to square leg and loud cheers as Gayle gets on strike
full outside off but swinging into his pads late. Rahul shuffles across to the off side, and pushes towards midwicket
full on off stump. Rahul takes a stride forward and fends it back to Sandeep

five-for, that's his career-best figures, and the best this season as well. Great work from Rajpoot, going full, going straight, giving very little leverage for the batsman. Nabi tries his best to launch it down the ground, but it only carries to long-off
back of a length and outside off, Pandey inside edges the cut into where silly point would be
misses a leg-stump full toss and is struck on the pad. Late inswing for Tye
starts with a carrom ball on middle and off, Pandey works it to long-on

dropped! Again! That's Pandey's third life of the game as he takes on a slower ball, on a length on middle, and tries to launch it over midwicket. The lack of pace messes with his timing. The height the ball goes messes with the fielder Agarwal
misfield from Ashwin, but it costs only one extra run with deep point still on the boundary. Pandey doing all he can to get a decent score on the board, this time with a late cut to a knuckle ball
oooh, that's the length he wants, right in his hitting arc on middle stump. But Tye saves himself some punishment with his change of pace. Pandey swings hard and gets an inside edge onto pad
wide yorker to follow the mean bouncer. Pandey is not ready for this one either.
shapes to cut a short ball that is loath to give him any room. Even though Pandey makes a lot of his own, he doesn't get the result he wants. Beaten
full and outside off, he lunges forward and is beaten on the outside edge. Yusuf is clearly not reading Mujeeb's variations
right in the slot outside off and Pandey monsters it over midwicket. A-grade hitting
comes in with his legbreak action, like Anil Kumble, and bowls the offbreak instead. Pandey jams his bat down on the near yorker-length ball
spins past the long leg fielder! That's lucky for Sunrisers and Pandey's hogging it all tonight. Sweeps hard. The ball bounces right in front of the fielder and spins past his left hand
another carrom ball, against which Pandey comes down the track and pops out to long-off
carrom ball, but it's gone short and allows Pandey the room he needs to smack it to the left of long-off. The lack of pace off the pitch, however, means he has no timing

caught at deep midwicket! Mujeeb, who took a cricket ball to his eye, is bowling like a champion. Taking pace off the ball and preying on the pressure piling on the batsman. Shakib goes for the slog. Mistimes it badly and has to walk back
pops up but it's too far away from Mujeeb, on his right, to be a chance. Beautiful bowling from the young offspinner, holding the ball back, deceiving Pandey in flight and dip.

oooh, that cuts back in sharply off the pitch. The length is such that the left-hander thinks it is ripe to cut. But with the ball spinning the wrong way, Shakib has to work overtime in pulling the shot off
follows the batsman as he makes room and as a result, Pandey can only push it to long-off for a single

moves back and across again, but this time, Tye does better, pitching the ball up, but not so far that it is a half-volley. With nothing to get under, and no room to work with, he mis-hits to short fine leg
back to top pace, and it's a yorker too, on leg stump. Basically the worst ball to deal with as a batsman. And Shakib works it to deep square leg
misses a full toss. Well, if there was any doubt over how hard it is to pick an Andrew Tye slower ball

yep, have to go, have to do something. And so Shakib walks across and pulls a slow, short ball away to the long leg boundary. Really good batting. Targeted the vacant area, so reduced the risk involved

full and outside off - but it's slow. So very slow. Pandey is preparing to paste it through the covers and has to adjust his shot considering the lack of pace. Single to long-off as the bat turns in his hand while making contact
another late cut, this time Pandey making sound connection as he beats the diving Sran to his left
beaten as the offspinner gets more bounce than turn and Pandey is looking for the non-existent turn with a late cut
makes him reach - an instinctive change in line as he sees Shakib backing away - and produces a miscued cut to third man
adjusts better to the pace of Mujeeb and plants the ball in the gap at cover

the batsmen must feel like this pitch can't make up its mind. To the quicks, it's fast and bounce. To the spinners, it keeps stopping. Pandey, here, all set to punch through cover, gets an inside edge back to the bowler
overpitched wide outside off, and it's an attempted drive from Pandey. Comes off the bat's toe end but sneaks through between the umpire and non-striker. Man at long on, however
slower ball, on a good length. Wide outside off, and Pandey's been deceived by the pace once again. Tries to cut but the ball goes over his blade
short on middle, and Shakib's quick to swivel and pull. But mistimed towards midwicket, which allows them to scamper across for one
good length outside off, and starts off with the cutter. Pandey's through his drive too early, and takes a thick-ish edge. Falls just short of point though. Well deceived!
good length outside off, and Shakib goes deep inside the crease. Taps it towards mid on for a walking single
back of a length on off but angling into Shakib. Goes onto the back foot and fends it back to the bowler
keeps it wicket to wicket and Pandey, without any room, can only block
holds the offbreak back, and Pandey is sucked in by the flight on this, goes through with the sweep shot way too early and misses altogether
good length on middle stump from around the wicket, with the normal action. Shakib knocks it to long-off
that's the high-arm action and Pandey drills the half-volley to deep cover
the ball comes out of his hand at around stump-high, as he bends his front knee and crouches in his action! Pandey stays still and works it through midwicket
around the wicket to bowl side-arm offbreaks, like Kedar Jadhav. Shakib works it behind square leg
is that a run-out. Ah, no. Ashwin loses the ball as he tries to guide it onto the stumps. So Shakib survives after a nudge into the covers and running a tad bit lazily
backs away as the good length offbreak comes in with the angle. Shakib punches it to cover
inside edge as Ashwin catches Shakib in the crease with a lovely length, just around the 4 m mark. The ball comes in with the angle and messes up the batsman's timing further

picks out third man! What is happening?! Shakib takes aim at a short and wide delivery and top-edges it straight down to third man. Oh, but wait! It's a no-ball! Shakib gets a life now! That's three wickets mucked up by Kings XI within the first 32 deliveries of the game.

dropped by the same man who gobbled up the last catch! Tye is in the firing line of a fierce pull shot from Pandey (loads of power, poor placement) and he fumbles an absolute dolly. Pandey gets a second life in the Powerplay

taken at midwicket! Rajpoot is winning this on his own!  Meanwhile, Saha, the experienced Saha, the man who should have dropped anchor after the openers fell, goes for an ugly slog and gets a top edge. Sunrisers fans, look away.
full and swinging away on off stump, Saha pushes to cover

dropped by Ashwin running back from mid-off! He moves a little slowly, perhaps because he has to keep track of the ball over his shoulder. Reaches out in desperation and ends up fluffing a mostly straightforward chance. And so Pandey gets a reprieve. Dude plays sweet shots, and then loses his head straight after. Like here, when he looks to take on a good length ball on off stump and lift it over mid-on. Not the shot to play on this pacy pitch
shortens his length immediately and pushes the ball further across the right-hander. Pandey leaves
some cut back in off the pitch surprises Saha as he blocks the ball with soft hands and trots across to the other end
good length on middle, pushes it down the pitch. Pandey is a senior player in bad form. If ever there was a time to come good
he's probing away, just outside off, generating steep bounce. Pandey chooses to leave again
good length, outside off, Pandey ignores it like the due date on a phone bill
the right-left combo spawning a few mistakes. Sran strays on Saha's pads, who deftly turns it to the fine leg boundary. That ball would've been perfect for Dhawan

bounced out! Because Williamson isn't prepared for it to kick up off the pitch as it does. He sees the ball pitching short, believes there is enough room on offer for the pull, goes through with the shot, but only splices it to mid-off. Ashwin takes a simple catch. Kings XI draw first blood.
back of a length and outside off, Williamson lets it through

crackalicious! How's that to win the match - a six over wide long-on with so much strength it's landed into the crowd. Dhoni absolutely bludgeoned that by going across and swinging it over the cow corner like that night at Wankhede in April 2011. Bravo lifts his arms and goes across to embrace MS Dhoni, who's cool as ever. Harbhajan comes out and lifts Dhoni!
another shortish ball outside off, Bravo stays back and cuts it over point for one
it's that trademark Bravo loft over the covers. Short ball on off, enough room for Bravo to throw everything at it, big and hard hit and it's sailed over the off side
edged and just past the keeper for four! He rolled his fingers over that short ball, it bounced well and Bravo hooked, got an edge and it went just over de Kock's leap
short and wide, Dhoni swings and that moves away further for another wide
slow bouncer, it bounces so much that Dhoni lets it go over him for a wide
have you seen that before?! Low full toss and Dhoni slices it for six over point! Not a bad ball, only slightly inaccurate but these get punished in the death
full toss, slightly high, and Bravo can't middle it as he sends it down to long off. It dipped a bit and Bravo came down the track so not a no ball
good, wide yorker from Siraj. Dhoni jams his bat into the ground to send it to point
almost gets the block hole again, Bravo slams it down to long off
low yorker outside off, almost a low full toss and Bravo gets a tiny edge to the keeper

Rayudu can't make it despite the dive! He steered it to short third man where Umesh dived to his right but the ball deflected away, making the batsmen think of two. But it wasn't too far and Umesh qickly got back and, guess what, direct hit at the keeper's end
too much room to free the arms, too short to give the batsman enough time and Rayudu gets on top of that to slap it between point and cover
wider from the batsman and Dhoni pushes it into off for one
over the sightscreen to bring up his half-century! Too full and straight after that wide, Dhoni's high back lift was waiting and he didn't even have to finish the follow through to hammer that
he has found the gap and the boundary we didn't see! In the channel outside off, Dhoni hung back and cut it late enough to bisect backward point and short third man. They didn't even move
short and slow outside off, Rayudu goes on his toes and lofts it over the covers for two more

pitched up with some room and Dhoni has cleverly driven that square, almost beating the fielder. De Grandhomme runs across to his left behind square and slides to just keep the ball in. The third umpire is checking and looks fine
almost in the block hole, Rayudu slams it down to long off
that's better from Rayudu, that's a six on any ground! Walked across for the length ball and clubbed it away into the cheering crowd over deep midwicket for his eighth six
these boundaries are so short, that's another six over the covers! Short again outside off and Rayudu stayed still until slapping that flat and well over the covers
short and wide outside off as Rayudu swings, misses and it's called a wide even though Anderson thinks it's not

dropped! Leading edge and Umesh has put it down. Rayudu went for the big shot from outside off, he didn't get close to it and that went so high Umesh had all the time in the world to get under it. He got under it in the cricle on the off side but it popped out
good delivery on the off stump, Dhoni pushes for a single as soon as he helps it to mid off
length delivery just outside off, Dhoni waits and then defends
over the covers and six, Rayudu's sixth six! He charged down the track and didn't look like he middled it, but he got enough to send it flat and over
slower short ball well outside off, Rayudu lets it go but it's not a wide
better line from Negi - wider outside off as Rayudu tries to sweep but it's out of his reach outside off
it's Rayudu's turn, he's sent that over the cow corner! Short enough from Negi for Rayudu to go back quickly and pull that to the leg side. It's a short boundary and they're making full use of it
changes the line to pitch it outside off, brings it shorter too and it turns to beat Dhoni
one more, not a drop of sweat and that's gone over long on! Another fullish delivery from Negi, on the stumps and right in the zone for Dhoni to hit it straight
here comes the golf swing! Pitched up on off and Dhoni is not going to leave those, quick hands, strong bottom hand and all the power from those arms and shoulders launches that over the sight screen
better line from Chahal as Dhoni drives that with turn into the covers
slow and well outside off, turns away further and Rayudu leaves, thinking it's a wide. But it's not
into the open sky and into the stands! Pitched up slightly in Dhoni's arc, he picked the length and smoked it over long on. Hit it so hard, I wouldn't have tried to catch it

Anderson appeals loudly for lbw as Rayudu goes down on a knee to sweep that to the leg side but misses it. Not given as runs and Kohli reviews it. It hit Rayudu around his waist but height may not be a problem, did it pitch in line? Pitches in line, and that has actually gone past and over stump so RCB lose a review.
not too far from the off stump, Dhoni stays back and punches it to long off
a cutter at 120kmh on leg stump, Rayudu guides it into the off side
enough room outside off for Dhoni to drive it away to deep point
goes for a big sweep but Chahal has smartly bowled it slow and Rayudu is through with the shot already, goes on to hit the stumps but doesn't matter
flat googly towards the stumps and Rayudu defends it back. Oh, no ball for overstepping. Ouch, harsh call from the umpire, Long
nicely flighted on middle and leg, Dhoni waits and helps it straight to midwicket
soft hands from Dhoni to work that to the leg side from leg stump, they run hard and make it back for two
towards the leg side and Dhoni covers his stumps to paddle that down and fine on the leg side before the fielder there dives to his right to save two
turning towards off from middle, Rayudu goes back and turns it to leg
nicely bowled on the stumps, around middle and leg and it turned enough to make Dhoni defend it back. No room whatsoever
targets the stumps with the angle, Dhoni pushes it straight back
towards the pads from Negi and Rayudu works it against the spin to leg
so much turn, he's got the off stump! After that wide, Chahal goes wide outside off, wide enough to tempt Jadeja into a cut and he tries that but it turns in viciously to knock the stumps over!
beaten! Rayudu stays back to let the ball turn and it turns so much that beats his outside edge
keeps low, loud appeal turned down quickly! It was short and quick, Rayudu pulled and missed but was struck outside leg
short and towards Jadeja's waist, works it away easily or one more
swings it into him from middle stump, no room for Jadeja to put it away
brings the length shorter and the ball doesn't bounce much but Rayudu stays back to whip it to leg
flatter on the pads, Rayudu pushes it to the right of Chahal and the bowler sprints across quickly
turns into him a fair bit from outside off, Jadeja tucks it to leg off the back foot

lots of turn and he's stumped! Billings came down the track, Chahal bowls it slower through the air and shorter on the stumps, Billings looks to flick it with the wrists but the ball turns so much that it's gone past him and into the keeper's gloves
straighter on the off stump, solid defence from Billings this time
wow! Goes through Billings, just misses off stump and de Kock takes it near his shoulders. That swung in late from back of length around off, Billins presented the staright bat but on the wrong line
on the pads again, his time Billings flicks it properly and over midwicket to clear the fielders for four
loud appeal  first ball for Billings, but it's going down leg, the excitement for RCB makes it a loud appeal. It was angling in and going down for sure

the persistence with pace pays off, Raina miscues it to backward point! Raina strayed from his stumps again and Umesh pitched it up with some swing towards his legs, Raina flicked but mistimed it horrible and the edge went the other way, easy peasy for Mandeep
the umpire ducks as Rayudu charges down and slaps the short of length ball over the bowler's head with sheer disdain. He's looking in ominuous form
in the air and right in the gap on the off side, he gets four too! Raina backed away again for the short ball and slayed that ball right between extra cover and cover point
goes towards the off stump and Siraj strays down leg for a wide
quick and nipping into Rayudu, just about gets his bat down for one towards point. Think he got glove actually
starts with a short ball outside off, Rayudu gets over the ball in the nick of time to defend
goes through him! Umesh cranking it up and bowling short to Raina even as he's making room to target the off side. This time the ball swings into him and he can't get any bat on that
short ball for Raina, he makes plenty of room and pulls that just wide of mid on and in the gap for four
cramps him for room with a short ball towards the ribs, good comeback from Umesh. Made Rayudu uncomfortable as he brought his bat down just in time
strays towards the pads and Rayudu won't let that go. Uses his wrists and flicks it off the middle to the long leg boundary. Goes all the way!
more elegant this time, pitched up and Rayudu stays still to drive that nicely down the ground with a big swing. Pressure on bowler now
flat and short at 99.6 kmh, Rayudu dances down and clobbers that over deep midwicket. He's broken the shackles
pretty straight outside off, Rayudu dabs it to cover point
here comes the short ball, not a bouncer, and Raina taps it with a horizontal bat to midwicket
138kmh and Raina had no clue about that! What a beautiful length delivery from Umesh, in the channel outside off, Raina doesn't know whether to go back or forward, drives and misses
it's angled away outside off and Raina dabs it tentatively to point
risky single the one as Umesh's short of length ball squared up Rayudu a bit, he defended it off the back foot towards cover and Raina made it just in time
swings it away from length as Rayudu helps it towards backward point where Negi puts in a dive
caught at mid-on, Negi has struck! Wasn't the short on the stumps but Watson went back to pull and miscued it, easy catch for mid-on
high and long! Lunges forward for the length delivery and gets under the ball really well to send that flying over long on. Negi shut his eyes as soon as Watson launched it
bit too short and Watson pulls but miscues it to backward square leg
starts with a full delivery and Watson drives it down to long off

you beauty. Sundar with some aggressive sensibility! Shows the older boys how it's done. Stands his ground once again, allows the bowler to bowl to him and reacts to find a boundary through point. It's a poor ball - short and wide, and he carves it expertly

smash. Sundar with a reminder that there's some batting left. Hangs deep in the crease, gets a short ball that is also a slower ball. Plenty of time to swing and he manages to lift it over deep midwicket. That's a Chinnaswamy sixer

and another! Well, scratch that about momentum. Three wickets in three balls. Two run outs. Quite appalling. It's a full toss and he lifts it inside-out to long-off's right. Jadeja picks up on the bounce. Sundar has settled into the crease at the non-striker's end. Negi is running down frantically though for some reason. Turns, slips, can't make his ground at the striker's end

Dhoni hits and that's Colin de Grandhomme. And the associated runs. Too simple for him - he chucks it overarm with his glove one. Negi was looking to dab this slower ball past him with a late cut and missed

taken at deep midwicket. Mandeep picks the knuckle ball, but this length ball is too far outside off for the slog sweep he plays eventually. Ends up slicing it and Jadeja has an easy one. This is a good innings from Mandeep, he has put the momentum back in RCB's favour

shot! This is Mandeep's arrival. It's taken some time. Stunning hit. A knuckle ball dug in short outside off. No pace off the pitch but somehow he has pummelled this, one the up, with a flat bat over long-off

sweetly timed! Mandeep Singh with a top-class shot. It's a length ball wide outside off and he gets his weight down on his back thigh as he reaches out and uses his wrists nicely to slice it over point
in the block hole but de Grandhomme lofts it back over the fielder and even beats long off for a four. What a shot!
moves across and whips the slow and low full toss to long leg. Chahar is stationed there but de Grandhomme comes back and throws in a dive as the throw comes wide
smacks it back to Bravo who sticks his left hand out couldn't hold on to it. It will count as a drop but was struck really hard
length delivery this time at 135kmh, it doesn't bounce much and Mandeep slogs but misses again
slow bouncer, it beats Mandeep completely. Can't get close
yorks de Grandhomme, who bunts the ball to the right of long on where Bravo chases and throws it back and Mandeep makes it with a dive just in time
pitched up and Mandeep uses his wrists to whip it to long on
some flight there outside off, de Grandhomme waits and drives to sweeper cover
lots of turn outside off, Mandeep stretches out to tap it through the covers

that turn beats the batsman and Dhoni! It pitched on leg stump, maybe even outside, Mandeep looked to work it to leg and that turned a mile to miss the off stump while Mandeep came out of the crease and Dhoni missed the ball too

two in two, Tahir is running again! Anderson got strike because they crossed over on the previous delivery, Tahir sent down a wrong'un outside off and Anderson poked tentatively to slip where Harbhajan pouched it

AB holes out, another great over for CSK. Not a great delivery, it was a short legbreak well outside off and turned away further but AB swung away from the body and the leading edge went high enough for Billings to run in from sweeper cover. He doesn't drop those
pretty short and Anderson miscues it down the ground, lands short of long on
he charges a bit after those five dot balls, Bravo is smart enough to land that wide and away from him, another dot
outside off, yorker again and Anderson chops it to backward point
big lbw appeal from Bravo, it was a really really slow yorker and beat Anderson completely, hitting him near the knee on the back foot. Looks like Dhoni didn't want to review
starts with a bouncer to Anderson and he lets it go outside off
