oh, he's broken this stand with a good return catch! It was a typical Bravo slower ball, back of length on the stumps and de Kock pulled but a bit too early and handed it back to the bowler, who brings out his dance celebration and the crowd loves it
really slow bouncer on middle and it's angled it, AB sways his head out of the line and tries a kind of ramp but misses
goes back and across, good reply from Thakur with a yorker outside off near the feet and AB drives it bit wide of long on
here comes the knuckleball, here comes another six! It was too full, that's what was wrong with it, AB spotted the speed variation and tonked it straight down the ground
launched into the sky and that's fifty for him too! It lands in the crowd beyond the midwicket fence. It wans't full or too short, but those things don't matter to AB
not that short, but what a shot! Just a tad short, de Kock stays back and still and then smokes it over the midwicket boundary. That's gone a long, long way!
wide yorker to de Kock as he makes room and then stretches to reach out for it, can't get there
top edge, where does it land? Just before long on who runs in a long way from the boundary. What luck for AB. He pulled the short ball and didn't get enough
tries the wide yorker and de Kock paddles it from so far to the leg side
length delivery at 123kmh outside off, big swing and AB gets it to long on for one
wide signalled by Nigel Long as this one is full and wide outside off. Watson lets out a smile
slower through the air on leg, de Kock works it with the spin to leg with soft hands so that they take two even though Dhoni chases it all the way

that's out of the stadium! He walks across to expose his stumps, it's a length delivery, although it doesn't matter to this man, and he clobbers that over long on, over the stands and over everything. Someone fetch that as AB grabs a drink
poor delivery - short and turning away, AB makes room and misses it
just outside off and AB gets a reverse sweep on that one, no power only guides it fine and gets four
in the block hole on the of stump, de Kock does well to steer it to deep point and they get two for that. The stand reaches 50
yorks him for the second time in three balls, got it across with the angle too and de Kock misses again. Bravo thought he got some bat
slower ball at 101kph, but it's too full and de Kock slams it straight and over the bowler's head for a clean six! Big stride and big bat swing
starts with a wide yorker which de Kock can't get bat on
on the middle stump, AB plonks his front foot across and goes for the big sweep. Thakur runs to his right at long leg and just about keeps it in, almost over-running in the deep
makes room and charges, Tahir yorks him and de Kock bunts it to cover point
little full and AB drives it down to long off for one
pitches this one leg stump, de Kock tries the reverse sweep and misses it completely. That wasn't far from the leg stump
tried the yorker but de Kock came down and turned it into a low full toss to work it down to long on for one
at 122.2 kmh this time and de Kock comes down to slam it to sweeper cover for one
angles it across, there's not much room but de Kock cuts that nicely off the back foot and bisects the gap between point and short third man. Not a bad ball, but really good shot

starts with a slow off cutter on middle and leg, de Kock nudges it to leg and they took a single at normal pace and realised no fielder was sprinting in on the ball so take one more. Plenty of 30-plus players in CSK
makes room, Harbhajan sends it slower and AB waits to defend it back. Loud cheers for that too
woah, a flat six over the covers! It was pitched up, no doubt and AB smoked that over the covers like he knew where that was coming and at what speed. What a shot!
some flight outside off and de Kock wants to whack it, but only gets a single down to long off
on the off side this time, AB steers it late to short third man
another good delivery, straight and on length. AB stays still and punches it back, just evading the bowler but they decide against the single because Jadeja is there
straight delivery served first up to ABD, he pushes it back

Jadeja dives and takes it at mid-on. Kohli walked down this time, it was a length delivery on the stumps and Kohli wanted to loft it over the fielder but didn't quite middle it. Jadeja was slightly wide at mid-on and he quicklt went to his left for a dive and grabbed it with both hands. Thakur is thrilled!
angles this length delivery into the pads, no swing and Kohli works it to midwicket
little flatter, de Kock goes hard at it outside off but doesn't quite middle it
bit of flight and it's pitched up a bit, Kohli helps it down to long on this time
pitched up around off, Kohli comes forward and drives it back
walks down the pitch and Chahar bowls it short outside off, not much room so Kohli dabs it square for a single

another slower ball, it's full and Kohli picks it to flick it with those mighty wrists, it's going fast towards the midwicket boundary where Billing dives to keep it in, but the ball is rolling towards the boundary again and we have the third umpire looking at it. Looks like Billings' fingers touched the boundary when he tried to keep it in for the second time
smokes it for six this time! Bit fuller, de Kock leans into it and slams that over the long-on boundary with the inswing
back of length again and tapped to point by Kohli again for one more single
he pitches it a touch shorter, Kohli waits and steers to cover point patiently
still too full, Kohli drives along the ground this time through the covers and gets two
the crowd loves it! Because this is pitched up, there's some outswing and there's Kohli driving that over mid off beautifully from the middle of the bat
walks down the track this time, Thakur sends it down towards the pads and he gets an inside edge behind square on the leg side
too full outside off and some swing for him too, de Kock reaches out to drive but doesn't middle it
back of length outside off, Kohli hangs back and punches it to cover
brings it touch shorter now and much straighter with that outswing, Kohli defends it back
bit too full on middle and leg and Kohli flicks it away almost nonchalantly over midwicket for a cracking four. Excellent timing
pitches it short to Kohli and gets some away movement, Kohli stays back and defends it to the leg side
oh there's life here still. Just about. Short of a length ball in at the hips. Bumrah swings cleanly and connects to drag this to fine leg's left. The slide won't help, it's four

aims midwicket again and that's curtains! Hardik Pandya has sliced one to third man! Same line and length three balls in a row, same shot offered with no result. You've got to question that strategy. But it's also superb bowling from Kaul. He has now picked up three wickets in under two overs. 3 off 19 balls for Pandya. This will be tough to get over. Mumbai on the verge of a stunning defeat.

Dhawan flies to his right and can't hold on! Oh what a catch that would have been! Kaul gets it to rise in the corridor and Bumrah fends at it with hard hands. It is sailing high and very wide of Dhawan at wide slip. He does superbly to even reach it. But can only parry it to third man

plumb! Markande is gone! Kaul has put the fear truly into Wankhede now! It's a full ball on middle. Markande plants the front leg across and tries to flick behind square. He's not good enough to do that. There is no doubt in this one
length ball outside off. Zips off the surface as Pandya leaves. Saha does well to hold on
arm ball. Pushed through flat and Pollard has no clue about this. Looking to punch through cover, gets an inside edge to fine leg
see ya! Pollard's brief evident. Shakib goes loopy, he goes full, he goes leg stump. Pollard goes smash to send it over long-on
Pandey leaps to his right at long-on after completely misjudging this. Pollard splices this off the inside half of the bat as he looks to slog the full one on leg stump

review. Lbw review. This back of a length ball rips into Krunal and beats him on the back foot punch. Hit him on the back leg. It's given not out. He's on the back foot, very deep in the crease it looks very out right now as we wait for the tracker. There's no edge on it .it's out! Decision will be overtuned. S Ravi gets a fairly straightforward one wrong. Krunal is gone, that's hitting middle and off.
the batsman wins this battle. Kaul offers a full toss on off stump, Krunal probably smirks internally as he bludgeons this straight down the ground
oh yes. What a contest this is. Krunal with the rebuttal so to speak. This is short of a length across the corridor and he gets on the back foot to swat this wide of mid-on
who needs swing? Kaul consigns Krunal to his backside. A sharp bouncer as he shuffles back and across. It's climbing up at his helmet and he quickly gets under it and can't hold his balance
well bowled. Bangs it into the corridor at a length and gets it to jag away. Krunal hangs the bat out and is beaten

glorious! Krunal with the shot of the evening. I said it might look different when Kaul bowls. Length ball skids on nicely outside off, no movement. He leans in, full balance and crunches a drive past mid-off

it's worked! Shakib lobs one up for Rohit and gets him to try and drive through cover. No feet whatsoever. It pitches and spins away, a hint of climb, and he's nowhere near the pitch of this. Easy one for Dhawan at slip

leading edge lobs up for point. This seems to be the worst delivery of the over on first glance. Full ball outside leg stump, not a lot of swing on it. Surely going wide if he doesn't attempt a shot, surely there for a tickle if he stays in the crease. But Lewis decides to walk down the pitch to cut out all the swing he's been seeing. Reaches out for it outside leg and is through the shot early. Easy take for Pandey
beats the outside edge and gets him on the back leg. Squares him up once again. This is not easy living for Lewis. Looking to tap that through midwicket and he's struck outside off on the back thigh
beaten by the awayswinger. Lewis looks to defend from the crease and it nowhere near this

falls short of cover. Lewis gets in a weird position there. Almost like it's the first time he's encountering a swinging ball. This goes away outside off and he hangs his bat out at it, no control at all
smashed down to long-off. A slower ball is hammered back past the bowler. Bumrah sticks out his right hand, but the ball flies past. Pollard throws to the batsman's end, but he's fine

run-out! Terrible from Sunrisers. They've had a shocking evening. A slower ball outside off, Kaul finally gets bat on it. Slices a drive to point. Hardik Pandya misfields, which makes Kaul think there is a single. Pathan comes running down, sees Pandya's throw is coming and returns back to his crease, allowing Kaul to sacrifice himself. The ball pops out of Kishan's gloves, just as he made contact with the stumps
a hat-trick of slower balls that beat Kaul's outside edge. Full and moving away, beats a drive rather easily.
excellently bowled, very slow through the air outside off, loads of flight. The ball leaves Sid Kaul on the outside edge.

gone through Thampi and Markande strikes! It's a flatter delivery, quick through the air and short. Yet, Thampi misreads the length, goes back and looks to cut, he fails to connect, but the ball hits off stump.
nicely guided with the angle but he picks out backward point. A short cutter from Mustafizur.
132 kph, sticks with the shorter length. A decent bouncer. Pathan gets underneath that.

inside edge? Yes. Williamson is walking. And Sunrisers sink further. There';s some seam movement for Hardik, a length delivery seams back in after pitching. Williamson plays close to his body, but the ball still moves back in enough to take the inside edge. An easy take for the keeper.

hammered. Superb pull shot from Williamson - technical perfection. Mustafiz drops it short of a length at his hips and he swivels, gets the bat parallel to the ground, watches the ball come on and keeps it down to beat deep square to his right
slower ball at a yorker length. Pathan clears his leg and jams it out towards short extra cover
beaten on the outside edge. Length ball banged into the corridor, moving away off the seam. Williamson looks to run it to third man but can't connect
Kishan's horror day behind the stumps continues. Predictably, Pathan gets a bouncer. It's well directed and has him ducking, but Kishan parries it over
falls short of mid-off. Length ball outside off and Pathan pummels it on the up towards mid-off. It dips on him and he might have dived if it weren't for Pathan's power behind it

mix-up and Shakib will be shown the way eventually. Got none of that from his partner. It's an offcutter that Williamson taps in front of short midwicket with soft hands. Takes the instinctive two steps forward but without a call. No call from Shakib either - they're both looking at the ball. There's no run there. Shakib is halfway down. Midwicket swivels and takes the non-striker's stumps down on the bounce .ah hang on. We've looked at the replays and it sounds like Williamson said yes first and then no.

straight to extra cover! Pandey's daredevilry comes to a close. An aesthetically pleasing innings ends in a tame, throwaway manner. Length ball wide outside off. He gives it the charge and can't get elevation on the drive to clear the fielder
inside edge zips past short fine. Pandya starts in a nice area - length on off stump. Williamson brings an angled bat down on it as he pushes on the front foot. Tentative. Effective.
he's come out with a plan. Pandey walks down the track a touch, uses the shuffle across again and gets close to this length ball pushed wide. Thumps it on the up over mid-off
sweeet. Pandey stands tall and slaps one over the non-striker. Length ball wide outside off but he shuffles and closes the face as he lifts this on the up
shot. Back of a length with width from Bumrah and he eases into this, without any feet movement. Just opens the face and steers it through point

got him! Saha chases again and isn't as lucky as before! McClenaghan, not a public favourite in Mumbai these days, has brought two wickets in his first over. Another length ball pushed across him and this time he's looking to drive away from the body. A thin edge and Kishan holds on
beaten on the outside edge. Saha gets one slanted across his corridor and he jabs at it on the front foot

surreal. He threads one through point and cover again, this time off the front foot. No one quite as gorgeous as Williamson on the square drive these days. This is a full ball swinging well away from him but he gets there with a big stride and caresses it

here we go. Can't have a Williamson innings without him getting on his toes, getting the elbow high and punching one between point and cover. That's exactly what he's done to this length ball in the corridor

taken at long-off and Kings XI win by four runs. Gambhir has his head in his hands. Iyer looks up. A flatter trajectory delivery outside off is chipped away to long-off. Finch takes the reverse-cupped catch and Kings XI begin their celebrations.
slogged away with bad timing to deep midwicket. A misfield allows two. Struggled for timing. Iyer initially didn't want even one.
six! NOT OVER YET. It's flat and wide, Iyer stands back and slaps a swat straight back over the bowler's head for six. sensational timing. Delhi are dancing again.
good length, flat down leg. Iyer can't connect. The ball hits the pad to fine leg.
it's in the slot for that shot. Full and wide, Mishra comes down and misses a swing. DOT!
that was in the slot, right in the slot. Full on off, Iyer cleared his front leg too and slogged to long-on

a golden duck for Plunkett. A slower delivery down leg from Sran. Excellent variation, because Plunkett meets the ball much earlier than he intended. As a result, a whip intended for midwicket goes aerially to deep square leg, where Nair takes a comfortable catch.

edged and gone. A slower ball from Tye, the knuckle ball outside off. Tewatia slogs but all he manages is a thick leading edge, which is easily taken by Rahul. A timely strike because it also gets a new batsman in.

well bowled. A low full toss outside off, guided to Yuvraj at backward point who unnecessarily throws at the bowler's end to concede an overthrow. Poor game awareness from the experienced man. Iyer was well in anyway.
falls short of Finch at long-off. Full outside off, looking to use the bottom hand to lift the ball through midwicket. Chipped to long-off instead. Think Iyer has played this very smartly

finds the gap for four. Full outside off, Tewatia feigns one shot, then the other. Eventually, he walks across and sweeps the fast bowler behind square leg for four. When did No. 7 start sweeping fast bowlers for fun?
smashed for six. Tewatia backs away, makes room and Sran follows him. But what he does badly is bowl it on a full length, right in the slot. And slammed back over his head for six.
strays on the pads but it also cramps Tewatia for room. Struck on the pad, one leg bye to short fine leg.
hammered for four. A tad too full this time from Mujeeb, Iyer stays balanced as he drills an on-drive past his partner.
the slider. Quick down leg, Tewatia misses a flick. Struck on the thigh pad as he misses that.
flat outside off, Tewatia goes back and punches one to long-off for one.

Iyer reviews immediately! Full and wide outside off, Iyer goes after a drive and misses. The bat hits the ground as it passes. The ball misses. Umpire Nanda Kishore has got that one wrong. The match would have been very different without DRS. At least, the right decision made.

too straight and worked into the gap at midwicket. The throw back to Ashwin is good, he takes the bails off in a hurry and he thinks he has Christian. And he does. Christian is short of his crease. Sensational work from Agarwal at long-on. First, to run to his right and pick up with one hand, then releasing so quickly. And then, throwing the ball well despite being off balance. Ashwin does the easier job of taking the bails off, but he did that very quickly too.
that's a filthy delivery, drops short outside off. Iyer rocks back and pummels the long-hop of a legbreak to the deep cover fence
just three off the over. Very full, met by a crisp drive from Christian. A misfield from Ashwin lets the ball go through.
very full outside off, Iyer opens the bat face and carves a ball to deep cover for one

Mujeeb thinks he has got bat on it. Iyer thinks he's fine. But the third umpire is called on. Full outside off, christian belts a drive right back at the bowler, who sticks out his right hand. The ball bursts through the fingers and hits the stump at the bowler's end, but Iyer's bat is in.
inside edge onto the pad. It's flat and quick on off. Christian tries to finds one through square leg.
a massive appeal, no, says umpire CK Nandan. Slow outside off, the ball pitches outside off and spins back in to hit Iyer in front of off. Replays say missing leg.
flat and quick outside off, no flight, no room. Iyer goes back and pushes the ball in front of point for one.

Mujeeb strikes first ball! Kings XI continue to fight. His first ball is a flick out of the front of the hand, it pitches outside off and spins back in with the angle and the direction of release. It finds a massive gap between bat and pad and knocks into off stump. Daredevils are in some trouble.
short-arm jab but the timing is magnificent. Bisects midwicket and mid on. Lovely from Iyer

turns this slower delivery from outside off towards midwicket. Oh, dear. Four overthrows, so make that five. Miller throws to the bowler's end, but Tye misses. Finch, backing up, also misses as this squeezes below him

gets a leading edge straight to mid-off. Gambhir was woefully out of form, was failing to hit anything off the middle and has now paid the price. Looked to hop across and work to the leg side but closed the bat face too early. Are Kings XI fighting back?
slower length ball across Gambhir, who defends to cover
slower length ball on middle, Gambhir waits, waits and then defends

this went really, really high in the air. Maxwell has ended up mistiming this pull and Tye takes a superbly judged catch at deep square leg. Looked to fetch it from outside off, this was an effort delivery from Rajpoot. Maxwell got this high on the bat.
shapes to pull but this got big on him, umpire thinks way over Gambhir's head. Wide called
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends. Off-cutter from Rajpoot, kept just a touch low.
is there an edge there? Thought I heard something. Maxwell looks to run this off the bat face wide of the keeper.
ah, super strike that! Walloped into the deep backward square leg fence. Too full, too straight and down leg, Maxwell just walloped it away. Bread and butter stroke for him
hint of curve back in to hit the pad as Gambhir looks to flick. He was slightly off balance. Big appeal, but no review. Replays confirm this pitched outside leg.
slower one down leg. Rolled through to the keeper as Gambhir looked to tickle it fine
swivel-pull but just about clears wide mid-on. Expensive, expensive over. Shaw didn't get hold of this pull as well as he would've liked.
slants this into the pads, worked to deep fine leg. Gambhir is off the mark
races away to the boundary like a?    .. TRACER BULLET!  Short of length and angling away, Shaw stood tall and slapped that behind point. Woah, delightful timing and placement

big appeal for lbw. Gambhir was on his toes when he was struck. Height was surely in question there, but no. Ashwin thinks otherwise and has asked for a review.. Pitch map shows this hit the turf outside leg,  so nothing else matters.
132 kph, Tye chops on! Wow, that was a struggle from Tye, 3 off 9. Full and wide, Tye unwinds and swings, but all he manages is a thick inside edge which hits middle and leg stump.
yikes, he isn't even close to the ball. A short slower cutter outside off. Tye is beaten as he swings.
another slower ball. Cutter. Tye swings and misses again. The ball clips the pad and then bounces over the leg stump
think the wide yorker would have been a better option to earn a dot ball. But Boult goes full and straight, Sran misses, struck on the pad, but it's sliding down
taken. Ashwin picks out backward point. Another wide yorker, Ashwin gets underneath the length but all he successfully does is chip a slice to the fielder. A comfortable reverse-cupped catch.
swing and miss. What a debut for Plunkett. So many cutters, finishes with 3 for 17. A slower ball outside off, Tye swings too early.
114 kph, a slower bouncer. Ashwin walks across but can't connect. The ball bounces in front of Pant, ricochets off the hand to short fine leg
nicely bowled. Goes wide of the crease, full outside off. Tye still can't get bat on ball, misses his third slog.
follows Ashwin as he backs away. A low full toss is bunted down to long-on
a short slower ball. Tye is through his big hoick again, off the body to third man for a leg bye.
115 kph, four leg byes, those are bad runs for Daredevils. A slower ball down leg, Tye slogs and misses. The ball takes the pad and flies away past Pant for four to fine leg

Miller finds Plunkett! And Kings XI are struggling now. It's yet another cutter outside off. Miller brings out all his power and brute force to smash a lofted drive over cover. But that fielder has been pushed back because Miller is very good with that shot. Plunkett gets low and takes an excellent catch.
a full and quick delivery down leg, Miller is hurried for pace as he misses a flick, struck on the pad.

a slower delivery on middle and leg, and Nair picks out long-on! And it's taken! Juust. Plunkett is having a terrific debut. Nair looked to whip that slower cutter through midwicket but got that too straight. Iyer runs across from his right and pouches the catch after juggling.
drifting into the pads, this time he's swept him to the left of short fine leg. Too easy for Nair. Gift of a delivery
take that! Fetch that! He's hit that into the top tier over long-on. In his swinging arc, too full from Mishra. Whack. Remember that old quote? If it's in the arc, i'll hit you out of the park
fired down leg, Nair misses the fine paddle, they scamper a leg bye as the ball rolls to short fine leg

Prithvi Shaw has put down a sitter at point!  Miller is living a charmed life here. Shaped to cut but checked his stroke, this lobbed up. He got his hands on it, juggled and put it down on the second attempt. What's happening?

dropped by Maxwell at cover!  What's worse is they concede an overthrow. Miller rocks back and slaps this straight. Both feet were in the air as he went for the catch sideways and it popped out. Reprieves his old mate
gets down to paddle, may have got bat but it's well stopped, even if unintentionally,  by Pant, who offers his pad. He was moving to his left when the ball thudded into it. Lucky for Mishra
this is a stunning delivery. Bowled at 145 clicks, whizzes across and beats Miller's push. Pant collected that over his head.

out to the pull, out to the pace! Yuvraj's struggle is over. This is a skiddy length ball angling way, Yuvraj had already decided he'll fetch the pull from outside off. The length wasn't quite there and so he gets an under-edge that is gleefully accepted by Pant.
saved by an inside-edge that flies past Pant, who went the wrong way. This was a very thin one. Yuvraj is beaten for pace as he shapes to pull from outside off. Didn't miss the off stump by much.
uppish, but lands short of short fine.This was fired in, Yuvraj toe-ended the paddle.
fizzes past Yuvraj's tentative forward push. Don't think he read the googly again. Lovely from Mishra
straightens from length on middle, Yuvraj looks to work to the leg side, but gets a leading edge that rolls wide of cover
steps out but Maxwell shortens his length, worked towards deep midwicket
crashes this short delivery to deep point. This was short and sliding away, Yuvraj picked the length early and made room to play the stroke
lovely start. Drifts one in from wide of the crease, Nair gets forward and defends back
a short delivery outside off, Nair tries to scoop the ball over short third man but makes no connection. Clever change in length.
back of a length outside off, Yuvraj finds short third man. Only because there is a misfield, there is one
a cutter, offcutter outside off, 122 kph. Yuvraj misses an attempted drive, beats the outside edge
back of a length outside off, 130 kph. Yuvraj finds point with a dab

gone through! 146 kph, Agarwal beaten for pace. A good length delivery, Agarwal anticipates another cutter, but it's quick. He tries a short-arm jab, but the ball isn't even short enough to play that stroke. He is far too late on the shot, the ball clips the thigh pad and then uproots off stump! A timely strike for Daredevils.
a shorter, slower delivery on middle. Nair helps that along towards fine leg. Avesh runs to his right and keeps the batsmen down to one, fine effort.
a slower ball on middle, clipped to deep midwicket for one. Decent over from Christian
just tapped into the gap between short third man and backward point. It's dug in short, and a tad wide outside off. Nair just bunts that chopped cut into the gap, to third man's right.
lovely shot. A tad overpitched from Avesh with some width. Nair strides forward and caresses a drive through cover with immaculate timing.

right in between the gap at third slip and gully in Test cricket. But no one there in T20s. Full and wide outside off, Nair drives, gets a thick outside edge which flies to Mishra at third man. He fumbles, but no damage done.

did he misjudge that? He did, but he still took the catch at short fine leg. Plunkett has his maiden IPL wicket. An offcutter around off, Rahul tries to scoop the ball over short fine leg, but the ball hits the top third of the bat, more towards the splice. The ball carries low to Avesh at short fine leg, he dives in front and takes a good, low catch.
mis-timed but still four. A slower delivery around off, Rahul mis-times an attempted lofted drive, the ball skews off the inside half, plonks over mid-on and races away.
yikes, Rahul will be unhappy with the execution. A slower delivery, back of a length and wide outside off. Rahul tries to ramp the ball over short third man, but cannot connect.
a slower delivery this time, but still a touch short. Rahul nails his pull to deep square leg, on the bounce.
flies for six! A short delivery down leg, plenty of pace on that, but all Rahul needs to do is use that pace. He gets inside the line and helps the errant delivery over fine leg for six. A flat six.
134 kph, back of a length outside off, Boult's angle brings that back to off. Chopped to the keeper, cramped for room
a very wide slower offcutter is bunted over cover point. Would have been wide had Rahul let that go, but he goes after it and toe-ends the ball over the infield.

oh yes, that's a much better shot. Good length outside off, Agarwal knows there's pace, there's width and there's an opportunity. All he does is open the bat face and guide the ball to the left of backward point
flayed away for four through point. Full and wide, the ball is too wide, allows Agarwal to throw his hands at that, sliced away.
more pace, more bounce, skiddy. 143 kph, back of a length outside off, Rahul misses an open-faced dab

another one that hurries the batsman! This is a batsman brought up in Victoria. A 148.7kph short delivery outside off, Finch this time, looks for the pull through midwicket, but he is too late on the shot. Takes the splice of the bat and lobs to cover. Clearly, harried for pace and Avesh strikes. Some pace and bounce in this surface.
hurried for pace? 142 kph, back of a length outside off. Rahul wants to pull but is nowhere near the shot. The ball splices to mid-on, doesn't carry
well bowled. Back of a length, moves back in after pitching. Finch, like you do in backyard cricket, intentionally avoids the ball by arching his body. But the ball goes over leg stump.
into the gap at cover for two! Full outside off, Finch pushes a drive through cover for a couple. Gambhir again races after it. Not great timing.

Gowtham conquers Jaipur! Short outside off, and the batsman stays on the back foot to pull it towards the leg side. Off the bat's sweet spot and the ball soars over the mid-wicket boundary. Royals win by three wickets
overpitched on off stump, and that's been drilled to cover. Unadkat's halfway down the wicket, but Gowtham sends him back. Will this hurt Royals?
ramped over short third man! It's full outside off, and Gowtham gets down on one knee, opens the bat's face, and sends it over the infield. The Royals camp erupts!
goes short outside off, and Archer's pull takes the top edge! Hardik gets under it, and manages to keep his composure

full on off stump, and Gowtham's leg-side heave comes off the bat's inside edge. That means the shot goes behind square, and that means into the gap. Finds the backward square boundary. Eighteen off the over
takes the pace off! Full, and super slow outside off. Gowtham tries to slog this over Bumrah's head, and ends up missing completely
slapped with disdain! Good length, but wide enough outside off to cut it furiously hard. Gowtham winds up and then pumps this past backward point
full toss on leg stump, and he's cramped for room. Hits his bat and trickles away towards mid-wicket. No one there, so that means Archer asks Gowtham to come for the second
good length outside off, and Archer has the power to slap this very square! Played wide enough of deep extra cover, and the outfielder can't pull it back
good length on off, and angling away from Gowtham. He tries to slog it over cover, but sliced over the infield. Lands in no man's land
awry! Super-high full toss outside off, and goes to Kishan on the full! Passed Archer from over his head. Fizz apologises right away
good length on middle stump, but the extra bounce doesn't bother the tall Gowtham. Flat-batted over Fizz's head to Pollard at long on

diving catch from Kishan! Angling away from Klaasen, and he tries to punch away from his body. The offcutter goees across Klaasen, and therefore takes the outside edge. Kishan's forced to dive diagonally forward but he's safe with the gloves. Three wickets in six balls
yorker on off stump, and that's been dug back to Bumrah. He's forced to stick his hand up and the ball sticks! Excellent over
yorker just outside off stump, and Archer can't carve this away. Bounces behind the stumps and goes through to Kishan's gloves. This is classic Bumrah
no he won't. Full on off stump, but Archer does well to get behind the line of the ball, and defend with soft hands
The zing bails light up! Super fast (144kph) on off stump and angling right into Buttler. He tries to defend it straight, but the ball goes between bat and pad. Crashes into middle stump

holes out to deep midwicket! Is that the end for Royals? Full on off, and to be honest, in Samson's arc. The slower delivery does the trick though, and finds the toe end of Samson's bat. In the air for ages, but too simple for Hardik
short and wide outside off, and Buttler can free his arms. Slaps this past the infield to the man in the deep
good length on leg stump, and angling into Buttler. He tries to back away to make some extra room, but Krunal follows him. Can't cut it away
good length on off, and spinning across Samson. Pushed to long off with soft hands, and that's fifty for Samson!
full just outside off, and Buttler's through with his drive too early. Slices it, but just short of Markande at point

there's the orange cap! Good length on off, and angling into Samson's body. Waits on the backfoot, and pulls this - along the ground - to wide long on. Man there in the deep, but he's just a spectator

yorker on leg stump! Stokes shuffled across to the off side to try and clip it off his toes, but misses. Tried to take advantage of short fine-leg being inside the circle, but Hardik went wicket-to-wicket
full toss outside off, but Samson can't put it away. Drives it off the bat's top-half, and goes only to cover
low full toss on middle stump, Stokes thumps it down the ground - past the non-striker - to long on
Stokes comes down the wicket, and therefore it's a low full toss on off. Driven towards wide long off
connects this time! Short and wide outside off, and that allows Stokes to free his arms. Shifts his body-weight towards the front foot, and then thumps it - flat-batted, really - over cover
low full toss on middle stump, and that's been blocked back to Bumrah. Straight back to the bowler, who thinks about having a shy at the stumps. Surprised Samson there
good length on middle stump, and angling into Samson. He punches it off the back foot past midwicket to the man in the deep. Two more. Also the team hundred
good length on middle and going across Stokes. He tries to ramp it over short fine leg, but then tries to ramp it over short third man. Eventually connects with neither
good length just outside off, and Samson rides the bounce to punch it past cover to the man in the deep
good length on leg stump, and cramping Stokes for room. Pushed down the ground to long off for a quick single
good length on off, and slightly turning away from Stokes. He punches it towards wide long on, and pushes Samson to complete the second
loopy, but outside off stump. Stokes is happy to let it go for more extras
overpitched just outside off, and Stokes digs it away towards cover. Man there
good length outside off, but too wide. Slides across Stokes
drilled past extra cover! Goes full and wide outside off, but Stokes kinda expected it. Backs away to make some extra room and slaps it past the cover-region
super slow mo! very short, but it's 92kph! Stokes swivels, winds up, and thumps it over short fine leg
half-tracker on off, but Stokes can't punish it. Pulled, along the ground, to deep midwicket
full, but outside leg stump. Stokes was already down the ground, so all he needs to do is clip it off his toes. Played to fine leg
full on middle and off, but angling across Stokes. Thumped off the backfoot, past the non-striker, to long off
goes full and wide outside off. Samson shuffles across to the off side but chooses not to play at it. The ump calls it as extras
good length on middle stump, and slower on this occasion. Pushed to wide long-on, and Stokes calls nice and early for the run
good length just outside off, and angling into Samson. Punched off the backfoot to deep extra cover. These two doing well to rotate the strike
back of a length, but on leg stump. Clipped off Stokes' hips to McClenaghan at deep backward point
short on off, and Samson rides the bounce to pull square. Top-edged to fine leg
good length outside off, and spinning away from Samson. Stays on the back foot and taps it back to Mayank
half-tracker on off, and it's the wrong'un this time. Stokes says on the backfoot and punches to long off
good length outside off, and spinning away from Samson. Carved off the front foot towards deep point
a slower ball outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides the ball to backward point for a run.
full outside off, Stokes walks down and pushes to mid-off for a quick single. Almost in sync. Rohit can't prevent one.

Stokes walks right across this too. But misses. A good length delivery outside off, Stokes walks across, misses and is struck on the pad! A massive appeal is quickly struck down, but Mumbai want to review. Stokes is well down the pitch, there isn't any bat. Two reds, but the ball is bouncing over the top of off stump. So Mumbai lose their review.
some flight outside off, Samson drives the ball with the spin to wide long-off, immediately calling for two. Nicely into the gap and two easy

another cross-batted stroke, the reverse sweep, it's the legbreak on middle and off. Stokes places this nicely through point, all along the ground. A good diving stop from Hardik, running to his right
slog-swept! The googly outside off, but it doesn't matter because Stokes opts for a cross-batted stroke. A hard sweep past midwicket's right
finds the gap! Another cutter outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides the ball into the gap between third man and point. Lovely.

finds midwicket! The pressure was building and the fielder was pushed to the edge of the circle to protect the over. It's another cutter, around middle and leg. Rahane gets enough bat on a wristy whip, but he picks out midwicket at a comfortable height too. The reverse-cupped hands over his head does the job for Krunal. Rahane gestures that he wanted to hit the ball wider of the fielder, like all batsmen try to do.

a slower delivery outside off, Rahane opens the bat face and guides the ball to short third man. Bumrah picks up and throws the stumps down at the striker's end, conceding an extra run in the process.
loses patience with those singles and changes the line, goes much fuller and much wider outside off. Rahane crashes a drive through cover for four.
a good length delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off for a single. A good call from Rahane.
another cutter, 129 kph, full and wide outside off. Samson strides forward and slices a drive to deep cover
slightly wider outside off, allowing Samson to throw his hands at the ball. Finds the timing and the placement, into the gap at cover.
a good length delivery on off, Samson opens the bat face and finds short third man.
flat on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Krunal cuts off that angle by running to his right.
edged through the vacant slip region for four. A bit of width, flat and wider. A thick edge goes flying away for four. Krunal got some turn on that.

picks out mid-on! I'm not sure what kind of a shot that was. Flat and straight, Tripathi just chips a drive to mid-on, did he try to go over? Or past him? That does not seem like a very clever shot, did it hold up? Something definitely did happen that resulted in a tame bunt to the fielder. Krunal doesn't care.
good stop from McClenaghan. Back of a length outside off, Rahane opens the bat face and guides a dab down to third man for a run.
skiddy. Good length on middle and leg, Tripathi gets behind the line to block.
slightly shorter, Rahane opens the bat face and guides that down to third man for one.
lovely start. A good length delivery on off, the ball pitches and straightens even with his angle. Tripathi is squared up, a thick outside edge goes down to third man.

nicely played and stopped. A full delivery on middle and leg, Tripathi drives with the full face, towards mid-off's right. The fielder gets across and cuts the ball off. A slightly sloppy start from Mumbai.
too straight again. A slower one on the pads and Tripathi works the ball through backward square leg for a couple.
good length delivery around middle and off, tapped towards point. Tripathi hares down, Rahane sends him back in time.
it's too straight. Full and drifting down leg. All Tripathi needs is a bit of bat, a thick inside edge and the ball flies down to the fine leg fence.
nicely bowled. Full and attacking the stumps, Rahane is aware of that wicket-taking option, so a broad bat comes down to defend.
full outside leg, and Pollard whips it fine down the leg side. Misfield in the deep, and that allows them to take the second. Rajasthan Royals need 168 to win
full outside leg stump, but Pollard expected that. Backs away further towards the leg side and thumps it towards deep midwicket
slipped out of his hand! Eye-line level full toss, but wide outside off. Pollard lets it go. Free hit
too slow! Pollard winds up for a biggie, but sends it nowhere. Full outside off, but through his shot way too early
falls just short of cow corner! Short on off, and Pollard mistimed the pull. Was in the air for ages, but Unadkat can't get to it
yorker on off stump, and that's been dug down the ground. A single's available, but Pollard asks Markande to get back
and McClenaghan's out! Comes from around the wicket and this is full on off stump. Almost a yorker, and the batsman can't connect. On a hat-trick

dropped by Archer! Was hit really hard though, but he doesn't show the pain. Smiles it off. Full on off, and Pollard drills it straight to Archer. He managed to get it with both hands, but the ball just pops out. Difficult chance
full on off, and lifted off his pads towards the leg side. Not hit well enough, and Klaasen - at wide long on - takes an easy catch. Looks like it's the knuckleball that earns Archer the wicket

excellent ball to end the over. Gives everything to this delivery and Unadkat takes a tumble on his followthrough. It's full and wide outside off, but inside the tram-lines. A much better spell from Unadkat tonight
another slower ball, it's the offcutter this time. Krunal wants to work it towards the leg side, but takes the leading edge. Falls near short extra cover
back of a length on off, and Pollard comfortably pulls it over short fine-leg's head
good length on middle, and angling across Pollard. Just enough width to free his arms, and he smacks it over the non-striker's head. Hit well enough!
good length outside off, and angling into Krunal. Stays on the back foot, and glances this past short third man. Beats the infield, and no stopping that thereafter!
back of a length outside off, and Krunal opens his bat's face to glance it towards short third man
back of a length on off stump, and it's another loopy slower ball. Pollard wants to pull but he's through his shot too early. Hits his arm
goes short! On off stump, and soars over Pollard's head as he's forced to duck
back of a length on off, and Pollard's been deceived by the pace. Defended off the back foot
short outside off, and forces Krunal to tip-toe. Chopped towards the keeper
starts off with the slower ball. Full outside off, and angling across Yadav. Tries to drive towards cover, but misses
full toss, but wide outside off. Sticks his bat out and drills it to deep extra cover. He's off the mark. Kulkarni ensuring the ball's not in Pollard's arc
good length just outside off on the fourth-stump line. Pollard takes a step forward and taps it back to the bowler
good length outside off, and Yadav takes a step towards the leg side and cuts it past point. Beats the infielders and there's no stopping that thereafter
full on off, and Kishan tries another leg-side slog. Inside-edged onto his pads, and goes towards midwicket. No one there, so Stokes has to run across to the leg side. Allows them to take the run
good length but just outside off. Punched off the back foot past Stokes' left to long off
good length outside off, and angling into Yadav. Flat-batted down the ground to long on. Also the hundred partnership
it's too short again. A long hop, Suryakumar Yadav hurries back and swats a pull into the gap at midwicket for four. Archer gets across to his left, but allows the ball to go through. Naughtily
a tad short, Suryakumar Yadav picks the length early, hurries back and swats a pull into the gap at midwicket for two.
connects this time. It's the same trajectory - flat and quick - and Suryakumar Yadav sweeps that easily through  backward square leg for four. Just had to get some bat on that.

a golden duck for Lewis this time! It's an overpitched half-volley outside off and Lewis wants to flay that through cover. It's the right stroke and the right plan, but downright awful execution. His feet are rooted to the crease, he doesn't account for the little bit of inswing, despite watching it from the other end. A thick inside edge clatters into the stumps.
oh, he's done it! Bravo's done it. A yorker outside off that Rashid can only drill down to long-on. Bravo takes flight. So close yet so far for Sunrisers
oh, yes! Another big hit. Bravo sprays a short ball that's angled into him, and Rashid swivels and heaves a pull over deep backward square leg. What a strike! What drama!
that's the class and experience of Bravo at this stage of the innings. A wide yorker, sneaks under the bat. CSK need five more of these from him

Rashid Khan reminding people that he's still here, and as long as he is, write off SRH at your own peril. This one's a fuller one outside off, right in the slot, and just what the newcomer wanted. Frees up his arms and shellacks it straight over

in the air and taken! Is that the match? Jadeja with a brilliant catch. Bravo slows it up, rolls his fingers on this back of a length delivery, and miscues the pull in the air. Jadeja charges forward and puts in a perfectly-timed dive forward to complete an amazing catch. CSK back in this. Remember, Yusuf is not at 100 percent
short, banged into him, that's tripe from Bravo. Yusuf swivels and helps this pull along to deep fine leg
beautifully bowled! Top stuff under pressure from the young quick. A very wide yorker again, and Williamson can do nothing about it apart from jamming the bat down and hitting the ground
very full outside off, Williamson walks across early and then ends up wearing it on the pad as the ball rolls away to short fine leg

is that a high full toss? No, umpires seem to think it's fine but that was definitely a no-ball. Williamson can't believe it. Vineet Kulkarni at square leg. Williamson works it away to backward square leg without control

that's another gift from the bowler. Changes the line and takes it away from the batsman's off-stump, but the length is the same. Williamson easily comes forward to get his weight behind that shot, and deposits it over long-off with minimal effort. Massive over; 22 off it. Game on in Hyderabad
that's six more! This is an unbelievable innings from the SRH captain. A poor delivery - leg-side fuller one from the leggie, and Williamson gets down on one knee and carts it over deep square leg
that's an even better shot. Williamson's turning it around here. Still giving SRH some hope. Gets on top of this fuller one and mows it over cow corner
heaved away! That's a top shot. Jadeja flattens his trajectory and takes this away from Williamson, but the batsman swings cleanly and with loads of timing to eaisly clear long-off
good fielding again. Full and wide, and Shakib drove it to the right of extra cover, where DJ bravo dives and half-stops it

Jadeja with a brilliant save but have theu run four? Yes, they have. Williamson whipped this uppishly through deep midwicket. Jadeja ran across a long way from deep square leg and did well to get down to it but ended up pulling it away too forcefully. He then has to chase it a second time as it goes towards the boundary again. And Faf du Plessis, backing up, had to pick it up in the end

a pristine late cut from Williamson. He's played some delightful strokes today, and that's as good as any. Short of a length from Jadeja, straightens around off, and Williamson stays back and cuts late through backward point
shot! This one was short and came with a bit too much width. Shakib jumps and flays an upper cut over backward point
short, pitching outside leg, that's a gift, and Shakib treats it as one as he swivels around and pulls it over fine leg
full and wide, Shakib reaches out for a drive that's intercepted by Billings diving to his left at point
slower short ball, Shakib doesn't get hold of it but finds the gap at midwicket
short, angled into Williamson, and he's waiting for it right back in the crease before flaying a pull flat over deep square leg
slow and dipping full toss, Williamson leans into a punch and Billings flings himself across at cover to make a brilliant save

easy catch at extra cover. Hooda pre-meditates and shuffles too early. It's the slower ball again and he goes through with the flick early to get a leading edge that Jadeja runs back a few inches to take
back of a length, sitting up nicely outside off. Was the slower one from the bowler, and Williamson rocks back and crunches a pull over midwicket

what an effort! That's a sensational effort! Karn Sharma at the third man boundary with a super piece of fielding. Leaps right up in the air after Williamson upper-cut this, and stretches out his right hand. Sees his left foot landing outside the boundary, and just as he's landing down, he releases it after completing the catch. Would have probably been on par with Boult's catch last night had he got that but top effort
short outside off, Hooda was walking towards it and is then forced to sway out of the line late
full, wide, holding its line this time, and Hooda walks across and lets it go

Deepak Chahar, what a star! Again some very sharp movement outside off, the away-swinger. Pandey, no feet, throws his hands at it, and gets a healthy outside edge that third man runs forward to grab. Poor shot, and Sunrisers in big trouble
short of a length outside off, Williamson cuts crisply off the backfoot past point
full and shaping away, Williamson drives back with some tight footwork back to the bowler

short and wide, Williamson dares to go over the in-field and just about clears the point fielder. And, oh, that's some great teamwork at the boundary. Two fielders - Rayudu and Karn Sharma converging - Rayudu slides forward and Karn, running across, gets the boot across to push it back and Rayudu does well to avoid contact as he completes the slide

edged and taken! This is lovely bowling. Set him up perfectly for this dismissal. First there was the awayswinger, then the inswinger, and then the one that swings away again. Bhui pushes forward with hard hands and gets a thick edge to Watson at first slip. Terrific start for CSK
now he gets it to cut in from a back of a length, and Bhui defends from the crease. Four dots. Pressure on already.
in the air, and almost a duck for the debutant. Bhui can't get entirely on top of this short ball and skews it in the air as point runs forward and slides but the ball drops short
short of a length on off, extra bounce, Bhui keeps it out from the crease
really full on off stump, not quite a yorker, Dhoni clears his front leg and belts it ram-rod straight, so much so it hits the stumps at the other end. They get a single and finish with 182 for 3
Raina shuffles across off, yorker just outside leg, Raina does not make contact. Not called a wide. Did that flick the pad?
full-toss outside off, Dhoni backs away and splices it over the covers. Two fielders circle around it but both miss it

back of a length and outside off, 129kph, slower one from Stanlake. Dhoni picks the legcutter, stands still, and short-arms it over the midwicket boundary. That back is fine. If it isn't, then the hands are great
Dhoni venturing a sweep? Interesting. Near yorker outside off, Dhoni shuffles across off, and wears it on the pad
full-toss outside off, Dhoni uses the pace of the bowler and deftly carves it away just wide of short third man for four
Raina shuffles away outside leg, Kaul follows him with a very full ball and attacks the pads. Deflected away to midwicket

116.4ks, short and wide outside off, Raina, having stepped away outside leg, tests out his calf, reaches out for the ball. Delays his shot and scythes it away to the left of backward point. Mr.IPL brings up his first fifty of the season
Dhoni forays down the track, meets a full-toss outside off, and hits it down to long-on
banged in short and aimed at the head of Dhoni, he top-edges a hook fine of short fine leg. Fortunate runs for CSK and Dhoni
dragged into the hips, Raina swivels and short-arms it away past short fine leg for another four. Another bad day for the best T20 bowler. He ends with 1 for 49
dragged short and outside off, Dhoni sizes it up and shovels it away with great power over Raina's head. First boundary for Dhoni v Rashid
short on off, Dhoni steps out and skews it to the covers

What a horrible mix-up between the wickets. Farcical running. But Rayudu and Raina laugh it off. Rayudu raises his bat and walks off. This was short and wide outside off, flat-batted away to wide long-off, where Pandey, one of India's best fielders, fumbles. Rayudu senses an opportunity for an extra run. Raina also (seemingly) calls for the second. Pandey throws the ball to Kaul, who fumbles too. He then runs after the ball, tags it to Williamson, who takes the bails off to catch Rayudu short at the non-striker's end. Rayudu can't undo his steps in time
slower knuckle ball, dips on off, or just a shade outside off, Rayudu stretches out and reverse-paddles it fine of short third man
back of a length and outside off, Rayudu shimmies out and slices to short third man
he goes around the wicket for the bouncer, all with the aim of cramping AB up. But the genius that he is, AB sways away, makes his own room and lifts it over short third man's head
short and outside off, AB chops it to point
slow, dipping full toss. Mandeep flicks through square leg and steals the strike

wallops the back of a length ball outside off over mid-off. Roy is the man haring after it, hoping to drag it back, throwing himself head-first at the ball. It's travelled too far, and he might have hurt himself from the effort. He's on his haunches with a crowd around him, talking to Chris Morris and the physio. Roy has gone off the field
slower ball becomes a full toss on leg stump. AB taps it down to long leg
full, slow and sliding down leg.  Mandeep tries a flick. Doesn't come off
144. 8 kph. And it's good enough to beat Anderson, who is swinging for the fences. Done by pure pace. This is what the non-millenials say you miss, I hit.

both batsmen are at the same end! Anderson races through the moment AB glides the short ball to point. But AB himself is not terribly keen. Then he changes his mind and goes for the run. But wait, by that point Anderson realises he should get back to the non-strikers' end and all of that culminates with both he, AB and the bowler Boult waiting on the fielder. The throw is poor, even Boult can't save its blushes. And so, Anderson has the chance to complete the single he so dearly wanted
the perfect wide yorker, with a tinge of away swing to beat Anderson's reach
Anderson's decided I want a slice of this pie. Takes a full toss around waist high and nails it over deep midwicket
top edge but with the ball going only as far as the 30 yard circle, and everyone on the leg side in the deep, AB's very very safe
goes for a bouncer, from around the wicket, but it goes too high. In looking to escape AB's punishment, he runs into the umpire's wrath
slower ball, sliding down leg, AB swipes it to the left of short fine leg. He's GPSing the ball into the gaps now. Simple as that.
he's not targeting the boundary - HE'S TARGETING THE BLEEPIN ROOF! Length ball. The absolute last thing you bowl to AB. And he clatters it straight down the ground.
tries to cramp AB with a back of a length ball on leg stump, the batsman swings it away to short fine leg
googly - pitches it short though and Anderson pulls to long-on
length ball, giving him the freedom to swing through the line. AB accepts it and politely slog sweeps the ball over long-on
tosses it up on leg stump, Anderson flicks to deep square leg
hits the yorker length, AB knocks it down to long-on

dismisses it to the boundary - he was eyeing midwicket, but he'll settle for extra cover. Mr 360 at his very best, starting things off by moving across outside off to open up the leg side. But Harshal one-ups him by bowling wide, as far wide as he dares. But AB raises the game with a blistering lofted drive for his fifty, off only 24 balls
who cares if the opposition just sparked to life? I'ma see this length ball and pulverise it over long-on. Thank you very much. That's what's going on in AB's head. I'm paraphrasing, of course.
spits off the pitch as Anderson looks to defend on the back foot. Gets him on the glove and lobs safely into the leg side

get out of here Trent Boult! Someone check if that isn't a robot there! This is sensational. A one-handed leap to his right at deep square after being wrong-footed to his left, then a landing backwards and a cobra pose to keep his chest from touching the rope! Soft signal out. Replays say - OUT. Wow. Unbelievable. It's a full toss on the pads and it's flying, flat over Boult's head because Kohli has got good power on that flick. It's a stunning recovery from Boult. A leap backwards, holding on with the right hand, landing on his stomach and then stopping all that momentum to complete it. Gets back on his feet and even he's in shock.
full toss on the pads. Go pick it up from the boundary.  AB doesn't have to move. Deep midwicket is powerless to his right
slow and short. Kohli nearly misses this one as he tries to go too square with the pull. But he manages to stay on his feet and get bat for a single at deep square

drops it short and doesn't bother to look! Tewatia has been slapped to the edge of the Chinnaswamy's roof, and for effect, AB makes sure it bounces back into the ground from there so that the game can move on. Proper pull shot over deep midwicket
leading edge goes over Morris. It's a back-of-the-hand slower ball that loops in at middle stump. De Villiers gets it on the full but he hasn't picked it. His flick ends up at mid-off

can't stop the bleeding! Overpitched ball on the pads and Kohli merely leans into this, gets his body weight into the bat and closes the wrists at the last moment to caress this between deep square and deep midwicket
and now the sweep again! Nadeem tosses this right up, full and wide outside off. No sweeping from there, right? Wrong. AB shuffles and swats it even harder this time to beat deep midwicket
hits Pant's right knee and is nearly run out. Kohli looking to run this late cut fine, is already running down the pitch. But Pant has stuck a leg out and nearly gets this to deflect onto the stumps
bouncer dug in very shot. Gets big on Kohli and he ducks under it

horrendous running and De Kock has ended up sacrificing his wicket. There is no run there. De Kock thinks so, but his no either isn't accepted or isn't heard, as Kohli keeps taking strides down the pitch as he watches the ball roll towards backward point. In the end, Kohli is halfway down, De Kock is stranded and he crosses over to give his wicket away

outside edge past slip! Oh Nadeem will think about this all night if Kohli makes runs today! He's beaten him in flight, got the ball to turn away from length outside off and induced an edge.  Slip is very very wide and that's four
good length outside off with some late swing inwards. No feet as Kohli looks to drive through the cover, well away from the body. Gets an inside edge onto pad

nervous Roy at deep backward square. Looks like he's held on! Vohra stops halfway through a sweep against a leg side ball. It's a top edge that hangs up teasingly for Roy who might have lost it early on in the air because he looked very nervous as he ran in. But he manages to get down quickly and he has his fingers around the ball

huuuuuuge appeal for lbw but the umpire isn't swayed by it. Beautiful bowling from Boult, pitching up to the new batsman, getting the ball to curl into him late. Vohra is not at all ready for the fiendish delivery. He tries to play a shot into the leg side and possibly gets an inside edge? Cause otherwise that kinda looks plumb
full on leg stump, de Kock takes care not to hit across the line and finds a single at mid-on
pristine hit! The on the up drive works perfectly, showing how well this new ball is coming onto the bat. All de Kock does is open the face to beat cover on his right

pretends to make room outside leg. The bowler lands it around the yorker outside off. Tewatia jumps in line with it, gets low, and scoops it over fine leg. Also, while running down the pitch, trying to take a single. he collides with Anderson

taken at long-on. Pant has produced some sensational shots. He looks for another, against a slower ball outside off, but this time it comes right off the bottom of the bat. Goes high instead of long and AB de Villiers takes a striaghtforward catch
spots the left-hander switching his stance for a reverse scoop and so plants the ball over the wide line to keep it out of Pant's reach
slow, full, on leg stump. Tewatia looks for the sweep, makes no contact, has to settle for a leg bye

now the other side, walking across his stumps to make sure he can scoop a slower short ball outside off over short fine leg's head. Pant is giving the Daredevils a total well beyond their wildest dreams when they were 28 for 2 after the Powerplay

what the weirdness  Woakes is looking for the wide yorker. Misses his mark by about two inches. And Pant is waiting, crouched in his stance, the bat face open, and at the perfect time, unleashes a scoop over third man

walks across and swipes at a short ball, looking for the long leg boundary. Ends up with a miscue over the wicketkeeper. Comes off the thigh pad. Fifty partnership in 20 balls. Pant has made 41 of those
full and outside off stump, Pant monsters it over cover. It's bat speed again. He sees the chance to free the arms and he holds absolutely nothing back. RCB leaking runs in the death again
half-volley on leg stump, Pant flicks it handsomely to deep midwicket
goes short on middle, Pant lets it go and then goes around yelling at himself.
slower ball and a premeditating Pant, looking to slog sweep the ball, is beaten soundly. Only problem is the umpire decides he's strayed too far outside off
full and outside off, he bangs it back down the ground and Siraj is in the way
low full toss in line with the stumps, but Pant somehow flicks it over the square leg boundary, despite there being a man positioned to take a catch
falls short of cover - which is where Siraj is at now. The ball has it in for him. Tewatia goes gung ho again at a full delivery
runs back, leaps up, sticks a hand out, but the ball evades mid-off! Tough break for Siraj, and even worse, it runs away to the boundary. Mis-hit loft from Tewatia

lbw appeal is turned down. Looking to ramp it fine this time as Chahal fires in what looks like a seam-up ball on leg stump. It's full and fast and catches him on the leg, but the umpire says no. Probably pitching outside
reverse-swat clears the third man boundary! It's a short of a length ball and Pant swivels quickly before having to really drag this using his forearms. Manages it somehow and clears the line

beats him in flight and is probably excited for a while before he remembers which ground this is. Pant with a big heave at this loopy length ball googly outside off. Miscues it completely but that's sailed over long-off

Siraj runs to his right and lunges to hold on at short third man. Maxwell is done by Chahal's slowness. It's tossed right up at a length outside off, and he looks to go over square on the off side with a reverse sweep. Ends up slicing it because he's through the shot too early. An indifferent season continues to go badly for Maxwell. Royal Challengers, like most teams, will be happy to see him gone in the 16th over

Pant is struck above his back knee as this tails away from him when he tries to slog it. He's on the floor. In the mean time, RCB are reviewing for lbw. It was given not out. Possibly pitching outside leg. No doubt with line otherwise I'd say yes, pitching well outside leg. Woeful review. Pant's back on his feet. On we go.

just misses the stumps as Maxwell goes on the back foot again. It's an inside edge that trickles past the stumps. De Kock then runs in and takes aim at the non-striker's stumps. Hits the stumps too but Maxwell is safe, as the replays confirm. He's also come back for a second

thick outside edge to short third man. It's almost like he's a fast bowler. Fires it full and wide outside off - almost past the wide marker. Iyer reaches out again but this one is drifting away and he won't be able to get it into the leg side. It lobs straight to the fielder there
fifty for Iyer, and this one is fetched from wide outside off. Length and across him. He reaches a long way and drags it wide of deep midwicket as he clears the boundary to his left

see ya! Sundar skids a short of a length ball at the pads from around the wickets and Iyer drops all the technique training he's done through his life and swings wildly to send it a long way over deep midwicket
pushes it through on leg stump, Pant looks to pull it away but makes contact with only thigh pad
mid-off is up and Pant drills the wide half-volley down the ground like a pro
tries to make room, but Woakes doesn't allow such shenanigans. Pant only ends up cutting the ball to point
tosses it up from around the wicket on middle stump. Pant tucks it to midwicket

jeez, that's outrageous! it's a half-volley on leg stump and Iyer treats it fairly kindly. All he does is flick the ball. Some other-worldly force takes it over the boundary at midwicket. And we have a time out to figure out just what happened there
not quite enough room so Iyer plays within himself, gliding the short ball down to third man
full on middle and off, Pant shuffles across his stumps and turns it to midwicket
goes around the wicket to the left-hander and even Sundar - who rarely gets the ball to move sideways - is beating the edge with turn.
it's all about ticking the singles over now as Pant too glides a back of a length delivery behind point
short and outside off, Iyer slices it to deep third man

knocks over leg stump! Sensational bowling from Chahal. After sowing doubts with big turning legbreaks, he sends down the flipper. Very quick, a shade short, on leg stump, tempting the batsman to back away and cut and beating him for pace. So Chahal is not just turning the ball off the pitch, but skid on too.
third time beaten! And this is huge turn! Chahal pitches it on middle. Roy is uncertain as he pushes forward. He could have had a bat as broad as five feet and he would still have missed it
it's a short ball, giving him the room to free his arms, but Iyer finds short midwicket with a mistimed pull

opens the face to try and find some runs behind point. There are none and so Roy is sent back. Mandeep hits the stumps direct and they pinch a single off the overthrow. Then the man backing up hits the stumps direct at the non-strikers now. Two perfect throws, no wickets
panics and goes for a reverse sweep, even those last-ditch measures don't work. Chahal reads the batsman perfectly, bowls on middle and leg, not allowing Roy the room he needs to work the ball

rips it past the outside edge again! Beautiful bowling from the leggie. He loops it up on middle, draws Roy forward, gets pretty decent purchase off the pitch and leaves Roy looking utterly bewildered
shimmies down the track, but Chahal spots it early, pulls his length back, and doesn't give any room. Roy tries a flick and is hit on the pads. All he can get is a leg bye

massive turn and is it enough to stump him?. He pushes it through on leg stump, demanding Roy to hit against the turn. The batsman tries, he's beaten all ends up, but the good thing is, his back leg did not lift up off the crease.
slower ball, in line with the stumps, Roy tries to force it through midwicket. No luck

top-edges the pull and Umesh strikes early again! It's a short ball, Gambhir tries to drag it from outside off. It gets a bit big on him. The bat face turns in his hand. The ball has no timing on it as it goes up and Chahal jogs back at square leg to take an easy catch
spears in a yorker, at the base of middle stump. Gambhir does well to yank his feet out of the way and bring a vertical bat down to find a single through square leg

slower bouncer - and it's very well executed too. Gambhir spots the length early but not the change in pace. He's into the pull shot and though he tries to adjust his bat swing, he misses the ball and it goes off his body towards point
good length ball outside off, Gambhir goes for an on-the-up drive over mid-off. No connection

flattens the stumps with a blistering straight drive. He sees the ball in his half, lunges forward gleefully and presents the full face of the bat. Woakes would be thrilled those wooden things were stuck where they were
rippah! Umesh hits the deck and makes the new ball jag away past the outside edge. Gambhir is stuck in his crease, he's pushing at the ball nervously, he's easily beaten
nice and tight on middle, Gambhir works it off his knees to midwicket
good length, outside off, Gambhir looks to slash it through the off side, can't make contact

inside edge as Roy attempts to punch through the covers. His front foot moving so little hampers those plans and the ball ends up wandering away to square leg. On another day, he might even have been bowled
back of a length and outside off, Roy lets it go. There is some outswing which gives merit to the one slip in place
low full toss on leg stump. Gayle taps it down the ground to long on. He'll keep strike. Kings XI need five off 12 balls
quick! Good length on off and angling across Gayle. He tries to slap this over cover, but misses completely. Wild, wild shot
almost chops on! Good length on off, and Gayle tries to punch it past cover. Takes an inside edge and almost onto his stumps
yorker outside leg stump, and Gayle does well to shuffle across to the off side. Extras
toe crusher on leg stump, but Gayle does well to get his feet out of the ball's way, and defends with soft hands
good length on middle stump, and spinning across Gayle. Defended off the back foot to the bowler. Kings XI need 9 off 18 balls
holes out to deep midwicket! Short on middle, and Rahul top-edges the pull! Curran gets under it, and dives forward to take the catch
good length, and wide outside of again. Rahul goes deep into the crease and crunches this boundary behind point
good length, but wide outside off. Rahul comes dancing down the wicket and slaps it past extra cover on this occasion. Delightful
fifty for Rahul too! Back of a length on off stump, and Rahul opens his stance to swing towards the leg side. Flat pull over deep midwicket
full and wide outside leg stump. Gayle tries to slog-sweep, but misses. Hits his front leg, but impact's outside leg
good length on leg stump. He stays on the back foot, and fends it back to Chawla
full on off stump, and Gayle's slog sweeps this over Rahul's head. Looked like he sliced it, and that's flying over long on. Pure muscle
full just outside off. Turns into Rahul, and he opens his bat's face to drive towards point
full on off and coming into Rahul's pads. Whipped off his toes to cow corner for a single
good length on leg stump, and spinning into Gayle's body. Punched to long on for a walking single
good length, just outside off. Rahul tries to cut but misses completely. Extra bounce takes it to the keeper
good length outside off, and spinning away from Gayle. Punched uppishly, but falls short of cover
almost a yorker on the fourth-stump line. Gayle muscles this down the ground to long on
good length on middle stump, and spinning away from Rahul. Turned off his pads to square leg
starts off with a half-tracker on middle, and Rahul sends that into the deep midwicket boundary. Pulled off the back foot with disdain
that's four more. A leg-side back of a length ball and Rahul just turns around and places it through fine leg
short of a length, not much turn away from him, and Rahul directs a pull to deep fine leg as he shifts across and moves languidly
blindly swipes across the angle as Chawla slides this googly across him and gets him beaten
ruins a good over with a leg-side fuller delivery that Gayle gets down and sweeps through backward square leg

ah, how rushed was Gayle there? Rana just fires this in at pace on Gayle's off-stump and the batsman backs away and just about manages to bring the bat down. A fraction of a second late, and he would have been gone. Imagine if the wicket had fallen that delivery! What a strange combination of circumstances that would have been to help KKR
this one's shorter still and Gayle backs away even further.. Doesn't manage to get on top of it entirely, but manages to cart it over deep backward point
teases Russell by foxing him into thinking he may come down the track but in reality just backs away to a slower delivery and slaps it away through point
full on middle and off, right within his swinging arc, and Gayle deposits it over cow corner with a clean swing of the arms. Off the inside part of the bat but he has so much power in those arms
short, outside off, Rahul gets on top of the bounce and hammers a pull over deep backward square leg
short ball, forces him to arch back with pace and no room,Gayle does well to control his shot through midwicket
a healthy inside edge. This one again tails away after pitching around middle and off, and Gayle drills it away through midwicket
short, pitches down the leg side, and Gayle gets over it
full, angled across, Gayle jams the bat down and gets beaten

ah, shot! Not often do you see Gayle collect boundaries with just timing and placement but this is one of those rare moments. Not a whole lot of movement of the feet but he has gorgeously placed thus fuller one through cover and point
sharp swing away from the right-hander, but look at that for a shot. Rahul gets a long stride across to cover for all the movement and then leans into a drive as he caresses it through covers
that's the best of the lot. On a length and subtle movement off the deck as he nearly shaves Gayle's outside edge
top stuff! Pitches it right up to Gayle and then gets it to swing away. Luckily for Gayle, he had his bat well inside the line
beautiful shot! Width on offer, and Rahul meets the pitch with half a stride forward and then uses his arms to punch it through cover and point
ah, streaky! Curves in a long way from a length and finds the inside edge of Rahul as he strides forward and screams away to the fine leg boundary
drops the length this time. Good length on off stump, and Gill comes dancing down the wicket. Tapped towards cover, and they complete the single. Knight Riders finish on 191 for 7
yes, they can! Full on off stump, and Chawla drives it over the non-striker's head to long off. What an excellent final over from Tye. Can he finish off well?
full just outside off, and Gill drills this down the ground to long on. They can't take the second, so Chawla's back on strike
poor from Mujeeb! Drops this at short third man. It was slow and short outside off, and Chawla tried to ramp it over short third man. Slices it, but a lazy effort from Mujeeb

full on off and slightly swinging away. Gill drives to short extra cover but DK's halfway down the wicket! Ashwin has a shy at the stumps, but misses, which therefore allows them to take the single anyway
slower ball, and full outside leg stump. Gill tries to play it fine, but can only clip it to the man inside the circle
full and wide outside off, and Gill's showing his class tonight. Slaps this off the front foot, and drills it to the extra-cover boundary

drilled to long off, but taken! Big wicket for Sran. Full on off, and Russell tries to slog it down the ground. It's hit very hard, but too flat. Karun Nair - at long off - runs to his right and sticks his hands out
good length outside leg stump, and Russell does well to shuffle across to the off side. Shoulders his arms but earns an extra run
slower ball, and wide outside leg stump. Allows Russell to actually adjust, swivel, and then smash this pull fine behind square
low full toss on leg stump, but all Russell has to do is get bat to ball. He simply check-drives down the ground and that's good enough for the ball to beat long off to the boundary. Sheer power
excellent yorker to start the over. Aimed at his toes, and all Russell can do is nudge it to Mayank at deep midwicket
low full toss on off stump, and Russell taps it with hard hands towards cow corner. He's off the mark
slower ball, short outside off. Russell has to wait ages before the ball comes to him, and he misses the cut completely. Bounces over Russell's blade, and through to Rahul on the bounce

bottom-edged to the keeper! The knuckle ball earns him the wicket. Full and wide outside off, and Lynn actually followed him to the off side, but the ball's too low and it takes a feather edge. An excellent innings comes to an end
good length on off, but once again legspin from Ashwin. Lynn stays on the back foot and drags a shot towards cow corner. Two men in the deep, and one of them cut it off
good length, but wide outside off. Lynn goes deep and cuts this square to Sran in the deep. Good effort by him, but did his boot - while sliding - touch the rope? Yes, it did
drilled in full and fast on leg stump. Lynn tries to slog-sweep but misses. Hits his front leg, but impact's outside the stumps. First dot ball in 21 deliveries!
good length on off, but spins sharply inwards. Lynn opens his bat's face and runs it fine. Stopped by Rajpoot, but wait, it slips through his hands. The misfield allows them to steal the run

dropped at deep extra cover! Short outside off, and this time Lynn's luck almost ran out. Cut it over the infield, but top-edged to the man in the deep. His diving effort just isn't good enough as the ball pops out of his hand. Barinder Sran the guilty party there
goes short again, and Lynn goes chasing after it. Too wide, and this time his slap-shot takes the bottom edge towards short third man
short and wide outside off, and Lynn's forced to reach at it. Cuts it anyway, and manages to get it over the infield. Beats the man at deep extra cover too!
knuckle ball on middle, but it's on a good length. Comes into Lynn's body, and he simply gets his front foot out of the way to tonk it over long on! 103 metres
short and wide outside off, but Lynn can't put it away. Bottom-edges this flat-batted shot to long off. Fifty for Lynn!
