that's another poor delivery. Morris is nicely feeding to the batsmen's strengths here. Lots of room outside off, and all he swings across without moving his feet but still manages good meat to clear long-on by a distance
and attempts a third hit through the same region, but Gambhir had Boult from square leg after those two boundaries, and Karthik knocks it straight into the hands of the fielder there
one ball after being dispatched for four, Morris offers the same delivery again, and Karthik responds with the same shot. Through midwicket
has that swung away? Karthik throws his hands hard at a length ball, it's a swipe across the line. It's a kuckle ball and lobs in the air off the outside edge

given! Shami hits the pad of Karthik and it seemed pretty plumb. But Karthik has no hesitation in going for the review. Could he have got an inside edge? This may be too high. Shami gets this to skid in off a length and Karthik has indeed got an inside edge on the flick. And it seems as though the ball may have gone over as well
shortish, angled in and tucked up for room, and Karthik gets the top-edge on the pull as he steps down, and sends it soaring over deep backward square leg
on the pads this time as Rana flicks to backward square leg and slips in his hurry to get back for the second. Has to settle for one

good catch from Jason Roy at long-on. Again no room for Lynn as Shami angles in a knuckle ball to his middle and leg stumps. Lynn miscues it, gets no power behind it, and Roy dives in front to snaffle a smart catch

Nadeem belts out an appeal for a leg before as Rana gets down to sweep and is hit on the pad. Not out is the on-field call, and it seems as though the impact may be outside off, but Nadeem convinces Gambhir to go for the review. Oops, seems like it may be well outside off. Also got to rule out the under-edge on the sweep. That seems alright, and the impact is miles outside off. Horrific review
short of a length, straightening around middle, Lynn backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
floats this up around the fourth-stump channel and Rana sweeps with the turn to backward square leg
Nadeem fires this one a length, and Rana advances down the ground and launches this over long-on
top edge is taken this time. Looks like Uthappa was late on the slog sweep this time. Nadeem gets some grip from a good length and marginal turn away from off stump. He completes a simple catch too
he isn't taking kindly to the demotion! In the mood today, Uthappa. No nudging around - puts a big front foot stride out and meets it as it lands on the pitch to send the slog sweep into orbit
deft. Nadeem in panic mode. Looks for the arm ball but drops it very short and very wide. Uthappa lets it come on and caresses it past cover point
oh yes. Right off the middle. Nadeem goes flat and on a length at leg stump. It skids through unlike the previous ball and Uthappa hits cleanly through the line to send this far over deep midwicket
shot. Classic Uthappa. Length ball on middle stump, half a stride across off stump and a clean punch straight over the bowler on the up
grip off the pitch and a leading edge as Lynn tries to flick through midwicket. Loopy length ball on off stump and he closes the face too early
slap. Lynn gets room outside off and he duly sends it flying over point. Right off the middle this time. Short from Boult but not climbing up enough to cause trouble
good length and past the outside edge. Uthappa late on the forward push as this slants away

Pant lobs it up, slip completes the catch. Is it the second bouncer? The umpires are checking .it's just under the shoulder. We all know the theory. Short ball to Narine. Boult goes with that, cramps him on the hook and gets it to tickle the top edge. Pant leaps up, one-handed, but he can't hold on. Slip has a few yards to cover behind and completes a simple catch
nicely done. Bouncer at an off stump line. Narine backs away again to try and slice over slip. Well beaten
yorker speared in at middle stump. Narine backs away and tries to squeeze it behind point, but he can only jam it into the leg side
beaten again. Length ball jags away from off stump. Lynn gets too far leg side of it and is swishing aimlessly in the end
beaten on the inside edge. Morris bangs it in again, gets it to nip back off the seam. It's waist height as Lynn backs away to try and swat this behind square.
full toss outside off, drilled straight to cover. That's a maiden, against Lynn. The first one of the season.

beats the off stump! Lynn exposes the stumps and it looks like he's anticipating the ball to swing into him from an off stump line. Wants to drill it through cover, but this ball goes straight through with the angle
full inswinger coming towards leg stump. Lynn shuffles around a little before managing to get the bat down to block it

oh, he's finished it off with a six! A six! If only this had come a ball earlier. Things could have been so different. Ah, the hurt of it all if you're Dhoni. An extremely full delivery on middle, Dhoni sends it soaring into the sky and straight over for a monstrous six
is that four, is that four? No. Deep point cuts it off. Dhoni steps down the track and squeezes this out through the covers. Deep point gets around to his right. Dhoni does not take the single
excellent! Wide yorker, bang on the line. An inch here or there and it was a wide. But it's right inside. Top stuff from Mohit. Dhoni brings the bat down and just hits the ground

tries an encore and it's drifted away too much. Tension building. Mohit needs to hold his own here. Dhoni has loads of experience in these situations. Injured back or not, you don't want to be bowling to him in these situations
great delivery. A wide yorker, making Dhoni reach. With that sore back, it's asking him to do the impossible. Beaten
good yorker, angled into Bravo's pads as he clips to deep midwicket

six more! MS Dhoni is doing the unthinkable here! And he's down on one knee after that shot. A full toss that angles into him and that angle makes up for the lack of power because of the injury. Swung away over square leg
overcompensates with a short ball and with the line too which is well outside off, and Dhoni ramps it over short third man! Oh the drama!
and there ends Jadeja's underwhelming stay. Full and angled across, and that drift does him in as he skews it in the air off the outside of the bat with Ashwin is waiting under it at extra cover
six! Another huge hit. Jadeja gets into the act. And it was about time he did so! A length ball that Jadeja gets on top of from the crease and hammers over long-on
short, wide, makes Dhoni reach out and he can't because of the injury, chops it into the surface. And that's fifty for Dhoni
humongous hit from Dhoni! A juicy half-volley, right in the slot for Dhoni to get underneath it and bludgeon it miles in the air and over cow corner
Jadeja drills a fuller one very hard back at the bowler and Mohit bumps into Dhoni as he moves to his right to try and stop it

in the air and missed chance. Mayank Dagar dives forward but the ball dips horribly on him and ends up sneaking from underneath to the boundary. A full toss that Dhoni shovelled to the deep midwicket region
Jadeja still can't get hold of his shots but he'll get four for this. A slow short of a length delivery that he backs away to and manages to chip over the in-field at the cover and point region
shoveled! Tremendous back-hand power as Dhoni slams this slower back of a length delivery through long-off. Wouldn't have mattered if you had all your fielders there
full, drifts away too far outside off. Not bothered with by Dhoni
shortish, and Jadeja gently pulls it through square leg
lots of bottom hand power as he flays a full one outside off past Jadeja who is forced to arch his back. Dhoni limps the single
full and wide, Dhoni brings the bat down to drive and makes no contact. Not much feet

full toss, booming drive through the covers by Jadeja. Sweeper moves across to his left and they take him on for the second. Sran slips on the follow through and get behind the stumps to gather the throw as Dhoni comes rushing back
this is brilliant death bowling. A wide yorker and all Jadeja can do is dig it out to point
short ball, Jadeja doesn't get hold of it again as he mistimes a pull to backward square leg
was that a wide? Touch and go. Very full and out of Jadeja's reach. Seemed like it was probably just within the line but the umpire thinks otherwise

short, cuts into Jadeja and gives him no pace, pulled away backward of square leg and this time they charge back for the second. Rahul takes the bails off after gathering the throw but Jadeja's well inside
full, wide, in the blockhole, Jadeja jams the bat down and makes no contact
slides into Dhoni's pads and it trickles into the leg side off the pads
short and some width, Dhoni slaps it through the covers off the backfoot
there's the biggie. Much-needed six from Dhoni. He's struggling with a sore back and it's slowed him down. But the power's still there as he slogs this over deep square leg
shortish, some width, Dhoni chops a cut to cover
a length ball that slides in and hits Dhoni in front of leg as he misses the flick
another yes and no. Dhoni sends Jadeja back but he manages to get back in comfortably after tapping a slower one to midwicket

Ashwin with a direct hit. And look at him take off. And look at the Kings XI dugout. A lightning quick piece of fielding from Ashwin. Rayudu drills it to extra cover and Ashwin just swoops down in a flash and nails a direct hit at the striker's end after Dhoni sends Rayudu back
back-of-the-hand slower delivery, Rayudu backs away and leaves it hoping for a wide. But well inside
a timely six from Rayudu breaks the shackles. Shuffles across to a shortish delivery and heaves a pull over backward square leg
Rayudu skips down the track but Sran shortens the length and Rayudu slightly chips it in the air. Well short of the bowler
short of a length, flattens the trajectory and drifts it in, and Dhoni whips it away to deep fine leg. And Dhoni breezes back for the second
this one spins in from a length and Rayudu punches to long-off
length ball on off, Dhoni punches from the crease
floats it up too much and offers up a full toss, a rare legbreak that Ashwin isn't in control of, and it's whipped away to deep square leg
slides down the leg side and sneaks past Dhoni's attempt to clip it
short, offers up width, that's not where you bowl at a new batsman, Dhoni cuts hard and cuts late through backward point
boy did he slam that! A savage Dhoni strike, all timing, but the placement's not so great as long-on gets around it comfortably despite how quickly that left the bat
back of a length, Rayudu gets behind the line and flicks to midwicket
another legbreak, make that three in a row, Dhoni reaches out and drives to long-off

will Ashwin review that? Appeals for the leg before but the signal is four off the bat. Yes, he goes for it. Another legbreak from Ashwin. Floats it up just enough to entice Billings to get down and sweep. There is absolutely no bat involved, which seemed pretty obvious to start off. UltraEdge confirms it, and three reds on Hawkeye as ball crashes into off-stump. Good review. Ashwin was super-confident of that and you could see why. That seemed pretty plumb from the outset
there's the legbreak. Sussed out by Billings who cuts to cover
just helped along. A googly that pitches around leg and spins away further down that line and all Billings has to do is put bat to ball to work it away through fine leg
there's that deceptive trajectory right away, Rayudu reaches out and gets an outside edge to third man

Sran with another catch and he's too chuffed again as he hurls the ball in the air. Vijay steps down the track, completely foxed by the slower one from Tye, and chips it in the air. Sran snaffles it at extra cover
down the ground and through the vacant long-on region as Rayudu smokes it with the inward angle
that's too short. Ruins what was a good over as Vijay deposits it well over midwicket with a ferocious pull
that's sublime timing! A length ball that pitches on middle and is slanted across, Rayudu drives past Ashwin diving to his right at mid-off
slower length ball at leg-stump, 100.6ks - could it get any slower? - as Vijay knocks it to point

there's the early wicket that Kings XI were looking for as Watson's caught at short fine leg. A back-of-the-hand slower ball from Mohit and Watson tries to whip it through the leg side. Gets the timing all wrong and skews it in the air off the leading edge
shifts down the leg side and it's another slower one as Tye swings without a clue about what he's doing. Beaten

goes for a big heave over the leg side and he's picked out Jadeja at deep midwicket who takes it reverse-cupped. Slower ball from Bravo does the trick as he messes up the timing by rolling his fingers over this delivery
no room on the pull as Ashwin shifts right back and gets a top-edge that Dhoni runs to his left to catch
length ball on the pads, Ashwin carts it off the pads over deep fine leg as the ball sails over Vijay leaping up. Could he have caught it if he was further back at the boundary?
length ball outside off, Ashwin jabs it to mid-off who loses the ball as he tries to stop it
another poor delivery. A length ball, angled into the pads, and Nair flicks to fine leg
angles in a length ball and Ashwin drills it off the inside of the bat to deep backward square leg

is that an edge? Oh, yeah! Tucked up for room and some extra bounce too that does him in. Yuvraj is trying to slap this over but gets a feather to the keeper. Gone for 20 but he Kings XI will be pleased he didn't scratch around
googly, spins in from a back of a length, and Nair punches to cover

Tahir strikes again, and it's another golden duck for Finch! Or is it? Finch reviews. But this was a poor shot from Finch. Pays the price for playing against the turn. A length ball and Finch clumsily steps forward and looks to close the face. The ball spins past it to hit the pad. A waste of a review, really, as the screen shows three reds

Agarwal miscues one to long-on. Tahir floats up a length ball and Agarwal's bat turned in his hands as he tried to loft it. Doesn't get the distance desired as a result, and Jadeja completes a simple catch

yorker from Bravo, and it goes away for four. Didn't really deserve a boundary. Bravo belts out an appeal for the lbw, but it's withheld. The ball, in the meanwhile, trickles away past a diving Harbhajan at short third man
short, sitting up outside off, and Yuvraj gets on his toes inside the crease and pulls to the right of deep midwicket
slower full toss, teasing the line with the height here, Yuvraj flicks it to deep midwicket
full, wide, flayed over point by Agarwal as Vijay runs to his left from sweeper cover to field it
slants across a length ball outside off and Yuvraj punches down the pitch
shortish, a googly that spins away, Yuvraj knocks it to point

a rather underwhelming end to a superb innings. He was kept quiet for the last couple of overs or so, and now he's offered a simple catch to short fine leg. Watson tucks him up for room and bangs it in, Gayle gets an edge as he tries to pull it away
Watson offers up a dolly, a really full one at 129.2 clicks on middle and off, Agarwal clears the front leg and sends it soaring straight over
misfield at mid-off as Agarwal watchfully blocks towards the fielder and sends back Gayle looking for one. The fielder lets it slip through the legs and they take the one anyway
length ball that spins away, Gayle watchfully blocks in the direction of point
brilliant from Agarwal. Uses the width to open the face really late and squeezes it out through backward point
Agarwal invites himself to the party with a straight six. Just how many have travelled that way tonight? A skip down the track and a neatly-timed punch over long-on
short, too close to Agarwal as he miscues a pull off the lower part of the bat
length, angled across, Gayle opens the face to point

after all the bad balls they have punished, Kings XI end up losing a wicket to a full toss. Wicket or boundary, it's almost as if CSK can't manage a delivery that doesn't make you flinch. Rahul punches it uppishly as he throws his weight behind the shot and finds DJ Bravo who leaps at cover to hold on to a sharp catch
slides it into the pads, and Rahul uses the angle and spin to tuck behind square
non-turning length ball, pretty wide outside off, Gayle punches it through point
straight down the ground again. Tahir slides this into Gayle's leg stump, and he gets the front leg out and pummels it for six more
brute force! And a fifty for Gayle, off 22 balls. That's as emphatic a franchise debut as there can be. A flighted fuller one on the stumps, and Gayle hammers it straight over
Tahir continues the trend of horrible deliveries, a full toss on leg stump, and Rahul flicks it to deep midwicket
there, much better! More of that. A yorker to end the over, and Gayle digs it out to cover
another shortish one, and ample of room. Jeez, when will they start bowling closer at the stumps. Gayle barely has to get the front foot away to slap it through long-off
slower short ball, Gayle swivels and helps it along to square leg. He jogs the first as two fielders converge, and that's fine because neither man can get to it
a length ball that nicely sits up for him outside off, around the fifth or sixth-stump line, and Gayle mows it over long-on with a clean swing of the arms

that's some more tripe. Another shortish delivery, they aren't learning anything from their mistakes, Gayle doesn't entirely time it but the big swing is enough to carry it just past the mid-on fielder running back and sliding in front of the boundary

CSK are putting on an exhibition of everything you shouldn't bowl in a T20 game. After a full one on the pads, he drops short to Rahul, at a gentle pace, as he shifts back and swivels into a powerful pull through midwicket
sprays one into the pads of Gayle who flicks to midwicket

edged and through the gap between keeper and wide slip. That's an unusually wide slip, probably even wider of where second slip would have been. That means Gayle can take liberties at throwing his hands at deliveries that are well outside his reach
this is some tripe! No control from Harbhajan, he's spraying it all around. This one's a full toss around off and Rahul punches it through the covers with ease
leg-side line again, he needs to settle into something here, Gayle waits and tucks it behind square for one
now he overcompensates with the line and floats up a fuller one that spins away to give Gayle all the room he wants to shovel it over long-off
shortish, slower through the air and zero turn outside off, Gayle rocks back and flays a cut to the left of point
switches over to an off-stump line for this back of a length delivery, Rahul chops a punch towards extra cover
short and banged into his leg stump, and all that leaves Rahul to do is to help it along to deep backward square leg
short of a length on off, and a rare quick single from Gayle as he drops it to the left of point and takes off
full, angled across, a wide yorker, but this time it curves in slightly and pretty late too to have Gayle hitting the ground as he brings the bat down
extremely full outside off, shapes away and sneaks underneath as Gayle jams the bat down
ah, has he got away with that? Seemed to drift a long way from the left-hander, nowhere near Gayle's reach, but for some reason, the umpire thought that was fine
steps down the track but it's a shorter length and that forces Rahul to resort to a mild push back to the bowler
back of a length, turns away from middle and off, Gayle waits on the backfoot before turning it away to midwicket
a nice flighted delivery outside off, and Gayle responds with a languid drive through the covers. Good stride forward and neatly splits the field

ah, shot! The aesthetic value of that is just unbelievable. Rahul simply leans into a punch through the covers, in the process covering for the late movement and using the pace to his advantage as he throws his weight behind it
ah, jeez, Rahul's been hit on the box attempting a pull. Gets really cramped up for room and the ball bounces off after hitting him there to graze the midriff. Painful
full and shaping away late outside off, Rahul swings and the ball sneaks past the inside edge
fullish, angled in at middle and leg and straightening, Rahul drills off the inside of the bat to backward square leg
now that swing works to Rahul's favour as it gives him the room he needs to open up his arms, an imperious punch over the extra cover region
makes room and drives inside out to deep extra cover, Mandeep scampers back. Can Mandeep get to his half-century? He's played beautifully.
right into the blockhole, squeezed to point. Superb from Laughlin
another swing, another miss. This time Stokes angled it full from around the stumps, Washington looked to hit this over long-on
full and wide outside off, Mandeep carves this behind point. Nice hands, nice reach, sublime timing

strikes, Buttler has finally taken a catch. This is slower and fuller outside off, Negi looks to work this to the leg side, but gets a thick edge as it cuts away late and this is well taken by Buttler diving to his left.
shapes to pull but the ball skids back in to hit the flap of the pad as Mandeep is through with the stroke early. That was bowled at 103kph
first he takes out Kohli and now has AB. Absolute half-tracker down leg, AB rocks back and pulls this straight to deep square leg. Unadkat takes an excellent low catch.
slow turn from length on off stump, AB defends. Took his bottom hand off the grip
steps out and lofts this over the infield, down to long-on. Far from off the middle. AB's struggling for timing just a touch tonight again
slices this into the gap between backward point and short third man. Not much pace on this, AB went hard at it, just about managed to find the gap.
makes room and punches this down to long-off. Can't get the kind of room he would've liked. That's three good deliveries so far from Unadkat
short and put away. Kohli rocks back and muscles this pull over deep midwicket. That's adding insult to injury.

stumping chance missed!  Oh, dear. Is that the turning point? AB is foxed by a googly that spins back in to beat the inside edge as he stepped out to go over the top. What's worse is the slip fielder's throw at the stumps resulted in an overthrow.
deceived by the googly, Kohli plays for the legspin but this one hits him on the pad. Caught on the crease, but this was sliding down
slower ball gone wrong, slides this down leg even as Kohli walks out to flick. Pressure on Stokes
full toss outside off, Kohli opens the bat face to slice this drive on the bounce over point.
he's welcomed with a fierce pull that leaves midwicket with no chance. Kohli wallops that a couple of bounces into the ropes.
swept fiercely, beats square leg. Fetched this from off stump. This wasn't all that bad a delivery from Gowtham, take your hat off to de Kock for being brave and risking being lbw to play that
grip and turn from middle, de Kock gets a leading edge towards point
crunching cover drive. Length outside off, Kohli walks into the stroke and bisects cover and mid-off. All class and quality
spins back in to strike the pad, but this was sliding down leg. Kohli was looking to work this to the leg side

rocks back and hammers this pull straight to Stokes at deep midwicket. This was hammered but it was almost as if McCullum didn't know there was a man there. Stokes made it look ridiculously easy. Timed his jump superbly and was airborne when it lodged in his bucket hands.
low full toss outside off, squeezes this to cover. Samson walks off to applause and appreciation from RCB. Stunning knock.
he's hitting them on demand. Samson has picked this full delivery outside off over long-off. Just made a bit of room and laced this over.
slower length ball on middle, Tripathi backs away and pulls to deep midwicket.  Oh, dear. Umesh has overstepped.  Samson on strike. Kohli is furious. That was a massive no-ball too
at the moment, he's dealing in just sixes. This slower ball is bowled at length, Samson backs away and lofts this through the line to clear long on
another one, a similar result. This one's even bigger, into the second tier. Khejroliya delivers another half-volley and Samson had the room to loft this cleanly.

excellent from Samson. He backs away and lofts this full delivery cleanly over long-off. The left foot went towards mid-on to create room. Khejroliya went for a yorker, missed his length and got punished
backs away and deposits this length ball into the second tier at midwicket. Very predictable there from Woakes
right into the blockhole, dug out in time, the ball rolls towards point.  First half-century in three games for Samson
slants this one into middle and leg, tucked to square leg. A direct hit at the bowler's end from Chahal and Samson would've been gone.
rocks back and hammers the pull deep into the stands at deep square. Picked the length early, did Samson
drifts in to squeeze off an inside edge back to Negi
Works this length ball from outside off towards midwicket, a direct hit at the bowler's end and  Samson would've been gone
helped into the stands at fine leg. Too short and angling in, Stokes was waiting for it as he swiveled back and used the pace to wallop that deep
clears long on effortlessly. Just hit that length ball through the line, so much power off the bottomhand. Stunning from Samson
pace length ball on off stump, Stokes stands tall and bunts this to midwicket
stunning short-arm jab over deep square. Samson has too much time when he places such strokes, so stylish. Picked the length early and allowed his wrists to do the rest.
short of length on off, Stokes through the short-arm jab too early, gets some bat off the edge as this rolls wide of the keeper on the off side

Guess what? He's not run out, but has to go. Chahal pushes this through, gets this to drift away, there's a hint of sidespin as well. Short shapes to cut but has no room and gets the toe end of the bat as de Kock takes an excellent catch.
too much width, Short gets right to the pitch and belts this straight to cover
defended with an angled bat, towards short third man. Nice flight again from Chahal
floats this full but down leg, Short looks to flick but misses.

he's not hit this well and has paid the price, straight to mid-on. This was another slower delivery from Woakes, full but way outside off, Rahane looked to hit this straight but ended up dragging it off the toe end. He's done his job though.  There was intent right from the outset.
this is just helped on its way over deep backward square. Stunning shot. Too slow and drifting down, this was almost as if Rahane was waiting for it as he swung through with the angle.
clean strike over the bowler's head. Too full and Short's eyes lit up as he belted this away
hint of turn from length on off, Rahane steers this towards point
hoicked away again, the midwicket boundary has been peppered again. Take that, he says. Rahane has come out looking to play a different game
makes room, Umesh follows him but it doesn't matter as Rahane hoicks this over midwicket. Races away to the fence off a mishit
length on middle and leg, Short hops back into the crease and defends into the leg side
swept fiercely, one bounce to the deep square leg fence. This was drifting in, Rahane was down on one knee as he executed that superbly.
slash and a miss. Went for an expansive cut, without any feet movement. Woakes lucky to get away with that
stifled appeal, Rahane went across the line to flick it fine but the ball angled in and deflected off the thigh pad to the leg side
picks the length early and slaps this over midwicket, one bounce to the ropes. Just a touch too short from Woakes
fastish delivery at length outside off, Rahane mistimes this reverse sweep into the off side
good length just outside off. Hooda walks across to the off side, and flicks to midwicket. Calls for the run early
good length on off, and that's been punched off the back foot. Lynn's at cover, but the ball just goes over his head. Pathan's lucky but he'll take the boundary
good length outside off, and Hooda misses the pull shot. The ball sneaks under his bat and through to DK
full on leg stump, and KW clips it off his pads, but straight to Russell at square leg. Soft dismissal! Big groan from Williamson as he sees Russell complete the catch
full on off, but Hooda comes dancing down the wicket. Pushes to wide long on to see Narine's spell off
good length outside off, and Hooda cuts it square to the man in the deep
full on off, and fended back to Narine

breaks leg stump! Good length on leg, but Shakib's caught in two minds. Chooses to defend eventually, but the ball sneaks through between bat and pad. This game's not over yet, folks! But for now it's the time out
good length on off, but spinning away from Shakib. Tries to cut but the extra bounce takes it over his bat
full on off stump, and Shakib fends it off the front foot
full on off stump, and Williamson bunts it to long on for another run
full on leg stump. Shakib shimmies down the wicket and drives it down to long on
full on leg, and Shakib backs away before driving to long off. Easy single collected
full, but very wide outside leg stump. Shakib, however, backed away a lot towards the leg side. Bunted down the ground to long on
full on off, and pushed to long off for a walking single. Sees another Narine over out
good length just outside off, and Shakib cuts it hard past the man at point. Work for the man in the deep, but he manages to pull it back
mistimed, but over mid off! Full on off, and Shakib lifts this over Uthappa at mid off. Not hit well, but enough behind that shot to take in beyond the infield
top edged over the keeper! Short on leg, and Shakib's pull takes the top edge. Karthik's not a tall man, and he's got no chance in stopping that
low full toss on off stump. Almost a yorker, and he taps it back to Russell. Fielded off the followthrough but the spectators celebrate the crowd catch instead
tossed up on leg stump, but Shakib's up to the challenge. Swept behind square to the fielder in the deep
leaking runs! Good length on leg, and KW pulls this behind square. The man had just moved straighter after the previous shot, and Williamson chose that new vacant spot to perfection
half-tracker on middle, and Williamson goes deep into the crease. Plenty of time to pull this along the ground. Crashes into the cow-corner boundary
full on middle stump. Williamson almost yorks himself, and squeezes towards the legside
full on leg stump, but the wrong'un to end the over. Shakib does well to fend it off the back foot
full on middle stump, spins into Shakib this time. He flicks it off his pads to midwicket
full on off, and spinning away from Shakib. Defended towards cover
full on off, and spinning away from Shakib. Pushed down the ground to long off
full on middle stump, and flicked to fine leg. Williamson calls early for the second run
tossed up on off stump. Shakib takes a big stride forward and sweeps it square to the man in the deep

slow finger of death! Full on leg stump, and Pandey defends it down the wrong line. He tried to play in front of middle stump, but the ball didn't spin at all. Hits his front leg, and the umpire agrees to Kuldeep's appeal. The former KKR player has to go back. Time out as well
flighted on leg stump. Williamson pushes at it, inside out, to long off
good length on off stump, but spinning into Williamson. Turned off his pads to square leg

flighted on middle stump, and Pandey comes down the wicket. Almost yorks himself,  but manages to lift it over Kuldeep eventually. The umpire goes on the floor - trying to duck - as the shot trickles down to long on
full outside off, but it zips straight through off the surface. Williamson tried to defend for the spin, but can't connect
full on off, and that's hit back hard to Kuldeep. He can't get his fingertips to it, and the ball runs down to long on
tossed up on middle stump, and Pandey takes a big wind up, but eventually checks his shot. Defended back to Kuldeep
good length on leg and spinning across Williamson. Tries to pull square but is through his shot way too early. Comes off the bat's toe end, and goes past Kuldeep's right
tossed up full outside off, and Williamson drives with the spin. Excellent stop by Russell at cover though, diving forward
good length outside off, but sharply spins inwards. Pandey mistimes his punch back to the bowler
good length on off, and spinning away from Pandey. Cut off the back foot to the man at point
full on off this time. Defended, once again, with soft hands. The ball is tapped back to Narine
full outside off, and defended with soft hands towards the off side. Slight hesitation from the batsmen, and Pandey chooses not to run

the zing bails have lit up! Overpitched on leg stump, and almost a yorker from Narine. Dhawan tries to defend but the ball sneaks under his bat. Hits his back leg, and then crashes into the base of off stump. Sunrisers lose their openers
punched through the infield! Textbook stuff from Williamson. Good length on off, and punched off the back foot between cover and cover point
good length just outside off. Punched off the back foot to long on. Successful over from Narine
arm ball on middle stump. Pitches full, and Williamson blocks off the back foot
out first ball! Full on leg, and spinning further away from Saha. Tries to flick it fine, but takes a feather edge off his bat. Excellent take from DK and that's got Narine grinning!
back of a length on leg stump. Cramps Saha for room, but still manages to flick it behind square off the back foot
full on off, and Saha crunches this over mid on! In Saha's arc, and he check-drives it to the on side. Enough behind it to beat the infield
another slower ball wide outside off. Saha's in position to lean into that shot, and times it extremely well past cover. Silences the Kolkata crowd again
overpitched, slower ball outside off. Saha tries to drive away from his body but is foxed by the pace. The umpire feels it's a wide
too short on middle, and Saha is quick to swivel and pull. Hit very square and there's no one there in the boundary. Collects another four
good length on off, and shaping away from Saha. Pokes at it, and tapped to Gill at point
full on off, and Saha lifts this over midwicket. Off the bat's toe end, so it doesn't have the legs to go the boundary
good length on off, and Saha pulls it square. Hit off the bat's middle, and manages to clear midwicket by a few feet. No one in the deep
full on leg, and Saha uses his wrists to whip it off his pads to deep backward square. Fine leg can't intercept either
good length on off, and jagging into Saha again. Fended off the back foot with soft hands this time
back of a length on middle and hits Saha's gloves. Fended towards point
awry from Johnson. Full, but pitched wide outside leg stump
full on off, and swinging into Saha. Tries to slog towards the leg side but the ball goes between bat and pad. How did that miss the top of off stump?
good length on off, and angling across Saha. Left alone by the batsman, and slightly unlucky that the umpire calls it a wide. It was well inside the tramlines
full on middle and Johnson manages to bunt it to long off
full outside off, and Johnson's wild swing doesn't connect. Goes under his bat and through to the keeper
good length on off, and Johnson tries to pull towards cow corner. Takes the top edge, but lands just short of Stanlake at third man. Finishes with 3 for 26

caught, but no ball! Full on off, and Johnson backed away to free his arms. Hit it towards cover, but slices it into the air. KW takes the catch, and even starts celebrating, before Bhuvi tells him about the no ball. Free hit
edged! Full outside off, and Karthik's drive away from his body takes the outside edge. Pocketed by Saha moving to his right
knuckle ball on off, but Karthik's spotted the length early. Big stride forward and muscled over the bowler's head. Lands beyond the sightscreen. Full use of the free hit!
full outside off, and DK hits it over Bhuvneshwar's head. Off the bat's toe end and falls in front of long off. Oh dear, front-foot no-ball too. Free hit

soft dismissal! Good length outside off, and swinging away from Gill. He tries to muscle this over the infield, but takes the top edge. Shakib - at cover - takes a few steps back and completes the catch from near his face. Bhuvi's knuckleball earns him a wicket
full, but wide outside off. Gill tries to drive towards the off side again, but comes off the bat's inside half. Hit to midwicket
good length on middle stump, and Gill turns it off his pads to fine leg
flighted outside off, and Gill check-drives. Hits it well, but Dhawan at wide long off cleans up
short outside off, and Gill tries to cut it over the slip cordon. Too high and through to Saha. Time out again

Poor from Russell. Full outside off, and Dre Russ slaps this over point once again. Slices it this time, and Pandey - at point - runs towards the boundary to complete an excellent diving catch! Slides across the ground after pocketing that. Pandey's been electric today
Full outside off, and Russell slaps this over point. Hooda races to his left and sticks his hand out, and even throws the ball in, but his back leg is hitting the boundary
tossed up on off stump, but Russell's not biting the apple. Defended off the front foot
darts it into Russell's pads, and he flicks towards deep backward square. Could've easily gone to the man at short leg too
falls for 49! Good length on middle, and Lynn punches this too soon. The ball stuck up after pitching, forcing the error from Lynn, and Shakib dives to his left to take a one-handed stunner
back of a length on middle stump. Lynn goes deep onto the back foot and muscles it to midwicket
quicker one, and on a good length. Angling into Karthik, who clips it off his pads to square leg
good length on off, and spinning into Lynn. Whipped off his pads to square leg
low full toss outside off, and Karthik attempts to drive over cover. Takes the bat's toe end, but falls just over cover. The man in the deep cleans up
tossed up on off stump, and driven down the ground past Shakib. Straight to long off

KW to the rescue! Good length outside off, and the arm ball does the trick. Narine swings through the line of the ball, but not off the meat of the bat. In the air for ages, and Williamson runs back from midwicket to complete the catch

good length outside off, and the ball spins away from Narine again. He tries to hit it over cover, but Narine manages to slice this over point! Kaul chases after it, but the ball picks up pace after hitting the practice pitches. Can't pull it back

stumped? The umpire's going upstairs. Good-length ball outside off, and the ball spins away from Narine this time. Tries to smash this over the bowler's head, but misses it completely. Replays suggest that Narine got his backfoot down in time though. Not out
full toss outside leg stump, and Narine misses the pull. But the keeper can't hold onto it either, which forces Stanlake - at short fine leg - to go chasing behind it
full outside off, and Narine dances down the wicket. Crunches a drive past cover, but Yusuf Pathan's full-stretched dive at long off saves the boundary
short on off, and Lynn tries to flat-bat this towards the off side. Comes off the bat's top half, and in the air. Lands just short of cover!
Kaul unlucky again! Overpitched on off stump, and Lynn's drive takes the inside edge. Misses leg stump and runs away to the fine-leg boundary
yorker on leg stump and Lynn does well to squeeze this away towards the off side

full outside off, and Lynn's done waiting. Makes room to the leg side and muscles this over the bowler's head. Rashid Khan - at long on - runs to his left and tries to take a diving catch. Manages to get his left hand to it, but the ball pops out, then hits his shoulder, and then finally falls beyond the boundary
back of a length outside leg, and Narine makes room on the leg side. Pulled, but mistimed, over square leg to the man in the deep
full outside leg, and Narine tries to swing towards the leg side. Inside edge, but falls short of the keeper diving to his right

Pandey again, but this time he drops it! Full on off, and Narine went through with the golf swing. Hit it well, and looked like it was gonna go over long on, but Pandey jumped, took the catch, and then threw it back in since he was falling over. Tried to return and complete the catch, but the ball falls short. He threw the ball back in with just a bit too much power. Saves five runs nonetheless. Time out
full on middle, and Lynn backs away. Tries to smack this down the ground but mistimed to long off
good length on off, and Narine tries to work it on the leg side. Takes the leading edge towards cover instead
good length just outside off, and Lynn cuts this square. Played off the front foot, but stopped by Bhuvi at point
full outside off, and Lynn drives away from his body. Straight to cover
back of a length on middle, and angling away from Narine. My, my, he shoulders his arms in a T20
welcomes him with a short ball on leg stump. Narine goes deep into his crease, and defends off the back foot

Pandey takes a screamer! Stanlake celebrates but the wicket's all Pandey's. Cuts this ball super hard, but Pandey - at point - dives to his right and sticks both hands out. The ball popped out of his hand, but managed to take the catch eventually as Pandey returned back to Earth. Excellent!
short on leg stump, and the ball soars over Rana's head. He happily gets under the line of this delivery
good length on middle, and fended off the front foot. Lynn went to the leg side but Stanlake's delivery angle followed him. Rana wanted the single, but Lynn wasn't sure. They complete it eventually
full just outside off, Lynn backs away and carves it towards point
good length outside off again, and Rana cuts it square to the man in the deep
full on off, and Lynn tries to crunch this past cover again. Mistimed towards the off side, but manages to take the single
good length on off, and spinning into Lynn. Punched to cover
half-tracker on middle, and spinning away from Rana. He backs away, and cuts this hard past point. No stopping that!
full on leg stump, and spinning across Rana's body. Defends the wrong'un off the front foot

flighted on middle stump, and Rana's picked this length early! Down on one knee, and slog swept over cow corner. Not timed extremely well, but enough behind Rana's swing to take it into the stands. First six off Rashid this season
full on off, and spins away from Lynn. He walks across to the off side and nudges towards midwicket
tossed up on middle, and Rana attempts a wide leg-side heave. Hit towards midwicket, but was in the air for a while
crunched through the covers! Raw power on display here. Pitched up on off, and Lynn swings his bat with all the force of this world. Smacked to the wide long-off boundary
full and wide outside off again! Lynn backs away and therefore can't reach at it. Through to the keeper
overpitched wide outside off. Lynn sticks his bat out, and cuts this past point. Backward point dives to his right and manages to get fingertips to it

Lynn's lucky this time! Full on off, and he tries to smack this over the bowler's head. Except, this time Lynn finds the bat's inside edge and sends it fine down the leg side. Another knuckleball this time, but much better execution

good length, but wide outside off. Lynn backs away and then slashes this over point. Three men in the infield, but clears all of them. The chase from the fielders are futile. Replays suggest it's the knuckleball
starts off with the slower ball. Did that slip out of his hand? It's short on middle, and Lynn tries to pull. But he's through his shot too early. Mistimed towards short fine leg

another excellent ball! Four dots to end the over. Similar ball to the one previously in the over. Good length on middle, and beautifully angling away from Rana as he tries to defend. He's lucky that didn't fine the outside edge
good length on leg and Rana's cramped for room this time. Tapped to cover off the back foot, but rather unconvincingly
beauty! Nice shape, and the ball just misses Rana's outside edge. Good length on middle stump and angling tantalisingly away from Rana. He tried to defend, but played it down the wrong line
good length on middle stump, but angling across Rana. Shoulders his arms this time
back of a length outside off and Lynn backs away. Chops it down to third man this time
short ball first up, and Rana gets his eyes off the ball! Gets big on him, and hits his handle as Rana tries to look away. Lands safe, just in front of point. Quick!
good length, and outside off. Rana sticks his bat out and pokes it towards point. Calls early for the single

appeal for caught behind! But not given. Williamson reviews straightaway. Sunrisers look convinced. It was a good length ball outside off, and jagging just into Uthappa. He tried to run it fine, but the ball took the outside edge. UltraEdge shows a big spike, and the umpire has to reverse his decision

back of a length outside off, and Lynn gives it a big heave. Hits it over the non-striker, but bounces just in front of mid on. The fielder jumps over the ball, and it races away to the boundary thereafter. Mistimed shot but gets four
good length on middle and angling sharply into Lynn. The batsman had made some room on the leg side, so Stanlake did well to follow him. Lynn taps it towards point
back of a length outside off. Angling into Lynn, and defended off the back foot

full on middle, and driven inside out over Stanlake. Williamson, at mid off, goes running backwards, and even sticks his hand out, but the ball drops out of his right hand. Terrific effort, but just too difficult. Another boundary
short outside off, and Lynn crunches this off the back foot. Slapped past backward point as the ball races away for a boundary. Manish Pandey groans 'nooo' as Lynn leans into that shot
big swing of the bat from Lynn, but misses completely. Good length outside off, and just about enough room to free his arms

back of a length on off, and angling into Uthappa. Worked off his body to square leg, and they take off for the run. Shakib's throw at the striker's end isn't a direct hit, or else Lynn would've been in trouble
back of a length first up to Lynn. Superb accuracy from Bhuvneshwar, which forces Lynn to defend off the back foot
stays back of a length again. Uthappa walks across to the off side and blocks off the back foot. Four dots to start the match. Can he finish well?
good length outside off, and Uthappa defends it away. Bhuvi starts off with two slips

it clears cover, and they complete the run. Delhi celebrate. Yes yes, it's another cutter outside off. Roy swings again, like he has been doing and the ball lobs off the outside half, but because every one is in, the ball clears the infield. And Delhi Daredevils complete a thrilling seven-wicket win against Mumbai.
125 kph, shortish delivery outside off, Roy misses another dab and it's another dot. Mumbai want to review. No bat. It's a dot.
a slower cutter again, outside off, the ball cuts nicely off the pitch and Roy misses a swing.
a slower ball outside off, that's the length that will cut off the pitch. Roy makes no contact.

and that's the game! Gambhir is pumped. Mumbai are despondent. What an inning sfrom Roy, it's the same shot that Jadhav played to get six in game 1. A full delivery on middle and leg, flicked away over fine leg for six. Such power in those wrists.
smashed for four! Full and wide from Mustafizur, it's not a bad option but it's slow because he's looking for the cutter. With that length, it won't cut. Drilled over cover for four.
another wide yorker, another offcutter! Inside the tramline. Sensational bowling. Iyer is beaten again as he tries to dab the ball. That is predictable, but still so hard to get bat on that.
DOT BALL! 122 kph, another cutter, it's just inside the tramline too. Iyer misses a dab.
a slower ball outside off, Roy is completely deceived, the ball lobs over the bowler, a chip for a couple. Did not pick that cutter.
a slower ball outside off, guided to deep point for one. Just one. Roy wants two.
a predictable cutter, around off. Iyer misses a swat, dot

and they concede the leg bye eventually! A full delivery down leg, Roy looks for the paddle scoop. The ball hits the pad to fine leg. Roy sends Iyer back, the throw is to the non-striker's end. Mustafizur doesn't bother colecting the throw and so concedes an extra
a cutter on middle, pushed to cover for one. Roy and Mustafizur collide. But the run is easily done.
that should be the match! A short delivery outside off, Iyer goes back and goes slashing. Straight to Mustafizur at a good height too, at short third man. The ball bursts out, a big, big drop
slow down leg, Iyer misses a big slog, struck on the pad.
sightscreen! Very well bowled, a slower delivery outside off, and wide too. Roy comes down and just chips the ball straight, still so much timing that it hits the sighscreen
83 kph, flat down leg, some spin too. Roy misses a hard sweep, struck on the body.

sensational catch by Hardik Pandya, off his bro's bowling. A slower delivery outside off, the ball is flighted and loopy. The ball spins away but Maxwell can't back down from his hit over cover. But because of that spin, the ball skews away off the outside half. Hardik runs around to his left, keeps his eyes on the ball and dives full length to get both hands on the ball to clasp the ball. But he doesn't let go of the ball even as his body and arm and shoulder hits the ground. Terrific catch.
under-edged? A flat delivery outside off, Roy looks for the cut, the ball beats the keeper en route to short fine leg.
another six. The runs just keep coming, the shots too. A legbreak on leg, Maxwell heaves his sweep with enough timing and power over square leg.
too straight, four on the bounce. A loopy delivery on leg, Maxwell clears his front leg and boshes a straight powerful drive to long-on
slow on middle, 78 kph. Maxwell pushes the ball to Krunal's right. He dives and stops the ball.

great catch by Pollard. A slower delivery outside off from Krunal, Pant looks to hit the ball over long-off, wanted to get under that, but the ball just skews away after the bat turns in his hand. The fielder dives to his left and takes the catch, diving to his left. Making a tough catch look relatively easy.
80 kph, a slower delivery outside off. Pant gets under the length of that and drills the drive right back at the bowler. Over the bowler and four.
just over mid-off. Full outside off, Roy nails the drive with so much power and enough timing that even Pollard can't get there with a well-timed leap. He may have done some damage too
a misfield. Full and wide outside off, carved to backward point. A fumble allows two and Roy's fifty
that is huuuuuge! Pant comes charging down again, gets to the pitch and smashes the ball over long-on. Fantastic timing.
superb shot! Six more. Mumbai's spinners are being mauled. Pant runs down, gets close to the pitch and lofts the ball cleanly and elegantly over long-on.
84 kph, four more. Markande being taken for plenty! Short on middle and leg, Pant rocks back and pulls this neatly through square leg for four.
juuuust over long-off! A googly outside off, Roy watches the ball till very late and swats a sweep-type stroke with enough power over the fielder
just over short third man! A googly outside off, Pant stays low and reverse-paddles the ball over the fielder's head at third man. Juust enough elevation

has it bounced? Ground-boot or boot and air? A flat delivery outside off, Roy chops the ball into hos leg, the ball pops up. Kishan dives full length to his right and take the catch full. The soft signal is out, but that's the wrong decision because the ball has hit the ground.
short around off, Pant goes back and swats one to cover.

taken! Mumbai strike. A back of a length delivery on middle and off, Gambhir stays on the back foot, looking to pull but he is hurried through the stroke, due to the pace of the ball. All he can do is splice a pull to Rohit at midwicket
hammered for four more. A slower delivery around off, beaten with immense power right over the bowler. These slower ones are not working to Roy. 21 off five
six more! That is humongous. Back of a length on middle and leg, Roy watches the ball onto his pull and goes bosh over square leg.
heaved away over square leg for four! It's a slower ball, on leg. Gambhir picks the length, stays back and heaves the ball behind square. The ball lands just inside the boundary.
chipped over the bowler! A cutter on middle and leg, Mustafizur's length is good too. Roy looks to turn the ball away but the ball splices over
full delivery outside off, a badly-timed drive to mid-off. Gambhir under pressure.
143 kph, full on middle and leg. That's Gambhir bread and butter. He misses a flick, struck on the pad. Just two runs off the over.
Gambhir struggling to account for the bounce! Back of a length outside off, another swing and miss.
a swing and miss. Back of a length on off, or just wider. Gambhir backs away and misses a drive. Just over the off stump.
good length outside off, the ball angles away and beats Gambhir. Just the angle.
flat on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket, Gambhir style, for one.
that's a poor ball. Good length down leg, worked away easily through backward square leg for four. Pandya is not happy with that finish, his fault though.
a big appeal. No. Pad says the umpire. Mumbai agree. Gambhir isn't unhappy. So seems like the right decision. Full down leg, Gambhir misses a flick. Clips the pad.
back of a length outside off, Roy stands tall again and smashes a punchy drive to that deep cover. 145 kph, says the speed gun.
that's width! Good length outside off, Roy stands tall and punches through cover for four. On the up.
full delivery outside off, Dananjaya fails to make contact. Another dot ball.
excellent use of the short ball, a bouncer on off. Dananjaya sways out of the line, dot.

off the pad or bat? Pad, says the umpire. Daredevils want to review. It's a good-length delivery outside off, Krunal gets right across and works the ball into his pad, and then to short fine leg. Big inside edge and that decision should be out. A successful review, can make a big difference to the total. Was looking for the ramp over short fine leg, but insufficient contact to beat his thigh.
full outside off, Krunal comes charging and drives to long-off for one.
a full delivery outside off, Krunal gets right across and uses his bottom hand to whip the ball towards wide long-on for a single.
just over mid-off. A slower delivery outside off, Krunal gets under the length and lifts the ball over the fielder.

a first-ball duck for Pollard. He comes down, looking to work the ball into the leg side. But he walks far across while looking to find his first run. The ball, a nothing delivery on off, clips the back of his front pad and then ricochets into the off stump. Not been a great start to the IPL for Pollard.

and finally Rohit gets a move too. Got some catching up to do with the rest of his mates, the Mumbai captain. On this occasion, he makes use of Christian's angle as he bangs one into the batsman and Rohit swivels and helps it along to the fine leg boundary
the switch hit for six! A low full toss on middle and leg, Kishan knows Tewatia is trying to take the ball away from him with googlies. Helped along over deep backward point.
that's four. Flat down leg, Ishan helps it down to the fine leg boundary with a paddle sweep, a poor delivery and four.

given! Tewatia strikes. Suryakumar has been given out lbw, will he review? Yes. He wants to check, did it pitch outside leg? No. Did it slide past leg? Was there some glove? There was no immediate review from Suryakumar, so he didn't think so. There's a thin spike on UltraEdge. HawkEye shows the ball is just clipping the side of leg stump. So Mumbai keep their review, but lose Suryakumar. He was looking for a sweep through square leg, but missed the ball. It pitched on leg and slid on.

88 kph, Lewis holes out this time! Another googly outside off, Lewis comes charging and skews an attempted hoick, off the outside half of the bat. It lobs to Roy at mid-off to end a sensational opening stand.
juuuust six! Skewed, but six. Some flight outside off, Lewis runs down and doesn't bother about the googly. Goes through with the shot, and just gets enough to clear the straight boundary
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off. A nice over from Maxwell.
another flat delivery on middle, punched back to Maxwell. Very tidy

more absolute filth from Daredevils. A cutter outside off that is a half-volley. Lewis says why both with four when I can check mys shot and get six for it. Smashed over mid-off. That's an 84-run Powerplay for Mumbai, their highest in the IPL
another overpitched delivery outside off, Lewis just uses what he's given and throws his arms at the width to get some free IPL runs. Smashed through cover.
a slower offcutter outside off and Lewis nails that too. Smashed through cover for four. Bludgeoned almost.

this is tripe! Filth from Nadeem. Short down leg, Lewis rocks back and pulls that easily and gleefully over square leg for a humongous six. Mumbai's fastest IPL fifty. An appalling start from Daredevils.
another misfield! It's short outside off, Suryakumar stands back and pummels a drive right back to his left. Nadeem sticks out a left hand but can't do much to stop the ball.
bunted for six! On a length on middle and off, Lewis watches the ball late and then just chips the ball with all his muscular prowess over mid-on. Way over for six.
now Boult errs in line, on the pads, worked away to deep square leg.

Boult stops the four! He's running back from short fine leg and just about gets there. That was a sensational effort. A flat delivery on middle and leg, Lewis gets a thick leading edge on his sweep, the top edge lobs in the air over fine leg. He races back, the ball is just beyond his reach and he pulls the ball back in despite losing balance.
did he play a shot? Back of a length down leg, Lewis thinks of playing but bails out of the stroke. The ball ricochets down to fine leg off the pad. The umpire thinks there was a shot.
slightly shorter and Lewis reads the length very quickly. He stays back and pulls over square leg. Too short.
past Gambhir's right this time at mid-off. No swing at all for Boult. It's full outside off and a gentle loosener for Suryakumar to drive easily. Drilled.
an overpitched start to begin. Full and wide, Suryakumar Yadav smashes that drive to Gambhir at mid-off, who labours to his left. A fumble allows two.
pitched up and outside off, Sundar lays into a drive and carts it away to the cover boundary to snap RCB's five-match losing streak at home
slower ball, floats away outside off, 107.4ks, foxes Sundar
dug in short and outside off, Sundar leaps and ramps it away to the third man boundary to level the scores. Third man isn't fine enough to cut it off

shortish and outside off, Mandeep swats it across the line to deep midwicket. Mandeep chances a second. It just wasn't there. Dagar, the sub fielder, throws it flat and hard to the keeper, who takes the bails off to catch Mandeep well short of the crease
Tye hushes the Chinnaswamy into silence. He goes short and outside off, AB upper cuts it in the air and holes out to Karun Nair at deep point.  Tye gives Kings XI hope. RCB need 10 off 11 balls
back of a length on off, Mandeep loses his shape as he swipes an inside edge to square leg
back of a length and outside off, knuckle ball? AB shuffles across off and swats it past the right of long-on

Mohit floats a slower ball on middle from the back of the hand, de Villiers picks it, waits for the ball to arrive and launches it with great authority over the long-on boundary. What a way to bring up a fifty. AB pumps his fists as he acknowledges the dugout. Kohli applauds. Three sixes on the bounce for AB. How the match has turned
This is more emphatic from AB and the Chinnaswamy roars in approval. Dragged down outside off, rocks back and nails a pull over midwicket. He sends it soaring into the stands
floated full and outside off, AB goes for the loft. Instead he slices it, but that's enough to clear the boundary at the Chinnaswamy. Up and over the long-off boundary
zippy offbreak on middle, pushed back to Mujeeb, and he lets the ball burst through his hands for a single. Mujeeb and AB collide. Just a single
short offbreak on middle, Mandeep goes deep in the crease and middles a pull to the left of deep square leg
short and wide outside off, AB backs away and slaps it away to wide long-off for just a single
wide of the crease, Mujeeb gets it to hold its line outside off, cracked to the covers, where Karun runs in, collects the ball, and throws it to the keeper. AB is quick enough to complete the single
back of a length and outside off, AB reaches out for the ball with his hands and scoops it off the toe end to long-off
really full on off, Mandeep can't get under it, forced to long-on
floats a slower full-toss outside off, stabbed straight back to Tye

low full-toss outside off again, AB shimmied outside leg, then jumps across off and slog-sweeps it between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Neither Karun nor Stoinis committed. They simply let the ball through them to the boundary
back of a length and skids on outside off, Mandeep goes with hard hands and nearly chops it back onto the stumps
another low full-toss on off, AB stabs it down the ground again
low full-toss outside off, AB shuffles across and drills it straight down the ground
back of a length and angling in at off, worked into the vacant spaces at midwicket. Tye chases, stumbles, and RCB sneak two
very full on middle, AB cracks it down to long-on
Ashwin lobs up a legbreak, dips on middle, tickled away to short fine leg off the inside half

Ashwin has two in two. This is the legbreak and Ashwin has posted a slip to catch it. Wide of the crease, angling in, and breaking away outside off, Sarfraz simply runs the ball to slip, where Nair takes a sharp catch
De Kock runs past a slider and Ashwin hits the top of middle. Slides on with the arm from around the wicket, de Kock steps out, swishes and does not make contact.

Three fielders, including the bowler, converge but the ball drops in between them. Tossed up and spins away outside off, the ball turns in de Kock's hands as he skews it over the bowler's head. Yuvraj runs in from long-off, can't get there. Axar runs back, can't get there either. The ball was far away from the other fielder
back of a length on middle, de Kock ventures another reverse-sweep, swatted away fine of short third man for four
low-arm slider on middle, more variations from Ashwin, de Kock goes low and sweeps it away through square leg for four
floated up on middle, de Kock races down the track again, gets under the length again and hoists it over Ashwin's head for a thumping six
de Kock runs down the track and hacks it off the inside half to the leg side
back of a length and outside off, AB punches to short cover

on a length outside off, spins back in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad. The appeal for lbw is shot down. Ashwin calls for a review. de Kock stretches out but is pinned on the front pad below the knee-roll. Impact outside off? The tracker returns umpire's call on impact and de Kock survives
de Kock closes the face early and leading-edges it to the left of Axar
back of a length and outside off, the ball flies off AB's bat. He flat-bats it fiercely past the right of sweeper cover. Regal shot.
short of a length on off stump, angling in from over the wicket, AB rocks back and pummels a pull in front of square. Bam!
AB steps out, the bowler shortens his length, forced down to long-off off the back foot
de Kock steps out and clips it wide of midwicket
looped up outside off, de Kock ventures down the track, takes a half-volley and belts it over midwicket
wide of the crease, tossed on middle, AB presses forward and drives to long-on
pitched up on off, AB meets the pitch and drives a single down to long-on
tossed on middle, steps out and flicks it in the air over midwcket. Stylish from de Kock

Seventeen-year-old Mujeeb bursts through the gate of Kohli. He unfurls a googly from the back of the hand. It pitches outside off and zips back in sharply, Kohli has no clue about this variation. He drives and has his stumps rattled. Mujeeb hits the top of middle. What a ripper from Mujeeb. This game is on
slower through the air and outside off, not much turn, de Kock is early into the paddle-sweep. He ends up scooping it over the keeper's head
pitched up and outside off, 115ks knuckle ball, Kohli now delays the drive. He picks the variation and delightfully drives through the covers
114.8ks knuckle ball on middle stump, de Kock delays his push and plays it to mid-off
and Kohli welcomes him into the attack with a boundary. Shorter on middle, shimmies out and pulls it away to the long leg fence
back of a length on middle from round the wicket, stabbed back to Mujeeb
skidder, stays low on middle, Kohli sits back and shovels it away to deep midwicket
floated on leg stump, de Kock does not make contact with a flick, off the pad and wanders away square on the leg side
darted shorter and outside off, de Kock can't get on top of it. Mistimes a cut to backward point
fired outside off, slightly overpitched, de Kock leans into it and laces it through the covers
non-turning offbreak on off, de Kock presses forward and smothers it
103ks dart outside off, Kohli uses the pace of Ashwin to his advantage and chops it away past the right of the keeper
Axar goes short and outside off, de Kock skips back and crisply punches the ball between backward point and the covers
dragged down outside off, Kohli sizes it up and cracks it it away past the left of Mujeeb. He does not get his body behind the ball and concedes four
Woakes bounces out Mujeeb and wraps up Kings XI for 155. Short ball, homing in at the ribs, Mujeeb is too late onto the hook. He splices it to backward point
Chahal dangles another wide legbreak. Ashwin runs down the track, but the ball dips, and breaks away sharply. Ashwin swings and misses. De Kock swipes the bails off in a flash
Ashwin dances out, Chahal dangles out a legbreak wide outside off. Ashwin goes through with his shot and flat-bats it over Chahal's head
tossed on middle stump, Ashwin uses his wrists and drives the ball away to deep midwicket

full on off, right in the swinging arc, but Tye does not get all of it. He miscues a loft to Kohli at the long-off region. The RCB captain moved to his left from long-on and pouched it in front of AB at long-off. Tye got it off the toe end, giving Kohli catching practice
Ashwin shuffles across for a scoop to fine leg, Woakes hurls it wide outside off, Ashwin checks his shot and slices it to point
on a length and outside off, Ashwin backs away, collapses his back leg and lofts it inside out over extra cover
really full and wide outside off as Ashwin steps out and does not connect with a drive
short and outside off, Ashwin checks his punch and slices to sweeper cover
short and cramps the batsman for room, Ashwin stands tall and punches to long-on
back of a length on off, Tye punches it in the air, Umesh running to his left from deep midwicket swats the ball away to Kohli running across from wide long-on
Ashwin is early into a drive and sends an inside edge to fine leg
hip-high short ball on middle, Ashwin swivels on the back foot and pulls it elegantly over square leg
Stoinis dares to step down the track, Sundar drags his length back and hurls it at 103.4ks, Stoinis swings and misses. De Kock gathers the ball and takes the bails off
Stoinis forays down the track, Sundar pulls his length back on off, Stoinis still launches it over the bowler's head, roughly in the direction of the sightscreen. Shot, Stoinis

an appeal for lbw, not given by umpire  Deshmukh. RCB ask for a review. Really full on middle, too full for the sweep, Stoinis misses the shot. This could go onto hit leg stump. The tracker, however, suggests it would head past the leg stump. Stoinis gets away and gets a leg bye

Kulwant returns and provides RCB with the breakthrough. Back of a length on middle stump, Nair swings so hard to the leg side that he loses his shape. He collects fresh air. Kulwant hits the top of middle
Sundar hits a hard length outside off, stabbed into the covers
Stoinis steps out, 101ks, jabbed back to the bowler
Quick fizzer from Sundar, bounces, and Sundar has Rahul top-edging a catch to short third man. Speared at 103.6ks outside off, rushes the batsman into a slog-sweep. Rahul skews it to Sarfraz Khan
big-turning legbreak. Chahal puts it on off and gets it to rip away outside off. Karun can't touch it
Chahal shifts his line wider of off, Rahul uses his feet and slices it over backward point
Karun steps out, Chahal gives this legbreak a big rip, top-edges a sweep in front of deep midwicket
full on middle stump, backs away and skews it over Sundar's head
pushed through on leg stump, Rahul drops down to one knee and deftly paddles it away fine of short fine leg for four
whipped from outside off to long-on. Lovely wristwork from Rahul
very full and drifting down leg for a wide. Re-set the radar, Mr. Woakes
dragged short and outside off, Karun Nair arches his back, rides the bounce and ramps it over the keeper
back of a length and outside off, Rahul stays beside the line and flashes a single to deep point
back of a length and angling in on middle stump, Rahul inches forward and pushes it back to the bowler
rank half-tracker on the leg stump, Rahul pounces onto it and smacks it flat and hard over deep square leg
tossed on middle stump, dips, Rahul does not meet the pitch., Therefore, drags it off the inside half past midwicket
Rahul ventures down the track, yorks himself, but digs it out
darted short and swings away outside off, Rahul slashes  and misses
dug in short on the leg stump, Rahul picks it up and pulls it up and over short fine leg for a flat six

Umesh is just too quick for Yuvraj Singh. Pretty full and speared in from around the wicket, rushes Yuvraj for pace. He storms through the gate and knocks out the middle stump. Umesh celebrates the wicket with an animated fist pump
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Yuvraj covers up in defence
full and wide outside off, Yuvraj leans into a drive and finds cover. Hat-trick averted

big appeal for lbw, and the finger goes up. Finch challenges the on-field out decision. Full nip-backer, Finch is caught on the crease, playing around his front pad and missing. Impact in line and the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. Finch bags a duck on return
edged and de Kock throws himself to his right to snag the catch. Pitched up and outside off, Agarwal throws his hands at a drive and nicks it behind. De Kock completes an outstanding catch

Dropped? Sarfraz dives forward from deep square leg but the ball dies in front of him. He is writhing in pain. He is clutching his ankle. Talk about adding injury to insult? This was another hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Agarwal short-arms it away in the air but it did not carry to the fielder
Agarwal shimmies out and punches on the up to mid-off
140.3ks but sprayed down the leg side, Agarwal simply tickles it away fine on the leg side past the keeper
Umesh floats a slower ball outside off, Rahul can only force it as far as backward point
Agarwal is matching Rahul shot for shot. He backs away outside leg and fiercely drills it past the left of Umesh and right of mid-off
Agarwal now throws himself into the action. Hip-high short ball on middle, Agarwal swivels back and short-arms it over midwicket
wrong line again, drifting into the pads, Rahul picks it off the pads and flicks it past short fine leg. Easy peasy
whoa! Back-to-back sixes for Rahul. Sublime timing. Too full and veering into the pads, massive whippage of the wrists from the local boy. Picked up and launched over the square leg boundary

Hit flat and hard for a six! Back of a length and much wider outside off, Rahul extends his hands and scythes it up and over the covers. Dismissive. Shot of a man who's coming off a fastest fifty in the IPL
back of a length and put outside off, Rahul hangs back to this and chops it behind in the direction of slip
full, angling in towards off, then nipping away slightly outside off, Rahul gets right behind the line and gently pats it to the covers

Field up, what?Stanlake hits over the top and secures a thrilling win for Sunrisers. Pretty full on middle stump, yet another slower ball from Cutting, Stanlake does not get all of it but manages to swipe it over midwicket for a boundary. Hooda embraces Stanlake and the celebrations begin in the Sunrisers camp
Hooda shuffles across the off stump, banged in short and attacking the body, miscues a scoop in the air. Bumrah runs in from short fine leg but the ball lands in front of him. Scores are tied
slower ball floating into the pads, tickled away to the leg side. Stanlake and Hooda scamper across for the single. The fumble from Rohit helped their cause
low full-toss outside off, bunted down to the right of long-off. Hooda looks for the second. But Pollard is too quick for him
back of a length and angling away wide outside off from round the stumps, Hooda slashes with all his might, but loses his shape, and only collects fresh air
Cutting loses his line and his head. Sprayed wide past the marker. Left alone
full-toss, angling away outside off, Hooda clears his front leg, then bends his knee, and sends it clattering over extra cover for a six. First six of the chase in the last over

Mustafizur has his hands aloft in delight. Sandeep attempts to clear short fine leg. No dice. He shows his ace early and shuffles across off stump. Mustafiz chases him with a short ball that gets big on the batsman. He miscues a scoop to Krunal Pandya. Not sure if the batsmen crossed over
yet another cutter, nipping away outside off, opens Sandeep up and goes past the outside edge

Mustafiz pockets a one-handed return catch. This was a Mustafiz special: cutter, skipping away outside off, Kaul chips a leading edge to the left of the bowler. Mustafiz stretches out his left hand and comes out with the ball. Mumbai edge ahead
very full and angling across off, another big swing and a miss. Hooda walks up to Kaul and has a word with him
cutter, moving away outside off, Kaul pushes away from the body and watches the ball run past the outside edge
back of a length on off, backs away and stabs to cover. Hooda stutters and eventually takes the single
very full and straight - near yorker - squeezed back. Two wickets and three runs off the over. Well done, Bumrah. Sunrisers need 12 off 12 balls

Two in two balls for Bumrah! He has Rashid nicking off now. Pitched up and outside off, Rashid stays leg-side of the ball and aims for an expansive dive. He does not get enough bat on it and only edges it behind to Kishan. Okay, I spoke too soon. Sunrisers still need 12 off 13 balls
Bumrah bounces out Pathan and gives Mumbai hope. Chest-high short ball on middle, rushes a pull, Pathan flaps it in the air. Pollard at short midwicket lumbers to his right and clings onto the ball
hip-high short ball on off stump, Pathan was waiting for the bad ball. He gets it now. Helped away past short fine leg for four. Sunrisers will breathe easy
slower short ball on the leg stump, Hooda has a big slog at it and only toe-ends it onto the pitch. He, however, calls his partner through for a single

picked off the hips to deep midwicket. Hooda and Yusuf scamper across for the second. The throw is to the keeper's end and Hooda dishes out a desperate full-length dive and just makes it. The dive saves Hooda
whipped across the line to midwicket. There's a mix-up between the wickets on the second. Hooda wants it, Pathan sends him back, Hooda dishes out a dive and reaches the safety of the crease

Markande has his fourth with his last ball of the night. Wrong'un, breaks away outside off, Shakib reads it off the pitch, and drags a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. What a spell from Markande. He ends with a potentially match-winning 4-0-23-4
jabbed to the right of the bowler, Markande dives to his right and takes some pace off the ball
Shakib gets on top of a short ball outside off and cuts it away to the point boundary
First-ball four for Hooda. He races down the track and smears it straight past the right of the bowler. Bam

Pandey ventures down the track and skies it. Rohit runs across to his right from extra cover, this was Markande's catch but he leaves it to his captain. Rohit stretches across to his right and hangs onto it. For a moment, I thought this was going to fall between Rohit and Markande. It was poor shot from Pandey. He steps out, slogs against the turn and holes out
shorter and spins away outside off, Pandey rocks back and cracks it away to the point boundary

Burmrah snags the catch at the edge of the long leg boundary. Markande has opened the game up for Mumbai. Tossed up and bounces on middle, finds the top edge as Dhawan goes to sweep. Bumrah judges it well in the deep. Just like that Mumbai have taken three wickets in three overs

good length and cutting away outside off, past the outside edge? Kishan goes up for an appeal. Mustafiz isn't  convinced. Not given by the umpire. It prompts another review from Mumbai. Breaks away sharply outside off and bounces in the channel, Williamson attempts a late cut but the ball gets big on him. He feathers it behind. UltraEdge detects a tiny spike. No woody sound, just a little spike, and it's enough to overturn the not-out decision. Former Sunriser Mustafiz strikes
slower offcutter, Williamson plays at the very last moment, he deftly runs it away fine on the off side past the diving Kishan

Saha steps out, Markande foxes him with a quicker googly, hits the thigh pad. Lbw appeal, but umpire Llong does not budge. Going down leg? Mumbai go for a review. Spins in, bounces to hit the front flap, the tracker returns three reds. Umpire Llong is bemused. He reverses his decision
slower through the air outside off, Saha stretches out and paddles it away behind square on the leg side

Dropped by Kishan behind the stumps. He can't cling onto the rebound either. Saha backs away for a cut, instead top-edges the turning ball. Kishan is undone by the bounce as the ball bobbles out. He dives forward but the ball evades his reach
straight ball on middle, defended back to Krunal
overpitched and outside off, Saha clears his front leg and clouts it over the non-striker's head
short on middle, Saha looses his grip and fends it off

Cutting runs back from mid-on, drops the catch, and parries the ball away to the boundary. Sangwan hits a hard length on off, neither driveable nor pullable, the bat turns in Saha's hands as he skews it and gets away
on a length and just a shade outside off, Saha loosens his grip and glides a single to deep third man
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, Saha stays beside the line and bunts the ball to cover
